Follow Us

  • Islamic Toolskeyboard_arrow_down

    Prayer Timeschevron_right

    Get accurate prayers times online and learn the pillars of salah.

    Qibla Direction chevron_right

    Find the exact direction for salah with our online Qibla experiences. The first, traditional compass, the second augmented reality.

    Tasbih Counterchevron_right

    Recite dhikr that are light for the tongue to remember but heavy on the scales.

    Third of Night Calculatorchevron_right

    "And rise at 'the last' part of the night, offering additional prayers, so your Lord may raise you to a station of praise." (Quran, 17:79)

    Coloring Bookchevron_right

    A unqiue experience for kids and adults. With over 8+ published books on famous Islamic stories from Qur'an and Hadith. We've even included descriptions for each coloring page and audio narration.

    Islamic Games & Quizzes chevron_right

    A fun and engaging way to learn more about Islam. You can use our memorization games or test your knowledge on a subject. Insha'Allah it will provide the motivation to read more to ace our tests.

    Qibla Direction

    Find the Correct Direction for your prayer

    Explore chevron_right

  • Guideskeyboard_arrow_down

    99 Names of Allahchevron_right

    "Allah has ninety-nine Names and whoever believes in their meanings and acts accordingly, will enter Paradise." (Bukhari 6410)

    Prophet Stories chevron_right

    Learn from the journey of each Prophet as they were perfect role models for all of us to follow.

    Du'a Centerchevron_right

    Explore the archive of all the du'as published on the site. Includes Qur'anic supplications, du'as of the prophets, and many other du'as from hadith.

    Companion Serieschevron_right

    The Prophet (∩╖║) said, "The best people are those of my generation, and then those who will come after them." In this series you can learn the stories of those who lived side by side with the Prophet.

    Hisnul Muslimchevron_right

    The famous du'a book compiled by Sa'id bin Ali bin Wahf Al-Qahtani which groups the supplications with everyday events just as Prophet Muhammad (∩╖║) recited them.

    Qur'an Verseschevron_right

    Explore the Qur'an by subject matter, we've compiled a list of topics and all the verses about that topic.

    Du'a Center

    Learn the du'a of Prophet Adam (╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘ç┘É ┘▒┘ä╪│┘Ä┘æ┘ä┘Ä╪º┘à┘Å)

    Explore chevron_right

  • Resourceskeyboard_arrow_down

    Islamic Terms Dictionarychevron_right

    Glossary of Arabic words and phrases from Qur'an and everyday expressions.

    Free Qur'an PDFchevron_right

    Elegantly designed and interactive PDFs of every Surah to make reading and understanding the Qur'an easy.

    Purchase 99 Names Ebookchevron_right

    The content is available free on the site, the ebook was produced to help support the site and future projects. Any donation amount will receive the ebook.

    Your Islamic Companion App

    Over 1000+ reviews and 4.9+ star rating. The My Islam App is the ultimate ad-free companion app to help you explore the Qur'an, learn new du'as, and update you on the latest prayer times. There is so much more we're leaving out, Insha'Allah you'll give us a chance to show you around once you download the app.

Side by Side View:

Hisnul Muslim

Hisnul Muslim / Hisn al-Muslim is a book of supplications compiled by Sa'eed Ibn Ali Ibn Wahf Al-Qahtaani. It's titled in English as the "Fortress of... the Muslim" and contains one of the most authentic collections of du'a and adkhar of the Prophet Muhammad (∩╖║).

The book is well known for its categorization of du'as which cover many common situations we're likely to find ourselves in that can be further beautified with the remembrance of Allah (╪│┘Å╪¿┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘░┘å┘Ä┘ç┘Å█Ñ ┘ê┘Ä╪¬┘Ä╪╣┘Ä┘░┘ä┘Ä┘ë┘░). It aims to help increase iman, give hope and relief to the distressed, and save the supplicant from despair and isolation. Here we provided all 267 du'as in this book to be read online in Arabic text, and included English Translation and Transliteration. Insha-Allah, our aim is to make the Hisnul Muslim du'a book even more accessible with our mobile app.READ MORE


X
Share this du'a
Subscribe for more du'as!
Chapter 1: When waking up
4 du'as
╪º┘ä╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘Å ┘ä┘É┘ä┘æ┘ç┘É ╪º┘ä┘æ╪░┘è ╪ú┘Ä╪¡┘Æ┘Ç┘è╪º┘å╪º ╪¿┘Ä╪╣┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘Ä ┘à╪º ╪ú┘Ä┘à╪º╪¬┘Ä┘Ç┘å╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪Ñ┘ä┘è┘ç ╪º┘ä┘å┘æ┘Å┘Ç╪┤┘ê╪▒
play_arrow
share
video_library
Alß╕Ñamdu lill─ühil-ladh─½ 'aß╕Ñy─ün─üba`da m─ü 'am─ütan─üwa 'ilayhin-nush┼½r.
Praise is to Allah Who gives us life after He has caused us to die and to Him is the return.
Reference:
Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 11/113; Muslim 4/2083
Hisnul Muslim 1
┘ä╪º ╪Ñ┘ä┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘ä╪º┘æ ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪¡┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ä╪º ╪┤┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘è┘â┘Ä ┘ä┘ç ┘ä┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä┘à┘Å┘ä┘Ç┘â┘Å ┘ê┘ä┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Ç╪» ┘ê┘ç┘ê┘Ä ╪╣┘ä┘ë ┘â┘ä┘æ ╪┤┘è╪í┘ì ┘é╪»┘è╪▒ ╪│┘Å┘Ç╪¿┘Æ╪¡╪º┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘É ┘ê╪º┘ä╪¡┘à┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘Å ┘ä┘ä┘ç ┘ê┘ä╪º ╪Ñ┘ä┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘ä╪º┘æ ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘Å ┘ê╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘Å ╪ú┘â╪¿┘Ä╪▒ ┘ê┘Ä┘ä╪º ╪¡┘Ä┘ê┘ä┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä┘ä╪º ┘é┘ê┘æ╪⌐ ╪Ñ┘ä╪º┘æ ╪¿╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘É ╪º┘ä╪╣┘ä┘è┘æ ╪º┘ä╪╣╪╕┘è┘à ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘É ╪º╪║┘Æ┘ü╪▒┘Æ ┘ä┘è
play_arrow
share
video_library
L─ü 'il─üha 'illall─ühu waß╕Ñdahu la shar─½ka lahu. lahul-mulku wa lahul-ß╕Ñamdu. wa huwa 'al─ü kulli shay'in qad─½rSubß╕Ñ─ünall─ühi, walß╕Ñamdu lill─ühi. wa l─ü 'il─üha 'illall─ühu, wall─ühu 'akbar. wa l─ü ß╕Ñaula wa l─ü quwwata 'ill─ü bill─ühil-`aliyyil-`aß║ô─½m. rabbighfir l─½.
There is none worthy of worship but Allah alone, Who has no partner, His is the dominion and to Him belongs all praise, and He is able to do all things. Glory is to Allah. Praise is to Allah. There is none worthy of worship but Allah. Allah is the Most Great. There is no might and no power except by Allah's leave, the Exalted, the Mighty. My Lord, forgive me.
Reference:
Whoever says this will be forgiven, and if he supplicates Allah, his prayer will be answered; if he performs ablution and prays, his prayer will be accepted. Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 3/39, among others. The wording here is from Ibn Majah 2/335.
Hisnul Muslim 2
╪º┘ä╪¡┘à╪»┘Å ┘ä┘ä┘ç┘É ╪º┘ä╪░┘è ╪╣╪º┘ü╪º┘å┘è ┘ü┘è ╪¼┘Ä╪│┘Ä╪»┘è ┘ê┘Ä╪▒┘Ä╪»┘æ ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘è┘æ ╪▒┘ê╪¡┘è ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä╪░┘É┘å┘Ä ┘ä┘è ╪¿┘É╪░┘É┘â┘Æ╪▒┘É┘ç
play_arrow
share
video_library
Al-ß╕Ñamdu lill─ühil-ladh─½`─üf─ün─½ f─½ jasad─½. wa radda `alayya r┼½ß╕Ñ─½. wa 'adhina l─½ bidhikrihi.
Praise is to Allah who gave strength to my body and returned my soul to me and permitted me to remember Him.
Reference:
At-Tirmidhi 5/473. See Al-Albani's Sahih Tirmidhi 3/144.
Hisnul Muslim 3
╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘Ä ┘ü┘É┘è ╪«┘Ä┘ä┘Æ┘é┘É ╪º┘ä╪│┘æ┘Ä┘à┘Ä┘ê┘Ä╪º╪¬┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä╪ú┘Ä╪▒┘Æ╪╢┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º╪«┘Æ╪¬┘É┘ä╪º┘Ä┘ü┘É ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘ä┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘å┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Ä╪º╪▒┘É ┘ä╪ó┘è┘Ä╪º╪¬┘ì ┘ä╪ú┘Å┘ê┘Æ┘ä┘É┘è ╪º┘ä╪ú┘ä┘Æ╪¿┘Ä╪º╪¿┘É {190} ╪º┘ä┘æ┘Ä╪░┘É┘è┘å┘Ä ┘è┘Ä╪░┘Æ┘â┘Å╪▒┘Å┘ê┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘Ä ┘é┘É┘è┘Ä╪º┘à┘ï╪º ┘ê┘Ä┘é┘Å╪╣┘Å┘ê╪»┘ï╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘ë┘Ä ╪¼┘Å┘å┘Å┘ê╪¿┘É┘ç┘É┘à┘Æ ┘ê┘Ä┘è┘Ä╪¬┘Ä┘ü┘Ä┘â┘æ┘Ä╪▒┘Å┘ê┘å┘Ä ┘ü┘É┘è ╪«┘Ä┘ä┘Æ┘é┘É ╪º┘ä╪│┘æ┘Ä┘à┘Ä┘ê┘Ä╪º╪¬┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä╪ú┘Ä╪▒┘Æ╪╢┘É ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Ä┘å┘Ä╪º ┘à┘Ä╪º ╪«┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘é┘Æ╪¬┘Ä ┘ç┘Ä╪░╪º ╪¿┘Ä╪º╪╖┘É┘ä╪º┘ï ╪│┘Å╪¿┘Æ╪¡┘Ä╪º┘å┘Ä┘â┘Ä ┘ü┘Ä┘é┘É┘å┘Ä╪º ╪╣┘Ä╪░┘Ä╪º╪¿┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘å┘æ┘Ä╪º╪▒┘É {191} ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Ä┘å┘Ä╪º ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘Ä┘â┘Ä ┘à┘Ä┘å ╪¬┘Å╪»┘Æ╪«┘É┘ä┘É ╪º┘ä┘å┘æ┘Ä╪º╪▒┘Ä ┘ü┘Ä┘é┘Ä╪»┘Æ ╪ú┘Ä╪«┘Æ╪▓┘Ä┘è┘Æ╪¬┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘Ä╪º ┘ä┘É┘ä╪╕┘æ┘Ä╪º┘ä┘É┘à┘É┘è┘å┘Ä ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ╪ú┘Ä┘å╪╡┘Ä╪º╪▒┘ì {192} ╪▒┘æ┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Ä┘å┘Ä╪º ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘Ä┘å┘Ä╪º ╪│┘Ä┘à┘É╪╣┘Æ┘å┘Ä╪º ┘à┘Å┘å┘Ä╪º╪»┘É┘è┘ï╪º ┘è┘Å┘å┘Ä╪º╪»┘É┘è ┘ä┘É┘ä╪Ñ┘É┘è┘à┘Ä╪º┘å┘É ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ ╪í╪º┘à┘É┘å┘Å┘ê╪º┘Æ ╪¿┘É╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘É┘â┘Å┘à┘Æ ┘ü┘Ä╪ó┘à┘Ä┘å┘æ┘Ä╪º ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Ä┘å┘Ä╪º ┘ü┘Ä╪º╪║┘Æ┘ü┘É╪▒┘Æ ┘ä┘Ä┘å┘Ä╪º ╪░┘Å┘å┘Å┘ê╪¿┘Ä┘å┘Ä╪º ┘ê┘Ä┘â┘Ä┘ü┘æ┘É╪▒┘Æ ╪╣┘Ä┘å┘æ┘Ä╪º ╪│┘Ä┘è┘æ┘É╪ª┘Ä╪º╪¬┘É┘å┘Ä╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪¬┘Ä┘ê┘Ä┘ü┘æ┘Ä┘å┘Ä╪º ┘à┘Ä╪╣┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪ú╪¿┘Æ╪▒┘Ä╪º╪▒┘É {193} ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Ä┘å┘Ä╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪í╪º╪¬┘É┘å┘Ä╪º ┘à┘Ä╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪╣┘Ä╪»╪¬┘æ┘Ä┘å┘Ä╪º ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘ë ╪▒┘Å╪│┘Å┘ä┘É┘â┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä┘ä╪º┘Ä ╪¬┘Å╪«┘Æ╪▓┘É┘å┘Ä╪º ┘è┘Ä┘ê┘Æ┘à┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘é┘É┘è┘Ä╪º┘à┘Ä╪⌐┘É ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘Ä┘â┘Ä ┘ä╪º┘Ä ╪¬┘Å╪«┘Æ┘ä┘É┘ü┘Å ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘à┘É┘è╪╣┘Ä╪º╪»┘Ä {194} ┘ü┘Ä╪º╪│┘Æ╪¬┘Ä╪¼┘Ä╪º╪¿┘Ä ┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘à┘Æ ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Å┘ç┘Å┘à┘Æ ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘æ┘É┘è ┘ä╪º┘Ä ╪ú┘Å╪╢┘É┘è╪╣┘Å ╪╣┘Ä┘à┘Ä┘ä┘Ä ╪╣┘Ä╪º┘à┘É┘ä┘ì ┘à┘æ┘É┘å┘â┘Å┘à ┘à┘æ┘É┘å ╪░┘Ä┘â┘Ä╪▒┘ì ╪ú┘Ä┘ê┘Æ ╪ú┘Å┘å╪½┘Ä┘ë ╪¿┘Ä╪╣┘Æ╪╢┘Å┘â┘Å┘à ┘à┘æ┘É┘å ╪¿┘Ä╪╣┘Æ╪╢┘ì ┘ü┘Ä╪º┘ä┘æ┘Ä╪░┘É┘è┘å┘Ä ┘ç┘Ä╪º╪¼┘Ä╪▒┘Å┘ê╪º┘Æ ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Å╪«┘Æ╪▒┘É╪¼┘Å┘ê╪º┘Æ ┘à┘É┘å ╪»┘É┘è┘Ä╪º╪▒┘É┘ç┘É┘à┘Æ ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Å┘ê╪░┘Å┘ê╪º┘Æ ┘ü┘É┘è ╪│┘Ä╪¿┘É┘è┘ä┘É┘è ┘ê┘Ä┘é┘Ä╪º╪¬┘Ä┘ä┘Å┘ê╪º┘Æ ┘ê┘Ä┘é┘Å╪¬┘É┘ä┘Å┘ê╪º┘Æ ┘ä╪ú┘Å┘â┘Ä┘ü┘æ┘É╪▒┘Ä┘å┘æ┘Ä ╪╣┘Ä┘å┘Æ┘ç┘Å┘à┘Æ ╪│┘Ä┘è┘æ┘É╪ª┘Ä╪º╪¬┘É┘ç┘É┘à┘Æ ┘ê┘Ä┘ä╪ú┘Å╪»┘Æ╪«┘É┘ä┘Ä┘å┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘à┘Æ ╪¼┘Ä┘å┘æ┘Ä╪º╪¬┘ì ╪¬┘Ä╪¼┘Æ╪▒┘É┘è ┘à┘É┘å ╪¬┘Ä╪¡┘Æ╪¬┘É┘ç┘Ä╪º ╪º┘ä╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ┘ç┘Ä╪º╪▒┘Å ╪½┘Ä┘ê┘Ä╪º╪¿┘ï╪º ┘à┘æ┘É┘å ╪╣┘É┘å╪»┘É ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘Å ╪╣┘É┘å╪»┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪¡┘Å╪│┘Æ┘å┘Å ╪º┘ä╪½┘æ┘Ä┘ê┘Ä╪º╪¿┘É {195} ┘ä╪º┘Ä ┘è┘Ä╪║┘Å╪▒┘æ┘Ä┘å┘æ┘Ä┘â┘Ä ╪¬┘Ä┘é┘Ä┘ä┘æ┘Å╪¿┘Å ╪º┘ä┘æ┘Ä╪░┘É┘è┘å┘Ä ┘â┘Ä┘ü┘Ä╪▒┘Å┘ê╪º┘Æ ┘ü┘É┘è ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¿┘É┘ä╪º┘Ä╪»┘É {196} ┘à┘Ä╪¬┘Ä╪º╪╣┘î ┘é┘Ä┘ä┘É┘è┘ä┘î ╪½┘Å┘à┘æ┘Ä ┘à┘Ä╪ú┘Æ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ç┘Å┘à┘Æ ╪¼┘Ä┘ç┘Ä┘å┘æ┘Ä┘à┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪¿┘É╪ª┘Æ╪│┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘à┘É┘ç┘Ä╪º╪»┘Å {197} ┘ä┘Ä┘â┘É┘å┘É ╪º┘ä┘æ┘Ä╪░┘É┘è┘å┘Ä ╪º╪¬┘æ┘Ä┘é┘Ä┘ê┘Æ╪º┘Æ ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘à┘Æ ┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘à┘Æ ╪¼┘Ä┘å┘æ┘Ä╪º╪¬┘î ╪¬┘Ä╪¼┘Æ╪▒┘É┘è ┘à┘É┘å ╪¬┘Ä╪¡┘Æ╪¬┘É┘ç┘Ä╪º ╪º┘ä╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ┘ç┘Ä╪º╪▒┘Å ╪«┘Ä╪º┘ä┘É╪»┘É┘è┘å┘Ä ┘ü┘É┘è┘ç┘Ä╪º ┘å┘Å╪▓┘Å┘ä╪º┘ï ┘à┘æ┘É┘å┘Æ ╪╣┘É┘å╪»┘É ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘É ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘Ä╪º ╪╣┘É┘å╪»┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘É ╪«┘Ä┘è┘Æ╪▒┘î ┘ä┘æ┘É┘ä╪ú┘Ä╪¿┘Æ╪▒┘Ä╪º╪▒┘É {198} ┘ê┘Ä╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘Ä ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ╪ú┘Ä┘ç┘Æ┘ä┘É ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘â┘É╪¬┘Ä╪º╪¿┘É ┘ä┘Ä┘à┘Ä┘å ┘è┘Å╪ñ┘Æ┘à┘É┘å┘Å ╪¿┘É╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘É ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘Ä╪º ╪ú┘Å┘å╪▓┘É┘ä┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘â┘Å┘à┘Æ ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘Ä╪ó ╪ú┘Å┘å╪▓┘É┘ä┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘ç┘É┘à┘Æ ╪«┘Ä╪º╪┤┘É╪╣┘É┘è┘å┘Ä ┘ä┘ä┘ç┘É ┘ä╪º┘Ä ┘è┘Ä╪┤┘Æ╪¬┘Ä╪▒┘Å┘ê┘å┘Ä ╪¿┘É╪ó┘è┘Ä╪º╪¬┘É ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘É ╪½┘Ä┘à┘Ä┘å┘ï╪º ┘é┘Ä┘ä┘É┘è┘ä╪º┘ï ╪ú┘Å┘ê┘Æ┘ä┘Ä╪ª┘É┘â┘Ä ┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘à┘Æ ╪ú┘Ä╪¼┘Æ╪▒┘Å┘ç┘Å┘à┘Æ ╪╣┘É┘å╪»┘Ä ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘É┘ç┘É┘à┘Æ ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘Ä ╪│┘Ä╪▒┘É┘è╪╣┘Å ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘É╪│┘Ä╪º╪¿┘É {199} ┘è┘Ä╪º ╪ú┘Ä┘è┘æ┘Å┘ç┘Ä╪º ╪º┘ä┘æ┘Ä╪░┘É┘è┘å┘Ä ╪í╪º┘à┘Ä┘å┘Å┘ê╪º┘Æ ╪º╪╡┘Æ╪¿┘É╪▒┘Å┘ê╪º┘Æ ┘ê┘Ä╪╡┘Ä╪º╪¿┘É╪▒┘Å┘ê╪º┘Æ ┘ê┘Ä╪▒┘Ä╪º╪¿┘É╪╖┘Å┘ê╪º┘Æ ┘ê┘Ä╪º╪¬┘æ┘Ä┘é┘Å┘ê╪º┘Æ ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘Ä ┘ä┘Ä╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘â┘Å┘à┘Æ ╪¬┘Å┘ü┘Æ┘ä┘É╪¡┘Å┘ê┘å┘Ä {200}

Inna f─½ khalqi-ssam─üw─üti wal-'ar─æi wakhtil─üfi-llayli wan-nah─üri la'─üy─ütin li'wl─½-l-'alb─üb. Al-ladh─½na yadhkur┼½na-allaha qiy─üman wa qu`┼½dan wa `al─ü jun┼½bihim wa yatafakkar┼½na f─½ Khalqi-ssam─üw─üti wal-'ar─æi rabban─ü m─ü khalaqta h─üdh─ü b─ü┼úil─üan sub─Ñ─ünaka faqin─ü `adh─üban-n─ür. Rabban─ü 'innaka man tudkhili-nn─üra faqad 'akhzaytahu wa m─ü li-┼╛┼╛─ülim─½na min 'an┼ƒ─ürin. Rabban─ü 'innan─ü sami`n─ü mun─üd─½an yun─üd─½ lil'─½m─üni 'an '─ümin┼½ birabbikum fa '─ümann─ü. Rabban─ü f─üghfirlan─ü dhun┼½ban─ü wa kaffir `ann─ü sayyi'─ütin─ü wa tawaffan─ü ma`a al-'abr─üri. Rabban─ü wa '─ütin─ü m─ü wa`adtan─ü `al├í rusulika wa l─ü tukhzin─ü yawmal-qiy─ümati 'innaka l─ü tukhliful-m─½`─üd. F─üstaj─üba lahum rabbuhum 'ann─½ l─ü 'u─æ─½`u `amala `─ümilin minkum min dhakarin 'aw 'unth├í ba`─æukum min ba`─æin fa-lladh─½na h─üjar┼½ wa 'ukhrij┼½ min diy─ürihim wa '┼½dh┼½ f─½ sab─½l─½ wa q─ütal┼½ wa qutil┼½ la'ukaffiranna `anhum sayyi'─ütihim wa la'udkhilannahum jann─ütin tajr─½ min ta─Ñtih─ül-'anh─üru thaw─üban min `indil-lahi wal-l─ühu `indahu ─Ñusnuth-thaw─üb. L─ü yaghurrannaka taqallubu 'l-ladh─½na kafar┼½ f─½ l-bil─üdi. Mat─ü`un qal─½lun thumma ma'w─ühum jahannamu wa bi'sa 'l-mih─üd. Lakini 'l-ladh─½na 'ttaqaw rabbahum lahum jann─ütun tajr─½ min ta─Ñtih─ü 'l-'anh─üru kh─ülid─½na f─½h─ü nuzulan min `indi 'l-lahi wa m─ü `inda 'llahi khayrun li 'l-abr─ür. Wa 'inna min 'ahli 'l-kit─übi laman yu'minu bil-lahi wa m─ü 'unzila 'ilaykum wa m─ü 'unzila 'ilayhim kh─üshi`─½na lillahi l─ü yashtar┼½na bi'─üy─üti 'l-lahi thamanan qal─½l─üan 'ul─ü'ika lahum 'ajruhum `inda rabbihim 'inna 'l-laha sar─½`u al-─Ñis─üb. Y─ü 'ayyuh─ü 'l-ladh─½na '─üman┼½-┼ƒbir┼½ wa ┼ƒ─übir┼½ wa r─übi┼ú┼½ wa 'ttaqu 'l-laha la`allakum tufli─Ñ┼½n.
Indeed, in the creation of the heavens and the earth and the alternation of the day and night there are signs for people of reason.╦╣They are╦║ those who remember Allah while standing, sitting, and lying on their sides, and reflect on the creation of the heavens and the earth ╦╣and pray╦║, ΓÇ£Our Lord! You have not created ╦╣all of╦║ this without purpose. Glory be to You! Protect us from the torment of the Fire. Our Lord! Indeed, those You commit to the Fire will be ╦╣completely╦║ disgraced! And the wrongdoers will have no helpers. Our Lord! We have heard the caller to ╦╣true╦║ belief, ╦╣proclaiming,╦║ ΓÇÿBelieve in your Lord ╦╣alone╦║,ΓÇÖ so we believed. Our Lord! Forgive our sins, absolve us of our misdeeds, and allow us ╦╣each╦║ to die as one of the virtuous. Our Lord! Grant us what You have promised us through Your messengers and do not put us to shame on Judgment DayΓÇöfor certainly You never fail in Your promise.ΓÇ¥So their Lord responded to them: ΓÇ£I will never deny any of youΓÇömale or femaleΓÇöthe reward of your deeds. Both are equal in reward. Those who migrated or were expelled from their homes, and were persecuted for My sake and fought and ╦╣some╦║ were martyredΓÇöI will certainly forgive their sins and admit them into Gardens under which rivers flow, as a reward from Allah. And with Allah is the finest reward!ΓÇ¥Do not be deceived by the prosperity of the disbelievers throughout the land. It is only a brief enjoyment. Then Hell will be their homeΓÇöwhat an evil place to rest! But those who are mindful of their Lord will be in Gardens under which rivers flow, to stay there foreverΓÇöas an accommodation from Allah. And what is with Allah is best for the virtuous. Indeed, there are some among the People of the Book who truly believe in Allah and what has been revealed to you ╦╣believers╦║ and what was revealed to them. They humble themselves before AllahΓÇönever trading AllahΓÇÖs revelations for a fleeting gain. Their reward is with their Lord. Surely Allah is swift in reckoning. O believers! Patiently endure, persevere, stand on guard, and be mindful of Allah, so you may be successful.
Reference:
Qur'an Al-Imran 3: 190-200; Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 8/237; Muslim 1/530.
Hisnul Muslim 4
Chapter 2: When wearing a garment

╪º┘ä╪¡┘à╪»┘Å ┘ä┘ä┘ç┘É ╪º┘ä┘æ╪░┘è ┘â┘Ä╪│╪º┘å┘è ┘ç╪░╪º (╪º┘ä╪½┘æ┘ê╪¿) ┘ê┘Ä╪▒┘Ä╪▓┘Ä┘é┘Ä┘å┘è┘ç ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ╪║┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Ç┘Æ╪▒┘É ╪¡┘Ä┘ê┘ä┘ì ┘à┘É┘å┘æ┘è ┘ê┘Ä┘ä╪º ┘é┘Ç┘ê┘æ╪⌐

video_library
Alß╕Ñamdu lill─ühil-ladh─½ kas─ün─½ h─üdh─ü (aththawba) wa razaqan─½hi min ghayri hawlim-minn─½ wa l─ü quwwah.
Praise is to Allah Who has clothed me with this (garment) and provided it for me, though I was powerless myself and incapable
Reference:
Al-Bukhari, Muslim, Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah, At-Tirmidhi. See also 'Irwa'ul-Ghalil 7/47.
Hisnul Muslim 5
Chapter 3: When wearing a new garment
1 du'as
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘Ä┘æ ┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪¡┘Ä┘Ç┘à┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘Å ╪ú┘å┘Æ┘Ç╪¬┘Ä ┘â┘Ä╪│┘Ä┘Ç┘ê┘Æ╪¬┘Ä┘å┘è┘ç┘É ╪ú┘Ä┘Ä╪│┘Æ╪ú┘Ä┘Ä┘ä┘Å┘Ç┘â┘Ä ┘à┘É┘Ç┘å┘Æ ╪«┘Ä┘Ç┘è╪▒┘É┘ç┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪«┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ╪▒┘É ┘à┘Ä╪º ╪╡┘Å┘å┘É╪╣┘Ä ┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘ç ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘ê╪░┘Å ╪¿┘É┘â┘Ä ┘à┘É┘Ç┘å┘Æ ╪┤┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘É┘æ┘ç┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪┤┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘É┘æ ┘à┘Ç╪º ╪╡┘Å┘å┘É╪╣┘Ä ┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘ç┘Å

video_library
All─ühumma lakal-ß╕Ñamdu 'anta kasawtan─½hi,'as'aluka min khayrihi wa khayri m─ü ß╣úuni`a lahu. wa 'a`oothu bika min sharrihi wa sharri m─ü ß╣úuni`a lahu.
O Allah, praise is to You. You have clothed me. I ask You for its goodness and the goodness of what it has been made for, and I seek Your protection from the evil of it and the evil of what it has been made for.
Reference:
Abu Dawud and At-Tirmidhi. See also Al-Albani, Mukhtasar Shama'il At-Tirmidhi, p. 47.

Tubl─½ wa yukhliful-l─ühu ta`─ül─ü.
May Allah replace it when it is worn out.
Reference:
Abu Dawud 4/41. See also Al-Albani Sahih Abu Dawud 2/760.
Hisnul Muslim 7
╪º┘É┘ä╪¿┘Ä┘Ç╪│ ╪¼┘Ä╪»┘è┘Ç╪»╪º┘ï ┘ê┘Ä╪╣┘É┘Ç╪┤┘Æ ╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Ç┘è╪»╪º┘ï ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘Å┘Ç╪¬┘Æ ╪┤┘ç┘è╪»╪º┘ï

video_library
Ilbas jad─½dan. wa `ish ß╕Ñam─½dan. wa mut shah─½dan.
Put on new clothes, live a praise-worthy life and die as a martyr.
Reference:
Ibn Majah 2/1178, Al-Baghawi 12/41. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah 2/275

Hisnul Muslim 9
Chapter 6: Before entering the bathroom
1 du'as
(╪¿┘É╪│┘Æ┘à┘É ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç) ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘É┘Ç┘è ╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Ç┘ê╪░┘Å ╪¿┘É┘Ç┘â┘Ä ┘à┘É┘Ç┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪«┘Å┘Ç╪¿┘Æ╪½┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Æ╪«┘Ä╪¿╪º╪ª┘É╪½
play_arrow
share
video_library
[Bismill─ühi] All─ühumma 'inn─½ 'a`┼½dhu bika minal-khubthi walkhab─ü'ith.
[In the Name of Allah]. O Allah, I seek protection in You from evil and the evil ones (or, from the evil male and female Jinn).
Reference:
Al-Bukhari 1/45, Muslim 1/283. The addition of Bismillah at its beginning was reported by Said bin Mansur. See Fathul-Bari 1/244

video_library
Ghufr─ünaka
I seek Your forgiveness.
Reference:
Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah and At-Tirmidhi. An-Nasa'i recorded it in 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah. Also see the checking of Ibn Al-Qayyim's Zadul-Ma'ad, 2/387.

Hisnul Muslim 12
Chapter 9: Upon completing the ablution
3 du'as
╪ú┘Ä╪┤┘Æ┘ç┘Ä╪»┘Å ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ ┘ä╪º ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪¡┘Æ╪»┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ä╪º ╪┤┘Ä╪▒┘è┘Ç┘â┘Ä ┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä╪┤┘Æ┘ç┘Ä╪»┘Å╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Ä┘æ ┘à┘Å╪¡┘Ä┘à┘æ┘Ç╪»╪º┘ï ╪╣┘Ä╪¿┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘Å┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪▒┘Ä╪│┘Ç┘ê┘ä┘Å┘Ç┘ç

video_library
Ash-hadu 'an l─ü 'il─üha 'illall─ühuwaß╕Ñdahu l─ü shar─½ka lahuwa 'ash-hadu 'anna Muß╕Ñammadan `abduhu wa Ras┼½luhu.
I bear witness that none has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner; and I bear witness that Muhammad is His slave and His Messenger.
Reference:
Muslim 1/209.
Hisnul Muslim 13
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘Ä┘æ ╪º╪¼┘Æ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘å┘Ç┘è ┘à┘É┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪¬┘Ä┘æ┘Ç┘ê┘æ╪º╪¿┘è┘å┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪º╪¼┘Æ╪╣┘Ä┘Ç┘ä┘Æ┘å┘è ┘à┘É┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘à╪¬┘Ä╪╖┘Ä┘ç┘æ┘Ç╪▒┘è┘å.

video_library
All─ühummaj`aln─½ minat-taww─üb─½nawaj`aln─½ minal-mutaß╣¡ahhir─½n.
O Allah, make me among those who turn to You in repentance, and make me among those who are purified.
Reference:
At-Tirmidhi 1/78. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At- Tirmidhi 1/18
Hisnul Muslim 14
╪│┘Å╪¿┘Æ╪¡┘Ç╪º┘å┘Ä┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘Ä┘æ ┘ê┘Ä╪¿┘É╪¡┘Ä┘à╪»┘É┘â ╪ú┘Ä╪┤┘Æ┘ç┘Ä┘Ç╪»┘Å ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ ┘ä╪º ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ╪¬┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä╪│┘Æ╪¬┘Ä╪║┘Æ┘ü┘É╪▒┘Å┘â┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä╪¬┘ê╪¿┘Å ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ┘â
play_arrow
share
video_library
Subß╕Ñ─ünaka All─ühumma wa biß╕Ñamdika,'ash-hadu 'an l─ü 'il─üha 'ill─ü 'Anta,'astaghfiruka wa 'at┼½bu 'ilayk.
Glory is to You, O Allah, and praise; I bear witness that there is noneworthy of worship but You. I seek Your forgiveness and turn to You inrepentance.
Reference:
An-Nasa'i, 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah, p. 173. See also Al-Albani, 'Irwa'ul-Ghalil 1/135 and 2/94.
Hisnul Muslim 15
Chapter 10: Remembrance when leaving the home
2 du'as
╪¿┘É╪│┘Æ┘à┘É ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘É ╪¬┘Ä┘ê┘Ä┘â┘Ä┘æ┘ä┘Æ┘Ç╪¬┘Å ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘ë ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘É ┘ê┘Ä┘ä╪º ╪¡┘Ä┘ê┘Æ┘ä┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä┘ä╪º ┘é┘Å┘Ç┘ê┘Ä┘æ╪⌐┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ ╪¿┘É╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç
play_arrow
share
video_library
Bismill─ühi, tawakkaltu `alall─ühi. wa l─ü ß╕Ñawla wa l─ü quwwata ill─ü bill─üh.
In the Name of Allah, I have placed my trust in Allah, there is no might and no power except by Allah.
Reference:
Abu Dawud 4/325, At-Tirmidhi 5/490. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/151
Hisnul Muslim 16
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘Ä┘æ ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘É┘æ┘Ç┘è ╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Ç┘ê╪░┘Å ╪¿┘É┘â┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ ╪ú┘Ä╪╢┘É┘Ç┘ä┘Ä┘æ ╪ú┘Ä┘ê┘Æ ╪ú┘Å╪╢┘Ä┘Ç┘ä ╪ú┘Ä┘ê┘Æ ╪ú┘Ä╪▓┘É┘ä┘Ä┘æ ╪ú┘Ä┘ê┘Æ ╪ú┘Å╪▓┘Ä┘ä ╪ú┘Ä┘ê┘Æ ╪ú┘Ä╪╕┘Æ┘ä┘É┘Ç┘à┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä┘ê┘Æ ╪ú┘Ä┘Å╪╕┘Æ┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘à ╪ú┘Ä┘ê┘Æ ╪ú┘Ä╪¼┘Æ┘ç┘Ä┘ä┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä┘ê┘Æ ┘è┘Å┘Ç╪¼┘Æ┘ç┘Ä┘ä┘Ä ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘æ
play_arrow
share
video_library
All─ühumma 'inn─½ 'a`┼½dhu bika'an 'aß╕ìilla, 'aw 'uß╕ìalla,'aw 'azilla, 'aw 'uzalla,'aw 'aß║ôlima, 'aw 'uß║ôlama,'aw 'ajhala 'aw yujhala `alayya.
O Allah, I seek refuge in You lest I misguide others, or I am misguided byothers, lest I cause others to err or I am caused to err, lest I abuse others or be abused, and lest I behave foolishly or meet with the foolishness of others.
Reference:
Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah, An-Nasa'i, At-Tirmidhi. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/152 and Sahih Ibn Majah 2/336
Hisnul Muslim 17
Chapter 11: Remembrance upon entering the home
1 du'as
╪¿┘É╪│┘Æ┘Ç┘à┘É ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘É ┘ê┘Ä┘ä┘Ä╪¼┘Æ┘å┘Ç╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪¿┘É╪│┘Æ┘Ç┘à┘É ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘É ╪«┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘Ä╪¼┘Æ┘å┘Ç╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ç┘ë ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘É┘æ┘å┘Ç╪º ╪¬┘Ä┘ê┘Ä┘â┘æ┘ä┘Æ┘Ç┘å (╪½┘à ┘ä┘è╪│┘ä┘à ╪╣┘ä┘ë ╪ú┘ç┘ä┘ç.)
play_arrow
share
video_library
Bismill─ühi walajn─ü. wa bismill─ühi kharajn─ü. wa `ala Rabbin─ü tawakkaln─ü
In the Name of Allah we enter, in the Name of Allah we leave, and upon our Lord we depend [then say As-Sal─ümu `Alaykum to those present].
Reference:
Abu Dawud 4/325. Muslim {Hadith no. 2018) says that one should mention the Name of Allah when entering the home and when beginning to eat; and that the devil, hearing this, says: "There is no shelter for us here tonight and no food."
Hisnul Muslim 18
Chapter 12: When going to the mosque
1 du'as
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘Ä┘æ ╪º╪¼┘Æ╪╣┘Ä┘Ç┘ä┘Æ ┘ü┘É┘è ┘é┘Ä┘ä┘Æ╪¿┘Ç┘è ┘å┘Å┘ê╪▒╪º┘ï

┘ê╪º╪¼┘Æ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Æ ┘ü┘É┘è ╪╣┘Ä╪╡┘Ä╪¿┘É┘è ┘å┘Å┘ê╪▒╪º┘ï,

(╪ú┘Ä┘ä┘ä┘Ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘à┘Ä┘æ ╪º╪¼┘É╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Æ ┘ä┘É┘è ┘å┘Å┘ê╪▒╪º┘ï
┘ü┘É┘è ┘é┘æ╪¿┘Æ╪▒┘É┘è

(┘ê┘Ä╪▓┘É╪»┘Æ┘å┘É┘è ┘å┘Å┘ê╪▒╪º┘ï,
┘ê┘Ä╪▓┘É╪»┘Æ┘å┘É┘è ┘å┘Å┘ê╪▒╪º┘Ä , ┘ê┘Ä╪▓┘É╪»┘Æ┘å┘É┘è ┘å┘Å┘ê╪▒╪º┘ï)
(┘ê┘Ä┘ç┘Ä╪¿┘Æ ┘ä┘É┘è ┘å┘Å┘ê╪▒╪º┘ï ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘ë ┘å┘Å┘ê╪▒╪º┘ï)

share
video_library
All─ühummaj'al f─½ qalb─½ n┼½ran.
wa f─½ lis─ün─½ n┼½ran.
wa f─½ sam`─½ n┼½ran.
wa f─½ baß╣úar─½ n┼½ran.
wa min fawq─½ n┼½ran.
wa min taß╕Ñt─½ n┼½ran.
wa `an yam─½n─½ n┼½ran.
wa `an shim─ül─½ n┼½ran.
wa min 'am─üm─½ n┼½ran.
wa min khalf─½ n┼½ran.
waj`al f─½ nafs─½ n┼½ran.
wa 'a`ß║ôim l─½ n┼½ran.
wa `ß║ôß║ôim l─½ n┼½ran.
waj`all─½ n┼½ran.
waj`aln─½ n┼½ran.
All─ühumma 'a`tin─½ n┼½ran.
waj'al f─½ `aß╣úab─½ n┼½ran.
wa f─½ laß╕Ñm─½ n┼½ran.
wa f─½ dam─½ n┼½ran.
wa f─½ sha`r─½ n┼½ran.
wa f─½ bashar─½ n┼½ran.
[All─ühummaj`all─½ n┼½ran f─½ qabr─½wa n┼½ran f─½ `iß║ô─üm─½.]
[Wa zidn─½ n┼½ran. wa zidn─½ n┼½ran. wa zidn─½ n┼½ran.]
[Wa hab l─½ n┼½ran `al─ü n┼½r.]
O Allah, place light in my heart,
and on my tongue light,
and in my ears light
and in my sight light
, and above me light,
and below me light,
and to my right light,
and to my left light,
and before me light
and behind me light.
Place in my soul light.
Magnify for me light,
and amplify for me light.
Make for me light
and make me a light.
O Allah, grant me light,
and place light in my nerves,
and in my body light
and in my blood light
and in my hair light
and in my skin light.1
[O Allah, make for me a light in my grave... and a light in my bones.]
(At-Tirmidhi 5/483 (Hadith no. 3419).) [Increase me in light, increase me in light, increase me in light.]
(Al-Bukhari in Al-'Adab Al-Mufrad (Hadith no. 695), p. 258. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Al-'Adab Al-Mufrad (no. 536).) [Grant me light upon light.](Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 11/118.)
Reference:
1 Up to this point was reported by Al-Bukhari 11 / 116 (Hadith no. 6316) and by Muslim 1/526, 529-530 (Hadithno. 763).
Hisnul Muslim 19
Chapter 13: Upon entering the mosque
1 du'as
╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘ê╪░┘Å ╪¿╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘É ╪º┘ä╪╣┘Ä╪╕┘è┘Ç┘à ┘ê┘Ä╪¿┘É┘ê┘Ä╪¼┘Æ┘ç┘É┘Ç┘ç┘É ╪º┘ä┘â┘Ä╪▒┘É┘è┘Ç┘à ┘ê┘Ä╪│┘Å┘ä┘Æ╪╖┘Ç╪º┘å┘É┘ç ╪º┘ä┘é┘Ä╪»┘è┘Ç┘à ┘à┘É┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪┤┘æ┘è┘Æ┘Ç╪╖╪º┘å┘É ╪º┘ä╪▒┘æ┘Ä╪¼┘Ç┘è┘à [ ╪¿┘É╪│┘Æ┘Ç┘à┘É ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä╪╡┘æ┘Ä┘ä╪º╪⌐┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä╪│┘æ┘Ä┘ä╪º┘à┘Å ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘ë ╪▒┘Ä╪│┘ê┘ä┘É ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç] ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪º┘ü┘Æ╪¬┘Ä┘Ç╪¡┘Æ ┘ä┘è ╪ú┘Ä╪¿┘Æ┘ê╪º╪¿┘Ä ╪▒┘Ä╪¡┘Æ┘à┘Ä╪¬┘Ç┘É┘â
play_arrow
share
video_library
A`┼½dhu bill─ühi l-`aß║ô─½m. wa bi-wajhihil-kar─½m. wa sult─ünihil-qad─½m. min ash-shayt─ünir-raj─½m.[Bismill─ühi, wassal─ütu wassal─ümu `al─ü ras┼½lill─ühi.] All─ühummaftaß╕Ñ l─½ 'abw─üba raß╕Ñmatik.
I seek refuge in Almighty Allah, By His Noble Face, By His primordial power, From Satan the outcast.1 [In the Name of Allah, and blessings2 and peace be upon the Messenger of Allah.3 O Allah, open before me the doors of Your mercy.4
Reference:
1. Abu Dawud and Al-Albani, Sahihul-Jdmi' As-Saghir (Hadithno. 4591). 2. Ibn As-Sunni (Hadith no. 88), graded good by Al-Albani. 3. Abu Dawud 1/126, see also Al-Albani, Sahihul-Jami'As-Saghir 1/528. 4. Muslim 1/494. There is also a report in Sunan Ibn Majah on the authority of Fatimah (RA), : "O Allah, forgive me my sins and open for me the doors of Your mercy." It was graded authentic by Al-Albani due to supporting Ahadith. See Sahih Ibn Majah 1/128-9.
Hisnul Muslim 20
Chapter 14: Upon leaving the mosque
1 du'as
╪¿┘É╪│┘à┘É ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä╪╡┘æ┘ä╪º╪⌐┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä╪│┘æ┘ä╪º┘à┘Å ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘ë ╪▒┘Ä╪│┘ê┘ä┘É ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘Ç┘è ╪ú┘Ä╪│┘Æ╪ú┘Ä┘ä┘Å┘â┘Ä ┘à┘É┘Ç┘å┘Æ ┘ü┘Ä╪╢┘Æ┘Ç┘ä┘É┘â ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪º╪╣╪╡┘É┘à┘Æ┘å┘Ç┘è ┘à┘É┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪┤┘æ┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘Ç╪╖╪º┘å┘É ╪º┘ä╪▒┘æ┘Ä╪¼┘Ç┘è┘à

video_library
Bismill─ühi waß╣úß╣úal─ütu wassal─ümu 'al─ü Ras┼½lill─ühi. All─ühumma 'inn─½ 'as'aluka min faß╕ìlika. All─ühumma`ß╣úimn─½ min ash-shayt─ünir-raj─½m.
In the Name of Allah, and peace and blessings be upon the Messenger of Allah. O Allah, I ask for Your favor, O Allah, protect me from Satan the outcast.
Reference:
ibid.
Hisnul Muslim 21
Chapter 15: Concerning the athan (the call to prayer)
3 du'as
Repeat what the Mu'adh-dhin says, except for when he says: Hayya 'alas-Sal─üh (hasten to the prayer) and Hayya 'alal-Fal─üh (hasten to salvation). Here you should say:
┘ä╪º ╪¡┘ê┘ä ┘ê┘ä╪º ┘é┘ê╪⌐ ╪Ñ┘ä╪º ╪¿╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç.
play_arrow
share
video_library
L─ü ß╕Ñawla wa l─ü quwwata 'ill─ü bill─üh.
There is no might and no power except by Allah.
Reference:
Al-Bukhari 1/152, Muslim 1/288.
Hisnul Muslim 22
┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä┘å╪º ╪ú┘Ä╪┤┘Æ┘Ç┘ç┘Ä╪»┘Å ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ ┘ä╪º ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ç┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪¡┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ä╪º ╪┤┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘è┘â┘Ä ┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘ç ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä┘å┘æ┘Ä ┘à╪¡┘Ä┘à┘æ┘Ç╪»╪º┘ï ╪╣┘Ä╪¿┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘Å┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪▒┘Ä╪│┘Ç┘ê┘ä┘Å┘ç ╪▒┘Ä╪╢┘è┘Ç╪¬┘Å ╪¿┘É╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘É ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Ä╪º┘ï ┘ê┘Ä╪¿┘É┘à┘Å╪¡┘Ä┘à┘æ┘Ä┘Ç╪»┘ì ╪▒┘Ä╪│┘Ç┘ê┘ä╪º┘ï ┘ê┘Ä╪¿┘É╪º┘ä╪Ñ┘É╪│┘Æ┘ä╪º┘à┘É ╪»┘è┘å┘Ä┘Ç╪º┘ï
play_arrow
share
video_library
Wa 'an─ü 'ash-hadu 'an l─ü 'il─üha 'illall─ühuwaß╕Ñdahu l─ü shar─½ka lahuwa 'anna Muß╕Ñammadan 'abduhu wa ras┼½luhu. raß╕ì─½tu bill─ühi rabban. wa bi Muß╕Ñammadin ras┼½lanwa bi 'l-isl─ümi d─½nan.
I bear witness that none has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner, and that Muhammad is His slave and His Messenger. I am pleased with Allah as my Lord, with Muhammad as my Messenger and with Islam as my religion.1 [To be recited in Arabic after the mu'adh-dhin's tashahhud or the words of affirmation of Faith] 2
Reference:
1. Muslim 1/290. 2. Ibn Khuzaymah 1/220.
Hisnul Muslim 23
recommendation du'as
After replying to the call of Mu'adh-dhin. you should recite in Arabic Allah's blessings on the Prophet (∩╖║).
┘è┘Å╪╡┘Ä┘ä┘æ┘É┘è ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘ë ╪º┘ä┘å┘æ┘Ä╪¿┘É┘è┘æ┘É ╪╡┘ä┘ë ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪╣┘ä┘è┘ç ┘ê╪│┘ä┘à ╪¿┘Ä╪╣┘Æ╪»┘Ä ┘ü┘Ä╪▒┘Ä╪º╪║┘É┘ç┘É ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ╪Ñ┘É╪¼┘Ä╪º╪¿┘Ä╪⌐┘É ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘à┘Å╪ñ┘Ä╪░┘æ┘É┘å┘É
play_arrow
share
video_library
Reference:
Muslim 1/288
Hisnul Muslim 24
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Ä ┘ç┘Ä╪░┘É┘ç┘É ╪º┘ä╪»┘æ╪╣┘Æ┘Ç┘ê┘Ä╪⌐┘É ╪º┘ä╪¬┘æ┘Ç╪º┘à┘æ┘Ä╪⌐ ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä╪╡┘æ┘ä╪º╪⌐┘É ╪º┘ä┘é┘Ä┘Ç╪º╪ª┘É┘à┘Ä╪⌐ ╪ó╪¬┘É ┘à╪¡┘Ä┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä╪»╪º┘ï ╪º┘ä┘ê┘Ä╪│┘è┘Ç┘ä╪⌐┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Æ┘ü┘Ä╪╢┘Ç┘è┘ä┘Ä╪⌐ ┘ê┘Ä╪º╪¿┘Æ╪╣┘Ä┘Ç╪½┘Æ┘ç ┘à┘Ä┘é┘Ç╪º┘à┘Ç╪º┘ï ┘à┘Ä╪¡┘Ç┘à┘ê╪»╪º┘ï ╪º┘ä┘æ┘Ä╪░┘è ┘ê┘Ä╪╣┘Ä┘Ç╪»┘Æ╪¬┘Ä┘ç [╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘Ä┘Ç┘â┘Ä ┘ä╪º ╪¬┘Å┘Ç╪«┘Æ┘ä┘É┘ü┘Å ╪º┘ä┘à┘è┘Ç╪╣╪º╪»]
play_arrow
share
video_library
All─ühumma rabba h─üdhihi 'd-da'wati 't-t─ümmahwaß╣ú-ß╣úal─üti 'l-q─ü'imah,'─üti Muhammadani 'l-was─½lata walfaß╕ì─½lata. wab 'ath-hu maq─üma 'm-mahm┼½dani 'l-ladh─½ wa`adtahu, ['innaka l─ü tukhliful-m─½'─üd]
O Allah, Lord of this perfect call and established prayer. Grant Muhammad the intercession and favor, and raise him to the honored station You have promised him, [verily You do not neglect promises].
Reference:
Al-Bukhari 1/152, and the addition between brackets is from Al-Bayhaqi 1/410 with a good (Hasan) chain of narration. See 'Abdul-Azlz bin Baz's Tuhfatul-'Akhyar, pg. 38.
Hisnul Muslim 25
recommendation du'as
Between the call to prayer and the 'Iqamah, you should supplicate Allah for yourself. Invocation during this time is not rejected.
┘è┘Ä╪»┘Æ╪╣┘Å┘ê ┘ä┘É┘å┘Ä┘ü╪│┘É┘ç┘É ╪¿┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪ú┘Ä╪░┘Ä╪º┘å┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Æ╪Ñ┘É┘é┘Ä╪º┘à┘Ä╪⌐┘É ┘ü┘Ä╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪»┘æ┘Å╪╣┘Ä╪º╪í┘Ä ╪¡┘É┘è┘å┘Ä╪ª┘É╪░┘ì ┘ä╪º┘Ä ┘è┘Å╪▒┘Ä╪»┘æ┘Å

video_library
Reference:
At-Tirmidhi, Abu Dawud, Ahmed. See Irwaa Al-Ghalil 1/262
Hisnul Muslim 26
Chapter 16: At the start of the prayer (after takbeer)
6 du'as
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪¿╪º╪╣┘É┘Ç╪»┘Æ ╪¿┘Ä┘è┘Ç┘å┘è ┘ê┘Ä╪¿┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘å┘Ä ╪«┘Ä╪╖┘Ç╪º┘è╪º┘è┘Ä ┘â┘Ä┘à╪º ╪¿╪º╪╣┘Ä╪»┘Æ╪¬┘Ä ╪¿┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘à┘Ä╪┤┘Æ╪▒┘É┘é┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘à┘Ä╪║┘Æ╪▒┘É╪¿┘Æ ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ┘å┘Ä┘é┘æ┘É┘å┘Ç┘è ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ╪«┘Ä╪╖╪º┘è╪º┘è┘Ä ┘â┘Ä┘à┘Ç╪º ┘è┘Å┘Ç┘å┘Ä┘é┘æ┘Ä┘ë ╪º┘ä╪½┘æ┘Ä┘Ç┘ê┘Æ╪¿┘Å ╪º┘ä╪ú┘Ä╪¿┘Æ┘è┘Ä╪╢┘Å ┘à┘É┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪»┘æ┘Ä┘å┘Ä╪│┘Æ ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪º╪║┘Æ╪│┘É┘ä┘Æ┘å┘Ç┘è ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ╪«┘Ä╪╖╪º┘è┘Ç╪º┘è┘Ä ╪¿┘É╪º┘ä╪½┘æ┘Ä┘ä┘Ç╪¼┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘à┘Ç╪º╪í┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¿┘Ä╪▒┘Ä╪»┘Æ.

video_library
All─ühumma b─ü'id bayn─½ wa bayna khat─üy─üyakam─ü b─üa'adta bayn al-mashriqi wal-maghribi. All─ühumma naqqin─½ min khat─üy─üyakam─ü yunaqqa 'th-thawbu 'l-'abyaß╕ìu min ad-danasi. All─ühumma 'ghsiln─½ min khat─üy─üya. bi 'th-thalji wal-m─ü'i wal-barad.
O Allah, separate me from my sins as You have separated the East from the West. O Allah, cleanse me of my transgressions as the white garment is cleansed of stains. O Allah, wash away my sins with ice and water and frost.
Reference:
Al-Bukhari 1/181, Muslim 1/419.
Hisnul Muslim 27
╪│┘Å╪¿┘Æ┘Ç╪¡╪º┘å┘Ä┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪¿┘É╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘É┘â┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪¬┘Ä╪¿╪º╪▒┘Ä┘â┘Ä ╪º╪│┘Æ┘à┘Å┘Ç┘â┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪¬┘Ä╪╣┘Ç╪º┘ä┘ë ╪¼┘Ä┘Ç╪»┘æ┘Å┘â┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä┘ä╪º ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘ç┘Ä ╪║┘Ä┘è┘Æ╪▒┘Å┘â

video_library
Subh─ünaka All─ühumma wa biß╕Ñamdika. wa tab─üraka 'smuka. wa ta'─ül─ü jadduka. wa l─ü 'il─üha ghayruk.
Glory is to You O Allah, and praise. Blessed is Your Name and Exalted is Your Majesty. There is none worthy of worship but You
Reference:
Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah, An-Nasa'i, At-Tirmidhi. See Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 1/77 and Sahih Ibn Majah 1/135.
Hisnul Muslim 28
┘ê┘Ä╪¼┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Ç╪¬┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪¼┘Æ┘ç┘É┘Ç┘è┘Ä ┘ä┘É┘ä┘æ┘Ä╪░┘è ┘ü┘Ä╪╖┘Ä╪▒┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪│┘æ┘Ä┘à┘Ç┘ê╪º╪¬┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä╪ú┘Ä╪▒┘Æ╪╢┘Ä ╪¡┘Ä┘å┘Ç┘è┘ü┘Ä╪º┘ï ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘Ç╪º ╪ú┘Ä┘å╪º ┘à┘É┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘à╪┤┘Æ╪▒┘É┘â┘è┘å ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘Ä ╪╡┘Ä┘ä╪º╪¬┘Ç┘è ┘ê┘Ä┘å┘Å╪│┘Å┘â┘è ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘Ä╪¡┘Æ┘Ç┘è╪º┘è┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘Ä┘à╪º╪¬┘Ç┘è ┘ä┘ä┘ç┘É ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘É ╪º┘ä╪╣╪º┘ä┘Ä┘à┘è┘å ┘ä╪º ╪┤┘Ä╪▒┘è┘Ç┘â┘Ä ┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪¿┘É╪░┘ä┘â┘Ä ╪ú┘Å┘à┘É╪▒┘Æ╪¬┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä┘å╪º ┘à┘É┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘à╪│┘Æ┘ä┘É┘Ç┘à┘è┘å. ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ╪¬┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘à┘Ä┘ä┘É┘â┘Å ┘ä╪º ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ╪¬ ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ╪¬┘Ä ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘É┘Ç┘è ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Ç╪º ╪╣┘Ä╪¿┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘Å┘â ╪╕┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘à┘Æ┘Ç╪¬┘Å ┘å┘Ä┘ü┘Æ╪│┘Ç┘è ┘ê┘Ä╪º╪╣┘Æ┘Ç╪¬┘Ä╪▒┘Ä┘ü┘Æ╪¬┘Å ╪¿┘É╪░┘Ä┘å┘Æ╪¿┘Ç┘è ┘ü┘Ä╪º╪║┘Æ┘ü┘É╪▒┘Æ ┘ä┘è ╪░┘Å┘å┘ê╪¿┘è ╪¼┘Ä┘à┘è╪╣╪º┘ï ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘Ä┘Ç┘ç ┘ä╪º ┘è┘Ä╪║┘Æ┘Ç┘ü┘É╪▒┘Å ╪º┘ä╪░┘æ┘Å┘å┘Ç┘ê╪¿┘Ä ╪Ñ┘ä╪º┘æ ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ╪¬. ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ç┘Æ╪»┘É┘å┘Ç┘è ┘ä╪ú┘Ä╪¡┘Æ╪│┘Ä┘å┘É ╪º┘ä╪ú┘Ä╪«┘Æ┘ä╪º┘é┘É ┘ä╪º ┘è┘Ä┘ç┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘è ┘ä╪ú┘Ä╪¡┘Æ╪│┘Ä┘Ç┘å┘É┘ç╪º ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ┘Ç╪¬ ┘ê┘Ä╪º╪╡┘Æ┘Ç╪▒┘É┘ü ╪╣┘Ä┘Ç┘å┘æ┘Æ┘è ╪│┘Ä┘è┘æ┘É╪ª┘Ä┘ç┘Ç╪º ┘ä╪º ┘è┘Ä╪╡┘Æ╪▒┘É┘ü┘Å ╪╣┘Ä┘Ç┘å┘æ┘Æ┘è ╪│┘Ä┘è┘æ┘É╪ª┘Ä┘ç┘Ç╪º ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ┘Ç╪¬ ┘ä┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ┘â┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪│┘Ä╪╣┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘â ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä╪«┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ╪▒┘Å ┘â┘Å┘ä┘æ┘Å┘Ç┘ç┘Å ╪¿┘É┘è┘Ä┘Ç╪»┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘Ç┘â ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä╪┤┘æ┘Ä╪▒┘æ┘Å ┘ä┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘Ç╪│┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ┘â ╪ú┘Ä┘å╪º ╪¿┘É┘â┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘Ç┘â ╪¬┘Ä╪¿┘Ç╪º╪▒┘Ä┘â┘Æ╪¬┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪¬┘Ä╪╣┘Ç╪º┘ä┘Ä┘è╪¬┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä╪│┘Æ╪¬┘Ä╪║┘Æ┘Ç┘ü┘É╪▒┘Å┘â┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä╪¬┘ê╪¿┘Å ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘â

video_library
Wajjahtu wajhiya li 'l-ladh├« faß╣¡ara s-sam─üw─üti wa 'l-arß╕ìa,ß╕Ñan─½fan wa m─ü ana min al-mushrik─½na. Inna sal─üti wa nusuk─½, wa mahy─üya wa mam─üt─½ lill─ühi rabbi 'l-`─ülam─½na. l─ü shar─½ka lahu. Wa bi dh─ülika umirtu wa ana min al-muslim─½na. All─ühumma anta 'l-maliku l─ü il─üha ill─ü anta. Anta rabb─½ wa ana `abduka,ß║ôalamtu nafs─½ wa`taraftu bi dhanb─½. Faghfir l─½ dhun┼½b─½ jam─½`an. innahu l─ü yaghfiru 'dh-dhun┼½ba ill─ü anta. Wahdin─½ li-aß╕Ñsani 'l-akhl─üqi. l─ü yahd─½ li aß╕Ñsanih─ü ill─ü anta. Waß╣úrif `ann─½ sayyi'ah─ü. l─ü yaß╣úrifu `ann─½ sayyi'ah─ü ill─ü anta. Labbayka wa sa`dayka. wa 'l-khayru kulluhu bi yadayka. wa 'sh-sharru laysa ilayka. ana bika wa ilayka. tab─ürakta wa ta`─ülayta. astaghfiruka wa at┼½bu ilayka.
I have turned my face sincerely towards He who has brought forth the heavens and the Earth and I am not of those who associate (others with Allah). Indeed my prayer, my sacrifice, my life and my death are for Allah, Lord of the worlds, no partner has He, with this I am commanded and I am of the Muslims. O Allah, You are the Sovereign, none has the right to be worshipped except You. You are my Lord and I am Your servant, I have wronged my own soul and have acknowledged my sin, so forgive me all my sins for no one forgives sins except You. Guide me to the best of characters for none can guide to it other than You, and deliver me from the worst of characters for none can deliver me from it other than You. Here I am, in answer to Your call, happy to serve you. All good is within Your hands and evil does not stem from You. I exist by your will and will return to you. Blessed and High are You, I seek Your forgiveness and repent unto You.
Reference:
Muslim 1/534
Hisnul Muslim 29
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Ä ╪¼┘É┘Ç╪¿┘Æ╪▒╪º╪ª┘è┘ä ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘è┘â┘Ç╪º╪ª┘è┘ä ┘ê┘Ä╪Ñ┘É╪│┘Æ┘Ç╪▒╪º┘ü┘è┘ä ┘ü╪º╪╖┘É┘Ç╪▒┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪│┘æ┘Ä┘à┘ê╪º╪¬┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä╪ú┘Ä╪▒┘Æ╪╢ ╪╣╪º┘ä┘Ç┘É┘à┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪║┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘Ç╪¿┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä╪┤┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Ç╪º╪»┘Ä╪⌐┘É ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ┘Ç╪¬┘Ä ╪¬┘Ä╪¡┘Æ┘Ç┘â┘à┘Å ╪¿┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘Ç┘å┘Ä ╪╣┘É╪¿┘Ç╪º╪»┘É┘â┘Ä ┘ü┘è┘Ç┘à╪º ┘â╪º┘å┘ê╪º ┘ü┘è┘ç┘É ┘è┘Ä╪«┘Æ╪¬┘Ä┘ä┘É┘ü┘Ç┘ê┘å. ╪º┘ç╪»┘É┘å┘Ç┘è ┘ä┘É┘à┘Ç╪º ╪º╪«┘Æ╪¬┘Å┘Ç┘ä┘É┘ü┘Ä ┘ü┘è┘Ç┘ç┘É ┘à┘É┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘Ç┘é┘æ┘É ╪¿┘É╪Ñ┘É╪░┘Æ┘å┘É┘â ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘Ä┘Ç┘â┘Ä ╪¬┘Ä┘ç┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘è ┘à┘Ä┘å┘Æ ╪¬┘Ä╪┤┘Ç╪º╪í┘Å ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘ë ╪╡┘É╪▒╪º╪╖┘ì ┘à┘Å╪│┘Æ╪¬┘Ä┘é┘Ç┘è┘à
play_arrow

video_library
All─ühumma, rabba Jibr─ü'─½la, wa M─½k─ü'─½la, wa Isr─üf─½laF─üß╣¡ira 's-sam─üw─üti wa 'l-arß╕ìi, `─ülima 'l-ghaybi wa 'sh-shah─üdati. anta taß╕Ñkumu bayna `ib─üdika f─½m─ü k─ün┼½ f─½hi yakhtalif┼½na. Ihdin─½ li makhtulifa f─½hi min al-ß╕Ñaqqi bi idhnika. Innaka tahd─½ man tash─ü'u il─ü ß╣úir─üß╣¡in mustaq─½m.
O Allah, Lord of Jibra─½l, M─½ka─½l and Israf─½l (great angels), Creator of the heavens and the Earth, Knower of the seen and the unseen. You are the arbitrator between Your servants in that which they have disputed. Guide me to the truth by Your leave, in that which they have differed, for verily You guide whom You will to a straight path."
Reference:
Muslim 1/534
Hisnul Muslim 30
╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘Å ╪ú┘Ä┘â┘Æ╪¿┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘Å ┘â┘Ä╪¿┘Ç┘è╪▒╪º ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘Å ╪ú┘Ä┘â┘Æ╪¿┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘Å ┘â┘Ä╪¿┘Ç┘è╪▒╪º ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘Å ╪ú┘Ä┘â┘Æ╪¿┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘Å ┘â┘Ä╪¿┘Ç┘è╪▒╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘Ç┘à┘Æ╪»┘Å ┘ä┘ä┘ç┘É ┘â┘Ä╪½┘Ç┘è╪▒╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘Ç┘à┘Æ╪»┘Å ┘ä┘ä┘ç┘É ┘â┘Ä╪½┘Ç┘è╪▒╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘Ç┘à┘Æ╪»┘Å ┘ä┘ä┘ç┘É ┘â┘Ä╪½┘Ç┘è╪▒╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪│┘Å╪¿┘Æ┘Ç╪¡╪º┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘É ╪¿┘â┘Æ┘Ç╪▒┘Ä╪⌐┘ï ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä╪╡┘è┘Ç┘ä╪º.( ╪½┘Ä┘ä╪º╪½╪º┘ï ) ╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Ç┘ê╪░┘Å ╪¿┘É╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘É ┘à┘É┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪┤┘Ä┘æ┘Ç┘è┘Æ╪╖╪º┘å┘É ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ┘å┘Ä┘ü┘Æ╪«┘É┘Ç┘ç┘É ┘ê┘Ä┘å┘Ä┘ü┘Æ┘Ç╪½┘É┘ç┘É ┘ê┘Ä┘ç┘Ä┘à┘Æ┘Ç╪▓┘É┘ç
play_arrow
share
video_library
All─ühu 'Akbar Kab─½ra. All─ühu 'Akbar Kab─½ra. All─ühu 'Akbar Kab─½ra. walß╕Ñamdu lill─ühi kath─½ra. walß╕Ñamdu lill─ühi kath─½ra. walß╕Ñamdu lill─ühi kath─½ra. wa Subß╕Ñ─ünall─ühi bukratan wa'aß╣ú─½la. [Recite three times in Arabic.] 'A `┼½dhu bill─ühi min ash-shayß╣¡─ünmin nafkhihi, wa nafthihi, wa hamzihi.
Allah is the Greatest, Most Great. Allah is the Greatest, Most Great. Allah is the Greatest, Most Great. Praise is to Allah, abundantly. Praise is to Allah, abundantly. Praise is to Allah, abundantly. Glory is to Allah, at the break of day and at its end. [Recite three times in Arabic.] I seek refuge in Allah from Satan. From his breath, and from his voice, and from his whisper.
Reference:
Abu Dawud 1/203, Ibn Majah 1/265, ai Ahmad 4/85. Muslim recorded a similar Hadil 1/420.
Hisnul Muslim 31
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘Ä┘æ ┘ä┘Ä┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ╪»┘Å ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ╪¬┘Ä ┘å┘Ç┘ê╪▒┘Å ╪º┘ä╪│┘Ä┘æ┘à┘Ç┘ê╪º╪¬┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä╪ú┘Ä╪▒┘Æ╪╢┘É ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘Ä┘å┘Æ ┘ü┘è┘Ç┘ç┘É┘å ┘ê┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ╪»┘Å ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ╪¬┘Ä ┘é┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘É┘æ┘à┘Å ╪º┘ä╪│┘Ä┘æ┘Ç┘à┘ê╪º╪¬┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä╪ú┘Ä╪▒┘Æ╪╢┘É ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘Ä┘å┘Æ ┘ü┘è┘Ç┘ç┘É┘å
 [┘ê┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ╪»┘Å ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ╪¬┘Ä ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘Å┘æ ╪º┘ä╪│┘Ä┘æ┘Ç┘à┘ê╪º╪¬┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä╪ú┘Ä╪▒┘Æ╪╢┘É ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘Ä┘å┘Æ ┘ü┘è┘Ç┘ç┘É┘å]
[┘ê┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ╪»┘Å ┘ä┘Ä┘â┘Ä ┘à┘Å┘ä┘Æ┘Ç┘â┘Å ╪º┘ä╪│┘Ä┘æ┘Ç┘à┘ê╪º╪¬┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä╪ú┘Ä╪▒┘Æ╪╢┘É ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘Ä┘å┘Æ ┘ü┘è┘Ç┘ç┘É┘å]
[┘ê┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ╪»┘Å ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ╪¬┘Ä ┘à┘Ä┘ä┘É┘Ç┘â┘Å ╪º┘ä╪│┘Ä┘æ┘Ç┘à┘ê╪º╪¬┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä╪ú┘Ä╪▒┘Æ╪╢┘É ]
[┘ê┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ╪»┘Å]
[╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ╪¬┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘Ç┘é┘æ ┘ê┘Ä┘ê┘Ä╪╣┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘Å┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘Ç┘é ┘ê┘Ä┘é┘Ä┘ê┘Æ┘ä┘Å┘Ç┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘Ç┘é ┘ê┘Ä┘ä┘É┘é┘Ç╪º╪ñ┘Å┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘Ç┘é ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¼┘Ä┘Ç┘å┘Ä┘æ╪⌐┘Å╪¡┘Ä┘Ç┘é ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘å┘æ┘Ç╪º╪▒┘Å ╪¡┘Ä┘Ç┘é ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘å┘Ä┘æ╪¿┘É┘Ç┘è┘æ┘ê┘å┘Ä ╪¡┘Ä┘Ç┘é ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘Ç╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Ä┘æ╪»┘î ╪¡┘Ä┘Ç┘é ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä╪│┘æ┘Ç╪º╪╣┘Ä╪⌐┘Å╪¡┘Ä┘Ç┘é]
[╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘Ä┘æ ┘ä┘Ä┘â┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä╪│┘Æ┘ä┘Ä┘à╪¬ ┘ê┘Ä╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ┘â┘Ä ╪¬┘Ä┘ê┘Ä┘â┘Ä┘æ┘ä┘Æ┘Ç╪¬ ┘ê┘Ä╪¿┘É┘â┘Ä ╪ó┘à┘Ä┘å┘Æ┘Ç╪¬ ┘ê┘Ä╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ┘â┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Ä╪¿┘Æ┘Ç╪¬ ┘ê┘Ä╪¿┘É┘Ç┘â┘Ä ╪«╪º╪╡┘Ä┘à┘Æ╪¬ ┘ê┘Ä╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ┘â┘Ä ╪¡╪º┘â┘Ä┘à┘Æ┘Ç╪¬ . ┘ü╪º╪║┘Æ┘ü┘É┘Ç╪▒┘Æ ┘ä┘è ┘à┘Ç╪º ┘é┘Ä╪»┘Ä┘æ┘à┘Æ╪¬┘Å ┘ê┘Ä┘à╪º ╪ú┘Ä╪«┘Ä┘æ┘Ç╪▒┘Æ╪¬ ┘ê┘Ä┘à╪º ╪ú┘Ä╪│┘Æ┘Ç╪▒┘Ä╪▒┘Æ╪¬ ┘ê┘Ä┘à╪º ╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Æ┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘å┘Æ╪¬ ]
[╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ╪¬┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘à┘Å┘é┘Ä┘Ç╪»┘É┘æ┘à┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ╪¬┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘à┘Å┘Ç╪ñ┘Ä╪«┘É┘æ╪▒ ┘ä╪º ╪Ñ┘É╪º┘Ç┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ┘Ç╪¬]
[╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ┘Ç╪¬┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ç┘ç┘è ┘ä╪º ╪Ñ┘É╪º┘Ç┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ┘Ç╪¬

video_library
All─ühumma lakal-ß╕Ñamdu 'Anta n┼½russam─üw─üti wal'arß╕ìhi wa man f─½hinna. wa lakal-ß╕Ñamdu 'Anta qayyimus-sam─üw─üti wal'arß╕ìi wa man f─½hinna,
[wa lakal-ß╕Ñamdu 'Anta Rabbus-sam─üw─üti wal'arß╕ìi wa man f─½hinna]
[wa lakal-ß╕Ñamdu laka mulkus-sam─üw─üti wal'arß╕ìi wa man f─½hinna]
[wa lakal-ß╕Ñamdu 'Anta Malikus-sam─üw─üti wal'arß╕ìi]
[wa lakal-ß╕Ñamdu]
['Antal-ß╕Ñaqq, wa wa`dukal-ß╕Ñaqq. wa qawlukal-ß╕Ñaqq, wa liq─ü'ukal-ß╕Ñaqq. waljannatu ß╕Ñaqq, wann─üru ß╕Ñaqq. wannabiyy┼½na ß╕Ñaqq, wa Muß╕Ñammadun (sallall─ühu 'alayhi wa sallam) ß╕Ñaqq. wass─ü`atu ß╕Ñaqq]
[All─ühumma laka 'aslamtu, wa `alayka tawakkaltu. wa bika '─ümantu, wa 'ilayka 'anabtu. wa bika kh─üß╣úamtu, wa 'ilayka ß╕Ñ─ükamtu. Faghfir l─½ maa qaddamtu, wa m─ü 'akhkhartu. wa m─ü 'asrartu, wa m─ü 'a`lantu
['Antal-Muqaddimu, wa 'Antal-Mu'akhkhirulaa 'il─üha 'ill─ü 'Anta]
['Anta 'il─üh─½ l─ü 'il─üha 'ill─ü 'Anta].
O Allah, praise is to You. You are the Light of the heavens and the earth and all that they contain. Praise is to You, You are the Sustainer of the heavens and the earth and all they contain. [Praise is to You, You are the Lord of the heavens and the earth and all they contain.] [Praise is to You, Yours is dominion of the heavens and the earth and all they contain.][Praise is to You, You are the King of the heavens and the earth.] [And praise is to You.] [You are the Truth, Your Promise is true, Your Word is true, Your audience is true, Paradise is true, Hell is true, the Prophets are true, and Muhammad (peace and blessings be upon him) is true, and the Hour of Judgment is true.][O Allah, to You I have submitted, and upon You I depend. I have believed in You and to You I turn in repentance. For Your sake I dispute and by Your standard I judge. Forgive me what I have sent before me and what I have left behind me, what I have concealed and what I have declared.][You are the One Who sends forth and You are the One Who delays, there is none who has the right to be worshipped but You.][You are my God, there is none who has the right to be worshipped butYou.]
Reference:
Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 3/3 , 11/ 116, 13/371, 423, 465. See also Muslim for a shorter account, 1/532.
Hisnul Muslim 32
Chapter 17: While bowing in prayer
5 du'as
╪│┘Å╪¿┘Æ┘Ç╪¡╪º┘å┘Ä ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘É┘Ç┘è┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪╣┘Ä╪╕┘Ç┘è┘à (╪½┘ä╪º╪½ ┘à╪▒╪º╪¬)
play_arrow
share
video_library
Subß╕Ñ─üna Rabbiyal-`Aß║ô─½m.
Glory to my Lord the Exalted (three times in Arabic)
Reference:
Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah, An-Nasa'i, At-Tirmidhi, and Ahmad. See Al-Albani's Sahih At-Tirmidhi 1/83.
Hisnul Muslim 33
╪│┘Å╪¿┘Æ┘Ç╪¡╪º┘å┘Ä┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘Ä┘æ ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘Ä┘æ┘Ç┘å╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪¿┘É╪¡┘Ä┘Ç┘à┘Æ╪»┘É┘â ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘Ä┘æ ╪º╪║┘Æ┘ü┘É┘Ç╪▒┘Æ ┘ä┘è
play_arrow
share
video_library
Subß╕Ñ─ünaka All─ühumma Rabban─ü wa biß╕Ñamdika All─ühum-maghfir l─½.
Glory is to You, O Allah, our Lord, and praise is Yours. O Allah, forgive me.
Reference:
Al-Bukhari 1/99, Muslim 1/350.
Hisnul Muslim 34
╪│┘Å╪¿┘Ç┘æ┘ê╪¡┘î ┘é┘Å┘Ç╪»┘æ┘Æ┘ê╪│ ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘Å┘æ ╪º┘ä┘à┘ä╪º╪ª┘É┘â┘Ä┘Ç╪⌐┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Ç╪▒┘Å┘æ┘ê╪¡

video_library
Subb┼½ß╕Ñun, Qudd┼½sun, Rabbul-mal─ü'ikati warr┼½ß╕Ñ.
Glory (to You), Most Holy (are You), Lord of the angels and the Spirit.
Reference:
Muslim 1/353, Abu Dawud 1/230.
Hisnul Muslim 35
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘Ä┘æ ┘ä┘Ä┘â┘Ä ╪▒┘Ä┘â┘Ä┘Ç╪╣┘Æ╪¬┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪¿┘É┘â┘Ä ╪ó┘à┘Ä┘Ç┘å┘Æ╪¬ ┘ê┘ä┘Ä┘â┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä╪│┘Æ┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘à┘Æ╪¬ ╪«┘Ä╪┤┘Ä┘Ç╪╣┘Ä ┘ä┘Ä┘â┘Ä ╪│┘Ä┘à┘Æ┘Ç╪╣┘è ┘ê┘Ä╪¿┘Ä╪╡┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘è ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘Å╪«┘É┘æ┘Ç┘è ┘ê┘Ä╪╣┘Ä╪╕┘Æ┘à┘Ç┘è ┘ê┘Ä╪╣┘Ä╪╡┘Ä┘Ç╪¿┘è ┘ê┘Ä┘à╪º ╪º╪│╪¬┘Ä┘é┘Ä┘Ç┘ä┘Ä┘æ ╪¿┘É┘ç┘É ┘é┘Ä╪»┘Ä┘à┘è
play_arrow
share
video_library
All─ühumma laka raka`tu. wa bika '─ümantu, wa laka 'aslamtukhasha`a laka sam`ee wa baß╣úar─½. wa mukhkh─½, wa `aß║ôm─½, wa `aß╣úab─½. wa mastaqalla bihi qadam─½.
O Allah, to You I bow (in prayer) and in You I believe and to You I have submitted. Before You my hearing is humbled, and my sight, and my mind, my bones, my nerves and what my feet have mounted upon (for travel).
Reference:
Muslim 1/534, Abu Dawud, An-Nasa'i and At- Tirmidhi.
Hisnul Muslim 36
╪│┘Å╪¿┘Æ┘Ç╪¡╪º┘å┘Ä ╪░┘è ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¼┘Ä╪¿┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘ê╪¬ ┘ê╪º┘ä┘à┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘â┘ê╪¬ ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘â┘É╪¿┘Æ┘Ç╪▒┘É┘è╪º╪í ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Æ╪╣┘Ä╪╕┘Ä┘Ç┘à┘Ä╪⌐┘É

share
video_library
Subß╕Ñ─üna dhil-jabar┼½ti, walmalak┼½ti, walkibriy─ü'i, wal`aß║ôamati.
Glory is to You, Master of power, of dominion, of majesty and greatness.
Reference:
Abu Dawud 1/230, An-Nasa'i and Ahmad. Its chain of narration is good (Hasan).
Hisnul Muslim 37
Chapter 18: Upon rising from the bowing position
3 du'as
╪│┘Ä┘à┘É┘Ç╪╣┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘Å ┘ä┘É┘à┘Ä┘Ç┘å┘Æ ╪¡┘Ä┘à┘É┘Ç╪»┘Ä┘ç

video_library
Sami`all─ühu liman ß╕Ñamidah.
Allah hears whoever praises Him.
Reference:
Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 2/282.
Hisnul Muslim 38
╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘Ä┘æ┘å┘Ç╪º ┘ê┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘Å ╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ┘Ç╪»╪º┘ï ┘â┘Ä╪½┘Ç┘è╪▒╪º┘ï ╪╖┘Ä┘è┘É┘æ┘Ç╪¿╪º┘ï ┘à┘Å┘Ç╪¿╪º╪▒┘Ä┘â╪º┘ï ┘ü┘è┘ç

Rabban─ü wa lakal-ß╕Ñamd,ß╕Ñamdan kath─½ran ß╣¡ayyiban mub─ürakan f─½h.
Our Lord, praise is Yours, abundant, good and blessed praise.
Reference:
Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 2/284.
Hisnul Muslim 39
┘à┘É┘ä┘Æ╪í┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪│┘æ┘Ä┘à┘Ç┘ê╪º╪¬┘É ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘É┘ä┘Æ╪í┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪ú┘Ä╪▒┘Æ╪╢ ┘ê┘Ä┘à╪º ╪¿┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘Ç┘å┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘à┘Ç╪º ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘É┘ä┘Æ╪í┘Ä ┘à╪º ╪┤┘É╪ª┘Æ┘Ç╪¬┘Ä ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ╪┤┘Ä┘è╪í┘ì ╪¿┘Ä╪╣┘Æ┘Ç╪» . ╪ú┘Ä┘ç┘Ç┘ä┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪½┘æ┘Ä┘Ç┘å╪º╪í┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘à┘Ä╪¼┘Ç╪» ╪ú┘Ä┘Ä╪¡┘Ä┘Ç┘é┘æ┘Å ┘à╪º ┘é╪º┘ä┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪╣┘Ä╪¿┘Æ┘Ç╪» ┘ê┘Ä┘â┘Å┘ä┘æ┘Å┘Ç┘å╪º ┘ä┘Ä┘â┘Ä ╪╣┘Ä┘Ç╪¿╪» . ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ┘ä╪º ┘à╪º┘å┘É╪╣┘Ä ┘ä┘É┘à╪º ╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Æ╪╖┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ╪¬ ┘ê┘Ä┘ä╪º ┘à┘Å╪╣┘Æ╪╖┘É┘Ç┘è┘Ä ┘ä┘É┘à╪º ┘à┘Ä┘å┘Ä┘Ç╪╣┘Æ╪¬ ┘ê┘Ä┘ä╪º ┘è┘Ä┘å┘Æ┘ü┘Ä┘Ç╪╣┘Å ╪░╪º ╪º┘ä╪¼┘Ä┘Ç╪»┘æ┘É ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ┘Ç┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪¼┘Ä┘Ç╪»
play_arrow
share
video_library
Mil'a 's-sam─üw─üti wa mil'a 'l-'arß╕ìi wa m─ü baynahum─ü. wa mil'a m─ü shi'ta min shay'in ba`d.'Ahla 'th-than─ü'i wa 'l-majdi,'aß╕Ñaqqu m─ü q─üla 'l-`abdu. wa kullun─ü laka `abdun. All─ühumma l─ü m─üni`a lim─ü 'a`ß╣¡ayta. wa l─ü mu`ß╣¡iya lim─ü mana`ta. wa l─ü yanfa`u dhal-jaddi minka 'l-jadd..
(A praise that) fills the heavens and the earth and what lies between them, and whatever else You please. (You Allah) are most worthy of praise and majesty, and what the slave has said - we are all Your slaves. O Allah, there is none who can withhold what You give, and none may give what You have withheld. And the might of the mighty person cannot benefit him against You.
Reference:
Muslim 1/346.
Hisnul Muslim 40
Chapter 19: While prostrating
7 du'as
╪│┘Å╪¿┘Æ┘Ç╪¡╪º┘å┘Ä ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘É┘Ç┘è┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Æ┘ä┘Ç┘ë.
(╪½┘ä╪º╪½ ┘à╪▒╪º╪¬)
play_arrow
share
video_library
Subß╕Ñ─üna Rabbiya ΓÇÿl-a`l─ü.
Glory is to my Lord, the Most High.
(This is said three times in Arabic.)
Reference:
Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah, An-Nasa'i, At-Tirmidhi, and Ahmad. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 1/83.
Hisnul Muslim 41
╪│┘Å╪¿┘Æ┘Ç╪¡╪º┘å┘Ä┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Ä┘Ç┘å╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪¿┘É╪¡┘Ä┘Ç┘à┘Æ╪»┘É┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪º╪║┘Æ┘ü┘É╪▒┘Æ ┘ä┘è
play_arrow
share
video_library
Subß╕Ñ─ünaka All─ühumma Rabban─ü wa biß╕Ñamdika All─ühumma ΓÇÿghfir l─½.
Glory is to You, O Allah, our Lord, and praise is Yours. O Allah, forgive me.
Reference:
Al-Bukhari and Muslim, see invocation no. 34 above.
Hisnul Muslim 42
╪│┘Å╪¿┘Ç┘æ┘ê╪¡┘î ┘é┘Å┘Ç╪»┘æ┘ê╪│ ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Å ╪º┘ä┘à┘ä╪º╪ª┘É┘â┘Ä┘Ç╪⌐┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Ç╪▒┘æ┘Å┘ê╪¡

Glory (to You), Most Holy (are You), Lord of the angels and the Spirit.
Reference:
Muslim 1/533, see invocation no. 35 above.
Hisnul Muslim 43
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ┘ä┘Ä┘â┘Ä ╪│┘Ä┘Ç╪¼┘Ä╪»┘Æ╪¬┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪¿┘É┘Ç┘â┘Ä ╪ó┘à┘Ä┘å┘Æ┘Ç╪¬ ┘ê┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘â┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä╪│┘Æ┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘à┘Æ╪¬ ╪│┘Ä╪¼┘Ä┘Ç╪»┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪¼┘Æ┘ç┘Ç┘è ┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘Ç╪░┘è ╪«┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘é┘Ä┘Ç┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪╡┘Ä┘Ç┘ê┘æ┘Ä╪▒┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪┤┘Ä┘é┘æ┘Ä ╪│┘Ä┘à┘Æ┘Ç╪╣┘Ä┘Ç┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪¿┘Ä╪╡┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘Ä┘ç ╪¬┘Ä╪¿┘Ç╪º╪▒┘Ä┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘Å ╪ú┘Ä╪¡┘Æ╪│┘Ç┘å┘Å ╪º┘ä╪«┘Ç╪º┘ä┘É┘é┘è┘Ç┘å
play_arrow
share
video_library
All─ühumma laka sajadtuwa bika ─ümantu. wa laka aslamtu. sajada wajΓÇÖhiya lilladh─½ khalaqahu, wa ß╣úawwarahu. wa shaqqa sam`ahu wa baß╣úarahu. tab─ürakall─ühu 'aß╕Ñsanul-kh─üliq─½n.
O Allah, to You I prostrate myself and in You I believe. To You I have submitted. My face is prostrated to the One Who created it, fashioned it, and gave it hearing and sight. Blessed is Allah, the Best of creators
Reference:
Muslim 1/534 and others.
Hisnul Muslim 44
╪│┘Å╪¿┘Æ┘Ç╪¡╪º┘å┘Ä ╪░┘è ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¼┘Ä╪¿┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘ê╪¬ ┘ê╪º┘ä┘à┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘â┘Ç┘ê╪¬ ┘ê╪º┘ä┘â┘É╪¿┘Æ┘Ç╪▒┘É┘è╪º╪í ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä╪╣┘Ä╪╕┘Ä┘à┘Ä┘Ç╪⌐┘É.

video_library
Subß╕Ñ─üna dhi ΓÇÖl-jabar┼½ti, wa ΓÇÖl-malak┼½ti, wa ΓÇÿl-kibriy─ü'i, wa ΓÇÿl-aß║ôamati.
Glory is to the master of power, sovereignty, of majesty and greatness.
Reference:
Abu Dawud 1/230, An-Nasa'i, Ahmad. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Abu Dawud 1/166, see invocation no. 37 above.

Chapter 22: The Tashahhud
1 du'as
╪º┘ä╪¬┘æ┘Ä╪¡┘É┘è┘æ┘Ç╪º╪¬┘Å ┘ä┘ä┘ç┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä╪╡┘æ┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘ê╪º╪¬┘Å ┘ê╪º┘ä╪╖┘æ┘Ä┘è┘æ┘É┘Ç╪¿╪º╪¬ ╪º┘ä╪│┘æ┘Ä┘ä╪º┘à┘Å ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘è┘Ç┘â┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä┘è┘æ┘Å┘ç┘Ç╪º ╪º┘ä┘å┘æ┘Ä╪¿┘É┘Ç┘è┘æ┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪▒┘Ä╪¡┘Æ┘à┘Ä┘Ç╪⌐┘Å ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪¿┘Ä╪▒┘Ä┘â┘Ç╪º╪¬┘Å┘ç ╪º┘ä╪│┘æ┘Ä┘ä╪º┘à┘Å ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘Ç┘å╪º┘ê┘Ä╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ç┘ë ╪╣┘É╪¿┘Ç╪º╪»┘É ┘ä┘ä┘ç┘É ╪º┘ä╪╡┘æ┘Ä┘Ç╪º┘ä┘É╪¡┘Ç┘è┘å . ╪ú┘Ä╪┤┘Æ┘Ç┘ç┘Ä╪»┘Å ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ ┘ä╪º ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ç┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä╪┤┘Æ┘Ç┘ç┘Ä╪»┘Å ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘æ┘Ä ┘à┘Å╪¡┘Ä┘à┘æ┘Ç╪»╪º┘ï ╪╣┘Ä╪¿┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘Å┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪▒┘Ä╪│┘Ç┘ê┘ä┘Å┘ç

share
video_library
Attaß╕Ñiyy─ütu lill─ühi waß╣úß╣úalaw─ütu, waß╣¡ß╣¡ayyib─üt. assal─ümu `alayka 'ayyuhan-Nabiyyuwa raß╕Ñmatull─ühi wa barak─ütuh. assal─ümu `alayn─ü wa `al─ü ΓÇÿib─üdill─ühiß╣ú-ß╣ú─üliß╕Ñ─½n.'Ash-hadu 'an l─ü 'il─üha 'illall─ühwa 'ash-hadu 'anna Muß╕Ñammadan `abduhu wa ras┼½luh.
All greetings of humility are for Allah, and all prayers and goodness. Peace be upon you, O Prophet, and the mercy of Allah and His blessings. Peace be upon us and upon the righteous slaves of Allah. I bear witness that there is none worthy of worship but Allah, and I bear witness that Muhammad is His slave and His Messenger.
Reference:
Al-Bukhari, Muslim 1/301. See also Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bal 1/13

╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪╡┘Ä┘ä┘æ┘É ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ç┘ë ┘à┘Å╪¡┘à┘æ┘Ä┘Ç╪» ┘ê┘Ä╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ç┘ë ╪ó┘ä┘É ┘à┘Å╪¡┘à┘æ┘Ä╪» ┘â┘Ä┘à┘Ç╪º ╪╡┘Ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘è┘Ç╪¬┘Ä ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ç┘ë ╪Ñ╪¿┘Æ╪▒╪º┘ç┘Ç┘è┘à┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ç┘ë ╪ó┘ä┘É ╪Ñ╪¿┘Æ╪▒╪º┘ç┘Ç┘è┘à ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘Ä┘â┘Ä ╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Ç┘è╪»┘î ┘à┘Ä╪¼┘Ç┘è╪» ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪¿╪º╪▒┘É┘â┘Æ ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ç┘ë ┘à┘Å╪¡┘à┘æ┘Ä┘Ç╪» ┘ê┘Ä╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ç┘ë ╪ó┘ä┘É ┘à┘Å╪¡┘à┘æ┘Ä┘Ç╪» ┘â┘Ä┘à┘Ç╪º ╪¿╪º╪▒┘É┘â┘Æ╪¬┘Ä ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ç┘ë ╪Ñ╪¿┘Æ╪▒╪º┘ç┘Ç┘è┘à┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ç┘ë ╪ó┘ä┘É ╪Ñ╪¿┘Æ╪▒╪º┘ç┘è┘à ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘Ä┘â┘Ä ╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Ç┘è╪»┘î ┘à┘Ä╪¼┘Ç┘è╪»

All─ühumma ß╣úalli `al─ü Muß╕Ñammadinwa `al─ü ΓÇÖ─üli Muß╕Ñammadin. kam─ü ß╣úallayta `al─ü 'Ibr─üh─½ma wa `al─ü ΓÇÖ─üli 'Ibr─üh─½ma, 'innaka ß╕Ñam─½dum-maj─½d. O Allah, bestow Your favor on Muhammad and on the family of Muhammad as You have bestowed Your favor on Ibrahim and on the family of Ibrahim, You are Praiseworthy, Most Glorious. Reference:

Hisnul Muslim 53
┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪╡┘Ä┘ä┘æ┘É ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ç┘ë ┘à┘Å╪¡┘à┘æ┘Ä┘Ç╪»┘ì ┘ê┘Ä╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ç┘ë ╪ú┘Ä╪▓┘Æ┘ê╪º╪¼┘É┘Ç┘ç┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪░┘Å╪▒┘æ┘É┘è┘æ┘Ä┘Ç╪¬┘É┘ç ┘â┘Ä┘à┘Ç╪º ╪╡┘Ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘Ç╪¬┘Ä ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ç┘ë ╪ó┘ä┘É ╪Ñ╪¿┘Æ╪▒╪º┘ç┘Ç┘è┘à . ┘ê┘Ä╪¿╪º╪▒┘É┘â┘Æ ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ç┘ë ┘à┘Å╪¡┘à┘æ┘Ä┘Ç╪»┘ì ┘ê┘Ä╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ç┘ë ╪ú┘Ä╪▓┘Æ┘ê╪º╪¼┘É┘Ç┘ç┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪░┘Å╪▒┘æ┘É┘è┘æ┘Ä┘Ç╪¬┘É┘ç ┘â┘Ä┘à┘Ç╪º ╪¿╪º╪▒┘É┘â┘Æ╪¬┘Ä ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ç┘ë ╪ó┘ä┘É ╪Ñ╪¿┘Æ╪▒╪º┘ç┘Ç┘è┘à . ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘Ä┘â┘Ä ╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Ç┘è╪»┘î ┘à┘Ä╪¼┘Ç┘è╪»

All─ühumma ß╣úalli `al─ü Muß╕Ñammadinwa `al─ü 'azw─üjihi wa dhurriyyatihi. kam─ü ß╣úallayta `al─ü '─üli 'Ibr─üh─½ma. Wa b─ürik `al─ü Muß╕Ñammadinwa `al─ü 'azw─üjihi wa dhurriyyatihi. kam─ü b─ürakta `al─ü '─üli 'Ibr─üh─½ma.'Innaka ß╕Ñam─½dum-maj─½d.

Hisnul Muslim 54
Chapter 24: After the last tashahhud and before salam
11 du'as
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘É┘Ç┘è ╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Ç┘ê╪░┘Å ╪¿┘É┘â┘Ä ┘à┘É┘Ç┘å┘Æ ╪╣┘Ä╪░╪º╪¿┘É ╪º┘ä┘é┘Ä┘Ç╪¿┘Æ╪▒ ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘É┘Ç┘å┘Æ ╪╣┘Ä╪░╪º╪¿┘É ╪¼┘Ä┘ç┘Ä┘Ç┘å┘æ┘Ä┘à ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘É┘Ç┘å┘Æ ┘ü┘É╪¬┘Æ┘Ç┘å┘Ä╪⌐┘É ╪º┘ä┘à┘Ä╪¡┘Æ┘Ç┘è╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘à┘Ä┘à┘Ç╪º╪¬ ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘É┘Ç┘å┘Æ ╪┤┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘æ┘É ┘ü┘É╪¬┘Æ┘Ç┘å┘Ä╪⌐┘É ╪º┘ä┘à┘Ä╪│┘è╪¡┘É ╪º┘ä╪»┘æ┘Ä╪¼┘æ╪º┘ä

All─ühumma ΓÇÿinn─½ ΓÇÿa`┼½dhu bika min `adh─übi ΓÇÿl-qabri. wa min `adh─übi jahannam. wa min fitnati ΓÇÿl-maß╕Ñy─ü wa ΓÇÿl-mam─üti. wa min sharri fitnati ΓÇÿl-mas─½ß╕Ñid-dajj─ül.
O Allah, I seek refuge in You from the punishment of the grave, and from the punishment of Hell-fire, and from the trials of life and death, and from the evil of the trial of the False Messiah.
Reference:
Al-Bukhari 2/102, Muslim 1/412, and this is Muslim's wording.
Hisnul Muslim 55
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘É┘Ç┘è ╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Ç┘ê╪░┘Å ╪¿┘É┘â┘Ä ┘à┘É┘Ç┘å┘Æ ╪╣┘Ä╪░╪º╪¿┘É ╪º┘ä┘é┘Ä┘Ç╪¿┘Æ╪▒ ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Ç┘ê╪░┘Å ╪¿┘É┘â┘Ä ┘à┘É┘Ç┘å┘Æ ┘ü┘É╪¬┘Æ┘Ç┘å┘Ä╪⌐┘É ╪º┘ä┘à┘Ä╪│┘è╪¡┘É ╪º┘ä╪»┘æ┘Ä╪¼┘æ┘Ç╪º┘ä ╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Ç┘ê╪░┘Å ╪¿┘É┘â┘Ä ┘à┘É┘Ç┘å┘Æ ┘ü┘É╪¬┘Æ┘Ç┘å┘Ä╪⌐┘É ╪º┘ä┘à┘Ä╪¡┘Æ┘Ç┘è╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘à┘Ä┘à┘Ç╪º╪¬ . ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘É┘Ç┘è ╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Ç┘ê╪░┘Å ╪¿┘É┘â┘Ä ┘à┘É┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘à┘Ä╪ú┘Æ╪½┘Ä┘Ç┘à┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘à┘Ä╪║┘Æ┘Ç╪▒┘Ä┘à
play_arrow
share
video_library
All─ühumma 'inn─½ ΓÇÿa`┼½dhu bika min `adh─übi ΓÇÿl-qabr. wa ΓÇÿa`┼½dhu bika min fitnati ΓÇÿl-mas─½ß╕Ñid-dajj─ül. wa ΓÇÿa`┼½dhu bika min fitnati ΓÇÿl-maß╕Ñy─ü wa ΓÇÿl-mam─üt. All─ühumma ΓÇÿinn─½ ΓÇÿa`┼½dhu bika mina ΓÇÿl-mΓÇÖathami wa ΓÇÿl-maghram.
O Allah, I seek refuge in You from the punishment of the grave, and I seek refuge in You from the trial of the False Messiah, and I seek refuge in You from the trials of life and death. O Allah, I seek refuge in You from sin and from debt.
Reference:
Al-Bukhari 1/202, Muslim 1/412.

╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪º╪║┘Æ┘Ç┘ü┘É╪▒┘Æ ┘ä┘è ┘à╪º ┘é┘Ä╪»┘æ┘Ä┘à┘Æ┘Ç╪¬┘Å ┘ê┘Ä┘à╪º ╪ú┘Ä╪«┘æ┘Ä╪▒┘Æ╪¬ ┘ê┘Ä┘à╪º ╪ú┘Ä╪│┘Æ┘Ç╪▒┘Ä╪▒┘Æ╪¬┘Å ┘ê┘Ä┘à╪º ╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Æ┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘å┘Æ╪¬ ┘ê┘Ä┘à╪º ╪ú┘Ä╪│┘Æ┘Ç╪▒┘Ä┘ü┘Æ╪¬ ┘ê┘Ä┘à╪º ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ╪¬┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Æ┘Ç┘ä┘Ä┘à┘Å ╪¿┘É┘ç┘É ┘à┘É┘å┘æ┘É┘è . ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ╪¬┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘à┘Å┘é┘Ä┘Ç╪»┘æ┘É┘à┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ╪¬┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘à┘Å┘Ç╪ñ┘Ä╪«┘æ┘É┘Ç╪▒┘Å ┘ä╪º ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ┘Ç╪¬

All─ühummaghΓÇÖfir l─½ m─ü qaddamtu, wa m─ü ΓÇÿakhkhartu. wa m─ü ΓÇÿasrartu, wa m─ü ΓÇÿa`lantu. wa m─ü ΓÇÿasraftu, wa m─ü 'anta ΓÇÿa`lamu bihi minn─½.ΓÇÿanta ΓÇÿl-Muqaddimu, wa 'anta ΓÇÿl-MuΓÇÿakhkhirul─ü 'il─üha 'ill─ü 'anta.
O Allah, forgive me what I have sent before me and what I have left behind me, what I have concealed and what I have done openly, what I have done in excess, and what You are better aware of than I. You are the One Who sends forth and You are the One Who delays. There is none worthy of worship but You.
Reference:
Muslim 1/534.

╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪¿┘É╪╣┘É┘ä┘Æ┘Ç┘à┘É┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪║┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ╪¿┘É ┘ê┘Ä┘é┘Å┘Ç╪»┘Æ╪▒┘Ä╪¬┘É┘Ç┘â┘Ä ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ç┘ë ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪«┘Ä┘ä┘é┘É ╪ú┘Ä╪¡┘Æ┘Ç┘è┘É┘å┘è ┘à╪º ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘É┘Ç┘à┘Æ╪¬┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪¡┘Ç┘è╪º╪⌐┘Ä ╪«┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ╪▒╪º┘ï ┘ä┘Ç┘è ┘ê┘Ä╪¬┘Ä┘ê┘Ä┘ü┘æ┘Ä┘Ç┘å┘è ╪Ñ┘É╪░╪º ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘É┘Ç┘à┘Æ╪¬┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ê┘Ä┘ü┘Ç╪º╪⌐┘Ä ╪«┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ╪▒╪º┘ï ┘ä┘Ç┘è ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘É┘Ç┘è ╪ú┘Ä╪│┘Æ┘Ç╪ú┘Ä┘ä┘Å┘Ç┘â┘Ä ╪«┘Ä╪┤┘Æ┘è┘Ä╪¬┘Ä┘Ç┘â┘Ä ┘ü┘è ╪º┘ä╪║┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ╪¿┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä╪┤┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Ç╪º╪»┘Ä╪⌐┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä╪│┘Æ┘Ç╪ú┘Ä┘ä┘Å┘Ç┘â┘Ä ┘â┘Ä┘ä┘É┘à┘Ä┘Ç╪⌐┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪¡┘Ä┘Ç┘é┘æ┘É ┘ü┘è ╪º┘ä╪▒┘æ┘É╪╢┘Ç╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä╪║┘Ä╪╢┘Ä┘Ç╪¿ ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä╪│┘Æ┘Ç╪ú┘Ä┘ä┘Å┘Ç┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘é┘Ä╪╡┘Æ╪»┘Ä ┘ü┘è ╪º┘ä╪║┘É┘å┘Ç┘ë ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘ü┘Ä┘é┘Æ┘Ç╪▒ ╪ú┘Ä╪│┘Æ┘Ç╪ú┘Ä┘ä┘Å┘Ç┘â┘Ä ┘å┘Ä╪╣┘Ç┘è┘à╪º┘ï ┘ä╪º ┘è┘Ä┘å┘Æ┘ü┘Ä┘Ç╪» ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä╪│┘Æ┘Ç╪ú┘Ä┘ä┘Å┘Ç┘â┘Ä ┘é┘Å┘Ç╪▒┘æ┘Ä╪⌐┘Ä ╪╣┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘Ç┘å┘ì ┘ä╪º ╪¬┘Ä┘å┘Æ┘Ç┘é┘Ä╪╖┘É╪╣┘Æ ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä╪│┘Æ┘Ç╪ú┘Ä┘ä┘Å┘Ç┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪▒┘æ┘É╪╢┘Ç╪º ╪¿┘Ä╪╣┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘é┘Ä╪╢┘Ç╪º╪í ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä╪│┘Æ┘Ç╪ú┘Ä┘ä┘Å┘Ç┘â┘Ä ╪¿┘ï┘Ç╪▒┘Æ╪»┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪╣┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ╪┤┘É ╪¿┘Ä╪╣┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘à┘Ä┘Ç┘ê┘Æ╪¬ ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä╪│┘Æ┘Ç╪ú┘Ä┘ä┘Å┘Ç┘â┘Ä ┘ä┘Ä┘Ç╪░┘æ┘Ä╪⌐┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘å┘æ┘Ä╪╕┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘É ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ç┘ë ┘ê┘Ä╪¼┘Æ┘Ç┘ç┘É┘â┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä╪┤┘æ┘Ä┘Ç┘ê┘Æ┘é┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ç┘ë ┘ä┘É┘é┘Ç╪º╪ª┘É┘Ç┘â ┘ü┘è ╪║┘Ä┘Ç┘è╪▒┘É ╪╢┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘æ╪º╪í┘Ä ┘à┘Å╪╢┘É┘Ç╪▒┘æ┘Ä╪⌐ ┘ê┘Ä┘ä╪º ┘ü┘É╪¬┘Æ┘Ç┘å┘Ä╪⌐┘ì ┘à┘Å╪╢┘Ç┘ä┘æ┘Ä╪⌐ ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪▓┘Ä┘è┘æ┘É┘Ç┘å┘æ╪º ╪¿┘É╪▓┘è┘å┘Ä┘Ç╪⌐┘É ╪º┘ä╪Ñ┘è┘Ç┘à╪º┘å ┘ê┘Ä╪º╪¼┘Æ┘Ç╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘å╪º ┘ç┘Å┘Ç╪»╪º╪⌐┘ï ┘à┘Å┘ç┘Æ┘Ç╪¬┘Ä╪»┘è┘å
play_arrow
share
video_library
All─ühumma bi `ilmika ΓÇÿl-ghayb, wa qudratika `ala ΓÇÿl-khalq. aß╕Ñyin─½ m─ü `alimta ΓÇÿl-ß╕Ñay─üta khayran l─½. wa tawaffan─½ idh─ü `alimta ΓÇÿl-waf─üta khayran l─½. All─ühumma inn─½ as'aluka khashΓÇÖyataka fil-ghaybi wash-shah─üdah. wa as'aluka kalimata ΓÇÿl-ß╕Ñaqqi fir-riß╕ì─ü wa ΓÇÿl-ghaß╕ìab. wa as'aluka ΓÇÿl-qaß╣úda fil-ghin─ü wa ΓÇÿl-faqr. wa as'aluka na`─½man l─ü yanfad. wa as'aluka qurrata `aynin l─ü tanqati`. wa as'alukar-riß╕ì─ü ba`dal-qaß╕ì─ü'. wa as'aluka barda ΓÇÿl-`ayshi ba`da ΓÇÿl-mawt. wa as'aluka ladh-dhatan-naß║ôari il─ü wajhik. wash-shawqa il─ü liq─ü'ik. f─½ ghayri ß╕ìarr─ü'a muß╕ìirrah, wa l─ü fitnatin muß╕ìillah. All─ühumma zayyinn─ü bi z─½nati ΓÇÿl-'─½m─ün. waj`aln─ü hud─ütan muhtad─½n.
O Allah, by Your Knowledge of the unseen and by Your Power over creation, let me live if You know that life is good for me, and let me die if You know that death is good for me. O Allah, I ask You to grant me fear of You in private and in public. I ask you for the word of truth in times of contentment and anger. I ask You for moderation in wealth and in poverty. I ask you for blessings never ceasing and the coolness of my eye (i. e. pleasure) that never ends. I ask You for pleasure after Your Judgment and I ask You for a life of coolness after death. I ask You for the delight of gazing upon Your Face, and the joy of meeting You, without any harm and misleading trials befalling me. O Allah, dress us with the beauty of Faith and make us guides who are upon (correct) guidance.
Reference:
An-Nasa'i 3/54, 55, Ahmad 4/364. See also Al-Albani, Sahih An-Nasa'i 1/281.
Hisnul Muslim 62
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘É┘Ç┘è ╪ú┘Ä╪│┘Æ╪ú┘Ä┘ä┘Å┘Ç┘â┘Ä ┘è╪º ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘Å ╪¿┘É╪ú┘Ä┘å┘æ┘Ä┘Ç┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ê╪º╪¡┘É┘Ç╪»┘Å ╪º┘ä╪ú┘Ä╪¡┘Ä┘Ç╪» ╪º┘ä╪╡┘æ┘Ä┘Ç┘à┘Ä╪»┘Å ╪º┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘Ç╪░┘è ┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘à┘Æ ┘è┘Ä┘ä┘É┘Ç╪»┘Æ ┘ê┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘à┘Æ ┘è┘ê┘ä┘Ä╪»┘Æ ┘ê┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘à┘Æ ┘è┘Ä┘â┘Ç┘å┘Æ ┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘â┘Å┘Ç┘ü┘Å┘ê╪º┘ï ╪ú┘Ä╪¡┘Ä┘Ç╪» ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ ╪¬┘Ä╪║┘Æ┘Ç┘ü┘É╪▒┘Æ ┘ä┘è ╪░┘Å┘å┘Ç┘ê╪¿┘è ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘Ä┘Ç┘â┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ┘Ç╪¬┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪║┘Ä┘ü┘Ç┘ê╪▒┘Å ╪º┘ä╪▒┘æ┘Ä╪¡┘æ┘É┘Ç┘è┘à

share
video_library
All─ühumma inn─½ as'aluka y─ü All─ühbi'annaka ΓÇÿl-W─üß╕Ñidu ΓÇÿl-Aß╕Ñaduß╣ú-ß╣úamad. alladh─½ lam yalid wa lam y┼½lad. wa lam yakun lahu kufuwan aß╕Ñad. an taghfir l─½ dhun┼½b─½. innaka anta ΓÇÿl-Ghaf┼½rur-Raß╕Ñ─½m.
O Allah, I ask You. O Allah, You are the One, the Only, Self-Sufficient Master, Who was not begotten and begets not, and none is equal to Him. Forgive me my sins, surely you are Forgiving, Merciful.
Reference:
An-Nasa'i 3/52, Ahmad 4/338. See also Al-Albani, Sahih An-Nasa'i 1/280 and Sifat Salatun-Nabi, pg. 204.
Hisnul Muslim 63
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘É┘Ç┘è ╪ú┘Ä╪│┘Æ╪ú┘Ä┘ä┘Å┘Ç┘â┘Ä ╪¿┘É╪ú┘Ä┘å┘æ┘Ä ┘ä┘Ä┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘Ç┘à┘Æ╪»┘Å ┘ä╪º ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ç┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ┘Ç╪¬┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪¡┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘Ä┘â┘Ä ┘ä╪º ╪┤┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘è┘â┘Ä ┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘à┘Ä┘å┘æ┘Ç╪º┘å┘Å ┘è╪º ╪¿┘Ä╪»┘è┘Ç╪╣┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪│┘æ┘Ä┘à┘ê╪º╪¬┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä╪ú┘Ä╪▒┘Æ╪╢┘É ┘è╪º ╪░╪º ╪º┘ä╪¼┘Ä┘ä╪º┘ä┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä╪Ñ┘É┘â┘Æ┘Ç╪▒╪º┘à ┘è╪º ╪¡┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘æ┘Å ┘è╪º ┘é┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘æ┘ê┘à┘Å ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘É┘Ç┘è ╪ú┘Ä╪│┘Æ╪ú┘Ä┘ä┘Å┘Ç┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪¼┘Ä┘Ç┘å┘æ┘Ä╪⌐┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Ç┘ê╪░┘Å ╪¿┘É┘Ç┘â┘Ä ┘à┘É┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Ç┘å┘æ╪º╪▒
play_arrow
share
video_library
All─ühumma inn─½ as'aluka bi'anna laka ΓÇÿl-ß╕Ñamd. l─ü il─üha ill─ü ant, waß╕Ñdaka l─ü shar─½ka lak. al-Mann─ün, y─ü Bad─½`as-sam─üw─üti wa ΓÇÿl-arß╕ìy─ü dha ΓÇÿl-Jal─üli wa ΓÇÿl-'Ikr─üm, y─ü ß╕Ñayyu y─ü Qayy┼½m. inn─½ as'aluka ΓÇÿl-jannah, wa a`┼½dhu bika minan-n─ür.
O Allah, I ask You, as You are the Owner of praise, there is none worthy of worship but You alone, You have no partner. You are the Giver of all good. O Creator of the heavens and the earth, Owner of majesty and honor. O Living and Everlasting One, I ask you for Paradise, and I seek refuge in You from the fire.
Reference:
Abu Dawud, An-Nasa'i, Ibn Majah, At-Tirmidhi. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah 2/329.
Hisnul Muslim 64
┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘É┘Ç┘è ╪ú┘Ä╪│┘Æ╪ú┘Ä┘ä┘Å┘Ç┘â┘Ä ╪¿┘É╪ú┘Ä┘å┘æ┘Ä┘Ç┘è ╪ú┘Ä╪┤┘Æ┘Ç┘ç┘Ä╪»┘Å ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘æ┘Ä┘Ç┘â┘Ä ╪ú┘å┘Æ┘Ç╪¬┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘Å ┘ä╪º ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ç┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ┘Ç╪¬ ╪º┘ä╪ú┘Ä╪¡┘Ä┘Ç╪»┘Å ╪º┘ä╪╡┘æ┘Ä┘Ç┘à┘Ä╪»┘Å ╪º┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘Ç╪░┘è ┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘à┘Æ ┘è┘Ä┘ä┘É┘Ç╪»┘Æ ┘ê┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘à┘Æ ┘è┘ê┘ä┘Ä┘Ç╪»┘Æ ┘ê┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘à┘Æ ┘è┘Ä┘â┘Ç┘å┘Æ ┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘â┘Å┘Ç┘ü┘Å┘ê╪º┘ï ╪ú┘Ä╪¡┘Ä┘Ç╪»
play_arrow
share
video_library
All─ühumma inn─½ as'alukabi'ann─½ ash-hadu annaka ant-All─ühl─ü 'il─üha 'ill─ü ant. Al-Aß╕Ñaduß╣ú-ß╣úamadalladh─½ lam yalid wa lam y┼½ladwa lam yakun lahu kufuwan aß╕Ñad.
O Allah, I ask You, by the fact that I bear witness that You are Allah. There is none worthy of worship but You, the Only God, Independent of creation, Who was not begotten and begets not, and none is equal to Him.
Reference:
Abu Dawud 2/62, Ibn Majah 2/1267, At-Tirmidhi 5/515, Ahmad 5/360. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah 2/329 and Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/163.
Hisnul Muslim 65
Chapter 25: After salam
8 du'as
╪ú┘Ä╪│┘Æ┘Ç╪¬┘Ä╪║┘Æ┘ü┘É╪▒┘Å ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç (╪½┘Ä┘ä╪º╪½╪º┘ï) ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ┘Ç╪¬┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪│┘æ┘Ä┘ä╪º┘à┘Å ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘É┘Ç┘å┘Æ┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪│┘æ┘Ä┘ä╪º┘à ╪¬┘Ä╪¿╪º╪▒┘Ä┘â┘Æ╪¬┘Ä ┘è╪º ╪░╪º ╪º┘ä╪¼┘Ä┘Ç┘ä╪º┘ä┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä╪Ñ┘É┘â┘Æ┘Ç╪▒╪º┘à

Astaghfirull─üh [three times] All─ühumma antas-sal─üm. wa minkas-sal─üm. tab─ürakta y─ü dhal-Jal─üli wal-'Ikr─üm.
I seek the forgiveness of Allah (three times). O Allah, You are Peace and from You comes peace. Blessed are You, O Owner of majesty and honor.
Reference:
Muslim 1/414.
Hisnul Muslim 66
┘ä╪º ╪Ñ┘ä┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘ä╪º┘æ ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å ┘ê╪¡╪»┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ä╪º ╪┤╪▒┘è┘â┘Ä ┘ä┘ç┘Å ┘ä┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä┘à┘Å┘Ç┘ä┘Æ┘â┘Å ┘ê┘ä┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ╪» ┘ê┘ç┘ê┘Ä ╪╣┘ä┘ë ┘â┘ä┘æ ╪┤┘Ä┘è╪í┘ì ┘é┘Ä╪»┘è╪▒ ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ┘ä╪º ┘à╪º┘å┘É╪╣┘Ä ┘ä┘É┘à╪º ╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Æ╪╖┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ╪¬ ┘ê┘Ä┘ä╪º ┘à┘Å╪╣┘Æ╪╖┘É┘Ç┘è┘Ä ┘ä┘É┘à╪º ┘à┘Ä┘å┘Ä┘Ç╪╣┘Æ╪¬ ┘ê┘Ä┘ä╪º ┘è┘Ä┘å┘Æ┘ü┘Ä┘Ç╪╣┘Å ╪░╪º ╪º┘ä╪¼┘Ä┘Ç╪»┘æ┘É ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ┘Ç┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪¼┘Ä┘Ç╪»

share
video_library
L─ü 'il─üha 'illall─üh. waß╕Ñdahu l─ü shar─½ka lah. lahu ΓÇÿl-mulku wa lahu ΓÇÿl-ß╕Ñamd. wa huwa `al─ü kulli shay'in qad─½r. All─ühumma l─ü m─üni`a lim─ü 'a`tayt. wa l─ü mu`tiya lim─ü mana`t. wa l─ü yanfa`u dhal-jaddi minkal-jadd.
None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, He has no partner, His is the dominion and His is the praise, and He is Able to do all things. O Allah, there is none who can withhold what You give, and none may give what You have withheld, and the might of the mighty person cannot benefit him against You.
Reference:
Al-Bukhari 1/255, Muslim 1/414.
Hisnul Muslim 67
┘ä╪º ╪Ñ┘ä┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘ä╪º┘æ ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç ┘ê╪¡╪»┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ä╪º ╪┤╪▒┘è┘â┘Ä ┘ä┘ç┘Å ┘ä┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä┘à┘ä┘â┘Å ┘ê┘ä┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä╪¡┘Ä┘à╪» ┘ê┘ç┘ê┘Ä ╪╣┘ä┘ë ┘â┘ä┘æ ╪┤┘è╪í┘ì ┘é╪»┘è╪▒ ┘ä╪º ╪¡┘Ä┘Ç┘ê┘Æ┘ä┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä┘ä╪º ┘é┘Ç┘ê┘æ┘Ä╪⌐┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ ╪¿┘É╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘É ┘ä╪º ╪Ñ┘ä┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘ä╪º┘æ ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ç┘ç ┘ê┘Ä┘ä╪º ┘å┘Ä╪╣┘Æ┘Ç╪¿┘Å┘Ç╪»┘Å ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ ╪Ñ┘è┘æ┘Ç╪º┘ç ┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä┘å┘æ┘É╪╣┘Æ┘Ç┘à┘Ä╪⌐┘Å ┘ê┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä┘ü┘Ä╪╢┘Æ┘ä ┘ê┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä╪½┘æ┘Ä┘Ç┘å╪º╪í┘Å ╪º┘ä╪¡┘Ä┘Ç╪│┘Ä┘å ┘ä╪º ╪Ñ┘ä┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘ä╪º┘æ ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å ┘à╪«┘Æ┘ä┘É╪╡┘Ç┘è┘å┘Ä ┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä╪»┘æ┘É┘è┘å┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘ê┘Æ ┘â┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘É┘ç┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘â┘Ç╪º┘ü┘É╪▒┘ê┘å

share
video_library
L─ü 'il─üha 'illall─üh. waß╕Ñdahu l─ü shar─½ka lah. lahul-mulku, wa lahul-ß╕Ñamd. wa huwa `al─ü kulli shay'in qad─½r. L─ü ß╕Ñawla wa l─ü quwwata 'ill─ü bill─üh. l─ü 'il─üha 'illall─üh. wa l─ü na`budu 'ill─ü 'iyy─üh. lahun-ni`matu wa lahul-faß╕ìl. wa lahuth-than─ü'ul-ß╕Ñasan. l─ü 'il─üha 'illall─üh. mukhliß╣ú─½na lahud-d─½n. wa law karihal-k─üfir┼½n.
None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, He has no partner, His is the dominion and His is the praise and He is Able to do all things. There is no power and no might except by Allah. None has the right to be worshipped but Allah, and we do not worship any other besides Him. His is grace, and His is bounty, and to Him belongs the most excellent praise. None has the right to be worshipped but Allah.(We are) sincere in making our religious devotion to Him, even though the disbelievers may dislike it.
Reference:
Muslim 1/415.
Hisnul Muslim 68
╪│┘Å┘Ç╪¿┘Æ╪¡╪º┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘É ┘ê╪º┘ä╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘Å ┘ä┘ä┘ç ┘ê╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘Å ╪ú┘â┘Æ┘Ç╪¿┘Ä╪▒ (╪½┘ä╪º╪½╪º┘ï ┘ê╪½┘ä╪º╪½┘è┘å) ┘ä╪º ╪Ñ┘ä┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘ä╪º┘æ ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪¡┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ä╪º ╪┤╪▒┘è┘â┘Ä ┘ä┘ç┘Å ┘ä┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä┘à┘ä┘â┘Å ┘ê┘ä┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ╪» ┘ê┘ç┘Å┘ê┘Ä ╪╣┘ä┘ë ┘â┘Å┘ä┘æ ╪┤┘Ä┘è╪í┘ì ┘é┘Ä┘Ç╪»┘è╪▒

Subß╕Ñ─ünall─üh. walß╕Ñamdu lill─üh. wall─ühu 'akbar, [each repeated 33 times] L─ü 'il─üha 'illall─ühwaß╕Ñdahu l─ü shar─½ka lahu. lahul-mulku wa lahul-ß╕Ñamdwa huw─ü`l─ü kulli shay'in qad─½r.
Glory is to Allah, and praise is to Allah, and Allah is the Most Great.(each said thirty-three times)None has the right to be worshiped but Allah alone, He has no partner, His is the dominion and His is the praise and He is Able to do all things.
Reference:
Muslim 1/418, Whoever says this after every prayer will be forgiven his sins even though they be as the foam of the sea.
Hisnul Muslim 69
(Surah Al-Ikhlas, Surah Al-Falaq, and Surah An-Nas) These Surahs should be recited in Arabic after each prayer. After the Maghrib and Fajr prayers, they should be recited three times each. With the Name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful.
╪¿┘É╪│┘Æ┘à┘É ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘É ╪º┘ä╪▒┘æ┘Ä╪¡┘Æ┘à┘Ä┘å┘É ╪º┘ä╪▒┘æ┘Ä╪¡┘É┘è┘à┘É
{┘é┘Å┘ä┘Æ ┘ç┘Å┘ê┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪ú┘Ä╪¡┘Ä╪»┘î* ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä╪╡┘æ┘Ä┘à┘Ä╪»┘Å* ┘ä┘Ä┘à┘Æ ┘è┘Ä┘ä┘É╪»┘Æ ┘ê┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘à┘Æ ┘è┘Å┘ê┘ä┘Ä╪»┘Æ* ┘ê┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘à┘Æ ┘è┘Ä┘â┘Å┘å ┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘â┘Å┘ü┘Å┘ê╪º┘ï ╪ú┘Ä╪¡┘Ä╪»┘î}
╪¿┘É╪│┘Æ┘à┘É ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘É ╪º┘ä╪▒┘æ┘Ä╪¡┘Æ┘à┘Ä┘å┘É ╪º┘ä╪▒┘æ┘Ä╪¡┘É┘è┘à┘É
{┘é┘Å┘ä┘Æ ╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Å┘ê╪░┘Å ╪¿┘É╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘É ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘ü┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘é┘É* ┘à┘É┘å ╪┤┘Ä╪▒┘æ┘É ┘à┘Ä╪º ╪«┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘é┘Ä* ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘É┘å ╪┤┘Ä╪▒┘æ┘É ╪║┘Ä╪º╪│┘É┘é┘ì ╪Ñ┘É╪░┘Ä╪º ┘ê┘Ä┘é┘Ä╪¿┘Ä* ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘É┘å ╪┤┘Ä╪▒┘æ┘É ╪º┘ä┘å┘æ┘Ä┘ü┘æ┘Ä╪º╪½┘Ä╪º╪¬┘É ┘ü┘É┘è ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪╣┘Å┘é┘Ä╪»┘É* ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘É┘å ╪┤┘Ä╪▒┘æ┘É ╪¡┘Ä╪º╪│┘É╪»┘ì ╪Ñ┘É╪░┘Ä╪º ╪¡┘Ä╪│┘Ä╪»┘Ä}
╪¿┘É╪│┘Æ┘à┘É ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘É ╪º┘ä╪▒┘æ┘Ä╪¡┘Æ┘à┘Ä┘å┘É ╪º┘ä╪▒┘æ┘Ä╪¡┘É┘è┘à┘É
{┘é┘Å┘ä┘Æ ╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Å┘ê╪░┘Å ╪¿┘É╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘É ╪º┘ä┘å┘æ┘Ä╪º╪│┘É* ┘à┘Ä┘ä┘É┘â┘É ╪º┘ä┘å┘æ┘Ä╪º╪│┘É* ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘É ╪º┘ä┘å┘æ┘Ä╪º╪│┘É* ┘à┘É┘å ╪┤┘Ä╪▒┘æ┘É ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘ê┘Ä╪│┘Æ┘ê┘Ä╪º╪│┘É ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪«┘Ä┘å┘æ┘Ä╪º╪│┘É* ╪º┘ä┘æ┘Ä╪░┘É┘è ┘è┘Å┘ê┘Ä╪│┘Æ┘ê┘É╪│┘Å ┘ü┘É┘è ╪╡┘Å╪»┘Å┘ê╪▒┘É ╪º┘ä┘å┘æ┘Ä╪º╪│┘É* ┘à┘É┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¼┘É┘å┘æ┘Ä╪⌐┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘å┘æ┘Ä╪º╪│┘É}
╪¿┘Ä╪╣┘Æ╪»┘Ä ┘â┘Å┘ä┘æ┘É ╪╡┘Ä┘ä╪º┘Ä╪⌐┘ì
play_arrow
share
video_library
Bismill─ühir-Raß╕Ñm─ünir-Raß╕Ñ─½m.
Qul huwall─ühu aß╕Ñad. All─ühuß╣ú-ß╣úamad. Lam yalid wa lam y┼½lad. Wa lam yakun lahu kufuwan aß╕Ñad.
Bismill─ühir-Raß╕Ñm─ünir-Raß╕Ñ─½m. Qul a`┼½dhu birabbil-falaq. Min sharri m─ü khalaq. Wa min sharri gh─üsiqin idh─ü waqab. Wa min sharrin-naff─üth─üti fil-`uqad. Wa min sharri ß╕Ñ─üsidin idh─ü ß╕Ñasad.
Bismill─ühir-Raß╕Ñm─ünir-Raß╕Ñ─½m.
Qul a`┼½dhu birabbin-n─üs. Malikin-n─üs. 'Il─ühin-n─üs. Min sharri ΓÇÿl-wasw─üsil-khann─üs. Alladh─½ yuwaswisu f─½ ß╣úud┼½rin-n─üs. Minal-jinnati wann─üs.
With the Name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful.
Say: He is Allah (the) One. The Self-Sufficient Master, Whom all creatures need, He begets not nor was He begotten, and there is none equal to Him.
With the Name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful.
Say: I seek refuge with (Allah) the Lord of the daybreak, from the evil of what He has created, and from the evil of the darkening (night) as it comes with its darkness, and from the evil of those who practice witchcraft when they blow in the knots, and from the evil of the envier when he envies.
With the Name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful.
Say: I seek refuge with (Allah) the Lord of mankind, the King of mankind, the God of mankind, from the evil of the whisperer who withdraws, who whispers in the breasts of mankind, of jinns and men.
Reference:
Abu Dawud 2/86, An-Nasa'i 3/68. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 2/8.
Hisnul Muslim 70
Recite in Arabic after each prayer.
∩┤┐╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å ┘ä╪º┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ┘Ä ┘ç┘Å┘ê┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘è┘æ┘Å ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘é┘Ä┘è┘æ┘Å┘ê┘à┘Å ┘ä╪º┘Ä ╪¬┘Ä╪ú┘Æ╪«┘Å╪░┘Å┘ç┘Å ╪│┘É┘å┘Ä╪⌐┘î ┘ê┘Ä┘ä╪º┘Ä ┘å┘Ä┘ê┘Æ┘à┘î ┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘à┘Ä╪º ┘ü┘É┘è ╪º┘ä╪│┘æ┘Ä┘à┘Ä╪º┘ê┘Ä╪º╪¬┘É ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘Ä╪º ┘ü┘É┘è ╪º┘ä╪ú┘Ä╪▒┘Æ╪╢┘É ┘à┘Ä┘å ╪░┘Ä╪º ╪º┘ä┘æ┘Ä╪░┘É┘è ┘è┘Ä╪┤┘Æ┘ü┘Ä╪╣┘Å ╪╣┘É┘å┘Æ╪»┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ┘Ä ╪¿┘É╪Ñ┘É╪░┘Æ┘å┘É┘ç┘É ┘è┘Ä╪╣┘Æ┘ä┘Ä┘à┘Å ┘à┘Ä╪º ╪¿┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘å┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä┘è┘Æ╪»┘É┘è┘ç┘É┘à┘Æ ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘Ä╪º ╪«┘Ä┘ä┘Æ┘ü┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘à┘Æ ┘ê┘Ä┘ä╪º┘Ä ┘è┘Å╪¡┘É┘è╪╖┘Å┘ê┘å┘Ä ╪¿┘É╪┤┘Ä┘è┘Æ╪í┘ì ┘à┘æ┘É┘å┘Æ ╪╣┘É┘ä┘Æ┘à┘É┘ç┘É ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ┘Ä ╪¿┘É┘à┘Ä╪º ╪┤┘Ä╪º╪í ┘ê┘Ä╪│┘É╪╣┘Ä ┘â┘Å╪▒┘Æ╪│┘É┘è┘æ┘Å┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä╪│┘æ┘Ä┘à┘Ä╪º┘ê┘Ä╪º╪¬┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä╪ú┘Ä╪▒┘Æ╪╢┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä┘ä╪º┘Ä ┘è┘Ä╪ñ┘Å┘ê╪»┘Å┘ç┘Å ╪¡┘É┘ü┘Æ╪╕┘Å┘ç┘Å┘à┘Ä╪º ┘ê┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘ê┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘É┘è┘æ┘Å ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪╣┘Ä╪╕┘É┘è┘à┘Å∩┤╛ ╪╣┘é╪¿ ┘â┘ä ╪╡┘ä╪º╪⌐
play_arrow
share
video_library
All─ühu l─ü il─üha ill─ü huwa ΓÇÿl-ß╕ñayyul-Qayy┼½m. l─ü ta'khudhuhu sinatun wa l─ü nawm. lahu m─ü fis-sam─üw─üti wa m─ü fil-ardh. man dhal-ladh─½ yashfa`u `indahu ill─ü bi'idhnih. ya`lamu m─ü bayna 'ayd─½him wa m─ü khalfahum. wa l─ü yuß╕Ñ─½t┼½na bishay'im-min `ilmihi ill─ü bim─ü sh─ü'a. wasi `a kursiyyuhus-sam─üw─üti wal-ardh. wa l─ü ya'┼½duhu hifß║ôuhum─ü. wa huwal-`Aliyyu ΓÇÿl-`Aß║ô─½m.
Allah! There is none worthy of worship but He, the Ever-Living, the One Who sustains and protects all that exists. Neither slumber nor sleep overtakes Him. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. Who is he that can intercede with Him except with His Permission? He knows what happens to them in this world, and what will happen to them in the Hereafter. And they will never compass anything of His Knowledge except that which He wills. His Throne extends over the heavens and the earth, and He feels no fatigue in guarding and preserving them. And He is the Most High, the Most Great. (Recite in Arabic after each prayer.)
Reference:
An-Nasa'i, 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah (Hadith no. 100), also Ibn As-Sunni (no. 121). See also Al-Albani, Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 5/339 and Silsilatul-Ahadith As-Sahihah 2/697 (no. 972).
Hisnul Muslim 71
Recite ten times in Arabic after the Maghrib and Fajr prayers.
┘ä╪º┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪¡┘Æ╪»┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ä╪º┘Ä ╪┤┘Ä╪▒┘É┘è┘â┘Ä ┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘à┘Å┘ä┘Æ┘â┘Å ┘ê┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ╪»┘Å ┘è┘Å╪¡┘Æ┘è┘É┘è ┘ê┘Ä┘è┘Å┘à┘É┘è╪¬┘Å ┘ê┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘ê┘Ä ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘ë ┘â┘Å┘ä┘æ┘É ╪┤┘Ä┘è┘Æ╪í┘ì ┘é┘Ä╪»┘É┘è╪▒┘î
(╪╣┘Ä╪┤┘Æ╪▒┘Ä ┘à┘Ä╪▒┘æ╪º╪¬┘ì ╪¿┘Ä╪╣┘Æ╪»┘Ä ╪╡┘Ä┘ä╪º╪⌐┘É ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘à┘Ä╪║┘Æ╪▒┘É╪¿┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä╪╡┘æ┘Å╪¿┘Æ╪¡┘É)
play_arrow
share
video_library
L─ü il─üha illall─ühwaß╕Ñdahu l─ü shar─½ka lah. lahuΓÇÿl-mulku wa lahuΓÇÿl-ß╕Ñamdyuß╕Ñy─½ wa yum─½twa huwa `al─ü kulli shay'in qad─½r.
None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner. His is the dominion and His is the praise. He brings life and He causes death, and He is Able to do all things.
(Recite ten times in Arabic after the Maghrib and Fajr prayers.)
Reference:
At-Tirmidhi 5/515, Ahmad 4/227. See its checking in Ibn Al-Qayyim Al-Jawziyyah's Zddul-Ma'ad 1/300.
Hisnul Muslim 72
To be said after giving salam for the Fajr prayer.
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘É┘è ╪ú┘Ä╪│┘Æ╪ú┘Ä┘ä┘Å┘â┘Ä ╪╣┘É┘ä┘Æ┘à╪º┘ï ┘å╪º┘ü┘É╪╣╪º┘ï ┘ê┘Ä╪▒┘É╪▓┘Æ┘é╪º┘ï ╪╖┘Ä┘è┘æ┘É╪¿╪º┘ï ┘ê┘Ä╪╣┘Ä┘à┘Ä┘ä╪º┘ï ┘à┘Å╪¬┘Ä┘é┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Ä┘ä╪º┘ï
(╪¿┘Ä╪╣┘Æ╪»┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪│┘æ┘ä╪º┘à┘É ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ╪╡┘Ä┘ä╪º┘Ä╪⌐┘É ╪º┘ä┘ü┘Ä╪¼┘Æ╪▒┘É)
play_arrow
share
video_library
All─ühumma inn─½ as'aluka `ilman n─üfi`an. wa rizqan ß╣¡ayyiban, wa `amalam-mutaqabbala.
O Allah, I ask You for knowledge which is beneficial, and sustenance which is good, and deeds which are acceptable.
[to be said after giving salam for the Fajr prayer.]
Reference:
Ibn Majah and others. See Sahih Ibn Majah 1/152 and Majma' Az-Zawa'id 10/111
Hisnul Muslim 73
Chapter 26: For seeking guidance in forming a decision or choosing the proper course
1 du'as
Jabir bin Abdullah (RA) said: The Prophet (∩╖║) used to teach us to seek Allah's Counsel in all matters, as he used to teach us a Surah from the Qur'an. He would say: When anyone of you has an important matter to decide, let him pray two Rak'ahs other than the obligatory prayer, and then say:
┘é╪º┘ä ╪¼╪º╪¿╪▒ ╪¿┘å ╪╣╪¿╪» ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪▒╪╢┘è ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪╣┘å┘ç┘à╪º : ┘â╪º┘å ╪▒╪│┘ê┘ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪╡┘ä┘ë ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪╣┘ä┘è┘ç ┘ê╪│┘ä┘à ┘è┘Å╪╣┘ä┘à┘å╪º ╪º┘ä╪º╪│╪¬╪«╪º╪▒╪⌐ ┘ü┘è ╪º┘ä╪ú┘à┘ê╪▒ ┘â┘ä┘ç╪º ┘â┘à╪º ┘è╪╣┘ä┘à┘Å┘å╪º ╪º┘ä╪│┘ê╪▒╪⌐ ┘à┘å ╪º┘ä┘é╪▒╪ó┘å ┘è┘é┘ê┘ä : ╪Ñ╪░╪º ┘ç┘à ╪ú╪¡╪»┘â┘à ╪¿╪º┘ä╪ú┘à╪▒ ┘ü┘ä┘è╪▒┘â╪╣ ╪▒┘â╪╣╪¬┘è┘å ┘à┘å ╪║┘è╪▒ ╪º┘ä┘ü╪▒┘è╪╢╪⌐ ╪½┘à ┘ä┘è┘é┘ä: '╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘à ╪Ñ┘å┘è ╪ú╪│╪¬╪«┘è╪▒┘â ╪¿╪╣┘ä┘à┘â ┘ê╪ú╪│╪¬┘é╪»╪▒┘â ╪¿┘é╪»╪▒╪¬┘â ┘ê╪ú╪│╪ú┘ä┘â ┘à┘å ┘ü╪╢┘ä┘â ╪º┘ä╪╣╪╕┘è┘à ┘ü╪Ñ┘å┘â ╪¬┘é╪»┘É╪▒┘Å ┘ê┘ä╪º ╪ú┘é╪»┘É╪▒┘Å ┘ê╪¬╪╣┘ä┘à ┘ê┘ä╪º ╪ú╪╣┘ä┘à ┘ê╪ú┘å╪¬ ╪╣┘ä╪º┘à ╪º┘ä╪║┘è┘ê╪¿ ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘à ╪Ñ┘å ┘â┘å╪¬ ╪¬╪╣┘ä┘à ╪ú┘å ┘ç╪░╪º ╪º┘ä╪ú┘à╪▒ - ┘è╪│┘à┘è ╪¡╪º╪¼╪¬┘ç - ╪«┘è╪▒ ┘ä┘è ┘ü┘è ╪»┘è┘å┘è ┘ê┘à╪╣╪º╪┤┘è ┘ê╪╣╪º┘é╪¿╪⌐ ╪ú┘à╪▒┘è - ╪ú┘ê ┘é╪º┘ä : ╪╣╪º╪¼┘ä┘ç ┘ê╪ó╪¼┘ä┘ç - ┘ü╪º┘é╪»╪▒┘ç ┘ä┘è ┘ê┘è╪│╪▒┘ç ┘ä┘è ╪½┘à ╪¿╪º╪▒┘â ┘ä┘è ┘ü┘è┘ç ┘ê╪Ñ┘å ┘â┘å╪¬ ╪¬╪╣┘ä┘à ╪ú┘å ┘ç╪░╪º ╪º┘ä╪ú┘à╪▒ ╪┤╪▒ ┘ä┘è ┘ü┘è ╪»┘è┘å┘è ┘ê┘à╪╣╪º╪┤┘è ┘ê╪╣╪º┘é╪¿╪⌐ ╪ú┘à╪▒┘è - ╪ú┘ê ┘é╪º┘ä : ╪╣╪º╪¼┘ä┘ç ┘ê╪ó╪¼┘ä┘ç - ┘ü╪º╪╡╪▒┘ü┘ç ╪╣┘å┘è ┘ê╪º╪╡╪▒┘ü┘å┘è ╪╣┘å┘ç ┘ê╪º┘é╪»╪▒ ┘ä┘è ╪º┘ä╪«┘è╪▒ ╪¡┘è╪½ ┘â╪º┘å ╪½┘à ╪º╪▒╪╢┘å┘è ╪¿┘ç '
play_arrow
share
video_library
All─ühumma inn─½ astakh─½ruka bi `ilmik. wa astaqdiruka biqudratik. wa as'aluka min faß╕ìlika ΓÇÿl-`Aß║ô─½m. fa'innaka taqdiru wa l─ü aqdir. wa ta`lamu wa l─ü a`lam. wa anta `all─ümu ΓÇÿl-ghuy┼½b. All─ühumma in kunta ta`lamu anna h─üdha ΓÇÿl-amra - [then mention the thing to be decided] Khayrun l─½ f─½ d─½n─½ wa ma`─üsh─½ wa `─üqibati amr─½ - [or say] `─üjilihi wa ─üjilih -faqdurhu l─½ wa yassirhu l─½thumma b─ürik l─½ f─½h. wa in kunta ta`lamu anna h─üdha ΓÇÿl-amrasharrun l─½ f─½ d─½n─½ wa ma`─üsh─½ wa `─üqibati 'amr─½ - [or say] `─üjilihi wa '─üjilihi -faß╣úrifhu `ann─½ waß╣úrifn─½ `anh. waqdur liya ΓÇÿl-khayra ß╕Ñaythu k─ün. thumma arß╕ìin─½ bih.
O Allah, I seek the counsel of Your Knowledge, and I seek the help of Your Omnipotence, and I beseech You for Your Magnificent Grace. Surely, You are Capable and I am not. You know and I know not, and You are the Knower of the unseen. O Allah, if You know that this matter [then mention the thing to be decided] is good for me in my religion and in my life and for my welfare in the life to come, - [or say: in this life and the afterlife] -then ordain it for me and make it easy for me, then bless me in it. And if You know that this matter is bad for me in my religion and in my life and for my welfare in the life to come, - [or say: in this life and the afterlife] -then distance it from me, and distance me from it, and ordain for me what is good wherever it may be, and help me to be content with it.
Reference:
Al-Bukhari 7/162. and Aal-'Imran 3:159.
Hisnul Muslim 74
Chapter 27: In the morning and evening
25 du'as
╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ╪»┘Å ┘ä┘É┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪¡┘Æ╪»┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä╪╡┘æ┘Ä┘ä╪º┘Ä╪⌐┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä╪│┘æ┘Ä┘ä╪º┘Ä┘à┘Å ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘ë ┘à┘Ä┘å┘Æ ┘ä╪º┘Ä ┘å┘Ä╪¿┘É┘è┘æ┘Ä ╪¿┘Ä╪╣┘Æ╪»┘Ä┘ç┘Å
play_arrow
share
video_library
Alß╕Ñamdulillahi waß╕Ñdahwaß╣ú-ß╣úalatu was-salam `al─ü man l─ü nabiyya ba`dah.
All praise is due to Allah alone, and peace and blessings be upon him after whom there is no other Prophet.
Reference:
Anas (RA) said that he heard the Prophet (∩╖║) say: "That I sit with people remembering Almighty Allah from the morning (Fajr) prayer until sunrise is more beloved to me than freeing four slaves from among the Children of Isma'il. That I sit with people remembering Allah from the afternoon ('Asr) prayer, until the sun sets, is more beloved to me than freeing four slaves from among the Children of Isma'il." This was reported by Abu Dawud (no. 3667). Al-Albani graded it good in Sahih Abu Dawud 2/698.
Hisnul Muslim 75a
(Ayat al-Kursi, Surah Baqarah Ayat 2:255)
(╪ú╪╣┘ê╪░ ╪¿╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ┘à┘å ╪º┘ä╪┤┘è╪╖╪º┘å ╪º┘ä╪▒╪¼┘è┘à)
∩┤┐╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å ┘ä╪º┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ┘Ä ┘ç┘Å┘ê┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘è┘æ┘Å ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘é┘Ä┘è┘æ┘Å┘ê┘à┘Å ┘ä╪º┘Ä ╪¬┘Ä╪ú┘Æ╪«┘Å╪░┘Å┘ç┘Å ╪│┘É┘å┘Ä╪⌐┘î ┘ê┘Ä┘ä╪º┘Ä ┘å┘Ä┘ê┘Æ┘à┘î ┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘à┘Ä╪º ┘ü┘É┘è ╪º┘ä╪│┘æ┘Ä┘à┘Ä╪º┘ê┘Ä╪º╪¬┘É ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘Ä╪º ┘ü┘É┘è ╪º┘ä╪ú┘Ä╪▒┘Æ╪╢┘É ┘à┘Ä┘å ╪░┘Ä╪º ╪º┘ä┘æ┘Ä╪░┘É┘è ┘è┘Ä╪┤┘Æ┘ü┘Ä╪╣┘Å ╪╣┘É┘å┘Æ╪»┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ┘Ä ╪¿┘É╪Ñ┘É╪░┘Æ┘å┘É┘ç┘É ┘è┘Ä╪╣┘Æ┘ä┘Ä┘à┘Å ┘à┘Ä╪º ╪¿┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘å┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä┘è┘Æ╪»┘É┘è┘ç┘É┘à┘Æ ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘Ä╪º ╪«┘Ä┘ä┘Æ┘ü┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘à┘Æ ┘ê┘Ä┘ä╪º┘Ä ┘è┘Å╪¡┘É┘è╪╖┘Å┘ê┘å┘Ä ╪¿┘É╪┤┘Ä┘è┘Æ╪í┘ì ┘à┘æ┘É┘å┘Æ ╪╣┘É┘ä┘Æ┘à┘É┘ç┘É ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ┘Ä ╪¿┘É┘à┘Ä╪º ╪┤┘Ä╪º╪í ┘ê┘Ä╪│┘É╪╣┘Ä ┘â┘Å╪▒┘Æ╪│┘É┘è┘æ┘Å┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä╪│┘æ┘Ä┘à┘Ä╪º┘ê┘Ä╪º╪¬┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä╪ú┘Ä╪▒┘Æ╪╢┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä┘ä╪º┘Ä ┘è┘Ä╪ñ┘Å┘ê╪»┘Å┘ç┘Å ╪¡┘É┘ü┘Æ╪╕┘Å┘ç┘Å┘à┘Ä╪º ┘ê┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘ê┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘É┘è┘æ┘Å ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪╣┘Ä╪╕┘É┘è┘à┘Å∩┤╛
play_arrow
share
video_library
(A`┼½dhu bill─ühi min ash-shayt─üni 'r-raj─½m)
All─ühu l─ü il─üha ill─ü huwa ΓÇÿl-ß╕ñayyul-Qayy┼½m. l─ü ta'khudhuhu sinatun wa l─ü nawm. lahu m─ü fis-sam─üw─üti wa m─üfil-arß╕ì. man dhal-ladh─½ yashfa`u `indahu ill─ü bi'idhnih. ya`lamu m─ü bayna ayd─½him wa m─ü khalfahum. wa l─ü yuß╕Ñ─½ß╣¡┼½na bishay'im-min `ilmihi ill─ü bim─ü sh─ü'. wasi`a kursiyyuhus-sam─üw─üti wal-arß╕ì. wa l─ü ya'┼½duhu hifß║ôuhum─ü. wa huwal-`AliyyuΓÇÿl-`Aß║ô─½m.
I seek refuge with Allah against the Satan, the outcast.
Allah! There is none worthy of worship but He, the Ever-Living, the One Who sustains and protects all that exists. Neither slumber nor sleep overtakes Him. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. Who is he that can intercede with Him except with His Permission?He knows what happens to them in this world, and what will happen to them in the Hereafter. And they will never encompass anything of His Knowledge except that which He wills. His Throne extends over the heavens and the earth, and He feels no fatigue in guarding and preserving them. And He is the Most High, the Most Great.
Reference:
Whoever says this when he rises in the morning will be protected from jinns until he retires in the evening, and whoever says it when retiring in the evening will be protected from them until he rises in the morning. It was reported by Al-Hakim 1 / 562, Al-Albani graded it as authentic in Sahihut-Targhib wat-Tarhib 1/273, and traces it to An-Nasa'i and At-Tabarani. He says that At-Tabarani's chain of transmission is reliable (Jayyid).
Hisnul Muslim 75
(Recite these three times each in Arabic).
╪¿╪│┘à ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪º┘ä╪▒╪¡┘à┘å ╪º┘ä╪▒╪¡┘è┘à
{ ┘é┘Å┘ä┘Æ ┘ç┘Å┘ê┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪ú┘Ä╪¡┘Ä╪»┘î * ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä╪╡┘æ┘Ä┘à┘Ä╪»┘Å * ┘ä┘Ä┘à┘Æ ┘è┘Ä┘ä┘É╪»┘Æ ┘ê┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘à┘Æ ┘è┘Å┘ê┘ä┘Ä╪»┘Æ * ┘ä┘Ä┘à┘Æ ┘è┘Ä┘â┘Å┘å ┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘â┘Å┘ü┘Å┘ê╪º┘ï ╪ú┘Ä╪¡┘Ä╪»┘î }
╪¿╪│┘à ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪º┘ä╪▒╪¡┘à┘å ╪º┘ä╪▒╪¡┘è┘à
{ ┘é┘Å┘ä┘Æ ╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Å┘ê╪░┘Å ╪¿┘É╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘É ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘ü┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘é┘É * ┘à┘É┘å ╪┤┘Ä╪▒┘æ┘É ┘à┘Ä╪º ╪«┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘é┘Ä * ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘É┘å ╪┤┘Ä╪▒┘æ┘É ╪║┘Ä╪º╪│┘É┘é┘ì ╪Ñ┘É╪░┘Ä╪º ┘ê┘Ä┘é┘Ä╪¿┘Ä * ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘É┘å ╪┤┘Ä╪▒┘æ┘É ╪º┘ä┘å┘æ┘Ä┘ü┘æ┘Ä╪º╪½┘Ä╪º╪¬┘É ┘ü┘É┘è ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪╣┘Å┘é┘Ä╪»┘É * ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘É┘å ╪┤┘Ä╪▒┘æ┘É ╪¡┘Ä╪º╪│┘É╪»┘ì ╪Ñ┘É╪░┘Ä╪º ╪¡┘Ä╪│┘Ä╪»┘Ä }
╪¿╪│┘à ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪º┘ä╪▒╪¡┘à┘å ╪º┘ä╪▒╪¡┘è┘à
{ ┘é┘Å┘ä┘Æ ╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Å┘ê╪░┘Å ╪¿┘É╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘É ╪º┘ä┘å┘æ┘Ä╪º╪│┘É * ┘à┘Ä┘ä┘É┘â┘É ╪º┘ä┘å┘æ┘Ä╪º╪│┘É * ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘É ╪º┘ä┘å┘æ┘Ä╪º╪│┘É * ┘à┘É┘å ╪┤┘Ä╪▒┘æ┘É ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘ê┘Ä╪│┘Æ┘ê┘Ä╪º╪│┘É ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪«┘Ä┘å┘æ┘Ä╪º╪│┘É * ╪º┘ä┘æ┘Ä╪░┘É┘è ┘è┘Å┘ê┘Ä╪│┘Æ┘ê┘É╪│┘Å ┘ü┘É┘è ╪╡┘Å╪»┘Å┘ê╪▒┘É ╪º┘ä┘å┘æ┘Ä╪º╪│┘É * ┘à┘É┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¼┘É┘å┘æ┘Ä╪⌐┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘å┘æ┘Ä╪º╪│┘É
(╪½┘ä╪º╪½ ┘à╪▒╪º╪¬)
play_arrow
share
video_library
Bismill─ühir-Raß╕Ñm─ünir-Raß╕Ñ─½m.
Qul huwall─ühu aß╕Ñad. All─ühuß╣ú-ß╣úamad. Lam yalid wa lam y┼½lad. Wa lam yakun lahu kufuwan aß╕Ñad.
Bismill─ühir-Raß╕Ñm─ünir-Raß╕Ñ─½m.
Qul a`┼½dhu birabbil-falaq. Min sharri m─ü khalaq. Wa min sharri gh─üsiqin idh─ü waqab. Wa min sharrin-naff─üth─üti fil-`uqad. Wa min sharri ß╕Ñ─üsidin idh─ü ß╕Ñasad.
Bismill─ühir-Raß╕Ñm─ünir-Raß╕Ñ─½m.
Qul a`┼½dhu birabbin-n─üs. Malikin-n─üs.'Il─ühin-n─üs. Min sharri ΓÇÿl-wasw─üsil-khann─üs. Alladh─½ yuwaswisu f─½ ß╣úud┼½rin-n─üs. Minal-jinnati wann─üs.
With the Name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful.
Say: He is Allah (the) One. The Self-Sufficient Master, Whom all creatures need, He begets not nor was He begotten, and there is none equal to Him.
With the Name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful.
Say: I seek refuge with (Allah) the Lord of the daybreak, from the evil of what He has created, and from the evil of the darkening (night) as it comes with its darkness, and from the evil of those who practice witchcraft when they blow in the knots, and from the evil of the envier when he envies.
With the Name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful.
Say: I seek refuge with (Allah) the Lord of mankind, the King of mankind, the God of mankind, from the evil of the whisperer who withdraws, who whispers in the breasts of mankind, of jinns and men.
(Recite these three times each in Arabic).
Reference:
Al-Ikhlas 112:1-4, Al-Falaq 113:1-5, An-Nas 114:1-6. Whoever recites these three times in the morning and in the evening, they will suffice him (as a protection) against everything. The Hadith was reported by Abu Dawud 4/322, and At-Tirmidhi 5/567. See Al-Albani's Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/182.
Hisnul Muslim 76
╪ú┘Ä╪╡┘Æ╪¿┘Ä╪¡┘Æ┘å┘Ä╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä╪╡┘Æ╪¿┘Ä╪¡┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘à┘Å┘ä┘Æ┘â┘Å ┘ä┘É┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ╪»┘Å ┘ä┘É┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘É ┘ä╪º┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘ä╪º┘æ┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪¡┘Æ╪»┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ä╪º┘Ä ╪┤┘Ä╪▒┘É┘è┘â┘Ä ┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘à┘Å┘ä┘Æ┘â┘Å ┘ê┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ╪»┘Å ┘ê┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘ê┘Ä ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘ë ┘â┘Å┘ä┘æ┘É ╪┤┘Ä┘è┘Æ╪í┘ì ┘é┘Ä╪»┘É┘è╪▒┘î ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘É ╪ú┘Ä╪│┘Æ╪ú┘Ä┘ä┘Å┘â┘Ä ╪«┘Ä┘è┘Æ╪▒┘Ä ┘à┘Ä╪º ┘ü┘É┘è ┘ç┘Ä╪░┘Ä╪º ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘è┘Ä┘ê┘Æ┘à┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪«┘Ä┘è╪▒┘Ä ┘à┘Ä╪º ╪¿┘Ä╪╣┘Æ╪»┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Å┘ê╪░┘Å ╪¿┘É┘â┘Ä ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ╪┤┘Ä╪▒┘æ┘É ┘à┘Ä╪º ┘ü┘É┘è ┘ç┘Ä╪░┘Ä╪º ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘è┘Ä┘ê┘Æ┘à┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪┤┘Ä╪▒┘æ┘É ┘à┘Ä╪º ╪¿┘Ä╪╣┘Æ╪»┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘É ╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Å┘ê╪░┘Å ╪¿┘É┘â┘Ä ┘à┘É┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘â┘Ä╪│┘Ä┘ä┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪│┘Å┘ê╪í┘É ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘â┘É╪¿┘Ä╪▒┘É ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘É ╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Å┘ê╪░┘Å ╪¿┘É┘â┘Ä ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ╪╣┘Ä╪░┘Ä╪º╪¿┘ì ┘ü┘É┘è ╪º┘ä┘å┘æ┘Ä╪º╪▒┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪╣┘Ä╪░┘Ä╪º╪¿┘ì ┘ü┘É┘è ╪º┘ä┘é┘Ä┘Ç╪¿┘Æ╪▒.

video_library
Aß╣úbaß╕Ñn─ü wa aß╣úbaß╕Ñal-mulku lill─üh, walß╕Ñamdu lill─üh. l─ü il─üha illall─ühu waß╕Ñdahu l─ü shar─½ka lah. lahul-mulku wa lahul-ß╕Ñamd, wa huwa `al─ü kulli shay'in Qad─½r. Rabbi as'aluka khayra m─ü f─½ h─üdha ΓÇÿl-yawmi wa khayra m─ü ba`dahuwa a`┼½dhu bika min sharri m─ü f─½ h─ütha ΓÇÿl-yawmi wa sharri m─ü ba`dahu. Rabbi a`┼½dhu bika minal-kasali, wa s┼½'il-kibar. Rabbi a`┼½dhu bika min `adh─übin fin-n─üri wa `adh─übin fil-qabr.
We have entered a new day 1 and with it all dominion is Allah's. Praise is to Allah. None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner. To Allah belongs the dominion, and to Him is the praise and He is Able to do all things. My Lord, I ask You for the goodness of this day and of the days that come after it, and I seek refuge in You from the evil of this day and of the days that come after it.<>sup>2 My Lord, I seek refuge in You from laziness and helpless old age. My Lord, I seek refuge in You from the punishment of Hell-fire, and from the punishment of the grave.3
Reference:
1 When you say this in the evening you should say Amsayn─ü wa amsal-mulku lill─üh: "We have ended another day and with it, all dominion is Allah's. 2 When you say this in the evening you should say: Rabbi as'aluka khayra m─ü f─½ h─üthihil-laylati, wa khayra m─ü ba`dah─ü, wa a`┼½thu bika min sharri m─ü f─½ h─üthihil-laylati wa sharri m─ü ba`dah─ü: "I ask You for the good things of this night and of the nights that come after it and I seek refuge in You from the evil of this night and of the nights that come after it." 3 Muslim 4/2088.
Hisnul Muslim 77
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪¿┘É┘â┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä╪╡┘Æ┘Ç╪¿┘Ä╪¡┘Æ┘å╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪¿┘É┘â┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä┘à┘Æ╪│┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘å╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪¿┘É┘â┘Ä ┘å┘Ä╪¡┘Æ┘Ç┘è╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪¿┘É┘â┘Ä ┘å┘Ä┘à┘Ç┘ê╪¬┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘å┘æ┘É┘Ç╪┤┘ê╪▒
┘ê╪Ñ╪░╪º ╪ú┘à╪│┘è ┘ü┘ä┘è┘é┘ä :
