All─ühumma bika aß╣úbaß╕Ñn─ü. wa bika amsayn─ü. wa bika naß╕Ñy─ü, wa bika nam┼½t. wa ilaykan-nush┼½r.
When you say this in the evening you should say:
All─ühumma bika amsayn─ü wa bika aß╣úbaß╕Ñn─ü. wa bika naß╕Ñy─ü, wa bika nam┼½t. wa ilaykal-maß╣ú─½r
O Allah, by You we enter the morning and by You we enter the evening, by You we live and by You we die, and to You is the Final Return.
O Allah, You bring us the end of the day as You bring us its beginning, You bring us life and you bring us death, and to You is our fate.
Reference:
Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/142.'
Hisnul Muslim 78
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ╪¬┘Ä ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘É┘Ç┘è ┘ä╪º ╪Ñ┘ä┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘ä╪º┘æ ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ╪¬┘Ä ╪«┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘é┘Æ╪¬┘Ä┘å┘Ç┘è ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä┘å╪º ╪╣┘Ä╪¿┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘Å┘â ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä┘å╪º ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ç┘ë ╪╣┘Ä┘ç┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘É┘â┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä┘ê┘Ä╪╣┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘É┘â┘Ä ┘à╪º ╪º╪│┘Æ╪¬┘Ä┘Ç╪╖┘Ä╪╣┘Æ┘Ç╪¬ ╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Ç┘ê╪░┘Å ╪¿┘É┘â┘Ä ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ╪┤┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘æ┘É ┘à╪º ╪╡┘Ä┘å┘Ä┘Ç╪╣┘Æ╪¬ ╪ú┘Ä╪¿┘Ç┘ê╪í┘Å ┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘â┘Ä ╪¿┘É┘å┘É╪╣┘Æ┘Ç┘à┘Ä╪¬┘É┘Ç┘â┘Ä ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘æ┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä╪¿┘Ç┘ê╪í┘Å ╪¿┘É╪░┘Ä┘å┘Æ┘Ç╪¿┘è ┘ü┘Ä╪º╪║┘Æ┘ü┘Ç┘É╪▒┘Æ ┘ä┘è ┘ü┘Ä╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘Ä┘Ç┘ç┘Å ┘ä╪º ┘è┘Ä╪║┘Æ┘Ç┘ü┘É╪▒┘Å ╪º┘ä╪░┘æ┘Å┘å┘Ç┘ê╪¿┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ╪¬┘Ä

video_library
All─ühumma anta Rabb─½ l─ü il─üha ill─ü ant. khalaqtan─½ wa an─ü `abduk. wa an─ü `al─ü `ahdika wa wa`dika mastaß╣¡a`t. a`┼½dhu bika min sharri m─ü ß╣úana`t. ab┼½'u laka bi ni`matika `alay. wa ab┼½'u bidhanb─½ faghfir l─½fa'innahu l─ü yaghfirudh-dhun┼½ba ill─ü ant.
O Allah, You are my Lord, there is none worthy of worship but You. You created me and I am your slave. I keep Your covenant, and my pledge to You so far as I am able. I seek refuge in You from the evil of what I have done. I admit to Your blessings upon me, and I admit to my misdeeds. Forgive me, for there is none who may forgive sins but You.
Reference:
Whoever recites this with conviction in the evening and dies during that night shall enter Paradise, and whoever recites it with conviction in the morning and dies during that day shall enter Paradise, Al-Bukhari 7/150. Other reports are in An-Nasa'i and At-Tirmidhi.
Hisnul Muslim 79
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘É┘Ç┘è ╪ú┘Ä╪╡┘Æ╪¿┘Ä┘Ç╪¡┘Æ╪¬┘Å ╪ú┘Ä┘Å╪┤┘Æ┘Ç┘ç┘É╪»┘Å┘â ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Å╪┤┘Æ┘Ç┘ç┘É╪»┘Å ╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘Ç╪⌐┘Ä ╪╣┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘Æ╪┤┘É┘Ç┘â ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘Ä┘ä╪º╪ª┘É┘â┘Ä╪¬┘É┘â ┘ê┘Ä╪¼┘Ä┘à┘Ç┘è╪╣┘Ä ╪«┘Ä┘ä┘Æ┘Ç┘é┘É┘â ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘æ┘Ä┘Ç┘â┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ┘Ç╪¬┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘Å ┘ä╪º ╪Ñ┘ä┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘ä╪º┘æ ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ┘Ç╪¬┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪¡┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘Ä┘â┘Ä ┘ä╪º ╪┤┘Ä╪▒┘è┘â┘Ä ┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘â ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä┘å┘æ┘Ä ┘Å ┘à┘Å╪¡┘Ä┘à┘æ┘Ç╪»╪º┘ï ╪╣┘Ä╪¿┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘Å┘â┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪▒┘Ä╪│┘Ç┘ê┘ä┘Å┘Ç┘â . (╪ú╪▒╪¿╪╣ ┘à╪▒╪º╪¬ ╪¡┘è┘å┘Ä ┘è╪╡┘Æ╪¿┘É╪¡ ╪ú┘ê┘Æ ┘è┘à╪│┘è)

All─ühumma inn─½ aß╣úbaß╕Ñtu ush-hidukawa ush-hidu ß╕Ñamalata `arshik. wa mal─ü'ikataka wajam─½`a khalqik. annaka antall─ühu l─ü il─üha ill─ü ant. waß╕Ñdaka l─ü shar─½ka lak. wa anna Muß╕Ñammadan `abduka wa ras┼½luk.
O Allah, I have entered a new morning 1 and call upon You and upon the bearers of Your Throne, upon Your angels and all creation to bear witness that surely You are Allah, there is none worthy of worship but You alone, You have no partners, and that Muhammad is Your slave and Your Messenger.(Recite four times in Arabic.) 2
Reference:
1 When you say this in the evening you should say, All─ühumma inn─½ amsaytu. . . .: "O Allah, I have ended another day..." 2 "Allah will spare whoever says this four times in the morning or evening from the fire of Hell." Abu Dawud 4/317. It was also reported by Al-Bukhari in Al-'Adab Al-Mufrad, An-Nasa'i in 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah and Ibn As-Sunni. Nasa'i's and Abu Dawud's chains of transmission are good (Hasan), Ibn Baz, p. 23.
Hisnul Muslim 80
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ┘à╪º ╪ú┘Ä╪╡┘Æ╪¿┘Ä┘Ç┘Ä╪¡┘Ä ╪¿┘è ┘à┘É┘Ç┘å┘Æ ┘å┘É╪╣┘Æ┘Ç┘à┘Ä╪⌐┘ì ╪ú┘Ä┘ê ╪¿┘É╪ú┘Ä╪¡┘Ä┘Ç╪»┘ì ┘à┘É┘Ç┘å┘Æ ╪«┘Ä┘ä┘Æ┘Ç┘é┘É┘â ┘ü┘Ä┘à┘É┘Ç┘å┘Æ┘â┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪¡┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘Ä┘â┘Ä ┘ä╪º ╪┤╪▒┘è┘â┘Ä ┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘â ┘ü┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘Å ┘ê┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪┤┘æ┘Å┘â┘Æ┘Ç╪▒

All─ühumma m─ü aß╣úbaha b─½ min ni`matinaw bi aß╕Ñadin min khalqik. fa minka waß╕Ñdaka l─ü shar─½ka lak. falaka ΓÇÿl-ß╕Ñamdu wa lakash-shukr.
O Allah, whatever blessing has been received by me or anyone of Your creation1is from You alone, You have no partner. All praise is for you and thanks is to You. 2
Reference:
1 When you say this in the evening, you should say: All─ühumma m─ü 'ams─ü b─½...: "O Allah, as I... enter this evening..." 2 Whoever recites this in the morning, has completed his obligation to thank Allah for that day; and whoever says it in the evening, has completed his obligation for that night. Abu Dawud 4/318, An-Nasa'i 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah (no. 7), Ibn As-Sunni (no. 41), Ibn Hibban (no. 2361). Its chain of transmission is good (Hasan), Ibn Baz, p. 24.
Hisnul Muslim 81
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪╣╪º┘ü┘É┘Ç┘å┘è ┘ü┘è ╪¿┘Ä╪»┘Ä┘å┘Ç┘è ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪╣╪º┘ü┘É┘Ç┘å┘è ┘ü┘è ╪│┘Ä┘à┘Æ┘Ç╪╣┘è ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪╣╪º┘ü┘É┘Ç┘å┘è ┘ü┘è ╪¿┘Ä╪╡┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘è ┘ä╪º ╪Ñ┘ä┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘ä╪º┘æ ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ┘Ç╪¬┘Ä. ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘Ç┘è ╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Ç┘ê╪░┘Å╪¿┘É┘â┘Ä ┘à┘É┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘â┘Å┘Ç┘ü╪▒ ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘ü┘Ä┘Ç┘é┘Æ╪▒ ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Ç┘ê╪░┘Å ╪¿┘É┘â┘Ä ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ╪╣┘Ä╪░╪º╪¿┘É ╪º┘ä┘é┘Ä┘Ç╪¿┘Æ╪▒ ┘ä╪º ╪Ñ┘ä┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘ä╪º┘æ ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ┘Ç╪¬┘Ä. (╪½┘ä╪º╪½ ┘à╪▒╪º╪¬)

video_library
All─ühumma `─üfin─½ f─½ badan─½. All─ühumma `─üfin─½ f─½ sam`─½. All─ühumma `─üfin─½ f─½ baß╣úar─½. l─ü il─üha ill─ü ant. All─ühumma inn─½ a`┼½dhu bika mina ΓÇÿl-kufri, wa ΓÇÿl-faqr. wa a`┼½dhu bika min `adh─übi ΓÇÿl-qabr. l─ü il─üha ill─ü ant.
O Allah, make me healthy in my body. O Allah, preserve for me my hearing. O Allah, preserve for me my sight. There is none worthy of worship but You. O Allah, I seek refuge in You from disbelief and poverty, and I seek refuge in You from the punishment of the grave. There is none worthy of worship but You(Recite three times in Arabic.)
Reference:
Abu Dawud 4/324, Ahmad 5/42, An-Nasa'i, 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah (no. 22), Ibn As-Sunni (no. 69), Al-Bukhari Al-'Adab Al-Mufrad. Its chain of transmission is good (Hasan), Ibn Baz, p. 26.
Hisnul Muslim 82
╪¡┘Ä╪│┘Æ╪¿┘É┘Ç┘è┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å ┘ä╪º ╪Ñ┘ä┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘ä╪º┘æ ┘ç┘Å┘ê┘Ä ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘ç┘É ╪¬┘Ä┘ê┘Ä┘â┘æ┘Ä┘Ç┘ä╪¬┘Å ┘ê┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘ê┘Ä ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Å ╪º┘ä╪╣┘Ä╪▒┘Æ╪┤┘É ╪º┘ä╪╣┘Ä╪╕┘Ç┘è┘à. (╪│╪¿╪╣ ┘à╪▒╪º╪¬)

ß╕ñasbiyall─ühu l─ü il─üha ill─ü huwa `alayhi tawakkalt. wa huwa Rabbu ΓÇÿl-`Arshi ΓÇÿl-'Aß║ô─½m.
Allah is sufficient for me. There is none worthy of worship but Him. I have placed my trust in Him, He is Lord of the Majestic Throne.(Recite seven times in Arabic.)
Reference:
Allah will grant whoever recites this seven times in the morning or evening whatever he desires from this world or the next, Ibn As-Sunni (no. 71), Abu Dawud 4/321. Both reports are attributed directly to the Prophet j┬º (Marfu1). The chain of transmission is sound (Sahih). Ibn As-Sunni.
Hisnul Muslim 83
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘É┘Ç┘è ╪ú╪│┘Æ┘Ç╪ú┘Ä┘ä┘Å┘Ç┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪╣┘Ä┘Ç┘ü┘Æ┘ê┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä╪╣┘Ç╪º┘ü┘É┘Ç┘è╪⌐┘Ä ┘ü┘è ╪º┘ä╪»┘æ┘Å┘å┘Æ┘Ç┘è╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä╪ó╪«┘É┘Ç╪▒┘Ä╪⌐ ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘É┘Ç┘è ╪ú╪│┘Æ┘Ç╪ú┘Ä┘ä┘Å┘Ç┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪╣┘Ä┘Ç┘ü┘Æ┘ê┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä╪╣┘Ç╪º┘ü┘É┘Ç┘è╪⌐┘Ä ┘ü┘è ╪»┘è┘å┘è ┘ê┘Ä╪»┘Å┘å┘Æ┘Ç┘è╪º┘è┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘ç┘Æ┘Ç┘ä┘è ┘ê┘Ä┘à╪º┘ä┘Ç┘è ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪º╪│┘Æ╪¬┘Å┘Ç╪▒┘Æ ╪╣┘Ç┘ê┘Æ╪▒╪º╪¬┘è ┘ê┘Ä╪ó┘à┘É┘Ç┘å┘Æ ╪▒┘Ä┘ê┘Æ╪╣╪º╪¬┘Ç┘è ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪º╪¡┘Æ┘ü┘Ä╪╕┘Æ┘Ç┘å┘è ┘à┘É┘å ╪¿┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘å┘É ┘è┘Ä╪»┘Ä┘è┘æ┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘É┘å ╪«┘Ä┘ä┘Æ┘ü┘Ç┘è ┘ê┘Ä╪╣┘Ä┘å ┘è┘Ä┘à┘Ç┘è┘å┘è ┘ê┘Ä╪╣┘Ä┘å ╪┤┘É┘à┘Ç╪º┘ä┘è ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘É┘å ┘ü┘Ä┘ê┘Æ┘é┘Ç┘è ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Ç┘ê╪░┘Å ╪¿┘É╪╣┘Ä╪╕┘Ä┘à┘Ä┘Ç╪¬┘É┘â┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä┘å ╪ú┘Å╪║┘Æ┘Ç╪¬╪º┘ä┘Ä ┘à┘É┘å ╪¬┘Ä╪¡┘Æ╪¬┘Ç┘è

video_library
All─ühumma inn─½ as'aluka 'l-`afwa wal-`─üfiyahfid-duny─ü wal-─ükhirah. All─ühumma inn─½ as'aluka 'l-`afwa wal-`─üfiyahf─½ d─½n─½ wa duny─üya, wa ahl─½, wa m─ül─½. All─ühummastur `awr─üt─½. wa ─ümin raw`─üt─½. All─ühummaß╕Ñfaß║ôn─½ min bayni yadayya, wa min khalf─½. wa `an yam─½n─½, wa `an shim─ül─½. wa min fawq─½. wa a`┼½dhu bi`aß║ôamatika an 'ught─üla min taß╕Ñt─½.
O Allah, I seek Your forgiveness and Your protection in this world and the next. O Allah, I seek Your forgiveness and Your protection in my religion, in my worldly affairs, in my family and in my wealth. O Allah, conceal my secrets and preserve me from anguish. O Allah, guard me from what is in front of me and behind me, from my left, and from my right, and from above me. I seek refuge in Your Greatness from being struck down from beneath me.
Reference:
Sahih Ibn Majah 2/332 and Abu Dawud.
Hisnul Muslim 84
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪╣╪º┘ä┘É┘Ç┘à┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪║┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ╪¿┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä╪┤┘æ┘Ç┘ç╪º╪»┘Ä╪⌐┘É ┘ü╪º╪╖┘É┘Ç╪▒┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪│┘æ┘à╪º┘ê╪º╪¬┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä╪ú╪▒┘Æ╪╢┘É ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Ä ┘â┘Ç┘ä┘æ┘É ╪┤┘Ä┘Ç┘è╪í┘ì ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘Ä┘ä┘è┘Ç┘â┘Ä┘ç ╪ú┘Ä╪┤┘Æ┘ç┘Ä┘Ç╪»┘Å ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ ┘ä╪º ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ç┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ╪¬ ╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Ç┘ê╪░┘Å ╪¿┘É┘â┘Ä ┘à┘É┘å ╪┤┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘æ┘É ┘å┘Ä┘ü┘Æ╪│┘Ç┘è ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘É┘å ╪┤┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘æ┘É ╪º┘ä╪┤┘æ┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘Ç╪╖╪º┘å┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪┤┘É┘Ç╪▒┘Æ┘â┘É┘ç ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ ╪ú┘Ä┘é┘Æ╪¬┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘É┘ü┘Ä ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ç┘ë ┘å┘Ä┘ü┘Æ╪│┘Ç┘è ╪│┘ê╪í╪º┘ï ╪ú┘Ä┘ê┘Æ ╪ú┘Ä╪¼┘Å┘Ç╪▒┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ç┘ë ┘à┘Å╪│┘Æ┘Ç┘ä┘É┘à

All─ühumma `─ülima ΓÇÿl-ghaybi wash-shah─üdahf─ütir as-sam─üw─üti wa ΓÇÿl'arß╕ì. Rabba kulli shay'in wa mal─½kah. ash-hadu an l─ü il─üha ill─ü ant. a`┼½dhu bika min sharri nafs─½. wa min sharrish-shayß╣¡─üni wa shirkih. wa an aqtarifa `al─ü nafs─½ s┼½'an, aw ajurrahu il─ü Muslim.
O Allah, Knower of the unseen and the evident, Maker of the heavens and the earth, Lord of everything and its Possessor, I bear witness that there is none worthy of worship but You. I seek refuge in You from the evil of my soul, and from the evil of Satan and his helpers.(I seek refuge in You) from bringing evil upon my soul and from harming any Muslim.
Reference:
Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/142 and AbuDawud.
Hisnul Muslim 85
╪¿┘É╪│┘Ç┘à┘É ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘É ╪º┘ä╪░┘è ┘ä╪º ┘è┘Ä╪╢┘Å┘Ç╪▒┘æ┘Å ┘à┘Ä╪╣┘Ä ╪º╪│┘à┘É┘Ç┘ç┘É ╪┤┘Ä┘è╪í┘î ┘ü┘è ╪º┘ä╪ú╪▒┘Æ╪╢┘É ┘ê┘Ä┘ä╪º ┘ü┘è ╪º┘ä╪│┘æ┘à┘Ç╪º╪í┘É ┘ê┘Ä┘ç┘Ç┘ê┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪│┘æ┘à┘Ç┘è╪╣┘Å ╪º┘ä╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ç┘è┘à . (╪½┘ä╪º╪½ ┘à╪▒╪º╪¬)

video_library
Bismill─ühi ΓÇÿl-ladh─½ l─ü yaß╕ìurru ma`a-smihishay'un fil-'arß╕ìi wa l─ü fis-sam─ü'wa huwas-Sam─½ `ul-`Al─½m.
In the Name of Allah, Who with His Name nothing can cause harm in the earth nor in the heavens, and He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing. (Recite three times in Arabic).
Reference:
Whoever recites it three times in the morning will not be afflicted by any calamity before evening, and whoever recites it three times in the evening will not be overtaken by any calamity before morning. Abu Dawud 4/323, At-Tirmidhi 5/465, Ibn Majah 2/332, Ahmad. Ibn Majah's chain of transmission is good (Hasan), Ibn Baz, p. 39.
Hisnul Muslim 86
╪▒┘Ä╪╢┘è┘Ç╪¬┘Å ╪¿┘É╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘É ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Ä┘Ç╪º┘ï ┘ê┘Ä╪¿┘É╪º┘ä╪Ñ╪│┘Æ┘ä╪º┘à┘É ╪»┘è┘Ç┘å╪º┘ï ┘ê┘Ä╪¿┘É┘à┘Å╪¡┘Ä┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä╪»┘ì ┘å┘Ä╪¿┘É┘è┘æ┘Ç╪º┘ï .

Raß╕ì─½tu bill─ühi Rabba. wa bil-Isl─ümi d─½na. wa bi-Muß╕Ñammadin (ß╣úallall─ühu `alayhi wa sallama) nabiyya.
I am pleased with Allah as my Lord, with Islam as my religion, and with Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) as my Prophet.(Recite three times in Arabic.)
Reference:
Allah has promised that anyone who says this three times every morning or evening will be pleased on the Day of Resurrection. Ahmad 4/ 337, An-Nasa'i, 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah p. 4, Ibn As-Sunni (no. 68), At-Tirmidhi 5/465. Its chain of transmission is good (Hasan), Ibn Baz, p. 39.

Y─ü ß╕ñayyu y─ü Qayy┼½mu biraß╕Ñmatika astagh─½thaß╣úlih l─½ sha'n─½ kullahwa l─ü takiln─½ il─ü nafs─½ ß╣¡arfata `ayn.
O Ever-Living One, O Eternal One, by Your mercy I call on You to set right all my affairs. Do not place me in charge of my soul even for the blinking of an eye (i. e. a moment).
Reference:
Its chain of transmission is sound (Sahih), Al-Hakim 1/545, see Albani, Sahihut-Targhib wat-Tarhib, 1/273.

╪ú┘Ä╪╡┘Æ╪¿┘Ä┘Ç╪¡┘Æ┘Ç┘å╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä╪╡┘Æ╪¿┘Ä┘Ç╪¡┘Æ ╪º┘ä┘à┘Å┘Ç┘ä┘â┘Å ┘ä┘ä┘ç┘É ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘É ╪º┘ä╪╣┘Ç╪º┘ä┘Ä┘à┘Ç┘è┘å ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘É┘Ç┘è ╪ú╪│┘Æ┘Ç╪ú┘Ä┘ä┘Å┘Ç┘â┘Ä ╪«┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ╪▒┘Ä ┘ç┘Ç╪░╪º ╪º┘ä┘Ç┘è┘Ä┘ê┘Æ┘à ┘ü┘Ä┘Ç╪¬┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä┘å┘Ä╪╡┘Æ┘Ç╪▒┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä┘å┘Ç┘ê╪▒┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪¿┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘Ä┘â┘Ä╪¬┘Ä┘Ç┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘Ç╪»╪º┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Ç┘ê╪░┘Å ╪¿┘É┘Ç┘â┘Ä ┘à┘É┘Ç┘å┘Æ ╪┤┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘æ┘É ┘à╪º ┘ü┘Ç┘è┘ç┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪┤┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘æ┘É ┘à╪º ╪¿┘Ä╪╣┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘Ä┘ç

Aß╣úbaß╕Ñn─ü wa aß╣úbaß╕Ñal-mulku lill─ühi Rabbi ΓÇÿl-a`l─üm─½n. All─ühumma inn─½ as'aluka khayra h─üdha ΓÇÿl-yawm:FatΓÇÖß╕Ñahu wa naß╣úrahu wa n┼½rahu. wa barakatahu, wa hud─üh. wa a`┼½dhu bika min sharri m─ü f─½hiwa sharri m─ü ba`dah.
We have entered a new day and with it all the dominion which belongs to Allah, Lord of all that exists. O Allah, I ask You for the goodness of this day, 2its victory, its help, its light, its blessings, and its guidance. I seek refuge in You from the evil that is in it, and from the evil that follows it.
Reference:
1 For evening recitation, say here: All─ühumma inn─½ as'aluka khayra h─üthihil-laylah: "My Lord, I ask You for the good things of this night." 2 Abu Dawud 4/322. Its transmission chain is good (Hasan). See also Ibn Al-Qayyim, Zadul- Ma'ad 2/273.
Hisnul Muslim 89
╪ú┘Ä╪╡┘Æ┘Ç╪¿┘Ä╪¡┘Æ┘å╪º[╪ú┘Ä┘à┘Æ╪│┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘å╪º] ╪╣┘ä┘Ç┘ë ┘ü┘É╪╖┘Æ┘Ç╪▒┘Ä╪⌐┘É ╪º┘ä╪Ñ╪│┘Æ┘ä╪º┘à ┘ê┘Ä╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ç┘ë ┘â┘Ä┘ä┘É┘Ç┘à┘Ä╪⌐┘É ╪º┘ä╪Ñ╪«┘Æ┘Ç┘ä╪º╪╡ ┘ê┘Ä╪╣┘ä┘Ç┘ë ╪»┘è┘å┘É ┘å┘Ä╪¿┘É┘Ç┘è┘æ┘É┘å╪º ┘à┘Å╪¡┘Ä┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä╪»┘ì ┘ê┘Ä╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ç┘ë ┘à┘É┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘Ç╪⌐┘É ╪ú╪¿┘è┘å┘Ç╪º ╪Ñ┘É╪¿┘Æ┘Ç╪▒╪º┘ç┘è┘Ç┘à┘Ä ╪¡┘Ä┘å┘è┘Ç┘ü╪º┘ï ┘à┘Å╪│┘Æ┘ä┘É┘Ç┘à╪º┘ï ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘Ç╪º ┘â┘Ç╪º┘å┘Ä ┘à┘É┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘à┘Å╪┤┘Ç╪▒┘É┘â┘è┘Ç┘å

Aß╣úbahn─ü `al─ü fiß╣¡rati ΓÇÿl-Isl─üm. wa `al─ü kalimati ΓÇÿl-ikhl─üs. wa `al─ü d─½ni nabiyyin─ü Muß╕Ñammadin (ß╣úallall─ühu `alayhi wa sallam). wa `al─ü millati ab─½n─ü Ibr─üh─½m,ß╕Ñan─½fan Muslimanwa m─ü k─üna mina ΓÇÿl-mushrik─½n.
We have entered a new day 1 upon the natural religion of Islam, the word of sincere devotion, the religion of our Prophet Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), and the faith of our father Ibrahim. He was upright (in worshipping Allah), and a Muslim. He was not of those who worship others besides Allah. 2
Reference:
1 When you say this in the evening, you should say: 'Amsayn─ü `al─ü fiß╣¡ratil-Isl─üm...: "We end this day..." 2 Ahmad 3/406-7, 5/123, An-Nasa'i, 'Amalul- Yawm wal-Laylah (no. 34), At-Tirmidhi 4/209.
Hisnul Muslim 90
╪│┘Å╪¿┘Æ╪¡┘Ç╪º┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪¿┘É╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘É┘ç┘É . (┘à╪º╪ª╪⌐ ┘à╪▒╪⌐)
play_arrow
share
video_library
Subß╕Ñ─ünall─ühi wa biß╕Ñamdih.
Glory is to Allah and praise is to Him.(Recite one hundred times in Arabic).
Reference:
Whoever recites this one hundred times in the morning and in the evening will not be surpassed on the Day of Resurrection by anyone having done better than this except for someone who had recited it more. Al-Bukhari 4/2071.
Hisnul Muslim 91
┘ä╪º ╪Ñ┘ä┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘ä╪º┘æ ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å ┘ê╪¡┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ä╪º ╪┤┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘è┘â┘Ä ┘ä┘ç┘Å ┘ä┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä┘à┘Å┘Ç┘ä┘Æ┘â┘Å ┘ê┘ä┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ┘Ç╪» ┘ê┘ç┘Å┘ê┘Ä ╪╣┘ä┘ë ┘â┘Å┘ä┘æ ╪┤┘Ä┘è╪í┘ì ┘é┘Ä╪»┘è╪▒ . (╪╣╪┤╪▒ ┘à╪▒╪º╪¬ ╪ú┘Ä┘ê┘Æ ┘à╪▒┘æ┘Ä╪⌐┘ï ┘ê╪º╪¡╪»╪⌐┘ï ╪╣┘å╪»┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘â┘Ä╪│┘Ä┘ä┘É)
play_arrow
share
video_library
L─ü il─üha illall─ühu waß╕Ñdahu l─ü shar─½ka lah. lahu ΓÇÿl-mulku walahu ΓÇÿl-ß╕Ñamd. wa huwa `al─ü kulli shay'in qad─½r.
None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner. His is the dominion and His is the praise and He is Able to do all things.(Recite ten times 1 in Arabic or one time to ward off laziness.) 2
Reference:
1Allah will write ten Hasanaat (rewards) for whoever recites this ten times in the morning, and forgive him ten misdeeds and give him the reward of freeing ten slaves and protect him from Satan. Whoever recites this ten times in the evening will get this same reward. An-Nasa'i, 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah (no. 24). Its chain of transmission is sound (Sahih). Albani 1/272. Abu Hurayrah ┬½fe narrated that the Prophet j┬º said: "Allah will write one hundred Hasanat for whoever says There is no God but Allah alone, He has no partner. To Allah is possession of everything, and to Him all praise is. He is Capable of all things' ten times in the morning, and forgive him one hundred misdeeds. He will have the reward of freeing a slave and will be protected from Satan throughout the day unto dusk. Whoever says it in the evening will have the same reward." Ahmad 8/704, 16/293. Its chain of transmission is good (Hasan), Ibn Baz, p. 44. 2 Whoever recites this in the morning, will have the reward of freeing a slave from the Children of Isma'il. Ten Hasanaat (rewards) will be written for him, and he will be forgiven ten misdeeds, raised up ten degrees, and be protected from Satan until evening. Whoever says it in the evening will have the same reward until morning. Abu Dawud 4/319, 3/957, Ahmad 4/ 60, Ibn Majah 2/331, Ibn Al-Qayyim Zadul-Ma'ad 2/388. Its chain of transmission is sound (Sahih). Al-Albani 1/270.
Hisnul Muslim 92
┘ä╪º ╪Ñ┘ä┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘ä╪º┘æ ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å ┘ê╪¡┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ä╪º ╪┤┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘è┘â┘Ä ┘ä┘ç┘Å ┘ä┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä┘à┘Å┘Ç┘ä┘Æ┘â┘Å ┘ê┘ä┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ┘Ç╪» ┘ê┘ç┘Å┘ê┘Ä ╪╣┘ä┘ë ┘â┘Å┘ä┘æ ╪┤┘Ä┘è╪í┘ì ┘é┘Ä╪»┘è╪▒ .
play_arrow
share
video_library
L─ü il─üha illall─ühu waß╕Ñdahu l─ü shar─½ka lah. lahu ΓÇÿl-mulku walahu ΓÇÿl-ß╕Ñamd. wa huwa `al─ü kulli shay'in qad─½r.
None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner. His is the dominion and His is the praise and He is Able to do all things.(Recite 100 times in Arabic upon rising in the morning).
Reference:
Whoever recites this one hundred times a day will have the reward of freeing ten slaves. One hundred Hasanaat (rewards) will be written for him and one hundred misdeeds will be washed away. He will be shielded from Satan until the evening. No one will be able to present anything better than this except for someone who has recited more than this. Al-Bukhari 4/95, Muslim 4/2071.
Hisnul Muslim 93
╪│┘Å╪¿┘Æ╪¡┘Ç╪º┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪¿┘É╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘É┘ç┘É ╪╣┘Ä╪»┘Ä╪»┘Ä ╪«┘Ä┘ä┘Æ┘Ç┘é┘É┘ç ┘ê┘Ä╪▒┘É╪╢┘Ç╪º ┘å┘Ä┘ü┘Æ╪│┘É┘Ç┘ç ┘ê┘Ä╪▓┘É┘å┘Ä┘Ç╪⌐┘Ä ╪╣┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘Æ╪┤┘É┘Ç┘ç ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘É┘Ç╪»╪º╪»┘Ä ┘â┘Ä┘ä┘É┘à┘Ç╪º╪¬┘É┘Ç┘ç

Subß╕Ñ─ünall─ühi wa biß╕Ñamdih:`adada khalqih. wa riß╕ì─ü nafsih. wa zinata `arshih. wa mid─üda kalim─ütih.
Glory is to Allah and praise is to Him, by the multitude of His creation, by His Pleasure, by the weight of His Throne, and by the extent of His Words.(Recite three times in Arabic upon rising in the morning.)
Reference:
Muslim 4/2090.
Hisnul Muslim 94
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘É┘è ╪ú┘Ä╪│┘Æ╪ú┘Ä┘ä┘Å┘â┘Ä ╪╣┘É┘ä┘Æ┘à╪º┘ï ┘å┘Ä╪º┘ü┘É╪╣╪º┘ï ┘ê┘Ä╪▒┘É╪▓┘Æ┘é╪º┘ï ╪╖┘Ä┘è┘æ┘É╪¿╪º┘ï ┘ê┘Ä╪╣┘Ä┘à┘Ä┘ä╪º┘ï ┘à┘Å╪¬┘Ä┘é┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Ä┘ä╪º┘ï (╪Ñ╪░╪º ╪ú╪╡╪¿╪¡┘Ä)
play_arrow
share
video_library
All─ühumma inn─½ as'aluka `ilman n─üfi`a. wa rizqan ß╣¡ayyiba. wa `amalan mutaqabbala.
O Allah, I ask You for knowledge that is of benefit, a good provision, and deeds that will be accepted.(Recite in Arabic upon rising in the morning.)
Reference:
Ibn As-Sunni, no. 54, Ibn Majah no. 925. Its chain of transmission is good (Hasan), Ibn Al-Qayyim 2/375.
Hisnul Muslim 95
╪ú┘Ä╪│┘Æ╪¬┘Ä╪║┘Æ┘ü┘É╪▒┘Å ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä╪¬┘Å┘ê╪¿┘Å ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘ç┘É (┘à┘É╪º╪ª┘Ä╪⌐┘Ä ┘à┘Ä╪▒┘æ┘Ä╪⌐┘ì ┘ü┘É┘è ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘è┘Ä┘ê┘Æ┘à┘É)

video_library
Astaghfirull─üha wa at┼½bu ilayh.
I seek the forgiveness of Allah and repent to Him. (Recite one hundred times in Arabic during the day.)
Reference:
Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 11/101, Muslim 4/2075.
Hisnul Muslim 96
╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Ç┘ê╪░┘Å ╪¿┘É┘â┘Ä┘ä┘É┘à┘Ç╪º╪¬┘É ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘É ╪º┘ä╪¬┘æ┘Ç╪º┘à┘æ┘Ç╪º╪¬┘É ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ╪┤┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘æ┘É ┘à╪º ╪«┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘é (╪½┘ä╪º╪½ ┘à╪▒╪º╪¬ ╪Ñ┘É╪░╪º ╪ú┘à╪│┘ë)
play_arrow
share
video_library
A`┼½dhu bikalim─üti-ll─ühit-t─ümm─üti min sharri m─ü khalaq.
I seek refuge in the Perfect Words of Allah from the evil of what He has created.(Recite three times in Arabic in the evening.)
Reference:
Whoever recites this three times in the evening will be protected from insect stings, Ahmad 2/ 290, An-Nasa'i, 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah no. 590, At-Tirmidhi 3/187, Ibn As-Sunni no. 68. According to Al-Albani, Ibn Majah's (2/266) chain of transmission is sound (Sahih), and following Ibn Baz 45, At-Tirmidhi's report is good (Hasan).
Hisnul Muslim 97
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪╡┘Ä┘ä┘æ┘É ┘ê┘Ä ╪│┘Ä┘ä┘æ┘É┘à┘Æ ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘ë ┘å┘Ä╪¿┘É┘è┘æ┘É┘å┘Ä╪º ┘à┘Å╪¡┘Ä┘à┘æ┘Ä╪»┘ì (╪╣╪┤╪▒ ┘à╪▒╪º╪¬)
play_arrow
share
video_library
All─ühumma ß╣úalli wa sallim `al─ü nabiyyin─ü Muß╕Ñammad.
O Allah, we ask for your peace and blessings upon our Prophet Muhammad.(Recite ten times in Arabic.)
Reference:
The Prophet (∩╖║) said: "Who recites blessings upon me ten times in the morning and ten times in the evening will obtain my intercession on the Day of Resurrection." At-Tabarani reported this Hadith together with two chains of transmission. One of them is reliable (Jayyid). See Haythami's Majma'uz-Zawa'id 10/120, and Al-Albani's Sahihut-Targhib wat-Tarhib 1/273.
Hisnul Muslim 98
Chapter 28: Before sleeping
12 du'as
┘è┘Ä╪¼┘Æ┘à┘Ä╪╣┘Å ┘â┘Ä┘ü┘æ┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘ç┘É ╪½┘Å┘à┘æ┘Ä ┘è┘Ä┘å┘Æ┘ü┘Å╪½┘Å ┘ü┘É┘è┘ç┘É┘à┘Ä╪º ┘ü┘Ä┘è┘Ä┘é┘Æ╪▒┘Ä╪ú┘Å ┘ü┘É┘è┘ç┘É┘à┘Ä╪º:
╪¿┘É╪│┘Æ┘à┘É ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘É ╪º┘ä╪▒┘æ┘Ä╪¡┘Æ┘à┘Ä┘å┘É ╪º┘ä╪▒┘æ┘Ä╪¡┘É┘è┘à┘É
{┘é┘Å┘ä┘Æ ┘ç┘Å┘ê┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪ú┘Ä╪¡┘Ä╪»┘î * ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä╪╡┘æ┘Ä┘à┘Ä╪»┘Å* ┘ä┘Ä┘à┘Æ ┘è┘Ä┘ä┘É╪»┘Æ ┘ê┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘à┘Æ ┘è┘Å┘ê┘ä┘Ä╪»┘Æ* ┘ê┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘à┘Æ ┘è┘Ä┘â┘Å┘å ┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘â┘Å┘ü┘Å┘ê╪º┘ï ╪ú┘Ä╪¡┘Ä╪»┘î}.
╪¿┘É╪│┘Æ┘à┘É ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘É ╪º┘ä╪▒┘æ┘Ä╪¡┘Æ┘à┘Ä┘å┘É ╪º┘ä╪▒┘æ┘Ä╪¡┘É┘è┘à┘É
{┘é┘Å┘ä┘Æ ╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Å┘ê╪░┘Å ╪¿┘É╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘É ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘ü┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘é┘É* ┘à┘É┘å ╪┤┘Ä╪▒┘æ┘É ┘à┘Ä╪º ╪«┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘é┘Ä* ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘É┘å ╪┤┘Ä╪▒┘æ┘É ╪║┘Ä╪º╪│┘É┘é┘ì ╪Ñ┘É╪░┘Ä╪º ┘ê┘Ä┘é┘Ä╪¿┘Ä* ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘É┘å ╪┤┘Ä╪▒┘æ┘É ╪º┘ä┘å┘æ┘Ä┘ü┘æ┘Ä╪º╪½┘Ä╪º╪¬┘É ┘ü┘É┘è ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪╣┘Å┘é┘Ä╪»┘É* ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘É┘å ╪┤┘Ä╪▒┘æ┘É ╪¡┘Ä╪º╪│┘É╪»┘ì ╪Ñ┘É╪░┘Ä╪º ╪¡┘Ä╪│┘Ä╪»┘Ä}.
╪¿┘É╪│┘Æ┘à┘É ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘É ╪º┘ä╪▒┘æ┘Ä╪¡┘Æ┘à┘Ä┘å┘É ╪º┘ä╪▒┘æ┘Ä╪¡┘É┘è┘à┘É
{┘é┘Å┘ä┘Æ ╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Å┘ê╪░┘Å ╪¿┘É╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘É ╪º┘ä┘å┘æ┘Ä╪º╪│┘É* ┘à┘Ä┘ä┘É┘â┘É ╪º┘ä┘å┘æ┘Ä╪º╪│┘É* ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘É ╪º┘ä┘å┘æ┘Ä╪º╪│┘É* ┘à┘É┘å ╪┤┘Ä╪▒┘æ┘É ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘ê┘Ä╪│┘Æ┘ê┘Ä╪º╪│┘É ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪«┘Ä┘å┘æ┘Ä╪º╪│┘É* ╪º┘ä┘æ┘Ä╪░┘É┘è ┘è┘Å┘ê┘Ä╪│┘Æ┘ê┘É╪│┘Å ┘ü┘É┘è ╪╡┘Å╪»┘Å┘ê╪▒┘É ╪º┘ä┘å┘æ┘Ä╪º╪│┘É* ┘à┘É┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¼┘É┘å┘æ┘Ä╪⌐┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘å┘æ┘Ä╪º╪│┘É}
╪½┘Å┘à┘æ┘Ä ┘è┘Ä┘à┘Æ╪│┘Ä╪¡┘Å ╪¿┘É┘ç┘É┘à┘Ä╪º ┘à┘Ä╪º ╪º╪│┘Æ╪¬┘Ä╪╖┘Ä╪º╪╣┘Ä ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ╪¼┘Ä╪│┘Ä╪»┘É┘ç┘É ┘è┘Ä╪¿┘Æ╪»┘Ä╪ú┘Å ╪¿┘É┘ç┘É┘à┘Ä╪º ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘ë ╪▒┘Ä╪ú┘Æ╪│┘É┘ç┘É ┘ê┘Ä┘ê┘Ä╪¼┘Æ┘ç┘É┘ç┘É ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘Ä╪º ╪ú┘Ä┘é╪¿┘Ä┘ä┘Ä ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ╪¼┘Ä╪│┘Ä╪»┘É┘ç┘É
(┘è┘ü╪╣┘ä┘Å ╪░┘ä┘â ╪½┘ä╪º╪½┘Ä ┘à╪▒┘æ┘Ä╪º╪¬┘ì)
play_arrow
share
video_library
Bismill─ühir-Raß╕Ñm─ünir-Raß╕Ñ─½m.
Qul huwall─ühu aß╕Ñad. All─ühuß╣ú-ß╣úamad. Lam yalid wa lam y┼½lad. Wa lam yakun lahu kufuwan aß╕Ñad. (Reference: Surah Al-Ikhlas)
Bismill─ühir-Raß╕Ñm─ünir-Raß╕Ñ─½m.
Qul a`┼½dhu birabbil-falaq. Min sharri m─ü khalaq. Wa min sharri gh─üsiqin idh─ü waqab. Wa min sharrin-naff─üth─üti fil-`uqad. Wa min sharri ß╕Ñ─üsidin idh─ü ß╕Ñasad. (Reference: Surah Al-Falaq).
Bismill─ühir-Raß╕Ñm─ünir-Raß╕Ñ─½m.
Qul a`┼½dhu birabbin-n─üs. Malikin-n─üs.'Il─ühin-n─üs. Min sharri ΓÇÿl-wasw─üsil-khann─üs. Alladh─½ yuwaswisu f─½ ß╣úud┼½rin-n─üs. Minal-jinnati wann─üs. (Reference: Surah An-Nas).
Hold the palms together, blow (with a little spittle) into them, and recite:
"With the Name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful.
Say: He is Allah (the) One. The Self-Sufficient Master, Whom all creatures need, He begets not nor was He begotten, and there is none equal to Him.
With the Name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful.
Say: I seek refuge with (Allah) the Lord of the daybreak, from the evil of what He has created, and from the evil of the darkening (night) as it comes with its darkness, and from the evil of those who practice witchcraft when they blow in the knots, and from the evil of the envier when he envies.
With the Name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful.
Say: I seek refuge with (Allah) the Lord of mankind, the King of mankind, the God of mankind, from the evil of the whisperer who withdraws, who whispers in the breasts of mankind, of jinns and men."
(Then pass your hands over as much of your body as you can reach, beginning with the head and the face, then the entire front of your body. Do this three times.)
Reference:
Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 9/62, and Muslim 4/ 1723.
Hisnul Muslim 99
((╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ä╪º┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ┘Ä ┘ç┘Å┘ê┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘è┘æ┘Å ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘é┘Ä┘è┘æ┘Å┘ê┘à┘Å ┘ä╪º┘Ä ╪¬┘Ä╪ú┘Æ╪«┘Å╪░┘Å┘ç┘Å ╪│┘É┘å┘Ä╪⌐┘î ┘ê┘Ä┘ä╪º┘Ä ┘å┘Ä┘ê┘Æ┘à┘î ┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘à┘Ä╪º ┘ü┘É┘è ╪º┘ä╪│┘æ┘Ä┘à┘Ä┘ê┘Ä╪º╪¬┘É ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘Ä╪º ┘ü┘É┘è ╪º┘ä╪ú┘Ä╪▒┘Æ╪╢┘É ┘à┘Ä┘å ╪░┘Ä╪º ╪º┘ä┘æ┘Ä╪░┘É┘è ┘è┘Ä╪┤┘Æ┘ü┘Ä╪╣┘Å ╪╣┘É┘å┘Æ╪»┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ┘Ä ╪¿┘É╪Ñ┘É╪░┘Æ┘å┘É┘ç┘É ┘è┘Ä╪╣┘Æ┘ä┘Ä┘à┘Å ┘à┘Ä╪º ╪¿┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘å┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä┘è┘Æ╪»┘É┘è┘ç┘É┘à┘Æ ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘Ä╪º ╪«┘Ä┘ä┘Æ┘ü┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘à┘Æ ┘ê┘Ä┘ä╪º┘Ä ┘è┘Å╪¡┘É┘è╪╖┘Å┘ê┘å┘Ä ╪¿┘É╪┤┘Ä┘è┘Æ╪í┘ì ┘à┘æ┘É┘å┘Æ ╪╣┘É┘ä┘Æ┘à┘É┘ç┘É ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ┘Ä ╪¿┘É┘à┘Ä╪º ╪┤┘Ä╪º╪í ┘ê┘Ä╪│┘É╪╣┘Ä ┘â┘Å╪▒┘Æ╪│┘É┘è┘æ┘Å┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä╪│┘æ┘Ä┘à┘Ä┘ê┘Ä╪º╪¬┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä╪ú┘Ä╪▒┘Æ╪╢┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä┘ä╪º┘Ä ┘è┘Ä╪ñ┘Å┘ê╪»┘Å┘ç┘Å ╪¡┘É┘ü┘Æ╪╕┘Å┘ç┘Å┘à┘Ä╪º ┘ê┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘ê┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘É┘è┘æ┘Å ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪╣┘Ä╪╕┘É┘è┘à┘Å))
play_arrow
share
video_library
All─ühu l─ü il─üha ill─ü huwa ΓÇÿl-ß╕ñayyul-Qayy┼½m. l─ü ta'khudhuhu sinatun wa l─ü nawm. lahu m─ü fis-sam─üw─üti wa m─üfil-ardh. man dhal-ladh─½ yashfa`u `indahu ill─ü bi'idhnih. ya`lamu m─ü bayna ayd─½him wa m─ü khalfahum. wa l─ü yuß╕Ñ─½t┼½na bishay'im-min `ilmihi ill─ü bim─ü sh─ü'. wasi`a kursiyyuhus-sam─üw─üti wal-ardh. wa l─ü ya'┼½duhu hifß║ôuhum─ü. wa huwal-`AliyyuΓÇÿl-`Aß║ô─½m.
Allah! There is none worthy of worship but He, the Ever-Living, the One Who sustains and protects all that exists. Neither slumber nor sleep overtakes Him. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. Who is he that can intercede with Him except with His Permission? He knows what happens to them in this world, and what will happen to them in the Hereafter. And they will never encompass anything of His Knowledge except that which He wills. His Throne extends over the heavens and the earth, and He feels no fatigue in guarding and preserving them. And He is the Most High, the Most Great.
Reference:
Surah Al-Baqarah 2:255. Whoever reads this when he lies down to sleep will have a guardian from Allah remain with him and Satan will not be able to come near him until he rises in the morning. See Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 4/487.
Hisnul Muslim 100
((╪í╪º┘à┘Ä┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪▒┘æ┘Ä╪│┘Å┘ê┘ä┘Å ╪¿┘É┘à┘Ä╪º ╪ú┘Å┘å╪▓┘É┘ä┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘ç┘É ┘à┘É┘å ╪▒┘æ┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘É┘ç┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Æ┘à┘Å╪ñ┘Æ┘à┘É┘å┘Å┘ê┘å┘Ä ┘â┘Å┘ä┘æ┘î ╪í╪º┘à┘Ä┘å┘Ä ╪¿┘É╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘É ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘Ä┘ä╪ó╪ª┘É┘â┘Ä╪¬┘É┘ç┘É ┘ê┘Ä┘â┘Å╪¬┘Å╪¿┘É┘ç┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪▒┘Å╪│┘Å┘ä┘É┘ç┘É ┘ä╪º┘Ä ┘å┘Å┘ü┘Ä╪▒┘æ┘É┘é┘Å ╪¿┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘å┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä╪¡┘Ä╪»┘ì ┘à┘æ┘É┘å ╪▒┘æ┘Å╪│┘Å┘ä┘É┘ç┘É ┘ê┘Ä┘é┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Å┘ê╪º┘Æ ╪│┘Ä┘à┘É╪╣┘Æ┘å┘Ä╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä╪╖┘Ä╪╣┘Æ┘å┘Ä╪º ╪║┘Å┘ü┘Æ╪▒┘Ä╪º┘å┘Ä┘â┘Ä ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Ä┘å┘Ä╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘à┘Ä╪╡┘É┘è╪▒┘Å {285} ┘ä╪º┘Ä ┘è┘Å┘â┘Ä┘ä┘æ┘É┘ü┘Å ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘Å ┘å┘Ä┘ü┘Æ╪│┘ï╪º ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ┘Ä ┘ê┘Å╪│┘Æ╪╣┘Ä┘ç┘Ä╪º ┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Ä╪º ┘à┘Ä╪º ┘â┘Ä╪│┘Ä╪¿┘Ä╪¬┘Æ ┘ê┘Ä╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘ç┘Ä╪º ┘à┘Ä╪º ╪º┘â┘Æ╪¬┘Ä╪│┘Ä╪¿┘Ä╪¬┘Æ ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Ä┘å┘Ä╪º ┘ä╪º┘Ä ╪¬┘Å╪ñ┘Ä╪º╪«┘É╪░┘Æ┘å┘Ä╪º ╪Ñ┘É┘å ┘å┘æ┘Ä╪│┘É┘è┘å┘Ä╪º ╪ú┘Ä┘ê┘Æ ╪ú┘Ä╪«┘Æ╪╖┘Ä╪ú┘Æ┘å┘Ä╪º ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Ä┘å┘Ä╪º ┘ê┘Ä┘ä╪º┘Ä ╪¬┘Ä╪¡┘Æ┘à┘É┘ä┘Æ ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘å┘Ä╪º ╪Ñ┘É╪╡┘Æ╪▒┘ï╪º ┘â┘Ä┘à┘Ä╪º ╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Ä┘ä┘Æ╪¬┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘ë ╪º┘ä┘æ┘Ä╪░┘É┘è┘å┘Ä ┘à┘É┘å ┘é┘Ä╪¿┘Æ┘ä┘É┘å┘Ä╪º ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Ä┘å┘Ä╪º ┘ê┘Ä┘ä╪º┘Ä ╪¬┘Å╪¡┘Ä┘à┘æ┘É┘ä┘Æ┘å┘Ä╪º ┘à┘Ä╪º ┘ä╪º┘Ä ╪╖┘Ä╪º┘é┘Ä╪⌐┘Ä ┘ä┘Ä┘å┘Ä╪º ╪¿┘É┘ç┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º╪╣┘Æ┘ü┘Å ╪╣┘Ä┘å┘æ┘Ä╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪º╪║┘Æ┘ü┘É╪▒┘Æ ┘ä┘Ä┘å┘Ä╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪º╪▒┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ┘å┘Ä╪ó ╪ú┘Ä┘å╪¬┘Ä ┘à┘Ä┘ê┘Æ┘ä╪º┘Ä┘å┘Ä╪º ┘ü┘Ä╪º┘å╪╡┘Å╪▒┘Æ┘å┘Ä╪º ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘ë ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘é┘Ä┘ê┘Æ┘à┘É ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘â┘Ä╪º┘ü┘É╪▒┘É┘è┘å┘Ä {286}))

─Çmanar-Ras┼½lu bim─ü unzila ilaihi mir-Rabbihi wa ΓÇÿl-mu'min┼½n. kullun ─ümana bill─ühi wa mal─ü'ikatihi wa kutubihi wa rusulih. l─ü nufarriqu bayna aß╕Ñadim-mir-rusulih. wa q─ül┼½ sami`n─ü wa aß╣¡a`n─ü. ghufr─ünaka Rabban─ü wa ilayka ΓÇÿl-maß╣ú─½r. L─ü yukallifu ΓÇÿll─ühu nafsan ill─ü wus`ah─ü. lah─ü m─ü kasabat wa `alayh─ü mak-tasabat. Rabban─ü l─ü tu'─ükhidhn─ü in nas─½n─ü aw akhta'n─ü. Rabban─ü wa l─ü taß╕Ñmil `alayn─ü iß╣úran kam─ü ß╕Ñamaltahu `alal-ladh─½na min qablin─ü. Rabban─ü wa l─ü tuß╕Ñammiln─ü m─ü l─ü ß╣¡─üqata lan─ü bih. wa`fu `ann─ü, waghfir lan─ü, warß╕Ñamn─ü. Anta mawl─ün─ü fanß╣úurn─ü `ala ΓÇÿl-qawmi ΓÇÿl-k─üfir─½n.
The Messenger believes in what has been sent down to him from his Lord, and so do the believers. Each one believes in Allah, His Angels, His Books, and His Messengers. They say: "We make no distinction between any of His Messengers, "and they say: "We hear, and we obey.(We seek) Your Forgiveness, our Lord, and to You is the return. "Allah burdens not a person beyond what he can bear. He gets rewarded for that (good) which he has earned, and he is punished for that (evil) which he has earned. Our Lord! Punish us not if we forget or fall into error. Our Lord! Lay not on us a burden like that which You did lay on those before us. Our Lord! Put not on us a burden greater than we have the strength to bear. Pardon us and grant us forgiveness. Have mercy on us. You are our Protector, and help us against the disbelieving people.
Reference:
Surah Al-Baqarah 2:285-6. These two Verses will be sufficient for anyone who recites them at night before sleeping. Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari.9/94, Muslim 1/554.
Hisnul Muslim 101
╪¿┘É╪º╪│┘Æ┘à┘É┘â┘Ä ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘É┘è ┘ê┘Ä╪╢┘Ä╪╣┘Æ╪¬┘Å ╪¼┘Ä┘å┘Æ╪¿┘É┘è ┘ê┘Ä╪¿┘É┘â┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä╪▒┘Æ┘ü┘Ä╪╣┘Å┘ç┘Å ┘ü┘Ä╪Ñ┘É┘å ╪ú┘Ä┘à┘Æ╪│┘Ä┘â┘Æ╪¬┘Ä ┘å┘Ä┘ü┘Æ╪│┘É┘è ┘ü╪º╪▒┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ┘ç┘Ä╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪Ñ┘É┘å┘Æ ╪ú┘Ä╪▒┘Æ╪│┘Ä┘ä┘Æ╪¬┘Ä┘ç┘Ä╪º ┘ü┘Ä╪º╪¡┘Æ┘ü┘Ä╪╕┘Æ┘ç┘Ä╪º ╪¿┘É┘à┘Ä╪º ╪¬┘Ä╪¡┘Æ┘ü┘Ä╪╕┘Å ╪¿┘É┘ç┘É ╪╣┘É╪¿┘Ä╪º╪»┘Ä┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪╡┘Ä┘æ╪º┘ä┘É╪¡┘É┘è┘å┘Ä

Bismika Rabb─½ waß╕ìa`tu janb─½. wa bika arfa`uh. fa in amsakta nafs─½ farß╕Ñamh─ü. wa in arsaltah─ü faß╕Ñfaß║ôh─übim─ü taß╕Ñfaß║ôu bihi `ib─üdakaß╣ú-ß╣ú─üliß╕Ñ─½n.
With Your Name1 my Lord, I lay myself down; and with Your Name I rise. And if You take my soul, have mercy on it, and if You send it back then protect it as You protect Your righteous slaves. 2
Reference:
1 "If any of you rises from his bed and later returns to it, let him dust off his bed with his waist garment three times and mention the Name of Allah, for he does not know what may have entered the bed after him, and when he lies down he should say. . . ". 2 Al-Bukhari 1 1/ 126 and Muslim 4/2084.
Hisnul Muslim 102
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘Ä┘â┘Ä ╪«┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘é┘Æ╪¬┘Ä ┘å┘Ä┘ü┘Æ╪│┘É┘è ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ╪¬┘Ä ╪¬┘Ä┘ê┘Ä┘ü┘æ┘Ä╪º┘ç┘Ä╪º ┘ä┘Ä┘â┘Ä ┘à┘Ä┘à┘Ä╪º╪¬┘Å┘ç┘Ä╪º ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘Ä╪¡┘Æ┘è╪º┘ç┘Ä╪º ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘Æ ╪ú┘Ä╪¡┘Æ┘è┘Ä┘è┘Æ╪¬┘Ä┘ç┘Ä╪º ┘ü┘Ä╪º╪¡┘Æ┘ü┘Ä╪╕┘Æ┘ç┘Ä╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪Ñ┘É┘å┘Æ ╪ú┘Ä┘à┘Ä╪¬┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Ä╪º ┘ü┘Ä╪º╪║┘Æ┘ü┘É╪▒┘Æ ┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Ä╪º. ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘É┘è ╪ú┘Ä╪│┘Æ╪ú┘Ä┘ä┘Å┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪╣┘Ä╪º┘ü┘É┘è┘Ä╪⌐┘Ä

All─ühumma innaka khalaqta nafs─½wa anta tawaff─üh─ü. laka mam─ütuh─ü wa maß╕Ñy─üh─ü. in aß╕Ñyaytah─ü faß╕Ñfaß║ôh─ü. wa in amattah─ü faghfir lah─ü. All─ühumma inn─½ as'aluka ΓÇÿl-`─üfiyah.
O Allah, You have created my soul and You take it back. Unto You is its death and its life. If You give it life then protect it, and if You cause it to die then forgive it. O Allah, I ask You for strength.
Reference:
Muslim 4/2083 and Ahmad 2/79.

All─ühumma qin─½ `adh─übaka yawma tab`athu `ib─üdak.
O Allah, 1 save me from Your punishment on the Day that You resurrect Your slaves. 2
Reference:
1 "When the Prophet (∩╖║) wanted to lie down to sleep, he used to place his right hand under his cheek and say..." 2 Abu Dawud 4/311. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/143.
Hisnul Muslim 104
╪¿┘É╪º╪│┘Æ┘Ç┘à┘É┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä┘à┘Ç┘ê╪¬┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä╪¡┘Æ┘Ç┘è╪º
play_arrow
share
video_library
Bismika All─ühumma am┼½tu wa aß╕Ñy─ü.
In Your Name, O Allah, I die and I live.
Reference:
Here, dying and living are metaphors for sleep and wakefulness. This explains why the normal order of these words has been reversed in this Hadith. In other contexts the living is mentioned before dying. See Qur'an Al-Baqarah 2:258, Aal-'Imrdn 3:156, Al-A'raf 7:158 among many other examples, (trans.). See also Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 11/113, Muslim 4/ 2083.
Hisnul Muslim 105
╪│┘Å╪¿┘Æ╪¡┘Ä╪º┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘É (╪½┘ä╪º╪½╪º┘ï ┘ê╪½┘ä╪º╪½┘è┘å) ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ╪»┘Å ┘ä┘É┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘É (╪½┘ä╪º╪½╪º┘ï ┘ê╪½┘ä╪º╪½┘è┘å) ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪ú┘Ä┘â┘Æ╪¿┘Ä╪▒┘Å (╪ú╪▒╪¿╪╣╪º┘ï ┘ê╪½┘ä╪º╪½┘è┘å┘Ä)

Subß╕Ñ─ünall─üh. Wa ΓÇÿl-ß╕Ñamdu lill─üh. Wall─ühu Akbar.
Glory is to Allah (thirty-three times in Arabic), Praise is to Allah (thirty-three times), Allah is the Most Great (thirty-four times)
Reference:
Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 7/71, Muslim 4/2091.
Hisnul Muslim 106
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪│┘æ┘à┘Ç┘ê╪º╪¬┘É ╪º┘ä╪│┘æ┘Ä╪¿┘Æ┘Ç╪╣┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪╣┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘Æ╪┤┘É ╪º┘ä╪╣┘Ä╪╕┘Ç┘è┘à ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Ä┘å┘Ç╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Ä ┘â┘Å┘Ç┘ä┘æ┘É ╪┤┘Ä┘Ç┘è╪í ┘ü╪º┘ä┘É┘Ç┘é┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪¡┘Ä┘Ç╪¿┘æ┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘å┘æ┘Ä┘Ç┘ê┘ë ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘Å┘Ç┘å┘Ä╪▓┘æ┘É┘ä┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪¬┘æ┘Ä┘Ç┘ê┘Æ╪▒╪º╪⌐┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä╪Ñ┘å┘Æ╪¼┘Ç┘è┘ä ┘ê╪º┘ä┘ü┘Å┘Ç╪▒┘Æ┘é╪º┘å ╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Ç┘ê╪░┘Å ╪¿┘É┘Ç┘â┘Ä ┘à┘É┘å ╪┤┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘æ┘É ┘â┘Å┘Ç┘ä┘æ┘É ╪┤┘Ä┘Ç┘è╪í┘ì ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ┘Ç╪¬┘Ä ╪ó╪«┘É┘Ç╪░┘î ╪¿┘É┘å┘Ç╪º╪╡┘É┘Ç┘è┘Ä╪¬┘É┘ç ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ┘Ç╪¬┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪ú┘ê┘æ┘Ä┘ä┘Å ┘ü┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘è╪│┘Ä ┘é┘Ä╪¿┘Æ┘Ç┘ä┘Ä┘â┘Ä ╪┤┘Ä┘è╪í ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ┘Ç╪¬┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪ó╪«┘É┘Ç╪▒┘Å ┘ü┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘è╪│┘Ä ╪¿┘Ä╪╣┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘Ä┘â┘Ä ╪┤┘Ä┘è╪í ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ┘Ç╪¬┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪╕┘æ┘Ç╪º┘ç┘É┘Ç╪▒┘Å ┘ü┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ╪│┘Ä ┘ü┘Ä┘Ç┘ê┘Æ┘é┘Ä┘Ç┘â┘Ä ╪┤┘Ä┘è╪í ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ┘Ç╪¬┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¿┘Ç╪º╪╖┘É┘Ç┘å┘Å ┘ü┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ╪│┘Ä ╪»┘ê┘å┘Ä┘Ç┘â┘Ä ╪┤┘Ä┘è╪í ╪º┘é┘Ç┘Æ╪╢┘É ╪╣┘Ä┘å┘æ┘Ç╪º ╪º┘ä┘Ç╪»┘æ┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘Ç┘å┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä╪║┘Æ┘Ç┘å┘É┘å┘Ç╪º ┘à┘É┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ü┘Ä┘Ç┘é┘Æ╪▒

All─ühumma Rabbas-sam─üw─ütis-sab`iwa Rabba ΓÇÿl-`Arshi ΓÇÿl-`Aß║ô─½m. Rabban─ü wa Rabba kulli shay'. f─üliqa ΓÇÿl-ß╕Ñabbi wan-naw─ü. wa munzilat-Tawr─üti wal-'Inj─½li, wal-Furq─ün. a`┼½dhu bika min sharri kulli shay'inanta ─ükhidhun bin─üß╣úiyatih. All─ühumma anta ΓÇÿl-awwalu falaysa qablaka shay'. wa antal-─ükhiru falaysa ba`daka shay'. wa antaß║ô-ß║ô─ühiru falaysa fawqaka shay'. wa antal-b─üß╣¡inu falaysa d┼½naka shay'. iqß╕ìi `annad-dayn. wa aghnin─ü mina ΓÇÿl-faqr.
O Allah! Lord of the seven heavens and Lord of the Magnificent Throne. Our Lord and the Lord of everything. Splitter of the grain and the date-stone, Revealer of the Torah and the Injeel1 and the Furqan (the Qur'an), I seek refuge in You from the evil of everything that You shall seize by the forelock.2 O Allah You are the First and nothing has come before you, and You are the Last, and nothing may come after You. You are the Most High, nothing is above You and You are the Most Near, and nothing is nearer than You. Remove our debts from usand enrich us against poverty. 3
Reference:
1 The Scripture that was revealed to 'Isa (Jesus). 2 See Qur'an Al-'Alaq 96:15, where seizure by the forelock preceeds being cast into Hell. (Translator) 3 Muslim 4/2084.
Hisnul Muslim 107
╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ╪»┘Å ┘ä┘É┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘É ╪º┘ä┘æ┘Ä╪░┘É┘è ╪ú┘Ä╪╖┘Æ╪╣┘Ä┘à┘Ä┘å┘Ä╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪│┘Ä┘é┘Ä╪º┘å┘Ä╪º ┘ê┘Ä┘â┘Ä┘ü┘Ä╪º┘å┘Ä╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪ó┘ê┘Ä╪º┘å┘Ä╪º ┘ü┘Ä┘â┘Ä┘à┘Æ ┘à┘É┘à┘æ┘Ä┘å┘Æ ┘ä╪º┘Ä ┘â┘Ä╪º┘ü┘É┘è┘Ä ┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä┘ä╪º┘Ä ┘à┘Å╪ñ┘Æ┘ê┘É┘è┘Ä

share
video_library
Alß╕Ñamdu lill─ühil-lath─½ 'aß╣¡`aman─ü wa saq─ün─ü. wa kaf─ün─ü, wa '─üw─ün─ü. fakam mimman l─ü k─üfiya lahu wa l─ü mu'w─½.
Praise is to Allah Who has provided us with food and with drink, sufficed us and gave us an abode, for how many are there with no provision and no home.
Reference:
Muslim 4/2085.
Hisnul Muslim 108
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪╣╪º┘ä┘É┘Ç┘à┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪║┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ╪¿┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä╪┤┘æ┘Ç┘ç╪º╪»┘Ä╪⌐┘É ┘ü╪º╪╖┘É┘Ç╪▒┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪│┘æ┘à╪º┘ê╪º╪¬┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä╪ú╪▒┘Æ╪╢┘É ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Ä ┘â┘Ç┘ä┘æ┘É ╪┤┘Ä┘Ç┘è╪í┘ì ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘Ä┘ä┘è┘Ç┘â┘Ä┘ç ╪ú┘Ä╪┤┘Æ┘ç┘Ä┘Ç╪»┘Å ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ ┘ä╪º ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ç┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ╪¬ ╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Ç┘ê╪░┘Å ╪¿┘É┘â┘Ä ┘à┘É┘å ╪┤┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘æ┘É ┘å┘Ä┘ü┘Æ╪│┘Ç┘è ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘É┘å ╪┤┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘æ┘É ╪º┘ä╪┤┘æ┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘Ç╪╖╪º┘å┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪┤┘É┘Ç╪▒┘Æ┘â┘É┘ç ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ ╪ú┘Ä┘é┘Æ╪¬┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘É┘ü┘Ä ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ç┘ë ┘å┘Ä┘ü┘Æ╪│┘Ç┘è ╪│┘ê╪í╪º┘ï ╪ú┘Ä┘ê┘Æ ╪ú┘Ä╪¼┘Å┘Ç╪▒┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ç┘ë ┘à┘Å╪│┘Æ┘Ç┘ä┘É┘à
play_arrow
share
video_library
All─ühumma `─ülima ΓÇÿl-ghaybi wash-shah─üdah. f─ütiras-sam─üw─üti wa ΓÇÿl-ardh. Rabba kulli shay'in wa mal─½kah. ash-hadu an l─ü il─üha ill─ü ant. a`┼½dhu bika min sharri nafs─½. wa min sharrish-shayß╣¡─üni wa shirkih. wa an aqtarifa `al─ü nafs─½ s┼½'an. aw ajurrahu il─ü Muslim.
O Allah, Knower of the unseen and the evident, Maker of the heavens and the earth, Lord of everything and its Master, I bear witness that there is none worthy of worship but You. I seek refuge in You from the evil of my soul, and from the evil of Satan and his helpers. (I seek refuge in You) from bringing evil upon my soul and from harming any Muslim.
Reference:
Abu Dawud 4/317. See also Al-Albani, SahihAt-Tirmidhi 3/142.
Hisnul Muslim 109
recommendation
Recite Surah 32 (As-Sajdah) and Surah 67 (Al-Mulk) in Arabic.

Hisnul Muslim 110

video_library
All─ühumma aslamtu nafs─½ ilayk. wa fawwaß╕ìtu amr─½ ilayk. wa wajjahtu wajh─½ ilayk. wa alja'tu ß║ôahr─½ ilayk. raghbatan wa rahbatan ilayk. l─ü malja'a wa la manj─ü minka ill─ü ilayk,─ümantu bikit─übika ΓÇÿl-ladh─½ anzalt. wa bi-nabiyyika ΓÇÿl-ladh─½ arsalt.
O Allah,1 I submit myself to You, entrust my affairs to You, turn my face to You, and lay myself down depending upon You, hoping in You and fearing You. There is no refuge, and no escape, except to You. I believe in Your Book (the Qur'an) that You revealed, and the Prophet whom You sent.
Reference:
1 "Before you go to bed perform ablutions as you would for prayer, then lie down on your right side and say. . . " The Prophet (∩╖║) said: "Whoever says this and dies in his sleep, has died in a state of the natural monotheism (Fitrah)." Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 11/113, Muslim 4/2081.
Hisnul Muslim 111
Chapter 29: When tossing and turning during the night
1 du'a
┘ä╪º ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ç┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä┘Ç┘ê╪º╪¡┘É╪»┘Å ╪º┘ä┘é┘Ä┘ç┘æ┘Ç╪º╪▒ ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Å ╪º┘ä╪│┘æ┘Ä┘Ç┘à┘ê╪º╪¬┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä╪ú╪▒┘Æ╪╢┘É ┘ê┘Ä┘à╪º ╪¿┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘Ç┘å┘Ä┘ç┘Ç┘à╪º ╪º┘ä╪╣┘Ä╪▓┘è┘Ç╪▓┘Å ╪º┘ä╪║┘Ä┘Ç┘ü┘æ╪º╪▒

video_library
L─ü il─üha illall─ühal-W─üß╕Ñidul-Qahh─ür. Rabbus-sam─üw─üti wa ΓÇÿl-arß╕ìi wa m─ü baynahumaal-`Az─½zul-Ghaff─ür.
There is none worthy of worship but Allah, the One, the Victorious, Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, the All-Mighty, the All-Forgiving.
Reference:
This is to be said if you turn over in bed during the night. Al-Hakim graded it authentic and Ath-Thahabi agreed 1/540. Also see An-Nasa'i, 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah, and Ibn As-Sunni. See also Al-Albani, Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 4/ 213.

A`┼½dhu bikalim─üti ΓÇÿll─ühit-t─ümm─ütimin ghaß╕ìabihi wa `iq─übihi wa sharri `ib─üdih. wa min hamaz─ütish-shay─üß╣¡─½ni wa an yaß╕Ñß╕ìur┼½n.

Hisnul Muslim 113
Chapter 31: Upon seeing a good dream or a bad dream
recommendation
Spit to your left (three times).1
Seek refuge in Allah from the Devil and from the evil of what you have seen (three times).2
Do not speak about it to anyone.3
Turn over on your other side.4
┘è┘Ä┘å┘Æ┘ü┘Å╪½┘Å ╪╣┘Ä┘å┘Æ ┘è┘Ä╪│┘Ä╪º╪▒┘É┘ç┘É (╪½┘ä╪º╪½╪º┘ï). ┘è┘Ä╪│┘Æ╪¬┘Ä╪╣┘É┘è╪░┘Å ╪¿┘É╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘É ┘à┘É┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪┤┘æ┘Ä┘è╪╖┘Ä╪º┘å┘É ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ╪┤┘Ä╪▒┘æ┘É ┘à┘Ä╪º ╪▒┘Ä╪ú┘Ä┘ë (╪½┘Ä┘ä╪º┘Ä╪½┘Ä ┘à┘Ä╪▒┘æ┘Ä╪º╪¬┘ì). ┘ä╪º┘Ä ┘è┘Å╪¡┘Ä╪»┘æ┘É╪½┘Æ ╪¿┘É┘ç┘Ä╪º ╪ú┘Ä╪¡┘Ä╪»╪º┘ï. ┘è┘Ä┘Ç┘Ç╪¬┘Ä╪¡┘Ä┘ê┘æ┘Ä┘ä┘Å ╪╣┘Ä┘å┘Æ ╪¼┘Ä┘å┘Æ╪¿┘É┘ç┘É ╪º┘ä┘æ┘Ä╪░┘É┘è ┘â┘Ä╪º┘å┘Ä ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘ç┘É.

1. Muslim 4/1 772. 2. Muslim 4/1 772, 3. 3. Muslim 4/1772. 4. Muslim 4/1773.

Hisnul Muslim 115
Chapter 32: Qunoot Al-Witr
3 du'as
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪º┘ç┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘É┘å┘Ç┘è ┘ü┘Ç┘è┘à┘Ä┘å┘Æ ┘ç┘Ä┘Ç╪»┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘Ç╪¬ ┘ê┘Ä╪╣┘Ç╪º┘ü┘É┘å┘Ç┘è ┘ü┘Ç┘è┘à┘Ä┘å┘Æ ╪╣╪º┘ü┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ╪¬ ┘ê┘Ä╪¬┘Ä┘ê┘Ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘Ç┘å┘è ┘ü┘Ç┘è┘à┘Ä┘å┘Æ ╪¬┘Ä┘ê┘Ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ╪¬ ┘ê┘Ä╪¿╪º╪▒┘É┘â┘Æ ┘ä┘Ç┘è ┘ü┘Ç┘è┘à╪º ╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Æ╪╖┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ╪¬ ┘ê┘Ä┘é┘É┘Ç┘å┘è ╪┤┘Ä╪▒┘æ┘Ä ┘à╪º ┘é┘Ä╪╢┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ╪¬ ┘ü┘Ä╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘Ä┘Ç┘â┘Ä ╪¬┘Ä┘é┘Æ┘Ç╪╢┘è ┘ê┘Ä┘ä╪º ┘è┘Å┘é┘Æ┘Ç╪╢┘ë ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ┘â ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘Ä┘Ç┘ç┘Å ┘ä╪º ┘è┘Ä┘Ç╪░┘É┘ä┘æ┘Å ┘à┘Ä┘å┘Æ ┘ê╪º┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ╪¬ [ ┘ê┘Ä┘ä╪º ┘è┘Ä╪╣┘É┘Ç╪▓┘æ┘Å ┘à┘Ä┘å ╪╣┘Ç╪º╪»┘Ä┘è┘Æ╪¬ ] ╪¬┘Ä╪¿┘Ç╪º╪▒┘Ä┘â┘Æ┘Ç╪¬┘Ä ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Ä┘Ç┘å╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪¬┘Ä╪╣┘Ç╪º┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ╪¬
play_arrow
share
video_library
All─ühummaΓÇÖhdin─½ f─½ man hadayt. wa `─üfin─½ f─½ man `─üfayt. wa tawallan─½ f─½ man tawallayt. wa b─ürik l─½ f─½ m─ü a`atayt. wa qin─½ sharra m─ü qaß╕ìayt. fa innaka taqß╕ì─½ wa l─ü yuqß╕ì─ü `alayk. innahu l─ü yadhillu man w─ülayt,[wa l─ü ya`izzu man `─üdayt] . tab─ürakta Rabban─ü wa ta`─ülayt.
O Allah, guide me with those whom You have guided, and strengthen me with those whom You have given strength. Take me to Your care with those whom You have taken to Your care. Bless me in what You have given me. Protect me from the evil You have ordained. Surely, You command and are not commanded, and none whom You have committed to Your care shall be humiliated[and none whom You have taken as an enemy shall taste glory]. You are Blessed, Our Lord, and Exalted.
Reference:
Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah, An-Nasa'i, At-Tirmidhi, Ahmad, Ad-Darimi, Al-Hakim, and Al-Bayhaqi. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 1/144, Sahih Ibn Majah 1/194, and 'Irwa'ul-GhaW. 2/ 172.
Hisnul Muslim 116
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘É┘Ç┘è ╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Ç┘ê╪░┘Å ╪¿┘É╪▒┘É╪╢┘Ç╪º┘â┘Ä ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ╪│┘Ä╪«┘Ä╪╖┘É┘Ç┘â ┘ê┘Ä╪¿┘É┘à┘Å╪╣┘Ç╪º┘ü╪º╪¬┘É┘Ç┘â┘Ä ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ╪╣┘Å┘é┘ê╪¿┘Ä┘Ç╪¬┘É┘â ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Ç┘ê╪░┘Å ╪¿┘É┘â┘Ä ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ┘Ç┘â ┘ä╪º ╪ú┘Å╪¡┘Æ╪╡┘Ç┘è ╪½┘Ä┘å┘Ç╪º╪í┘ï ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ┘â ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ┘Ç╪¬┘Ä ┘â┘Ä┘à┘Ç╪º ╪ú┘Ä╪½┘Æ┘å┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ╪¬┘Ä ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ç┘ë ┘å┘Ä┘ü┘Æ╪│┘Ç┘É┘â
play_arrow
share
video_library
All─ühumma inn─½ a`┼½dhu biriß╕ì─üka min sakhaß╣¡ik. wa bimu`─üf─ütika min `uq┼½batik. wa a`┼½dhu bika mink. l─ü uß╕Ñß╣ú─½ than─ü'an `alayk. Anta kam─ü athnayta `al─ü nafsik.
O Allah, I seek refuge with Your Pleasure from Your anger. I seek refuge in Your forgiveness from Your punishment. I seek refuge in You from You. I cannot count Your praises, You are as You have praised Yourself.
Reference:
Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah, An-Nasa'i, At-Tirmidhi, Ahmad. See Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/180, Sahih Ibn Majah 1/194, and 'Irwa'ul-Ghalil. 2/ 175.
Hisnul Muslim 117
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘è┘æ┘Ç╪º┘â┘Ä ┘å╪╣┘Æ┘Ç╪¿┘Å╪»┘Æ ┘ê┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘â┘Ä ┘å┘Å╪╡┘Ä┘ä┘æ┘Ç┘è ┘ê┘Ä┘å┘Ä╪│┘Æ┘Ç╪¼┘Å╪» ┘ê┘Ä╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ┘â┘Ä ┘å┘Ä╪│┘Æ┘Ç╪╣┘ë ┘ê┘Ä┘å┘Ä╪¡┘Æ┘Ç┘ü┘É╪» ┘å┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘Æ╪¼┘ê ╪▒┘Ä╪¡┘Æ┘à┘Ä┘Ç╪¬┘Ä┘â ┘ê┘Ä┘å┘Ä╪«┘Æ╪┤┘Ç┘ë ╪╣┘Ä┘Ç╪░╪º╪¿┘Ä┘â ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘Ä ╪╣┘Ä┘Ç╪░╪º╪¿┘Ä┘â┘Ä ╪¿╪º┘ä┘â┘Ç╪º┘ü╪▒┘è┘å ┘à┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘Ç┘é. ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ╪º ┘å┘Ä╪│┘Æ╪¬┘Ä╪╣┘Ç┘è┘å┘Å┘â┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä┘å┘Ä╪│┘Æ╪¬┘Ä┘Ç╪║┘Æ┘ü┘É╪▒┘Å┘â ┘ê┘Ä┘å┘Å╪½┘Æ┘Ç┘å┘Ç┘è ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ┘â ╪º┘ä╪«┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ╪▒┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä┘ä╪º ┘å┘Ä┘â┘Æ┘Ç┘ü┘Å╪▒┘Å┘â ┘ê┘Ä┘å┘Å┘Ç╪ñ┘Æ┘à┘É┘å┘Å ╪¿┘É┘â ┘ê┘Ä┘å┘Ä╪«┘Æ┘Ç╪╢┘Ä╪╣┘Å ┘ä┘Ä┘â┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä┘å┘Ä╪«┘Æ┘Ç┘ä┘Ä╪╣┘Å ┘à┘Ä┘å┘Æ ┘è┘Ä┘â┘Æ┘Ç┘ü╪▒┘Å┘â
play_arrow
share
video_library
All─ühumma iyy─üka na`bud. wa laka nuß╣úall─½ wa nasjud. wa ilayka nas`─ü wa naß╕Ñfid. narj┼½ raß╕Ñmatak. wa nakhsh─ü `adh─übak. inna `adh─übaka bilk─üfir─½na mulß╕Ñaq. All─ühumma inn─ü nasta`─½nuk. wa nastaghfiruk. wa nuthn─½ `alaykal-khayr. wa l─ü nakfuruk. wa nu'minu bik. wa nakhß╕ìa`u lak. wa nakhla`u man yakfuruk.
O Allah, You alone do we worship, and to You we pray and bow down prostrate. To You we hasten to worship and to serve. Our hope is for Your mercy, and we fear Your punishment. Surely, Your punishment of the disbelievers is at hand. O Allah, we seek Your help and Your forgiveness, and we praise You beneficently. We do not deny You and we believe in You. We surrender to You and renounce whoever disbelieves in You.
Reference:
Al-Bayhaqi graded its chain authentic in As-Sunan Al-Kubra. Al-Albani said in 'Irwa'ul-GhaliL 2/170 that its chain is authentic as a statement of 'Umar.
Hisnul Muslim 118
Chapter 33: Immediately after salam of the witr prayer
1 du'a
'╪│╪¿╪¡╪º┘å ╪º┘ä┘à┘ä┘â ╪º┘ä┘é╪»┘ê╪│' ╪½┘ä╪º╪½ ┘à╪▒╪º╪¬ ┘ê╪º┘ä╪½╪º┘ä╪½╪⌐ ┘è╪¼┘ç╪▒ ╪¿┘ç╪º ┘ê┘è┘à╪» ╪¿┘ç╪º ╪╡┘ê╪¬┘ç '╪▒╪¿┘æ┘É ╪º┘ä┘à┘ä╪º╪ª┘â╪⌐┘É ┘ê╪º┘ä╪▒┘æ┘ê╪¡'
play_arrow
share
video_library
Subß╕Ñ─üna ΓÇÿl-Maliki ΓÇÿl-Qudd┼½s. [Recite three times, and raise and extend the voice on the third time and say...] Rabbi ΓÇÿl-Mal─ü'ikati war-r┼½h.
Glory is to the King, the Holy.[Recite three times in Arabic, and raise and extend the voice on the third time and say...] Lord of the angels and the Spirit.
Reference:
An-Nasa'i 3/244, Ad-Daraqutni and others. The final addition is from Ad-Daraqutni's version 2/ 31 and its chain of narration is authentic. See the checking of Zadul-Ma'ad by Shu'aib Al-Arna'ut and 'Abdul-Qadir Al-Arna'ut 1/337.
Hisnul Muslim 119
Chapter 34: For anxiety and sorrow
2 du'as
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘É┘è ╪╣┘Ä╪¿┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘Å┘â┘Ä ╪º╪¿┘Æ┘å┘Å ╪╣┘Ä╪¿┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘É┘â┘Ä ╪º╪¿┘Æ┘å┘Å ╪ú┘Ä┘à┘Ä╪¬┘É┘Ç┘â┘Ä ┘å┘Ä╪º╪╡┘É┘è┘Ä╪¬┘É┘è ╪¿┘É┘è┘Ä┘Ç╪»┘É┘â┘Ä ┘à┘Ä╪º╪╢┘ì ┘ü┘É┘è┘æ┘Ä ╪¡┘Å┘â┘Æ┘à┘Å┘â┘Ä ╪╣┘Ä╪»┘Æ┘ä┘î ┘ü┘É┘è┘æ┘Ä ┘é┘Ä╪╢┘Ä╪º╪ñ┘â┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä╪│┘Æ╪ú┘Ä┘ä┘Å┘Ç┘â┘Ä ╪¿┘É┘â┘Å┘ä┘æ┘É ╪º╪│┘Æ┘à┘ì ┘ç┘Å┘ê┘Ä ┘ä┘Ä┘â┘Ä ╪│┘Ä┘à┘æ┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ╪¬┘Ä ╪¿┘É┘ç┘É ┘å┘Ä┘ü┘Æ╪│┘Ä┘â┘Ä ╪ú┘É┘ê┘Æ ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ╪▓┘Ä┘ä┘Æ╪¬┘Ä┘Ç┘ç┘Å ┘ü┘É┘è ┘â┘É╪¬┘Ä╪º╪¿┘É┘â┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä┘ê┘Æ ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘à┘Æ┘Ç╪¬┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪ú┘Ä╪¡┘Ä╪»╪º┘ï ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ╪«┘Ä┘ä┘Æ┘é┘É┘Ç┘â┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä┘ê┘É ╪º╪│┘Æ╪¬┘Ä┘Ç╪ú┘Æ╪½┘Ä╪▒┘Æ╪¬┘Ä ╪¿┘É┘ç┘É ┘ü┘É┘è ╪╣┘É┘ä┘Æ┘à┘É ╪º┘ä╪║┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘Ç╪¿┘É ╪╣┘É┘å┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘Ä┘â┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ ╪¬┘Ä╪¼┘Æ┘Ç╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘é┘Å╪▒┘Æ╪ó┘å┘Ä ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘É┘è┘Ç╪╣┘Ä ┘é┘Ä┘ä┘Æ╪¿┘É┘Ç┘è ┘ê┘Ä┘å┘ê╪▒┘Ä ╪╡┘Ä┘Ç╪»┘Æ╪▒┘É┘è ┘ê╪¼┘Ä┘ä┘Ä╪º╪í┘Ä ╪¡┘Å┘Ç╪▓┘Æ┘å┘É┘è ┘ê╪░┘Ä┘ç┘Ä╪º╪¿┘Ä ┘ç┘Ä┘à┘æ┘É┘Ç┘è
play_arrow
share
video_library
All─ühumma inn─½ `abduk. ibnu `abdik. ibnu amatik. n─üsiyat─½ biyadik. m─üß╕ìin fiyya ß╕Ñukmuk,`adlun fiyya qaß╕ì─ü'uk. as'aluka bikullisΓÇÖmin huwa lak. sammayta bihi nafsak. aw anzaltahu f─½ kit─übik. aw `allamtahu aß╕Ñadan min khalqik. awΓÇÿista'tharta bihi f─½ `ilmil-ghaybi `indak. an taj`ala ΓÇÿl-Qur'─üna rab─½`a qalb─½. wa n┼½ra ß╣úadr─½. wa jal─ü'a ß╕Ñuzn─½. wa dhah─üba hamm─½.
O Allah, I am Your slave, and the son of Your male slave, and the son of your female slave. My forehead is in Your Hand (i. e. you have control over me). Your Judgment upon me is assured, and Your Decree concerning me is just. I ask You by every Name that You have named Yourself with, revealed in Your Book, taught any one of Your creation, or kept unto Yourself in the knowledge of the unseen that is with You, to make the Qur'an the spring of my heart, and the light of my chest, the banisher of my sadness, and the reliever of my distress.
Reference:
Ahmad 1/391, and Al-Albani graded it authentic.
Hisnul Muslim 120
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘É┘è ╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Æ┘ê╪░┘Å ╪¿┘É┘â┘Ä ┘à┘É┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ç┘Ä┘Ç┘à┘æ┘É ┘ê┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Å┘Ç╪▓┘Æ┘å┘É ┘ê╪º┘ä╪╣┘ï╪¼┘Æ┘Ç╪▓┘É ┘ê╪º┘ä┘â┘Ä╪│┘Ä┘ä┘É ┘ê╪º┘ä╪¿┘Å╪«┘Æ┘Ç┘ä┘É ┘ê╪º┘ä╪¼┘Å┘Ç╪¿┘Æ┘å┘É ┘ê╪╢┘Ä┘ä┘Æ┘Ç╪╣┘É ╪º┘ä┘Ç╪»┘æ┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘å┘É ┘ê╪║┘Ä┘ä┘Ä╪¿┘Ä┘Ç╪⌐┘É ╪º┘ä╪▒┘æ┘É╪¼╪º┘ä
play_arrow
share
video_library
All─ühumma 'inn─½ 'a`┼½dhu bikamina ΓÇÿl-ß╕Ñammi wa ΓÇÿl-ß╕Ñuzn. wa ΓÇÿl-`ajzi wa ΓÇÿl-kasal. wa ΓÇÿl-bukhli wa ΓÇÿl-jubn. wa ß╕ìala`id-dayn. wa ghalabatir-rij─ül.
O Allah, I seek refuge in you from grief and sadness, from weakness and from laziness, from miserliness and from cowardice, from being overcome by debt and overpowered by men (i. e. others).
Reference:
Al-Bukhari 7/158. See also Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 11/173.
Hisnul Muslim 121
Chapter 35: For one in distress
4 du'as
┘ä┘Ä╪º ╪Ñ┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘æ┘Ä╪º ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪╣┘Ä╪╕┘Ç┘è┘à┘Å ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘ä┘É┘Ç┘è┘à┘Æ ┘ä┘Ä╪º ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘æ┘Ä╪º ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Å ╪º┘ä╪╣┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘Æ╪┤┘É ╪º┘ä╪╣┘Ä╪╕┘É┘è┘Ç┘à┘É ┘ä┘Ä╪º ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘æ┘Ä╪º ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Æ ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Å ╪º┘ä╪│┘æ┘Ä┘à┘Ä┘Ç┘ê┘æ╪º╪¬┘É ┘ê╪▒┘æ╪¿┘æ┘Å ╪º┘ä╪ú┘Ä╪▒┘Æ╪╢┘É ┘ê╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Å ╪º┘ä╪╣┘Ä╪▒┘Æ╪┤┘É ╪º┘ä┘â┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘è┘à
play_arrow
share
video_library
L─ü il─üha illall─ühal-`Aß║ô─½mul-ß╕ñal─½m. l─ü il─üha illall─üh Rabbu ΓÇÿl-`Arshi ΓÇÿl-'Aß║ô─½m. l─ü il─üha illall─üh Rabbus-sam─üw─üti wa Rabbu ΓÇÿl-arß╕ìwa Rabbu ΓÇÿl-`Arshi ΓÇÿl-Kar─½m.
There is none worthy of worship but Allah, the Mighty, the Forbearing. There is none worthy of worship but Allah, Lord of the Magnificent Throne. There is none worthy of worship but Allah, Lord of the heavens and Lord of the earth, and Lord of the Noble Throne.
Reference:
Al-Bukhari 8/154, Muslim 4/2092
Hisnul Muslim 122
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪▒┘Ä╪¡┘Æ┘à┘Ä╪¬┘Ä┘Ç┘â┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä╪▒┘Æ╪¼┘Ç┘ê ┘ü┘Ä┘ä╪º ╪¬┘Ä┘â┘É┘ä┘Ç┘å┘è ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘ë ┘å┘Ä┘ü┘Æ┘Ç╪│┘è ╪╖┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘Æ┘ü┘Ä╪⌐┘Ä ╪╣┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ┘å ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä╪╡┘Æ┘ä┘É┘Ç╪¡┘Æ ┘ä┘è ╪┤┘Ä╪ú┘Æ┘å┘Ç┘è ┘â┘Å┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘Ç┘ç ┘ä┘Ä╪º ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘æ┘Ä╪º ╪ú┘å┘Æ┘Ç╪¬
play_arrow
share
video_library
All─ühumma raß╕Ñmataka arj┼½fal─ü takiln─½ il─ü nafs─½ ß╣¡arfata `ayn. wa aß╣úliß╕Ñ l─½ sha'n─½ kullah. l─ü il─üha ill─ü ant.
O Allah, I hope for Your mercy. Do not leave me to myself even for the blinking of an eye (i. e. a moment). Correct all of my affairs for me. There is none worthy of worship but You.
Reference:
Abu Dawud 4/324, Ahmad 5/42. Al-Albani graded it as good in Sahih Abu Dawud 3/959.
Hisnul Muslim 123
┘ä┘Ä╪º ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘æ┘Ä╪º ╪ú┘å┘Æ┘Ç╪¬ ╪│┘Å┘Ç╪¿┘Æ╪¡╪º┘å┘Ä┘â┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘É┘è ┘â┘Å┘å┘Æ┘Ç╪¬┘Å ┘à┘É┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪╕┘æ┘Ç╪º┘ä┘É┘à┘è┘Ç┘å

video_library
L─ü il─üha ill─ü anta subß╕Ñ─ünakainn─½ kuntu minaß║ô-ß║ô─ülim─½n.
There is none worthy of worship but You, glory is to You. Surely, I was among the wrongdoers.
Reference:
At-Tirmidhi 5/529. Al-Hakim declared it authentic and Ath-Thahabi agreed with him 1/ 505. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/168.
Hisnul Muslim 124
╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘Å ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘É┘è ┘ä╪º ╪ú┘Å╪┤┘Æ┘Ç╪▒┘É┘â┘Å ╪¿┘É┘ç┘É ╪┤┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘Ç╪ª╪º┘ï

All─üh, All─ühu Rabb─½ l─ü ushriku bihi shay'a.
Allah, Allah is my Lord. I do not associate anything with Him.
Reference:
Abu Dawud 2/87. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Mdjah 2/335.
Hisnul Muslim 125
Chapter 36: Upon encountering an enemy or those of authority
3 du'as
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘å╪º ┘å┘Ä╪¼┘Æ┘Ç╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Å┘â┘Ä ┘ü┘è ┘å┘Å╪¡┘Ç┘ê╪▒┘É┘ç┘É┘Ç┘à ┘ê┘Ä┘å┘Ä╪╣┘Ç┘ê╪░┘Å ╪¿┘É┘â┘Ä ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ╪┤┘Å╪▒┘ê╪▒┘É┘ç┘Ç┘à┘Æ
play_arrow
share
video_library
All─ühumma inn─ü naj`aluka f─½ nuß╕Ñ┼½rihimwa na`┼½dhu bika min shur┼½rihim.
O Allah, we ask You to restrain them by their necks, and we seek refuge in You from their evil.
Reference:
Abu Dawud 2/89, and Al-Hakim graded it authentic and Ath-Thahabi agreed 2/142.
Hisnul Muslim 126
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ╪¬┘Ä ╪╣┘Ä╪╢┘Å┘Ç╪»┘è ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ╪¬┘Ä ┘å┘Ä╪╡┘Ç┘è╪▒┘è ╪¿┘É┘â┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä╪¼┘Ç┘ê┘ä┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪¿┘É┘â┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä╪╡┘Ç┘ê┘ä┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪¿┘É┘â┘Ä ╪ú┘Å┘é┘Ç╪º╪¬┘É┘ä
play_arrow
share
video_library
All─ühumma anta `aß╕ìud─½, wa anta naß╣ú─½r─½. bika aj┼½lu, wa bika aß╣ú┼½lu, wa bika uq─ütil.
O Allah, You are my strength and You are my support. For Your sake, I go forth and for Your sake, I advance and for Your sake, I fight.
Reference:
Abu Dawud 3/42, At-Tirmidhi 5/572. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/183.
Hisnul Muslim 127
╪¡┘Ä╪│┘Æ╪¿┘Å┘Ç┘å╪º ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä┘å┘É╪╣┘Æ┘Ç┘à┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ê┘Ä┘â┘Ç┘è┘ä
play_arrow
share
video_library
ß╕ñasbunall─ühu wa ni`mal-wak─½l.
Allah is sufficient for us and the best of those on whom to depend.
Reference:
Al-Bukhari, 5/172.
Hisnul Muslim 128
Chapter 37: For one afraid of the ruler's injustice
2 du'as
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪▒╪¿┘æ┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪│┘æ┘Ä┘à┘Ä┘ê┘Ä╪º╪¬┘É ╪º┘ä╪│┘æ┘Ä╪¿┘Æ╪╣┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪╣┘Ä╪▒┘Æ╪┤┘É ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪╣┘Ä╪╕┘É┘è┘à┘É ┘â┘Å┘å┘Æ ┘ä┘É┘è ╪¼┘Ä╪º╪▒╪º┘ï ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ┘ü┘Å┘ä╪º┘Ä┘å┘É ╪¿┘Æ┘å┘É ┘ü┘Å┘ä╪º┘Ä┘å┘ì ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä╪¡┘Æ╪▓┘Ä╪º╪¿┘É┘ç┘É ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ╪«┘Ä┘ä╪º┘Ä╪ª┘É┘é┘É┘â┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ ┘è┘Ä┘ü┘Æ╪▒┘Å╪╖┘Ä ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘è┘æ┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä╪¡┘Ä╪»┘î ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ┘ç┘Å┘à┘Æ ╪ú┘Ä┘ê┘Æ ┘è┘Ä╪╖┘Æ╪║┘Ä┘ë ╪╣┘Ä╪▓┘æ┘Ä ╪¼┘Ä╪º╪▒┘Å┘â┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪¼┘Ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä ╪½┘Ä┘å┘Ä╪º╪ñ┘Å┘â┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä┘ä╪º┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ╪¬┘Ä
play_arrow
share
video_library
All─ühumma Rabbas-sam─üw─ütis-sab`. wa Rabba ΓÇÿl-`Arshi ΓÇÿl-`Aß║ô─½m. kun l─½ j─üran min [here you mention the person's name]. wa aß╕Ñz─übihi min khal─ü'iqik. an yafruß╣¡a `alayya aß╕Ñadun minhum aw yaß╣¡gh─ü,`azza j─üruk. wa jalla than─ü'uk. wa l─ü il─üha ill─ü ant.
O Allah, Lord of the seven heavens, Lord of the Magnificent Throne, be for me a support against [such and such a person] and his helpers from among your creatures, lest any of them abuse me or do me wrong. Mighty is Your patronage, and glorious are Your praises. There is none worthy of worship but You.
Reference:
Al-Bukhari, Al-'Adab Al-Mufrad (no. 707). Al-Albani graded it authentic in Sahih Al-'Adab Al-Mufrad (no. 545).
Hisnul Muslim 129
╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪ú┘â╪¿╪▒ ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪ú╪╣╪▓ ┘à┘å ╪«┘ä┘é┘ç ╪¼┘à┘è╪╣╪º┘ï ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪ú╪╣╪▓ ┘à┘à╪º ╪ú╪«╪º┘ü ┘ê╪ú╪¡╪░╪▒ ╪ú╪╣┘ê╪░ ╪¿╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪º┘ä╪░┘è ┘ä╪º ╪Ñ┘ä┘ç ╪Ñ┘ä╪º ┘ç┘ê ╪º┘ä┘à┘à╪│┘â ╪º┘ä╪│┘à┘ê╪º╪¬ ╪º┘ä╪│╪¿╪╣ ╪ú┘å ┘è┘é╪╣┘å ╪╣┘ä┘ë ╪º┘ä╪ú╪▒╪╢ ╪Ñ┘ä╪º ╪¿╪Ñ╪░┘å┘ç ┘à┘å ╪┤╪▒ ╪╣╪¿╪»┘â ┘ü┘ä╪º┘å ┘ê╪¼┘å┘ê╪»┘ç ┘ê╪ú╪¬╪¿╪º╪╣┘ç ┘ê╪ú╪┤┘è╪º╪╣┘ç ┘à┘å ╪º┘ä╪¼┘å ┘ê╪º┘ä╪ú┘å╪│ ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘à ┘â┘å ┘ä┘è ╪¼╪º╪▒╪º┘ï ┘à┘å ╪┤╪▒┘ç┘à ╪¼┘ä ╪½┘å╪º╪ñ┘â ┘ê╪╣╪▓ ╪¼╪º╪▒┘â ┘ê╪¬╪¿╪º╪▒┘â ╪º╪│┘à┘â ┘ê┘ä╪º ╪Ñ┘ä┘ç ╪║┘è╪▒┘â (╪½┘ä╪º╪½ ┘à╪▒╪º╪¬)
play_arrow
share
video_library
All─ühu Akbar. All─ühu a`azzu min khalqihi jam─½`a. All─ühu a`azzu mimm─ü akh─üfu wa aß╕Ñdhar. a`┼½dhu bill─ühi ΓÇÿl-ladh─½ l─ü il─üha ill─ü h┼½. almumsikis-sam─üw─ütis-sab`ian yaqa`na `ala ΓÇÿl-arß╕ìi ill─ü bi idhnih. min sharri `abdika [name of the person]. wa jun┼½dihi wa atb─ü`ihi wa ashy─ü`ih. mina ΓÇÿl-jinni wa ΓÇÿl-ins. All─ühumma kun l─½ j─üran min sharrihim. jalla than─ü'uk. wa `azza j─üruk. wa tab─üraka-smuk. wa l─ü il─üha ghayruk.
Allah is the Most Great, Mightier than all His creation. He is Mightier than what I fear and dread. I seek refuge in Allah, Who there is none worthy of worship but Him. He is the One Who holds the seven heavens from falling upon the earth except by His command.[I seek refuge in You Allah] from the evil of Your slave [name of the person], and his helpers, his followers, and his supporters from among the jinn and mankind. O Allah, be my support against their evil. Glorious are Your praises and mighty is Your patronage. Blessed is Your Name, there is no true God but You. (Recite three times in Arabic.)
Reference:
Al-Bukhari, 5/172.
Hisnul Muslim 130
Chapter 38: Against enemies
1 du'a
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘à┘æ┘Ä ┘à┘Å┘å┘Æ╪▓┘É┘ä┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘â┘É╪¬┘Ä╪º╪¿ ╪│┘Ä╪▒┘É┘è╪╣┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘É╪│┘Ä╪º╪¿ ╪º┘ç┘Æ╪▓┘É┘à ╪º┘ä╪ú┘Ä╪¡┘Æ╪▓┘Ä╪º╪¿ ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪º┘ç┘Æ╪▓┘É┘à┘Æ┘ç┘Å┘à┘Æ ┘ê┘Ä ╪▓┘Ä┘ä┘Æ╪▓┘É┘ä┘Æ┘ç┘Å┘à

share
video_library
All─ühumma munzila ΓÇÿl-kit─üb. sar─½`a ΓÇÿl-ß╕Ñis─üb. ihzimi ΓÇÿl-aß╕Ñz─üb. All─ühumma-hzimhum wa zalzilhum.
O Allah, Revealer of the Book, Swift to account, defeat the groups (of disbelievers). O Allah, defeat them and shake them.
Reference:
Muslim 3/1362.

O Allah, suffice me with what You have allowed instead of what You have forbidden, and make me independent of all others besides You.

Hisnul Muslim 136
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘É┘è ╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Å┘ê╪░┘Å ╪¿┘É┘â┘Ä ┘à┘É┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘ç┘Ä┘à┘æ┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä╪▓┘Ä┘å┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Æ╪╣┘Ä╪¼┘Æ╪▓┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Æ┘â┘Ä╪│┘Ä┘ä┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¿┘Å╪«┘Æ┘ä┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¼┘Å╪¿┘Æ┘å┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪╢┘Ä┘ä┘Ä╪╣┘É ╪º┘ä╪»┘æ┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘å┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪║┘Ä┘ä┘Ä╪¿┘Ä╪⌐┘É ╪º┘ä╪▒┘æ┘É╪¼┘Ä╪º┘ä┘É

All─ühumma inn─½ a`┼½dhu bika mina ΓÇÿl-ß╕Ñammi wa ΓÇÿl-ß╕Ñazan. wa ΓÇÿl-`ajzi wa ΓÇÿl-kasal. wa ΓÇÿl-bukhli wa ΓÇÿl-jubn. wa ß╕ìala`id-dayni wa ghalabatir-rij─ül.
O Allah! I seek refuge with You from worry and grief, from incapacity and laziness, from cowardice and miserliness, from being heavily in debt and from being overpowered by (other) men.
Reference:
Al-Bukhari 7/158.
Hisnul Muslim 137

Hisnul Muslim 138
Chapter 43: For one whose affairs have become difficult
1 du'a
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘à┘æ┘Ä ┘ä╪º┘Ä ╪│┘Ä┘ç┘Æ┘ä┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ┘Ä ┘à┘Ä╪º ╪¼┘Ä╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Æ╪¬┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪│┘Ä┘ç┘Æ┘ä╪º┘ï ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ╪¬┘Ä ╪¬┘Ä╪¼┘Æ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Å ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä╪▓┘Æ┘å┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É╪░┘Ä╪º ╪┤┘É╪ª┘Æ╪¬┘Ä ╪│┘Ä┘ç┘Æ┘ä╪º┘ï

video_library
All─ühumma l─ü saß╕Ñla ill─ü ma ja`altahu saß╕Ñlawa anta taj`alu ΓÇÿl-ß╕Ñazna idh─ü shi'ta saß╕Ñla.
O Allah, there is no ease other than what You make easy. If You please You ease sorrow.
Reference:
Ibn Hibban in his Sahih (no. 2427), and Ibn As- Sunni (no. 351). Al-Hafidh (Ibn Hajar) said that this Hadith is authentic. It was also declared authentic by 'Abdul-Qadir Al-Arna'ut in his checking of An-Nawawi's Kitabul-Athkarp. 106.
Hisnul Muslim 139
Chapter 44: Upon committing a sin
recommendation
There is not any slave of Allah who commits a sin, then he perfects his purification and stands to pray two Rak'ahs of prayer, then seeks Allah's forgiveness, except that Allah will forgive him.
┘à┘Ä╪º ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ╪╣┘Ä╪¿┘Æ╪»┘ì ┘è┘Å╪░┘å┘É╪¿┘Å ╪░┘Ä┘å┘Æ╪¿╪º┘ï ┘ü┘Ä┘è┘Å╪¡┘Æ╪│┘É┘å┘Å ╪º┘ä╪╖┘æ┘Å┘ç┘Å┘ê╪▒┘Ä ╪½┘Å┘à┘æ┘Ä ┘è┘Ä┘é┘Å┘ê┘à┘Å ┘ü┘Ä┘è┘Å╪╡┘Ä┘ä┘æ┘É┘è ╪▒┘Ä┘â┘Æ╪╣┘Ä╪¬┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘å┘É ╪½┘Å┘à┘æ┘Ä ┘è┘Ä╪│┘Æ╪¬┘Ä╪║┘Æ┘ü┘É╪▒┘Å ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ┘Ä ╪║┘Ä┘ü┘Ä╪▒┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Å
play_arrow
share
video_library
Reference:
Abu Dawud 2/86, At-Tirmidhi 2/257. Al-Albani graded it authentic in Sahih Abu Dawud 1/283.
Hisnul Muslim 140
Chapter 45: For expelling the devil and his whisperings
1 du'a
╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Å┘ê╪░┘Å ╪¿┘É╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘É ┘à┘É┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪┤┘æ┘Ä┘è╪╖┘Ä╪º┘å┘É ╪º┘ä╪▒┘æ┘Ä╪¼┘É┘è┘à┘É
play_arrow
share
video_library
A`┼½dhu bill─ühi minash-shayß╣¡─ünir-raj─½m.
Seeking refuge with Allah against him (i. e. by saying I seek refuge in Allah from Satan the outcast).
Reference:
Abu Dawud 1/206, At-Tirmidhi. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 1/77, and Surat Al-Mu'minun, 23:98-9.
Hisnul Muslim 141
recommendation
The call to prayer - 'Athan.
╪º┘ä┘Æ╪ú┘Ä╪░┘Ä╪º┘å┘Å
play_arrow
share
video_library
Reference:
Muslim 1/291, Al-Bukhari 1/151.
Hisnul Muslim 142
recommendation
Saying words of Allah's remembrance (Thikr) and recitation of the Qur'an.
╪º┘ä┘Æ╪ú┘Ä╪░┘Æ┘â┘Ä╪º╪▒┘Å ┘ê┘Ä┘é┘É╪▒┘Ä╪º╪í┘Ä╪⌐┘Å ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘é┘Å╪▒┘Æ╪ó┘å┘É
play_arrow
share
video_library
Reference:
Do not turn your homes into graveyards, surely the Devil flees from the house in which Surat Al-Baqarah is read, Muslim 1/539. The Devil is also driven out by the invocations for morning and evening, those that are said before sleeping and upon waking up, those for entering and leaving the house, including those for entering and leaving the mosque, and by many other authentic invocations taught to us by the Prophet (∩╖║) such as the reading of 'Ayatul-Kursi, (Al-Baqarah 2:255), and the last two 'Ayat of Surat Al-Baqarah before going to sleep. Whoever says: "There is none worthy of worship but Allah alone, Who has no partner, His is the dominion and His is the praise, and he is Able to do all things," one hundred times, it will be a protection for him from the Devil throughout the day.'
Hisnul Muslim 143
Chapter 46: When stricken with a mishap or overtaken by an affair
1 du'a
┘é┘Ä╪»┘æ┘Ä╪▒┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä┘à╪º ╪┤┘Ç╪º╪í┘Ä ┘ü┘Ä╪╣┘Ä┘Ç┘ä
play_arrow
share
video_library
Qaddarall─ühu wa m─ü sh─ü'a fa`al.
It is the Decree of Allah and He does whatever He wills.
Reference:
The strong believer is better and more dear to Allah than the weak believer, and in each of them there is good. Be vigilant for what is to your benefit and seek the help of Allah and do not falter. But when you are striken by some setback, do not say: 'If only I had done such and such,' rather say: 'It is the Decree of Allah and He does whatever He wills.' For verily the saying 'if (i.e. if only I had) begins the work of the Devil. Muslim 4/2052.
Hisnul Muslim 144
Chapter 47: Congratulation on the occasion of a birth and its reply
1 du'a
(╪¿┘Ä╪º╪▒┘Ä┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ä┘Ä┘â┘Ä ┘ü┘É┘è ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘à┘Ä┘ê┘Æ┘ç┘Å┘ê╪¿┘É ┘ä┘Ä┘â┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪┤┘Ä┘â┘Ä╪▒┘Æ╪¬┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ç┘É╪¿┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪¿┘Ä┘ä┘Ä╪║┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä╪┤┘Å╪»┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪▒┘Å╪▓┘É┘é┘Æ╪¬┘Ä ╪¿┘É╪▒┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å).
 ┘ê┘Ä┘è┘Ä╪▒┘Å╪»┘æ┘Å ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘ç┘É ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘à┘Å┘ç┘Ä┘Ç┘Ç┘Ç┘Ç┘Ç┘Ç┘å┘æ┘Ä╪ú┘Å ┘ü┘Ä┘è┘Ä┘é┘Å┘ê┘ä┘Å:
(╪¿┘Ä╪º╪▒┘Ä┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ä┘Ä┘â┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪¿┘Ä╪º╪▒┘Ä┘â┘Ä ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘â┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪¼┘Ä╪▓┘Ä╪º┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪«┘Ä┘è┘Æ╪▒╪º┘ï ┘ê┘Ä╪▒┘Ä╪▓┘Ä┘é┘Ä┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘à┘É╪½┘Æ┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä╪¼┘Æ╪▓┘Ä┘ä┘Ä ╪½┘Ä┘ê┘Ä╪º╪¿┘Ä┘â┘Ä).
play_arrow
share
video_library
B─ürakall─ühu laka fi ΓÇÿl-mawh┼½bi lak. wa shakarta ΓÇÿl-w─ühib. wa balagha ashuddah. wa ruziqta birrah.
The reply of the person being congratulated is to say:
B─ürakallahu laka wa b─üraka `alayk. wa jaz─ükall─ühu khayra. wa razaqakall─ühu mithlah. wa ajzala thaw─übak.
May Allah bless you with His gift to you, and may you (the new parent) give thanks, may the child reach the maturity of years, and may you be granted its righteousness. The reply of the person being congratulated is to say: May Allah bless you, and shower His blessings upon you, and may Allah reward you well and bestow upon you its like and reward you abundantly
Reference:
An-Nawawi, Kitdbul-'Athkarp. 349, and Sahihul-'Athkar2/7l3 by Saleem Al-Hilali.
Hisnul Muslim 145
Chapter 48: Placing childen under AllahΓÇÖs protection
1 du'a

' ╪ú╪╣┘è╪░┘â┘à╪º ╪¿┘â┘ä┘à╪º╪¬ ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪º┘ä╪¬╪º┘à╪⌐ ┘à┘å ┘â┘ä ╪┤┘è╪╖╪º┘å ┘ê┘ç╪º┘à╪⌐ ┘ê┘à┘å ┘â┘ä ╪╣┘è┘å┘É ┘ä╪º┘à╪⌐ '
play_arrow
share
video_library
U`─½thukum─ü bikalim─üti ΓÇÿll─ühit-t─ümmatimin kulli shayß╣¡─ünin wa h─ümmah. wa min kulli `aynin l─ümmah
I seek protection for you in the Perfect Words of Allah from every devil and every beast, and from every envious blameworthy eye.
Reference:
Al-Bukhari4/119.

Chapter 49: When visiting the sick

Hisnul Muslim 147
╪ú┘Ä╪│┘Æ┘Ç╪ú┘Ä┘ä┘Å ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪╣┘Ä┘Ç╪╕┘è┘Ç┘à ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪╣┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘Æ╪┤┘É ╪º┘ä╪╣┘Ä┘Ç╪╕┘è┘Ç┘à ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ ┘è┘Ä╪┤┘Æ┘ü┘Ç┘è┘â

As'alull─üha ΓÇÿl-`Aß║ô─½ma Rabba ΓÇÿl-`Arshil-`Aß║ô─½mi an yashfiyak.
I ask Almighty Allah, Lord of the Magnificent Throne, to make you well. (Recite seven times in Arabic .)
Reference:
At-Tirmidhi, Abu Dawud. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 2/210 and Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 5/180.
Hisnul Muslim 148
Chapter 50: Excellence of visiting the sick
recommendation
When a man goes to visit his sick Muslim brother, he walks along a path of Paradise until he sits, and when he sits he is cloaked in mercy. If he comes in the morning, seventy thousand angels pray for him until evening, and if he comes in the evening, seventy thousand angels pray for him until morning.
┘é┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Ä ╪╡┘ä┘ë ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪╣┘ä┘è┘ç ┘ê╪│┘ä┘à: (╪Ñ┘É╪░┘Ä╪º ╪╣┘Ä╪º╪»┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪▒┘æ┘Ä╪¼┘Å┘ä┘Å ╪ú┘Ä╪«┘Ä╪º┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘à┘Å╪│┘Æ┘ä┘É┘à┘Ä ┘à┘Ä╪┤┘Ä┘ë ┘ü┘É┘è ╪«┘É╪▒┘Ä╪º┘ü┘Ä╪⌐┘É ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¼┘Ä┘å┘æ┘Ä╪⌐┘É ╪¡┘Ä╪¬┘æ┘Ä┘ë ┘è┘Ä╪¼┘Æ┘ä┘É╪│┘Ä ┘ü┘Ä╪Ñ┘É╪░┘Ä╪º ╪¼┘Ä┘ä┘Ä╪│┘Ä ╪║┘Ä┘à┘Ä╪▒┘Ä╪¬┘Æ┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä╪▒┘æ┘Ä╪¡┘Æ┘à┘Ä╪⌐┘Å ┘ü┘Ä╪Ñ┘É┘å┘Æ ┘â┘Ä╪º┘å┘Ä ╪║┘Å╪»┘Æ┘ê┘Ä╪⌐┘ï ╪╡┘Ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ë ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘ç┘É ╪│┘Ä╪¿┘Æ╪╣┘Å┘ê┘å┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä┘ä┘Æ┘ü┘Ä ┘à┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘â┘ì ╪¡┘Ä╪¬┘æ┘Ä┘ë ┘è┘Å┘à┘Æ╪│┘É┘è┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪Ñ┘É┘å┘Æ ┘â┘Ä╪º┘å┘Ä ┘à┘Ä╪│┘Ä╪º╪í┘ï ╪╡┘Ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ë ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘ç┘É ╪│┘Ä╪¿┘Æ╪╣┘Å┘ê┘å┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä┘ä┘Æ┘ü┘Ä ┘à┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘â┘ì ╪¡┘Ä╪¬┘æ┘Ä┘ë ┘è┘Å╪╡┘Æ╪¿┘É╪¡┘Ä)
play_arrow
share
video_library
Reference:

Hisnul Muslim 149
Chapter 51: When the sick have renounced all hope of life
3 du'as
╪ú┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪º╪║┘Æ┘ü┘É┘Ç╪▒┘Æ ┘ä┘è ┘ê┘Ä╪º╪▒┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ┘Ç┘å┘è ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘É┘é┘Æ┘Ç┘å┘è ╪¿┘É╪º┘ä╪▒┘æ┘Ä┘ü┘Ç┘è┘é┘É ╪º┘ä╪ú┘æ╪╣┘Æ┘ä┘Ç┘ë

All─ühummaΓÇÖghfir l─½ warß╕Ñamn─½wa alß╕Ñiqn─½ bir-raf─½qi ΓÇÿl-'A`al─ü.
O Allah, forgive me and have mercy upon me, and join me with the highest companions (in Paradise).
Reference:
Al-Bukhari7/10, Muslim 4/1893.
Hisnul Muslim 150
As he was dying, the Prophet (∩╖║) dipped his hands in water and wiped his face saying:
┘ä╪º ╪Ñ┘ä┘ç ╪Ñ┘ä╪º ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪Ñ┘å ┘ä┘ä┘à┘ê╪¬ ┘ä╪│┘â╪▒╪º╪¬
play_arrow
share
video_library
L─ü il─üha illall─ühinna li ΓÇÿlmawti laΓÇÖsakar─üt.
There is none worthy of worship but Allah, surely death has agonies.
Reference:
Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 8/144. The Hadith also mention him using the Siivak (tooth stick).
Hisnul Muslim 151
┘ä╪º ╪Ñ┘ä┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘ä╪º┘æ ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å ╪ú┘Ä┘â┘Æ╪¿┘Ä┘Ç╪▒ ┘ä╪º ╪Ñ┘ä┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘ä╪º┘æ ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å ┘ê╪¡┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ä╪º ╪Ñ┘ä┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘ä╪º┘æ ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å ┘ê╪¡┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ä╪º ╪┤┘Ä╪▒┘è┘â┘Ä ┘ä┘ç┘Å ┘ä╪º ╪Ñ┘ä┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘ä╪º┘æ ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å ┘ä┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä┘à┘Å┘ä┘â┘Å ┘ê┘ä┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ╪» ┘ä╪º ╪Ñ┘ä┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘ä╪º┘æ ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä┘ä╪º ╪¡┘Ä┘Ç┘ê┘Æ┘ä┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä┘ä╪º ┘é┘Å┘Ç┘ê┘æ┘Ä╪⌐┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ ╪¿┘É╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç
play_arrow
share
video_library
L─ü il─üha illall─ühwall─ühu Akbar. l─ü il─üha illall─ühu waß╕Ñdah. l─ü il─üha illall─ühwaß╕Ñdahu l─ü shar─½ka lah. l─ü il─üha illall─ühlahu ΓÇÿl-mulku wa lahu ΓÇÿl-ß╕Ñamd. l─ü il─üha illall─ühwa l─ü ß╕Ñawla wa l─ü quwwata ill─ü bill─üh.
There is none worthy of worship but Allah, Allah is the Most Great. None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone. None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner. There is none worthy of worship but Allah, His is the dominion and His is the praise. There is none worthy of worship but Allah, there is no power and no might but by Allah.
Reference:
At-Tirmidhi and Ibn Majah. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/152 and Sahih Ibn Majah 2/317.
Hisnul Muslim 152
Chapter 52: Instruction for the one nearing death
1 du'a
'┘ä╪º ╪Ñ┘ä┘ç ╪Ñ┘ä╪º ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç' ╪»╪«┘ä ╪º┘ä╪¼┘å╪⌐
play_arrow
share
video_library
L─ü il─üha illall─üh
Whoever dies with the last words (whose meaning is): "There is none worthy of worship but Allah" will enter Paradise.
Reference:
Abu Dawud 3/190. See also Al-Albani, Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 5/432.
Hisnul Muslim 153
Chapter 53: For one afflicted by a calamity
1 du'a
╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ╪º ┘ä┘ä┘ç┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪Ñ┘É┘å┘Ä╪º ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ┘ç┘É ╪▒╪º╪¼┘É╪╣┘Ç┘ê┘å ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘É ╪º┘Æ╪¼┘Å┘Ç╪▒┘Æ┘å┘è ┘ü┘è ┘à┘Å╪╡┘Ç┘è╪¿┘Ä╪¬┘è ┘ê┘Ä╪º╪«┘Æ┘ä┘Å┘Ç┘ü┘Æ ┘ä┘è ╪«┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘Ç╪▒╪º┘ï ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ┘Ç┘ç╪º

Inn─ü lill─ühi wa inn─ü ilayhi r─üji`┼½n. All─ühumma-jurni f─½ muß╣ú─½bat─½wa 'khluf l─½ khayran minh─ü.
We are from Allah and unto Him we return. O Allah take me out of my plight and bring to me after it something better.
Reference:
Muslim 2/632.
Hisnul Muslim 154
Chapter 54: When closing the eyes of the deceased
1 du'a
╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘É ╪º╪║┘Æ┘ü┘É┘Ç╪▒┘Æ ┘ä┘É┘Ç┘ü┘ä╪º┘å (╪¿╪º╪│┘Ç┘à┘ç) ┘ê┘Ä╪º╪▒┘Æ┘ü┘Ä╪╣┘Æ ╪»┘Ä╪▒┘Ä╪¼┘Ä╪¬┘Ä┘Ç┘ç┘Å ┘ü┘è ╪º┘ä┘à┘Ä┘ç┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘É┘è┘è┘Ç┘å ┘ê┘Ä╪º╪«┘Æ┘Ç┘ä┘Å┘ü┘Æ┘Ç┘ç┘Å ┘ü┘è ╪╣┘Ä┘é┘É┘Ç╪¿┘É┘ç┘É ┘ü┘è ╪º┘ä╪║╪º╪¿┘É┘Ç╪▒┘è┘å ┘ê┘Ä╪º╪║┘Æ┘ü┘É┘Ç╪▒┘Æ ┘ä┘Ä┘å┘Ç╪º ┘ê┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘ç┘Å ┘è╪º ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪╣┘Ç╪º┘ä┘Ä┘à┘Ç┘è┘å ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ü┘Æ╪│┘Ä┘Ç╪¡┘Æ ┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ü┘è ┘é┘Ä╪¿┘Æ┘Ç╪▒┘É┘ç┘É ┘ê┘Ä┘å┘Ä┘Ç┘ê┘æ┘É╪▒┘Æ ┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ü┘è┘ç

All─ühummaΓÇÖghfir li (name of the person) warfa` darajatahu fi ΓÇÿl-mahdiyy─½n. wakhlufhu f─½ `aqibihi fi ΓÇÿl-gh─übir─½n. waghΓÇÖfir-lan─ü wa lahu y─ü Rabba ΓÇÿl-`─ülam─½n. wafsaß╕Ñ lahu f─½ qabrihi wa nawwir lahu f─½h.
O Allah, forgive [name of the person] and elevate his station among those who are guided. Send him along the path of those who came before, and forgive us and him, O Lord of the worlds. Enlarge for him his grave, and shed light upon him in it.
Reference:
Muslim 2/634.
Hisnul Muslim 155
Chapter 55: For the deceased at the funeral prayer
4 du'as
╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘É ╪º╪║┘Æ┘ü┘É┘Ç╪▒┘Æ ┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪º╪▒┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ┘Ç┘ç ┘ê┘Ä╪╣╪º┘ü┘É┘ç┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º╪╣┘Æ┘ü┘Å ╪╣┘Ä┘å┘Æ┘Ç┘ç ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä┘â┘Æ┘Ç╪▒┘É┘à┘Æ ┘å┘Å╪▓┘Å┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘ç ┘ê┘Ä┘ê┘Ä╪│┘æ┘É┘Ç╪╣┘Æ ┘à┘Å╪»┘Æ╪«┘Ä┘Ç┘ä┘Ä┘ç ┘ê┘Ä╪º╪║┘Æ╪│┘É┘ä┘Æ┘Ç┘ç┘Å ╪¿┘É╪º┘ä┘Æ┘à┘Ç╪º╪í┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä╪½┘æ┘Ä┘Ç┘ä┘Æ╪¼┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¿┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘Ä╪»┘Æ ┘ê┘Ä┘å┘Ä┘é┘æ┘É┘Ç┘ç┘É ┘à┘É┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪«╪╖┘Ç╪º┘è╪º ┘â┘Ä┘à╪º ┘å┘Ä┘Ç┘é┘æ┘è┘Æ╪¬┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Ç╪½┘æ┘Ä┘ê┘Æ╪¿┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪ú┘Ä╪¿┘Æ┘è┘Ä┘Ç╪╢┘Ä ┘à┘É┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪»┘æ┘Ä┘å┘Ä┘Ç╪│┘Æ ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä╪¿┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘É┘ä┘Æ┘ç┘Å ╪»╪º╪▒╪º┘ï ╪«┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ╪▒╪º┘ï ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ╪»╪º╪▒┘É┘ç ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä┘ç┘Æ┘ä╪º┘ï ╪«┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ╪▒╪º┘ï ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ╪ú┘Ä┘ç┘Æ┘ä┘É┘Ç┘ç ┘ê┘Ä╪▓┘Ä┘ê┘Æ╪¼┘Ä┘Ç╪º┘ï ╪«┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ╪▒╪º┘ï ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ╪▓┘Ä┘ê┘Æ╪¼┘É┘ç ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä╪»┘Æ╪«┘É┘Ç┘ä┘Æ┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¼┘Ä┘Ç┘å┘æ┘Ä╪⌐ ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘É┘Ç╪░┘Æ┘ç┘Å ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ╪╣┘Ä╪░╪º╪¿┘É ╪º┘ä┘é┘Ä┘Ç╪¿┘Æ╪▒ [┘ê┘Ä╪╣┘Ä╪░╪º╪¿┘É ╪º┘ä┘å┘æ┘Ç╪º╪▒]

share
video_library
All─ühummaΓÇÖghfir lahu warß╕Ñamh. wa `─üfihi, wa`fu `anh. wa akrim nuzulah. wa wassi` mudkhalah. waghΓÇÖsilhu bi ΓÇÿlm─ü'i wath-thalji walbarad. wa naqqihi mina ΓÇÿl-khaß╣¡─üy─ükam─ü naqqaytath-thawba ΓÇÿl-abyaß╕ìa minad-danas. wa abdilhu d─üran khayran min d─ürih. wa ahlan khayran min ahlih. wa zawjan khayran min zawjih. wa adkhilhu ΓÇÿl-jannah. wa a`idhhu min `adh─übi ΓÇÿl-qabri [wa `adh─übin-n─ür].
O Allah, forgive him and have mercy on him, and give him strength and pardon him. Be generous to him, and cause his entrance to be wide, and wash him with water and snow and hail. Cleanse him of his transgressions as white cloth is cleansed of stains. Give him an abode better than his home, and a family better than his family, and a wife better than his wife. Take him into Paradise, and protect him from the punishment of the grave [and from the punishment of Hell-fire].
Reference:
Muslim 2/663.
Hisnul Muslim 156
╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘É ╪º╪║┘Æ┘ü┘É┘Ç╪▒┘Æ ┘ä┘É╪¡┘Ä┘è┘æ┘É┘Ç┘å╪º ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘Ä┘è┘æ┘É╪¬┘É┘Ç┘å╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪┤┘Ç╪º┘ç┘É╪»┘É┘å╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪║╪º╪ª┘É╪¿┘É┘Ç┘å╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪╡┘Ä╪║┘è┘Ç╪▒┘É┘å╪º ┘ê┘Ä┘â┘Ä╪¿┘è┘Ç╪▒┘É┘å╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪░┘Ä┘â┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘É┘å╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Å┘å┘Æ╪½┘Ç╪º┘å╪º . ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘É ┘à┘Ä┘å┘Æ ╪ú┘Ä╪¡┘Æ┘è┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘Ç╪¬┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘à┘É┘å┘æ╪º ┘ü┘Ä╪ú┘Ä╪¡┘Æ┘è┘É┘Ç┘ç┘É ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘ë ╪º┘ä╪Ñ┘É╪│┘Æ┘ä╪º┘à ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘Ä┘å┘Æ ╪¬┘Ä┘ê┘Ä┘ü┘æ┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ╪¬┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘à┘É┘å┘æ╪º ┘ü┘Ä╪¬┘Ä┘ê┘Ä┘ü┘æ┘Ä┘Ç┘ç┘Å ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘ë ╪º┘ä╪Ñ┘É┘è┘Ç┘à╪º┘å ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘É ┘ä╪º ╪¬┘Ä╪¡┘Æ┘Ç╪▒┘É┘à┘Æ┘å┘Ç╪º ╪ú┘Ä╪¼┘Æ┘Ç╪▒┘Ä┘ç ┘ê┘Ä┘ä╪º ╪¬┘Å╪╢┘É┘Ç┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘å╪º ╪¿┘Ä╪╣┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘Ä┘ç

video_library
All─ühummaΓÇÖghfir liß╕Ñayyin─ü, wa mayyitin─ü. wa sh─ühidin─ü, wa gh─ü'ibin─ü. wa ß╣úagh─½rin─ü wa kab─½rin─ü. wa dhakarin─ü wa unth─ün─ü. All─ühumma man aß╕Ñyaytahu minn─üfa aß╕Ñyihi `ala ΓÇÿl-Isl─üm. wa man tawaffaytahu minn─üfatawaffahu `alal-─½m─ün. All─ühumma l─ü taß╕Ñrimn─ü ajrahwa l─ü tuß╕ìillan─ü ba`dah.
O Allah forgive our living and our dead, those who are with us and those who are absent, our young and our old, our menfolk and our womenfolk. O Allah, whomever you give life from among us give him life in Islam, and whomever you take away from us take him away in Faith. O Allah, do not forbid us their reward and do not send us astray after them.
Reference:
Ibn Majah 1/480, Ahmad 2/368. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah 1/251.
Hisnul Muslim 157
╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘É ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘Ä ┘ü┘Å┘ä╪º┘å┘Ä ╪¿┘Æ┘å┘Ä ┘ü┘Å┘ä╪º┘å┘ì ┘ü┘è ╪░┘É┘à┘æ┘Ä┘Ç╪¬┘É┘â ┘ê┘Ä╪¡┘Ä╪¿┘Æ┘Ç┘ä┘É ╪¼┘É┘Ç┘ê╪º╪▒┘É┘â ┘ü┘Ä┘é┘É┘Ç┘ç┘É ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ┘ü┘É╪¬┘Æ┘Ç┘å┘Ä╪⌐┘É ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘é┘Ä┘Ç╪¿┘Æ╪▒┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪╣┘Ä╪░╪º╪¿┘É ╪º┘ä┘å┘æ┘Ç╪º╪▒ ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ╪¬┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä┘ç┘Æ┘ä┘Å ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘ê┘Ä┘ü┘Ç╪º╪í┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Æ┘Ç╪¡┘Ä┘é┘æ┘É ┘ü┘Ä╪º╪║┘Æ┘ü┘É┘Ç╪▒┘Æ ┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪º╪▒┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ┘Ç┘ç┘Å ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘Ä┘â┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ╪¬┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪║┘Ä┘Ç┘ü┘ê╪▒┘Å ╪º┘ä┘Ç╪▒┘æ┘Ä╪¡┘è┘à

video_library
All─ühumma inna [name the person] f─½ dhimmatik. wa ß╕Ñabli jiw─ürik. faqihi min fitnati ΓÇÿl-qabri wa `adh─übin-n─ür. wa anta ahlu ΓÇÿl-waf─ü'i wa ΓÇÿl-ß╕Ñaqq. Faghfir lahu warß╕Ñamhinnaka anta ΓÇÿl-Ghaf┼½rur-Raß╕Ñ─½m.
O Allah, surely [name the person] is under Your protection, and in the rope of Your security, so save him from the trial of the grave and from the punishment of the Fire. You fulfill promises and grant rights, so forgive him and have mercy on him. Surely You are Most Forgiving, Most Merciful.
Reference:
Ibn Majah, Abu Dawud 3/211. See also Al Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah 1/251.
Hisnul Muslim 158
╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘É ╪╣┘Ä╪¿┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘Å┘â┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪º╪¿┘Æ┘å┘Å ╪ú┘Ä┘à┘Ä┘Ç╪¬┘É┘â ╪º╪¡┘Æ╪¬┘Ç╪º╪¼┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘ë ╪▒┘Ä╪¡┘Æ┘à┘Ä┘Ç╪¬┘É┘â ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ╪¬┘Ä ╪║┘Ä┘å┘É┘Ç┘è┘æ┘î ╪╣┘Ä┘å┘Æ ╪╣┘Ä╪░╪º╪¿┘É┘Ç┘ç ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘Æ ┘â╪º┘å┘Ä ┘à┘Å╪¡┘Æ┘Ç╪│┘É┘å╪º┘ï ┘ü┘Ä╪▓┘É╪»┘Æ ┘ü┘è ╪¡┘Ä╪│┘Ä┘Ç┘å╪º╪¬┘É┘ç ┘ê┘Ä╪Ñ┘É┘å┘Æ ┘â╪º┘å┘Ä ┘à┘Å╪│┘Ç┘è╪ª╪º┘ï ┘ü┘Ä╪¬┘Ä┘Ç╪¼╪º┘ê┘Ä╪▓┘Æ ╪╣┘Ä┘å┘Æ┘Ç┘ç
play_arrow
share
video_library
All─ühumma `abduka wabnu 'amatikiß╕Ñt─üja il─ü raß╕Ñmatik. wa anta ghaniyyun `an `adh─übih. in k─üna muß╕Ñsinan fazid f─½ ß╕Ñasan─ütih. wa in k─üna mus─½'an fataj─üwaz `anh.
O Allah, Your male slave and the child of Your female slave is in need of Your mercy, and You are not in need of his torment. If he was pious then increase his rewards and if he was a transgressor then pardon him.
Reference:
Al-Hakim 1/359 who graded it authentic and Ath-Thahabi agreed with him. See also Al-Albani, Ahkamul-Jana'iz, p. 125.
Hisnul Muslim 159
Chapter 56: When the deceased is a child, during the funeral prayer
2 du'as
'╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘à ╪ú╪╣╪░┘ç ┘à┘å ╪╣╪░╪º╪¿ ╪º┘ä┘é╪¿╪▒ ' ┘ê╪Ñ┘å ┘é╪º┘ä: '╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘à ╪º╪¼╪╣┘ä┘ç ┘ü╪▒╪╖╪º┘ï ┘ê╪░╪«╪▒╪º┘ï ┘ä┘ê╪º┘ä╪»┘è┘ç ┘ê╪┤┘ü┘è╪╣╪º┘ï ┘à╪¼╪º╪¿╪º┘ï . ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘à ╪½┘é┘ä ╪¿┘ç ┘à┘ê╪º╪▓┘è┘å┘ç╪º ┘ê╪ú╪╣╪╕┘à ╪¿┘ç ╪ú╪¼┘ê╪▒┘ç┘à╪º ┘ê╪ú┘ä╪¡┘é┘ç┘Å ╪¿╪╡╪º┘ä╪¡ ╪º┘ä┘à╪ñ┘à┘å┘è┘å ┘ê╪º╪¼╪╣┘ä┘ç┘Å ┘ü┘è ┘â┘ü╪º┘ä╪⌐ ╪Ñ╪¿╪▒╪º┘ç┘è┘à ┘ê┘é┘ç ╪¿╪▒╪¡┘à╪¬┘â ╪╣╪░╪º╪¿ ╪º┘ä╪¼╪¡┘è┘à ┘ê╪ú╪¿╪»┘ä┘ç ╪»╪º╪▒╪º┘ï ╪«┘è╪▒╪º┘ï ┘à┘å ╪»╪º╪▒┘ç ┘ê╪ú┘ç┘ä╪º┘ï ╪«┘è╪▒╪º┘ï ┘à┘å ╪ú┘ç┘ä┘ç ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘à ╪º╪║┘ü╪▒ ┘ä╪º╪│┘ä╪º┘ü┘å╪º ┘ê╪ú┘ü╪▒╪º╪╖┘å╪º ┘ê┘à┘å ╪│╪¿┘é┘å╪º ╪¿╪º┘ä╪Ñ┘è┘à╪º┘å ' ┘ü╪¡╪│┘å
play_arrow
share
video_library
All─ühumma a`idhΓÇÖhu min `adh─übi ΓÇÿl-qabr[or say:] All─ühumma ΓÇÿj`alhu faraß╣¡an wa dhukhran liw─ülidayh. wa shaf─½`an muj─üban. All─ühumma thaqqil bihi maw─üz─½nahum─üwa a`ß║ôim bihi uj┼½rahum─ü. wa alß╕Ñiqhu biß╣ú─üliß╕Ñi ΓÇÿl-mu'min─½n. waj`alhu f─½ kaf─ülati Ibr─üh─½m. wa qihi biraß╕Ñmatika `adh─üba ΓÇÿl-jaß╕Ñ─½m. wa abdilhu d─üran khayran min d─ürih. wa ahlan khayran min ahlih. All─ühummaΓÇÖghfir li asl─üfin─ü wa afr─üß╣¡in─üwa man sabaqan─ü bil ─½m─ün.
O Allah, protect him from the torment of the grave.[It is also good to say:] O Allah, make him a precursor, a forerunner and a treasure for his parents and an answered intercessor. O Allah, make him weigh heavily in their scales (of good) and magnify their reward. Make him join the righteous of the believers. Place him in the care of Ibrahim. Save him by Your mercy from the torment of Hell. Give him a home better than his home, and a family better than his family. O Allah, forgive those who have gone (i. e. passed away) before us, our children lost (by death), and those who have preceded us in Faith.
Reference:
Ibn Qudamah, Al-Mughni 3/416 and Ad-Duroosul-Muhimmah li-Aammatil-'Ummah, pg. 15, by Shaikh 'Abdul-'Aziz bin Baz.
Hisnul Muslim 160
╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘É ╪º╪¼┘Æ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Æ┘Ç┘ç┘Å ┘ä┘Ä┘å╪º ┘ü┘Ä╪▒┘Ä╪╖┘Ç╪º┘ï ┘ê┘Ä╪│┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘ü╪º┘ï ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä╪¼┘Æ┘Ç╪▒╪º┘ï
play_arrow
share
video_library
All─ühummaΓÇÖj`alhu lan─ü faraß╣¡an, wa salafan, wa ajra.
O Allah, make him for us a precursor, a forerunner and a cause of reward.
Reference:
Al-Hasan (Al-Basri) used to recite Surat Al-Fatihah for a child's funeral and then say this. Al-Bukhari, Kitabul-Jana'iz, p. 65.
Hisnul Muslim 161
Chapter 57: Condolence
1 du'a
'╪Ñ┘å ┘ä┘ä┘ç ┘à╪º ╪ú╪«╪░ ┘ê┘ä┘ç ┘à╪º ╪ú╪╣╪╖┘ë . ┘ê┘â┘ä ╪┤┘è╪í ╪╣┘å╪»┘ç ╪¿╪ú╪¼┘ä ┘à┘Å╪│┘à┘ë ... ┘ü┘ä╪¬╪╡╪¿╪▒ ┘ê┘ä╪¬╪¡╪¬╪│╪¿ ' ┘ê╪Ñ┘å ┘é╪º┘ä : '╪ú╪╣╪╕┘à ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪ú╪¼╪▒┘â ┘ê╪ú╪¡╪│┘å ╪╣╪▓╪º╪í┘â ┘ê╪║┘ü╪▒ ┘ä┘à┘è╪¬┘â' ┘ü╪¡╪│┘å
play_arrow
share
video_library
Inna lill─ühi m─ü akhadh. wa lahu m─ü a`t─ü. wa kullu shay'in `indahu bi ajalin musamm─ü... faltaß╣úbir wa ΓÇÿl-taß╕Ñtasib.
[Also good to say:]
A`ß║ôamall─ühu ajrak. wa 'aß╕Ñsana `az─ü'ak. wa ghafara limayyitik.
Surely, Allah takes what is His, and what He gives is His, and to all things He has appointed a time... so have patience and be rewarded.1 May Allah magnify your reward, and make perfect your bereavement, and forgive your departed.2
Reference:
1 Al-Bukhari 2/80, Muslim 2/636. 2An-Nawawi, Kitabul-'Athkar, p. 126.
Hisnul Muslim 162
Chapter 58: Placing the deceased in the grave
1 du'a
╪¿┘É╪│┘Æ┘Ç┘à┘É ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ç┘ë ╪│┘Å┘Ç┘å┘æ┘Ä╪⌐┘É ╪▒┘Ä╪│┘Ç┘ê┘ä┘É ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç
play_arrow
share
video_library
Bismill─ühwa `al─ü sunnati Ras┼½lill─üh.
With the Name of Allah, and according to the Sunnah of the Messenger of Allah.
Reference:
Abu Dawud 3/314 with an authentic chain. Ahmad also recorded it with the wording: With the Name of Allah, and according to the religion of the Messenger of Allah. Its chain is also authentic.
Hisnul Muslim 163
Chapter 59: After burying the deceased
1 du'a
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪º╪║┘Æ┘ü┘É╪▒┘Æ ┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪½┘Ä╪¿┘É┘æ╪¬┘Æ┘ç┘Å
play_arrow
share
video_library
All─ühummaΓÇÖghfir lahAll─ühumma thabbitΓÇÖh.
O Allah, forgive him. O Allah, strengthen him.
Reference:
The Prophet (∩╖║) used to stop after burying the dead and say to the people: "Ask Allah to forgive your brother and pray for him to be strengthened, for indeed he is now being questioned." Abu Dawud 3/315, and Al-Hakim 1/370 who graded it authentic and Ath-Thahabi agreed.
Hisnul Muslim 164
Chapter 60: Visiting the graves
1 du'a
╪º┘ä╪│┘æ┘Ä┘ä╪º┘à┘Å ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ┘â┘Å┘à┘Æ ╪ú┘Ä┘ç┘Æ┘ä┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪»┘æ┘É┘è╪º╪▒┘É ┘à┘É┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘à╪ñ┘Æ┘à┘É┘å┘è┘Ç┘å┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Æ┘à┘Å╪│┘Æ┘ä┘É┘à┘è┘å ┘ê┘Ä╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ╪º ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘Æ ╪┤╪º╪í┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘Å ╪¿┘É┘â┘Å┘Ç┘à┘Æ ┘ä╪º╪¡┘É┘é┘Ç┘ê┘å ┘å┘Ä╪│┘Æ┘Ç╪º┘Ä┘ä┘Å ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘Ä ┘ä┘å┘Ç╪º ┘ê┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘â┘Å┘Ç┘à┘Æ ╪º┘ä╪╣┘Ç╪º┘ü┘É┘è┘Ä╪⌐
play_arrow
share
video_library
Assal─ümu `alaykum ahlad-diy─üri minal-mu'min─½na wa ΓÇÿl-muslim─½n. wa inn─ü in sh─ü' All─ühu bikum l─üß╕Ñiq┼½nnas'alull─üha lan─ü wa lakumul-`─üfiyah.
Peace be upon you, people of this abode, from among the believers and those who are Muslims, and we, by the Will of Allah, shall be joining you.[May Allah have mercy on the first of us and the last of us] I ask Allah to grant us and you well-being.
Reference:
Muslim 2/671, Ibn Majah 1/494, the portion brackets is from Muslim 2/671.
Hisnul Muslim 165
Chapter 61: During a wind storm
2 du'as
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘Ä┘Ç┘è ╪ú┘Ä╪│┘Æ┘Ç╪ú┘Ä┘ä┘Å┘Ç┘â┘Ä ╪«┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘Ç╪▒┘Ä┘ç╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Ç┘ê╪░┘Å ╪¿┘É┘â┘Ä ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ╪┤┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘æ┘É┘ç╪º
play_arrow
share
video_library
All─ühumma inn─½ as'aluka khayrah─ü. wa a`┼½dhu bika min sharrih─ü.
O Allah, I ask You for the good of it, and seek refuge in You against its evil.
Reference:
Abu Dawud 4/326, Ibn Majah 2/1228. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah 2/305.
Hisnul Muslim 166
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘Ä┘Ç┘è ╪ú┘Ä╪│┘Æ┘Ç╪ú┘Ä┘ä┘Å┘Ç┘â┘Ä ╪«┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘Ç╪▒┘Ä┘ç╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪«┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘Ç╪▒┘Ä ┘à╪º ┘ü┘è┘ç┘Ç╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪«┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘Ç╪▒┘Ä ┘à╪º ╪º┘Å╪▒┘Æ╪│┘É┘ä┘Ä┘Ç╪¬┘Æ ╪¿┘É┘ç ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Ç┘ê╪░┘Å ╪¿┘É┘â┘Ä ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ╪┤┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘æ┘É┘ç╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪┤┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘æ┘É ┘à╪º ┘ü┘è┘ç┘Ç╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪┤┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘æ┘É ┘à╪º ╪º┘Å╪▒┘Æ╪│┘É┘ä┘Ä┘Ç╪¬┘Æ ╪¿┘É┘ç

video_library
All─ühumma inn─½ as'aluka khayrah─ü. wa khayra m─ü f─½h─ü. wa khayra m─ü ursilat bih. wa a`┼½dhu bika min sharrih─ü. wa sharri m─ü f─½h─ü. wa sharri m─ü ursilat bih.
O Allah, I ask You for the good of it, for the good of what it contains, and for the good of what is sent with it. I seek refuge in You from the evil of it, from the evil of what it contains, and from the evil that is sent with it.
Reference:
Muslim 2/616, Al-Bukhari 4/76.
Hisnul Muslim 167
Chapter 62: Upon hearing thunder
1 du'a
╪│┘Å╪¿┘Æ┘Ç╪¡╪º┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘æ╪░┘è ┘è┘Å╪│┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘É┘Ç╪¡┘Å ╪º┘ä┘Ç╪▒┘æ┘Ä╪╣┘Æ╪»┘Å ╪¿┘É╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘É┘ç┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘à┘ä╪º╪ª┘É┘â┘Ç╪⌐┘Å ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ╪«┘è┘Ç┘ü┘Ä╪¬┘ç
play_arrow
share
video_library
Subß╕Ñ─üna ΓÇÿl-ladh─½ yusabbiß╕Ñur-ra`du bi ß╕Ñamdihiwa ΓÇÿl-mal─ü'ikatu min kh─½fatih.
Glory is to Him Whom thunder and angels glorify due to fear of Him.
Reference:
Whenever Abdullah bin Zubair (RA) would hear thunder, he would abandon all conversation and say this supplication. See Al-Muwatta' 2/992. It was graded authentic by Al-Albani as a statement of Abdullah bin Zubayr only.
Hisnul Muslim 168
Chapter 63: For rain
3 du'as
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪º╪│┘Æ┘é┘É┘Ç┘å╪º ╪║┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘Ç╪½╪º┘ï ┘à┘Å╪║┘è┘Ç╪½╪º┘ï ┘à┘Ä╪▒┘è╪ª╪º┘ï ┘à┘Å╪▒┘è┘Ç╪╣╪º┘ï ┘å╪º┘ü┘É╪╣┘Ç╪º┘ï ╪║┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘Ç╪▒┘Ä ╪╢╪º╪▒ ╪╣╪º╪¼┘É┘Ç┘ä╪º┘ï ╪║┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ╪▒┘Ä ╪ó╪¼┘É┘ä

All─ühumma ΓÇÿasqin─ü ghaythan mugh─½than mar─½'an mur─½`a, n─üfi`an ghayra ß╕ì─ürr, `─üjilan ghayra ─üjil.
O Allah, shower upon us abundant rain, beneficial not harmful, swiftly and not delayed.
Reference:
Abu Dawud 1/303. See also Al-Albani SahihAbu Dawud 1/216.
Hisnul Muslim 169
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪ú╪║┘É╪½┘Æ┘å┘Ç╪º ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪ú╪║┘É╪½┘Æ┘å┘Ç╪º ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪ú╪║┘É╪½┘Æ┘å┘Ç╪º

All─ühumma aghithn─ü, All─ühumma aghithn─ü, All─ühumma aghithn─ü.
O Allah, send us rain. O Allah, send us rain. O Allah, send us rain.
Reference:
Al-Bukhari 1/224, Muslim 2/613.
Hisnul Muslim 170
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪º╪│┘Æ┘é┘É ╪╣┘É╪¿╪º╪»┘Ä┘â┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪¿┘Ä┘ç┘Ç╪º╪ª┘É┘à┘Ä┘â ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘å┘Æ╪┤┘Å┘Ç╪▒┘Æ ╪▒┘Ä╪¡┘Æ┘à┘Ä┘Ç╪¬┘Ä┘â┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä╪¡┘Æ┘è┘É┘è ╪¿┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘Ç╪»┘Ä┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘à┘Ä┘è┘æ┘É┘Ç╪¬

All─ühummaΓÇÖsqi `ib─üdaka wa bah─ü'imak. wanshur raß╕Ñmatak. wa aß╕Ñyi baladaka ΓÇÿl-mayyit
O Allah, give water to Your slaves, and Your livestock, and spread Your mercy, and revive Your dead land.
Reference:
Abu Dawud 1/305. Al-Albani graded it good in Sahih Abu Dawud 1/218.
Hisnul Muslim 171
Chapter 64: When it rains

All─ühumma ß╣úayyiban n─üfi`a.
O Allah, (bring) beneficial rain clouds.
Reference:
Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 2/518.
Hisnul Muslim 172
Chapter 65: After rainfall
1 du'a
┘à┘Å╪╖┘É┘Ç╪▒┘Æ┘å╪º ╪¿┘É┘ü┘Ä╪╢┘Æ┘Ç┘ä┘É ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪▒┘Ä╪¡┘Æ┘à┘Ä┘Ç╪¬┘É┘ç

Muß╣¡irn─ü bifaß╕ìlill─ühi wa raß╕Ñmatih.
We have been given rain by the grace and mercy of Allah.

Hisnul Muslim 173
Chapter 66: Asking for clear skies
1 du'a
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪¡┘Ä┘ê╪º┘ä┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘å╪º ┘ê┘Ä┘ä╪º ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘Ç┘å╪º ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘ë ╪º┘ä╪ó┘â┘Ç╪º┘à┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä╪╕┘æ┘É┘Ç╪▒╪º╪¿ ┘ê┘Ä╪¿┘Å╪╖┘Ç┘ê┘å┘É ╪º┘ä╪ú┘ê┘Æ╪»┘É┘è╪⌐ ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘Ä┘å┘Ç╪º╪¿┘É╪¬┘É ╪º┘ä╪┤┘æ┘Ä╪¼┘Ç╪▒
play_arrow
