video_library
All─ühumma ß╕Ñaw─ülayn─ü wa l─ü `alayn─ü. All─ühumma `ala ΓÇÿl-─ük─ümi waß║ô-ß║ôir─üb. wa buß╣¡┼½ni ΓÇÿl-awdiyati, wa man─übitish-shajar.
O Allah, let the rain fall around us and not upon us, O Allah, (let it fall) on the pastures, hills, valleys, and the roots of trees.
Reference:
Al-Bukhari 1/224, Muslim 1/614
Hisnul Muslim 174
Chapter 67: Upon sighting the crescent moon
1 du'a
╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘Å ╪ú┘Ä┘â┘Æ┘Ç╪¿┘Ä╪▒ ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä┘ç┘É┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘Ç┘ç┘Å ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘Ç┘å╪º ╪¿┘É╪º┘ä╪ú┘à┘Æ┘Ç┘å┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä╪Ñ┘è┘à┘Ç╪º┘å ┘ê╪º┘ä╪│┘æ┘Ä┘ä╪º┘à┘Ä┘Ç╪⌐┘É ┘ê╪º┘ä╪Ñ╪│┘Æ┘ä╪º┘à ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä╪¬┘æ┘Ä┘Ç┘ê┘Æ┘ü┘è┘Ç┘é┘É ┘ä┘É┘à╪º ╪¬┘Å╪¡┘É┘Ç╪¿┘æ┘Å ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Ä┘å┘Ç╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪¬┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘Æ╪╢┘Ç┘ë ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Å┘å┘Ç╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Å┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç
play_arrow
share
video_library
All─ühu Akbar. All─ühumma ahillahu `alayna bi ΓÇÿl-amni wa ΓÇÿl-─½m─ün. was-sal─ümati wa ΓÇÿl-'Isl─üm. wat-tawf─½qi lim─ü tuß╕Ñibbu Rabban─ü wa tarß╕ì─ü. Rabbun─ü wa Rabbukall─üh.
Allah is the Most Great. O Allah, bring us the new moon with security and Faith, with peace and in Islam, and in harmony with what our Lord loves and what pleases Him. Our Lord and your Lord is Allah.
Reference:
At-Tirmidhi 5/504, Ad-Darimi 1/336. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/157.
Hisnul Muslim 175
Chapter 68: Upon breaking fast
2 du'as
╪░┘Ä┘ç┘Ä┘Ç╪¿┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪╕┘æ┘Ä┘à┘Ä┘Ç╪ú┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪º╪¿┘Æ╪¬┘Ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘Ç╪¬┘É ╪º┘ä╪╣┘Å┘Ç╪▒┘ê┘é ┘ê┘Ä╪½┘Ä╪¿┘Ä┘Ç╪¬┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪ú╪¼┘Æ┘Ç╪▒┘Å ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘Æ ╪┤┘Ç╪º╪í┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç
play_arrow
share
video_library
Dhahabaß║ô-ß║ôama'. wabtallati ΓÇÿl-`ur┼½q. wa thabata ΓÇÿl-'ajru in sh─ü All─üh.
The thirst is gone, the veins are moistened, and the reward is confirmed, if Allah wills.
Reference:
Abu Dawud 2/306 and others. See also Al- Albani, Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 4/209.
Hisnul Muslim 176
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘Ä┘Ç┘è ╪ú┘Ä╪│┘Æ┘Ç╪ú┘Ä┘ä┘Å┘Ç┘â┘Ä ╪¿┘É╪▒┘Ä╪¡┘Æ┘à┘Ä┘Ç╪¬┘É┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘æ╪¬┘è ┘ê┘Ä╪│┘É┘Ç╪╣┘Ä╪¬ ┘â┘Å┘ä┘æ┘Ä ╪┤┘è╪í ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ ╪¬┘Ä╪║┘Æ┘Ç┘ü┘É╪▒┘Ä ┘ä┘è
play_arrow
share
video_library
All─ühumma inn─½ as'alukabi raß╕Ñmatika ΓÇÿl-lat─½ wasi`at kulla shay'an taghfira l─½.
O Allah, I ask You by Your mercy, which encompasses all things, that You forgive me.
Reference:
Ibn Majah 1/557 from a supplication of Abdullah bin 'Amr. Al-Hafidh graded it as good in his checking of An-Nawawi's Kitabul-'Athkdr. See Sharhul- Athkar 4/342.
Hisnul Muslim 177
Chapter 69: Before eating
2 du'as
╪¿╪│┘à┘É ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘É ┘ü┘É┘è ╪ú┘Ä┘ê┘æ┘Ä┘ä┘É┘ç┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪ó╪«┘É╪▒┘É┘ç┘É
play_arrow
share
video_library
When anyone of you begins eating, say:Bismill─üh. And if you forget then when you remember, say:Bismill─ühi f─½ awwalihi wa ─ükhirih.
When anyone of you begins eating, say: With the Name of Allah. And if you forget then, when you remember, say: With the Name of Allah, in the beginning, and in the end.
Reference:
Abu Dawud 3/347, At-Tirmidhi 4/288. See Al- Albani's Sahih At-Tirmidhi 2/167.
Hisnul Muslim 178
'╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪¿┘Ä╪º╪▒┘É┘â┘Æ ┘ä┘Ä┘å┘Ä╪º ┘ü┘É┘è┘ç┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä╪╖┘Æ╪╣┘É┘à┘Æ┘å┘Ä╪º ╪«┘Ä┘è┘Æ╪▒╪º┘ï ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ┘ç┘Å' '╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪¿┘Ä╪º╪▒┘É┘â┘Æ ┘ä┘Ä┘å┘Ä╪º ┘ü┘É┘è┘ç┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪▓┘É╪»┘Æ┘å┘Ä╪º ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ┘ç┘Å'
play_arrow
share
video_library
Whomever Allah has given food, should say:All─ühumma b─ürik lan─ü f─½hi. wa aß╣¡`imn─ü khayran minh. Whomever Allah has given milk to drink, should say :All─ühumma b─ürik lan─ü f─½hi. wa zidn─ü minh.
Whomever Allah has given food, should say: O Allah, bless us in it and provide us with better than it. Whomever Allah has given milk to drink, should say: O Allah, bless us in it and give us more of it.
Reference:
At-Tirmidhi 5/506. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/158.
Hisnul Muslim 179
Chapter 70: Upon completing the meal
2 du'as
╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘Å ┘ä┘ä┘ç┘É ╪º┘ä┘æ┘Ä╪░┘è ╪ú┘Ä╪╖┘Æ╪╣┘Ä┘à┘Ä┘å┘Ç┘è ┘ç┘Ç╪░╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪▒┘Ä╪▓┘Ä┘é┘Ä┘å┘Ç┘è┘ç┘É ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ╪║┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ╪▒┘É ╪¡┘Ä┘ê┘Æ┘ä┘ì ┘à┘É┘å┘æ┘É┘è ┘ê┘Ä┘ä╪º ┘é┘Å┘ê┘æ┘Ä╪⌐
play_arrow
share
video_library
Alhamdu lill─ühi ΓÇÿl-ladh─½ aß╣¡`aman─½ h─üdh─ü. wa razaqan─½hi min ghayri ß╕Ñawlin minn─½ wa l─ü quwwah.
Praise is to Allah Who has given me this food, and sustained me with it though I was unable to do it and powerless.
Reference:
At-Tirmidhi, Abu Dawud, and Ibn Majah. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/159.
Hisnul Muslim 180
╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘Å ┘ä┘ä┘ç┘É ╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ┘Ç╪»╪º┘ï ┘â┘Ä╪½┘Ç┘è╪▒╪º┘ï ╪╖┘Ä┘è┘æ┘É┘Ç╪¿╪º┘ï ┘à┘Å╪¿┘Ç╪º╪▒┘Ä┘â╪º┘ï ┘ü┘è┘ç ╪║┘Ä┘è┘Æ╪▒┘Ä ┘à┘Ä┘â┘Æ┘ü┘É┘è┘æ┘ì ┘ê┘Ä┘ä╪º ┘à┘Å┘ê┘Ä╪»┘æ┘Ä╪╣┘ì ┘ê┘Ä┘ä╪º ┘à┘Å╪│┘Æ╪¬┘Ä╪║┘Æ┘Ç┘å┘ë┘ï ╪╣┘Ä┘å┘Æ┘Ç┘ç┘Å ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Ä┘Ç┘å╪º
play_arrow
share
video_library
Alhamdu lill─ühi ß╕Ñamdan kath─½ran tayyiban mub─ürakan f─½h. ghayra makfiyyin wa l─ü muwadda`in. wa l─ü mustaghnan `anhu Rabban─ü.
All praise is to Allah, praise in abundance, good and blessed. It cannot [be compensated for, nor can it] be left, nor can it be done without, our Lord.
Reference:
Al-Bukhari 6/214, At-Tirmidhi 5/507.
Hisnul Muslim 181
Chapter 71: Of the guest for the host
1 du'a
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪¿╪º╪▒┘É┘â┘Æ ┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘à┘Æ ┘ü┘è┘à╪º ╪▒┘Ä╪▓┘Ä┘é┘Æ┘Ç╪¬┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘à ┘ê┘Ä╪º╪║┘Æ┘ü┘É┘Ç╪▒┘Æ ┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘Æ ┘ê┘Ä╪º╪▒┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ┘ç┘Å┘à┘Æ

All─ühumma b─ürik lahum f─½ m─ü razaqtahum. waghΓÇÖfir lahum warß╕Ñamhum.
O Allah, bless them in what You have provided for them, and forgive them and have mercy on them.
Reference:

Hisnul Muslim 182
Chapter 72: To one who intends to give food or drink
1 du'a
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä╪╖┘Æ╪╣┘É┘à┘Æ ┘à┘Ä┘å ╪ú┘Ä╪╖┘Æ╪╣┘Ä┘à┘Ä┘å┘è ┘ê┘Ä╪º╪│┘Æ┘é┘É ┘à┘Ä┘å ╪│┘é╪º┘å┘è

O Allah, feed the one who has fed me, and give drink to the one who has given me drink.
Reference:
Muslim 3/126.
Hisnul Muslim 183
Chapter 73: When breaking fast in someoneΓÇÖs home
1 du'a
╪ú┘Ä┘ü┘Æ╪╖┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘Ä ╪╣┘É┘å┘Æ╪»┘Ä┘â┘Å┘à ╪º┘ä╪╡┘æ┘Ç╪º╪ª┘É┘à┘ê┘å┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä┘â┘Ä┘ä┘Ä ╪╖┘Ä╪╣╪º┘à┘Ä┘Ç┘â┘Å┘à┘Å ╪º┘ä╪ú╪¿┘Æ┘Ç╪▒╪º╪▒ ┘ê┘Ä╪╡┘Ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘Ç╪¬┘Æ ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ┘â┘Å┘à┘Å ╪º┘ä┘à┘ä╪º╪ª┘É┘â┘Ä┘Ç╪⌐
play_arrow
share
video_library
Afß╣¡ara `indakumuß╣ú-ß╣ú─ü'im┼½n. wa akala ß╣¡a`─ümakumu ΓÇÿl-'abr─ür. wa ß╣úallat `alaykumu ΓÇÿl-mal─ü'ikah.
With you, those who are fasting have broken their fast, you have fed those who are righteous, and the angels recite their prayers upon you.
Reference:
Abu Dawud 3/367, Ibn Majah 1/556, An-Nasa'i, 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah 296-8. Al-Albani graded it authentic in Sahih Abu Dawud 2/730.
Hisnul Muslim 184
Chapter 74: By one fasting when presented with food and does not break his fast
recommendation
When you are invited (to eat) then reply to the invitation. If you are fasting then invoke Allah's blessings (on your host), and if you are not fasting then eat.
(╪Ñ┘É╪░┘Ä╪º ╪»┘Å╪╣┘É┘è┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä╪¡┘Ä╪»┘Å┘â┘Å┘à┘Æ ┘ü┘Ä┘ä┘Æ┘è┘Å╪¼┘É╪¿┘Æ ┘ü┘Ä╪Ñ┘É┘å┘Æ ┘â┘Ä╪º┘å┘Ä ╪╡┘Ä╪º╪ª┘É┘à╪º┘ï ┘ü┘Ä┘ä┘Æ┘è┘Å╪╡┘Ä┘ä┘æ┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪Ñ┘É┘å┘Æ ┘â┘Ä╪º┘å┘Ä ┘à┘Å┘ü┘Æ╪╖┘É╪▒╪º┘ï ┘ü┘Ä┘ä┘Æ┘è┘Ä╪╖┘Æ╪╣┘Ä┘à┘Æ) ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘Ä╪╣┘Æ┘å┘Ä┘ë ┘ü┘Ä┘ä┘Æ┘è┘Å╪╡┘Ä┘ä┘æ┘É ╪ú┘Ä┘è┘Æ ┘ü┘Ä┘ä┘Æ┘è┘Ä╪»┘Æ╪╣┘Å.
play_arrow
share
video_library
Reference:
Muslim 2/1054.
Hisnul Muslim 185
Chapter 75: When insulted while fasting
1 du'a
╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘É┘è ╪╡┘Ä╪º╪ª┘É┘à┘î ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘É┘è ╪╡┘Ä╪º╪ª┘É┘à┘î
play_arrow
share
video_library
Inn─½ ß╣ú─ü'im. inn─½ ß╣ú─ü'im.
I am fasting. I am fasting.
Reference:
Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-BAri 4/103, Muslim 2/806.
Hisnul Muslim 186
Chapter 76: Upon seeing the early or premature fruit
1 du'a
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪¿╪º╪▒┘É┘â┘Æ ┘ä┘Ä┘å╪º ┘ü┘è ╪½┘Ä┘à┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘É┘å╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪¿╪º╪▒┘É┘â┘Æ ┘ä┘Ä┘å╪º ┘ü┘è ┘à┘Ä╪»┘è┘å┘Ä╪¬┘É┘å┘Ç╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪¿╪º╪▒┘É┘â┘Æ ┘ä┘Ä┘å╪º ┘ü┘è ╪╡╪º╪╣┘É┘å┘Ç╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪¿╪º╪▒┘É┘â┘Æ ┘ä┘Ä┘å╪º ┘ü┘è ┘à┘Å╪»┘æ┘É┘å╪º
play_arrow
share
video_library
Allahumma b─ürik lan─ü f─½ thamarin─ü. wa b─ürik lan─ü f─½ mad─½natin─üwa b─ürik lan─ü f─½ ß╣ú─ü`in─ü. wa b─ürik lan─ü f─½ muddin─ü.
O Allah, bless us in our dates and bless us in our town, bless us in our Sa' and in our Mudd.
Reference:
Muslim 2/1000 (Sa' and Mudd are both dry measures used for agricultural produce by the Arabs in the Prophet's time. Of the two, the So.' was the larger measure.) (Translator)
Hisnul Muslim 187
Chapter 77: Upon sneezing
1 du'a
╪Ñ┘É╪░┘Ä╪º ╪╣┘Ä╪╖┘Ä╪│┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä╪¡┘Ä╪»┘Å┘â┘Å┘à ┘ü┘Ä┘ä┘Æ┘è┘Ä┘é┘Å┘ä┘É
(╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ╪»┘Å ┘ä┘É┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘É)
┘ê┘Ä┘ä┘Æ┘è┘Ä┘é┘Å┘ä┘Æ ┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪ú┘Ä╪«┘Å┘ê┘ç┘Å ╪ú┘Ä┘ê┘Æ ╪╡┘Ä╪º╪¡┘É╪¿┘Å┘ç┘Å: (┘è┘Ä╪▒┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Å┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å)
┘ü┘Ä╪Ñ┘É╪░┘Ä╪º ┘é┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Ä ┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Å: (┘è┘Ä╪▒╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Å┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å) ┘ü┘Ä┘ä┘Æ┘è┘Ä┘é┘Å┘ä┘Æ:
(┘è┘Ä┘ç┘Æ╪»┘É┘è┘â┘Å┘à┘Å ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä┘è┘Å╪╡┘Æ┘ä┘É╪¡┘Å ╪¿┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Ä┘â┘Å┘à┘Æ)
play_arrow
share
video_library
When you sneeze, say: Alß╕Ñamdulill─üh
Your companion should say: Yarß╕Ñamukall─üh
When someone says Yarß╕Ñamukall─üh to you then you should say:
Yahd─½kumu ΓÇÿll─ühu wa yuß╣úliß╕Ñu b─ülakum.
When you sneeze, then say: All praises and thanks are to Allah.
Your companion should say: May Allah have mercy upon you.
When someone says Yarß╕Ñamukall─üh to you then you should say:
May Allah guide you and set your affairs in order.
Reference:
Al-Bukhari 7/125.
Hisnul Muslim 188
Chapter 78: When a disbeliever praises Allah after sneezing
1 du'a
┘è┘Ä┘ç┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘è┘â┘Å┘Ç┘à┘Å ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä┘è┘Å╪╡┘Æ┘Ç┘ä┘É╪¡┘Å ╪¿╪º┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘â┘Å┘à
play_arrow
share
video_library
Yahd─½kumull─ühu wa yuß╣úliß╕Ñu b─ülakum.
May Allah guide you and set your affairs in order
Reference:
At-Tirmidhi 5/82, Ahmad 4/400, Abu Dawud 4/ 308. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 2/354.
Hisnul Muslim 189
Chapter 79: To the newlywed
1 du'a
╪¿╪º╪▒┘Ä┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å ┘ä┘Ä┘â ┘ê┘Ä╪¿╪º╪▒┘Ä┘â┘Ä ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ┘â ┘ê┘Ä╪¼┘Ä┘à┘Ä╪╣┘Ä ╪¿┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘Ç┘å┘Ä┘â┘Å┘à╪º ┘ü┘è ╪«┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ╪▒
play_arrow
share
video_library
B─ürakall─ühu lak. wa b─üraka `alayk. wa jama`a baynakum─ü f─½ khayr.
May Allah bless you, and shower His blessings upon you, and join you together in goodness.
Reference:
Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah and At-Tirmidhi. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 1/316.
Hisnul Muslim 190
Chapter 80: On the wedding night or when buying an animal
1 du'a
╪Ñ┘É╪░┘Ä╪º ╪¬┘Ä╪▓┘Ä┘ê┘æ┘Ä╪¼┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä╪¡┘Ä╪»┘Å┘â┘Å┘à┘Å ╪º┘à┘Æ╪▒┘Ä╪ú┘Ä╪⌐┘ï ╪ú┘Ä┘ê┘Æ ╪Ñ┘É╪░┘Ä╪º ╪º╪┤┘Æ╪¬┘Ä╪▒┘Ä┘ë ╪«┘Ä╪º╪»┘É┘à╪º┘ï ┘ü┘Ä┘ä┘Æ┘è┘Ä┘é┘Å┘ä┘Æ:
(╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘É┘è ╪ú┘Ä╪│┘Æ╪ú┘Ä┘ä┘Å┘â┘Ä ╪«┘Ä┘è┘Æ╪▒┘Ä┘ç┘Ä╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪«┘Ä┘è┘Æ╪▒┘Ä ┘à┘Ä╪º ╪¼┘Ä╪¿┘Ä┘ä┘Æ╪¬┘Ä┘ç┘Ä╪º ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘ç┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Å┘ê╪░┘Å ╪¿┘É┘â┘Ä ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ╪┤┘Ä╪▒┘æ┘É┘ç┘Ä╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪┤┘Ä╪▒┘æ┘É ┘à┘Ä╪º ╪¼┘Ä╪¿┘Ä┘ä┘Æ╪¬┘Ä┘ç┘Ä╪º ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘ç┘É)
┘ê┘Ä╪Ñ┘É╪░┘Ä╪º ╪º╪┤┘Æ╪¬┘Ä╪▒┘Ä┘ë ╪¿┘Ä╪╣┘É┘è╪▒╪º┘ï ┘ü┘Ä┘ä┘Æ┘è┘Ä╪ú┘Æ╪«┘Å╪░┘Æ ╪¿┘É╪░┘É╪▒┘Æ┘ê┘Ä╪⌐┘É ╪│┘Ä┘å┘Ä╪º┘à┘É┘ç┘É ┘ê┘Ä┘ä┘Æ┘è┘Ä┘é┘Å┘ä┘Æ ┘à┘É╪½┘Æ┘ä┘Ä ╪░┘Ä┘ä┘É┘â┘Ä.
play_arrow
share
video_library
All─ühumma inn─½ as'aluka khayrah─üwa khayra m─ü jabaltah─ü `alayh. wa a`┼½dhu bika min sharrih─üwa sharri m─ü jabaltah─ü `alayh.
When any of you marries a woman or purchases a maid-servant then let him say:
O Allah, I ask You for the goodness of her, and the goodness upon which You have created her, and I seek refuge in You from the evil of her, and from the evil upon which You have created her. If you purchase a camel then take hold of the top of its hump and say the same.
Reference:
Abu Dawud 2/248 and Ibn Majah 1/617. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah 1/324.
Hisnul Muslim 191
Chapter 81: Before sexual intercourse with the wife
1 du'a
╪¿┘É╪│┘Æ┘à┘É ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪¼┘Ä┘å┘æ┘É╪¿┘Æ┘å╪º ╪º┘ä╪┤┘æ┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘Ç╪╖╪º┘å┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪¼┘Ä┘å┘æ┘É╪¿┘É ╪º┘ä╪┤┘æ┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ╪╖╪º┘å┘Ä ┘à╪º ╪▒┘Ä╪▓┘Ä┘é┘Æ┘Ç╪¬┘Ä┘å╪º
play_arrow
share
video_library
Bismill─üh. All─ühumma jannibnash-Shayß╣¡─ün. wa jannibish-Shayß╣¡─üna m─ü razaqtan─ü.
With the Name of Allah. O Allah, keep the Devil away from us, and keep the Devil away from that which You provide for us.
Reference:
Al-Bukhari 6/141, Muslim 2/1028.
Hisnul Muslim 192
Chapter 82: When angry
1 du'a
╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Ç┘ê╪░┘Å ╪¿┘É╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘É ┘à┘É┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪┤┘æ┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘Ç╪╖╪º┘å┘É ╪º┘ä╪▒┘æ┘Ä╪¼┘è┘Ç┘à
play_arrow
share
video_library
A`┼½dhu bill─ühi minash-Shayß╣¡─ünir-raj─½m.
I seek refuge in Allah from Satan the outcast.
Reference:
Al-Bukhari 7/99, Muslim 4/2015.
Hisnul Muslim 193
Chapter 83: Upon seeing someone in trial or tribulation
1 du'a
╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘Å ┘ä┘ä┘ç┘É ╪º┘ä┘æ╪░┘è ╪╣╪º┘ü╪º┘å┘è ┘à┘É┘à┘æ╪º ╪º╪¿┘Æ╪¬┘Ä┘Ç┘ä╪º┘â┘Ä ╪¿┘É┘ç┘É ┘ê┘Ä┘ü┘Ä╪╢┘æ┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘å┘è ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘ë ┘â┘Ä╪½┘è┘Ç╪▒┘ì ┘à┘É┘à┘æ┘Ä┘å┘Æ ╪«┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘é┘Ä ╪¬┘Ä┘ü┘Æ╪╢┘Ç┘è┘ä╪º
play_arrow
share
video_library
Alhamdu lill─ühi ΓÇÿl-ladh─½ `─üf─ün─½ mimmab-tal─üka bihiwa faß╕ìß╕ìalan─½ `al─ü kath─½rin mimman khalaqa tafß╕ì─½l─ü.
Praise is to Allah Who has spared me what He has afflicted you with, and preferred me greatly above much of what He has created.
Reference:
At-Tirmidhi 5/493,4. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/153.
Hisnul Muslim 194
Chapter 84: At a sitting or gathering
1 du'a
Ibn Umar (ra) said: Allah's Messenger (∩╖║) used to repeat in a single sitting:
╪╣┘å ╪º╪¿┘å ╪╣┘à╪▒ ┘é╪º┘ä : ┘â╪º┘å ┘è╪╣╪» ┘ä╪▒╪│┘ê┘ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪╡┘ä┘ë ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪╣┘ä┘è┘ç ┘ê╪│┘ä┘à ┘ü┘è ╪º┘ä┘à╪¼┘ä╪│ ╪º┘ä┘ê╪º╪¡╪» ┘à╪º╪ª╪⌐ ┘à╪▒╪⌐ ┘à┘å ┘é╪¿┘ä ╪ú┘å ┘è┘é┘ê┘à '╪▒╪¿ ╪º╪║┘ü╪▒ ┘ä┘è ┘ê╪¬╪¿ ╪╣┘ä┘è ╪Ñ┘å┘â ╪ú┘å╪¬ ╪º┘ä╪¬┘ê╪º╪¿ ╪º┘ä╪║┘ü┘ê╪▒
play_arrow
share
video_library
RabbighΓÇÖfir l─½wa tub `alayyinnaka antat-Taww─übu ΓÇÿl-Ghaf┼½r.
Ibn Umar (ra) said: Allah's Messenger (∩╖║) used to repeat in a single sitting: My Lord, forgive me, and accept my repentance, You are the Ever-Relenting, the All-Forgiving.
Reference:
Sahih Ibn Majah 2/321. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/153.
Hisnul Muslim 195
Chapter 85: For the expiation of sins, said at the conclusion of a sitting or gathering
1 du'a
╪│┘Å╪¿┘Æ╪¡┘Ç╪º┘å┘Ä┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪¿┘É╪¡┘Ä┘à╪»┘É┘â ╪ú┘Ä╪┤┘Æ┘ç┘Ä┘Ç╪»┘Å ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ ┘ä╪º ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ╪¬┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä╪│┘Æ╪¬┘Ä╪║┘Æ┘ü┘É╪▒┘Å┘â┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä╪¬┘ê╪¿┘Å ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ┘â
play_arrow
share
video_library
Subh─ünaka All─ühumma wa biß╕Ñamdik. ash-hadu an l─ü il─üha ill─ü ant. astaghfiruka wa at─½bu ilayk.
Glory is to You, O Allah, and praise is to You. I bear witness that there is none worthy of worship but You. I seek Your forgiveness and repent to You.
Reference:
Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah, At-Tirmidhi and An-Nasa'i. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/ 153. Aishah (RA) said: "Allah's Messenger (∩╖║) did not sit in a gathering, and did not recite the Qur'an, and did not perform any prayer without concluding by saying ... (then she quoted the above)." This was reported by An-Nasa'i in 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah (no.308), and Dr. Farooq Hamadah graded it authentic in his checking of the same book, p. 273. See also Ahmad 6/77
Hisnul Muslim 196
Chapter 86: Returning a supplication of forgiveness
1 du'a
┘ê┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘â┘Ä
play_arrow
share
video_library
Walaka
And you.
Reference:
Ahmad 5/82, and An-Nasa'i in 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah p. 218, with checking by Dr. Farooq Hamadah.
Hisnul Muslim 197
Chapter 87: To one who does you a favour
1 du'a
╪¼┘Ä╪▓╪º┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘Å ╪«┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ╪▒╪º┘ï
play_arrow
share
video_library
Jaz─ükall─ühu khayra.
May Allah reward you with good.
Reference:
At-Tirmidhi (no. 2035). See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 2/200 and Sahihul-Jami' (no. 6244).
Hisnul Muslim 198
Chapter 88: Protection from the Dajjal
recommendation
Whoever memorizes ten 'Ayat (Verses) from the beginning of Surat Al-Kahf, will be protected from the False Messiah1
if he recites in every prayer after the final Tashahhud before ending the prayer, seeking the protection of Allah from the trials of the False Messiah.
.(┘à┘Ä┘å┘Æ ╪¡┘Ä┘ü┘É╪╕┘Ä ╪╣┘Ä╪┤┘Æ╪▒┘Ä ╪ó┘è┘Ä╪º╪¬┘ì ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ╪ú┘Ä┘ê┘æ┘Ä┘ä┘É ╪│┘Å┘ê╪▒┘Ä╪⌐┘É ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘â┘Ä┘ç┘Æ┘ü┘É ╪╣┘Å╪╡┘É┘à┘Ä ┘à┘É┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪»┘æ┘Ä╪¼┘æ┘Ä╪º┘ä┘É) ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Æ╪º╪│┘Æ╪¬┘É╪╣┘Ä╪º╪░┘Ä╪⌐┘Å ╪¿┘É╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘É ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ┘ü┘É╪¬┘Æ┘å┘Ä╪¬┘É┘ç┘É ╪╣┘Ä┘é┘É╪¿┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪¬┘æ┘Ä╪┤┘Ä┘ç┘æ┘Å╪»┘É ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪ú┘Ä╪«┘É┘è╪▒┘É ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ┘â┘Å┘ä┘æ┘É ╪╡┘Ä┘ä╪º┘Ä╪⌐┘ì.
play_arrow
share
video_library
Reference:
1 Muslim 1/555, another version mentions the last ten 'Ayat, Muslim 1/556. 2 See invocations no. 55 and 56 of this book.
Hisnul Muslim 199
Chapter 89: To one who pronounces his love for you, for AllahΓÇÖs sake
1 du'a
╪ú┘Ä╪¡┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Ä┘Ç┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘æ╪░┘è ╪ú┘Ä╪¡┘Æ╪¿┘Ä╪¿┘Æ┘Ç╪¬┘Ä┘å┘è ┘ä┘Ä┘ç

share
video_library
Aß╕Ñabbaka ΓÇÿlladh─½ aß╕Ñbabtan─½ lah.
May He for Whose sake you love me, love you.
Reference:
Abu Dawud 4/333. Al-Albani graded it good in Sahih Abu Dawud 3/965.

Hisnul Muslim 201
Chapter 91: To the debtor when his debt is settled
1 du'a
╪¿╪º╪▒┘Ä┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘Å ┘ä┘Ä┘â┘Ä ┘ü┘è ╪ú┘Ä┘ç┘Æ┘ä┘É┘â┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä┘à╪º┘ä┘É┘â ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘Ä┘à╪º ╪¼┘Ä┘Ç╪▓╪º╪í┘Å ╪º┘ä╪│┘æ┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘ü┘É ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ╪»┘Å ┘ê╪º┘ä╪ú┘Ä╪»╪º╪í

B─ürakall─ühu laka f─½ ahlika wa m─ülik. innam─ü jaz─ü'us-salafi ΓÇÿl-ß╕Ñamdu waΓÇÿl-ad─ü'.
May Allah bless you in your family and your wealth, surely the reward for a loan is praise and returning (what was borrowed).
Reference:
An-Nasa'i, 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylahp. 300, Ibn Majah 2/809. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah2/55.
Hisnul Muslim 202
Chapter 92: For fear of shirk
1 du'a
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘Ç┘è ╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Ç┘ê╪░┘Å╪¿┘É┘â┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ ╪ú┘Å╪┤┘Æ┘Ç╪▒┘É┘â┘Ä ╪¿┘É┘â┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä┘å╪º ╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Æ┘Ç┘ä┘Ä┘à┘Æ ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä╪│┘Æ╪¬┘Ä┘Ç╪║┘Æ┘ü┘É╪▒┘Å┘â┘Ä ┘ä┘É┘à╪º ┘ä╪º ╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Æ┘Ç┘ä┘Ä┘à

video_library
All─ühumma inn─½ a`┼½dhu bika an ushrika bika wa an─ü a`lam. wa astaghfiruka lim─ü l─ü a`lam.
O Allah, I seek refuge in You lest I associate anything with You knowingly, and I seek Your forgiveness for what I know not.
Reference:
Ahmad 4/403. See also Al-Albani, Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 3/233 and Sahihut-Targhib wat- Tarhib 1/19.

Hisnul Muslim 204
Chapter 94: The scorn of ascribing things to evil omens
1 du'a
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ┘ä╪º ╪╖┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘Ç╪▒┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ ╪╖┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘Ç╪▒┘Å┘â ┘ê┘Ä┘ä╪º ╪«┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ╪▒┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ ╪«┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ╪▒┘Å┘â ┘ê┘Ä┘ä╪º ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘ç┘Ä ╪║┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘Ç╪▒┘Å┘â
play_arrow
share
video_library
All─ühumma l─ü ß╣¡ayra ill─ü ß╣¡ayruk. wa l─ü khayra ill─ü khayruk. wa l─ü il─üha ghayruk.
O Allah there is no portent other than Your portent, no goodness other than Your goodness, and none worthy of worship other than You.
Reference:
Ahmad 2/220, Ibn As-Sunni (no. 292). See also Al-Albani, Silsilatul-'Ahadlth As-Sahihah 3/54, (no. 1065). As for bodings of good, these used to please the Prophet (∩╖║) and so when he heard good words from someone, he used to say: "We have taken from you a good portent from your mouth," Abu Dawud, Ahmad. See also Al-Albani, Silsilatul-'Ahadith As-Sahihah 2/363, and it is with Abu Ash-Shaikh Al-Asfahani in 'Akhlaqun-Nabiyy, pg. 270.
Hisnul Muslim 205
Chapter 95: When mounting an animal or any means of transport
1 du'a
╪¿┘É╪│┘Æ┘Ç┘à┘É ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘Å ┘ä┘ä┘ç ∩┤┐╪│┘Å╪¿┘Æ╪¡┘Ä╪º┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘æ┘Ä╪░┘É┘è ╪│┘Ä╪«┘æ┘Ä╪▒┘Ä ┘ä┘Ä┘å┘Ä╪º ┘ç┘Ä╪░┘Ä╪º ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘Ä╪º ┘â┘Å┘å┘æ┘Ä╪º ┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘à┘Å┘é┘Æ╪▒┘É┘å┘É┘è┘å┘Ä * ┘ê┘Ä╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘Ä╪º ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ä┘ë ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘É┘å┘Ä╪º ┘ä┘Ä┘à┘Å┘å┘é┘Ä┘ä┘É╪¿┘Å┘ê┘å┘Ä∩┤╛ ╪º┘ä╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘Å ┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪º┘ä╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘Å ┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪º┘ä╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘Å ┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘Å ╪ú┘â┘Æ┘Ç╪¿┘Ä╪▒ ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘Å ╪ú┘â┘Æ┘Ç╪¿┘Ä╪▒ ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘Å ╪ú┘â┘Æ┘Ç╪¿┘Ä╪▒ ╪│┘Å┘Ç╪¿┘Æ╪¡╪º┘å┘Ä┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘Å┘Ç┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘è ╪╕┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘à┘Æ╪¬┘Å ┘å┘Ä┘ü┘Æ╪│┘è ┘ü┘Ä╪º╪║┘Æ┘Ç┘ü┘É╪▒┘Æ ┘ä┘è ┘ü┘Ä╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ä╪º ┘è┘Ä╪║┘Æ┘ü┘É┘Ç╪▒┘Å ╪º┘ä╪░┘æ┘Å┘å┘ê╪¿┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ┘Ç╪¬
play_arrow
share
video_library
Bismill─üh. walß╕Ñamdulill─üh. Subß╕Ñ─üna ΓÇÿlladh─½ sakhkhara lan─ü h─üdh─üwa m─ü kunn─ü lahu muqrin─½n. Wa inn─ü il─ü Rabbin─ü lamunqalib┼½n. Alß╕Ñamdulill─üh, alß╕Ñamdulill─üh, alß╕Ñamdulill─üh. All─ühu Akbar, All─ühu Akbar, All─ühu Akbar. Subß╕Ñ─ünaka ΓÇÿll─ühumma inn─½ ß║ôalamtu nafs─½. faghfir l─½. fa innahu l─ü yaghfirudh-dhun┼½ba ill─ü ant.
With the Name of Allah. Praise is to Allah. Glory is to Him Who has provided this for us though we could never have had it by our efforts. Surely, unto our Lord, we are returning. Praise is to Allah. Praise is to Allah. Praise is to Allah. Allah is the Most Great. Allah is the Most Great. Allah is the Most Great. Glory is to You. O Allah, I have wronged my own soul. Forgive me, for surely none forgives sins but You.
Reference:
Abu Dawud 3/34, At-Tirmidhi 5/501. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi3/156.
Hisnul Muslim 206
Chapter 96: For travel
1 du'a
'╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪ú┘Ä┘â┘Æ╪¿┘Ä╪▒┘Å ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪ú┘Ä┘â┘Æ╪¿┘Ä╪▒┘Å ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪ú┘Ä┘â┘Æ╪¿┘Ä╪▒┘Å
∩┤┐╪│┘Å╪¿┘Æ╪¡┘Ä╪º┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘æ┘Ä╪░┘É┘è ╪│┘Ä╪«┘æ┘Ä╪▒┘Ä ┘ä┘Ä┘å┘Ä╪º ┘ç┘Ä╪░┘Ä╪º ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘Ä╪º ┘â┘Å┘å┘æ┘Ä╪º ┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘à┘Å┘é┘Æ╪▒┘É┘å┘É┘è┘å┘Ä *
┘ê┘Ä╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘Ä╪º ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ä┘ë ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘É┘å┘Ä╪º ┘ä┘Ä┘à┘Å┘å┘é┘Ä┘ä┘É╪¿┘Å┘ê┘å┘Ä∩┤╛
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ╪º ┘å┘Ä╪│┘Æ╪ú┘Ä┘ä┘Å┘â┘Ä ┘ü┘É┘è ╪│┘Ä┘ü┘Ä╪▒┘É┘å┘Ä╪º ┘ç┘Ä╪░┘Ä╪º ╪º┘ä╪¿┘É╪▒┘æ┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä╪¬┘æ┘Ä┘é┘Æ┘ê┘Ä┘ë
┘ê┘Ä┘à┘É┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪╣┘Ä┘à┘Ä┘ä┘É ┘à┘Ä╪º ╪¬┘Ä╪▒┘Æ╪╢┘Ä┘ë
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘à┘æ┘Ä ┘ç┘Ä┘ê┘æ┘É┘å┘Æ ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘å┘Ä╪º ╪│┘Ä┘ü┘Ä╪▒┘Ä┘å┘Ä╪º ┘ç┘Ä╪░┘Ä╪º
┘ê┘Ä╪º╪╖┘Æ┘ê┘É ╪╣┘Ä┘å┘Ä┘æ╪º ╪¿┘Å╪╣┘Æ╪»┘Ä┘ç┘Å
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ╪¬┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪╡┘Ä┘æ╪º╪¡┘É╪¿┘Å ┘ü┘É┘è ╪º┘ä╪│┘æ┘Ä┘ü┘Ä╪▒┘É
┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Æ╪«┘Ä┘ä┘è┘ü┘Ä╪⌐┘Å ┘ü┘É┘è ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪ú┘Ä┘ç┘Æ┘ä┘É
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘É┘æ┘è ╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Å┘ê╪░┘Å ╪¿┘É┘â┘Ä ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ┘ê┘Ä╪╣┘Æ╪½┘Ä╪º╪í┘É ╪º┘ä╪│┘æ┘Ä┘ü┘Ä╪▒┘É
┘ê┘Ä┘â┘Ä╪ó╪¿┘Ä╪⌐┘É ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘à┘Ä┘å┘Æ╪╕┘Ä╪▒┘É
┘ê┘Ä╪│┘Å┘ê╪í┘É ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘à┘Å┘å┘Æ┘é┘Ä┘ä┘Ä╪¿┘É ┘ü┘É┘è ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘à┘Ä╪º┘ä┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Æ╪ú┘Ä┘ç┘Æ┘ä┘É'
┘ê╪Ñ╪░╪º ╪▒┘Ä╪¼┘Ä╪╣┘Ä ┘é┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘å┘æ┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪▓┘Ä╪º╪»┘Ä ┘ü┘É┘è┘ç┘É┘å┘æ┘Ä:
'╪ó┘è┘É╪¿┘Å┘ê┘å┘Ä ╪¬╪º╪ª┘É╪¿┘Å┘ê┘å┘Ä ╪╣┘Ä╪º╪¿┘É╪»┘Å┘ê┘å┘Ä
┘ä┘É╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘É┘å┘Ä╪º ╪¡┘Ä╪º┘à┘É╪»┘Å┘ê┘å┘Ä'
play_arrow
share
video_library
All─ühu Akbar, All─ühu Akbar, All─ühu Akbar.
Subß╕Ñ─üna ΓÇÿl-ladhi sakhkhara lan─ü h─üdh─ü
wa m─ü kunn─ü lahu muqrin─½n.
Wa inn─ü il─ü Rabbin─ü lamunqalib┼½n.
All─ühumma inn─ü nas'aluka f─½ safarin─ü h─üdha ΓÇÿl-birra wat-taqw─ü.
Wa mina ΓÇÿl-`amali m─ü tarß╕ì─ü.
All─ühumma hawwin `alayn─ü safaran─ü h─üdh─ü
waß╣¡wi `ann─ü bu`dah.
All─ühumma antas-s─üß╕Ñibu fis-safar.
wa ΓÇÿl-khal─½fatu fil-ahl.
All─ühumma inn─½ a`┼½dhu bika min wa`th─ü'is-safar.
wa ka'─übati ΓÇÿl-manß║ôar.
wa s┼½'il-munqalabi fil-m─üli wa ΓÇÿl-ahl.
(Upon returning recite the same again adding)
─ÇΓÇÖib┼½na, t─ü'ib┼½na, `─übid┼½n. Li Rabbin─ü ß╕Ñ─ümid┼½n.
Allah is the Most Great. Allah is the Most Great. Allah is the Most Great.
Glory is to Him Who has provided this for us
though we could never have had it by our efforts.
Surely, unto our Lord we are returning.
O Allah, we ask You on this our journey for goodness and piety,
and for works that are pleasing to You.
O Allah, lighten this journey for us
and make its distance easy for us.
O Allah, You are our Companion on the road
and the One in Whose care we leave our family.
O Allah, I seek refuge in You from this journey's hardships,
and from the wicked sights in store
and from finding our family and property in misfortune upon returning.

(Upon returning recite the same again adding)
We return repentant to our Lord, worshipping our Lord, and praising our Lord.
Reference:
Muslim 2/978.
Hisnul Muslim 207
Chapter 97: Upon entering a town or village
1 du'a
╪ú┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ç┘ç┘Å┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪│┘æ┘Ä┘Ç┘à┘ê╪º╪¬┘É ╪º┘ä╪│┘æ┘Ç╪¿┘Æ╪╣┘É ┘ê┘Ä┘à╪º ╪ú┘Ä╪╕┘Æ┘ä┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘å ┘ê┘Ä╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪ú┘Ä╪▒╪º╪╢┘è┘Ç┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪│┘æ┘Ç╪¿┘Æ╪╣┘É ┘ê┘Ä┘à╪º ╪ú┘é┘Æ┘ä┘Ä┘ä┘Æ┘Ç┘å ┘ê┘Ä╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪┤┘æ┘Ä┘è┘Ç╪º╪╖┘è┘å┘É ┘ê┘Ä┘à╪º ╪ú┘Ä╪╢┘Æ┘ä┘Ä┘ä┘Æ┘Ç┘å ┘ê┘Ä╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪▒┘æ┘É┘è╪º╪¡┘É ┘ê┘Ä┘à╪º ╪░┘Ä╪▒┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘Ç┘å ╪ú┘Ä╪│┘Æ┘Ç╪ú┘Ä┘ä┘Å┘Ç┘â┘Ä ╪«┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘Ç╪▒┘Ä ┘ç╪░┘ç┘É ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘é┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘Æ┘è┘Ä╪⌐┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪«┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘Ç╪▒┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä┘ç┘Æ┘ä┘É┘Ç┘ç╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪«┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘Ç╪▒┘Ä ┘à╪º ┘ü┘è┘ç╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Ç┘ê╪░┘Å ╪¿┘É┘â┘Ä ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ╪┤┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘æ┘É┘ç╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪┤┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘æ┘É ╪ú┘Ä┘ç┘Æ┘ä┘É┘Ç┘ç╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪┤┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘æ┘É ┘à╪º ┘ü┘è┘ç╪º
play_arrow
share
video_library
All─ühumma Rabbas-sam─üw─ütis-sab`i wa m─ü aß║ôlaln. Wa Rabba ΓÇÿl-ar─üß╕ì─½nas-sab`i wa m─ü aqlaln. wa Rabbash-shay─üß╣¡─½ni wa m─ü aß╕ìlaln. wa Rabbar-riy─üß╕Ñi wa m─ü dharayn. As'aluka khayra h─üdhihi ΓÇÿl-qaryah. wa khayra ahlih─ü. wa khayra m─üf─½h─ü. wa a`┼½dhu bika min sharrih─ü. wa sharri ahlih─ü. wa sharri m─ü f─½h─ü.
O Allah, Lord of the seven heavens and all they overshadow, Lord of the seven worlds and all they uphold, Lord of the devils and all they lead astray, Lord of the winds and all they scatter. I ask You for the goodness of this town, and for the goodness of its people, and for the goodness it contains. I seek refuge in You from its evil, from the evil of its people, and from the evil it contains.
Reference:
Al-Hakim who graded it authentic and Ath-Tfaahabi agreed 2/100, and Ibn As-Sunni (no. 524). Al-Hafidh graded it good in his checking of Al-'Athkdr 5/154. Ibn Baz said in Tuhfatul-'Akhydr p. 37, that An-Nasa'i recorded it with a good chain of narration.
Hisnul Muslim 208
Chapter 98: When entering the market
1 du'a
┘ä╪º ╪Ñ┘ä┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘ä╪º┘æ ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç ┘ê╪¡╪»┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ä╪º ╪┤╪▒┘è┘â┘Ä ┘ä┘ç┘Å ┘ä┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä┘à┘Å┘ä┘Æ┘Ç┘â┘Å ┘ê┘ä┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ┘Ç╪» ┘è┘Å╪¡┘Æ┘è┘Ç┘è ┘ê┘Ä┘è┘Å┘à┘è┘Ç╪¬┘Å ┘ê┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘ê┘Ä ╪¡┘Ä┘è┘æ┘î ┘ä╪º ┘è┘Ä┘à┘Ç┘ê╪¬ ╪¿┘É┘è┘Ä┘Ç╪»┘É┘ç┘É ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪«┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ╪▒┘Å ┘ê┘Ä┘ç┘ê┘Ä ╪╣┘ä┘ë ┘â┘ä┘æ ╪┤┘è╪í┘ì ┘é╪»┘è╪▒
play_arrow
share
video_library
L─ü il─üha illall─ühwaß╕Ñdahu l─ü shar─½ka lah. Lahu ΓÇÿl-mulku wa lahu ΓÇÿl-ß╕Ñamd. Yuß╕Ñy─½ wa yum─½t. wa huwa ß╕Ñayyun l─ü yam┼½t. Biyadihi ΓÇÿl-khayr. wa huwa `al─ü kulli shay'in Qad─½r.
None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner. His is the dominion and His is the praise. He brings life and He causes death, and He is living and does not die. In His Hand is all good, and He is Able to do all things.
Reference:
At-Tirmidhi 5/291, and Al-Hakim 1/538. Al-Albani graded it good in Sahih Ibn Majah 2/21 and Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/152.

Bismill─üh.
With the Name of Allah.
Reference:
Abu Dawud 4/296. Al-Albani graded it authentic in Sahih Abu Dawud 3/941.
Hisnul Muslim 210
Chapter 100: Supplication of the traveller for the resident

╪ú┘Ä╪│┘Æ╪¬┘Ä┘Ç┘ê┘Æ╪»┘É╪╣┘Å┘â┘Å┘Ç┘à┘Å ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘æ┘Ä╪░┘è ┘ä╪º ╪¬┘Ä╪╢┘Ç┘è╪╣┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪»╪º╪ª┘É╪╣┘Å┘Ç┘ç

Astawdi`ukumu ΓÇÿll─üha ΓÇÿl-ladhi l─ü taß╕ì─½`u wad─ü'i`uh.
I place you in the trust of Allah, whose trust is never misplaced.
Reference:
Ahmad 2/403, Ibn Majah 2/943. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah 2/133.
Hisnul Muslim 211
Chapter 101: Supplication of the resident for the traveller
2 du'as
╪ú┘Ä╪│┘Æ╪¬┘Ä┘Ç┘ê┘Æ╪»┘É╪╣┘Å ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Ä ╪»┘è┘Ç┘å┘Ä┘â┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä┘à╪º┘å┘Ä╪¬┘Ä┘Ç┘â┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪«┘Ä┘Ç┘ê╪º╪¬┘è┘Ç┘à┘Ä ╪╣┘Ä┘à┘Ä┘Ç┘ä┘É┘â

video_library
Astawdi`ull─üha d─½nak. wa am─ünatak. wa khaw─üt─½ma `amalik.
I leave your religion in the care of Allah, as well as your safety, and the last of your deeds.
Reference:
Ahmad 2/7, At-Tirmidhi 5/499. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 2/155.
Hisnul Muslim 212
╪▓┘Ä┘ê┘æ┘Ä╪»┘Ä┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä╪¬┘é┘Æ┘ê┘ë ┘ê┘Ä╪║┘Ä┘ü┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘Ä╪░┘Ä┘å┘Æ┘Ç╪¿┘Ä┘â┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä┘è┘Ä╪│┘æ┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘Ä ┘ä┘Ä┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪«┘Ä┘Ç┘è┘Æ╪▒┘Ä ╪¡┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘Ç╪½┘Å┘à╪º ┘â┘Å┘å┘Æ┘Ç╪¬

video_library
Zawwadaka ΓÇÿll─ühut-taqw─ü. wa ghafara dhanbak. wa yassara laka ΓÇÿl-khayra ß╕Ñaythu m─ü kunt.
May Allah give you piety as your provision, forgive your sins, and make goodness easy for you wherever you are.
Reference:
At-Tirmidhi. See Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi, 3/155.
Hisnul Muslim 213
Chapter 102: Takbir and Tasbih during travel
recommendation
Jabir (ra), said: Whenever we went up a hill we would say All─ühu Akbar (Allah is the Most Great) and when we descended we would say Subß╕Ñ─ünall─üh (Glory is to Allah).
┘é┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Ä ╪¼┘Ä╪º╪¿┘É╪▒┘î ╪▒╪╢┘è ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪╣┘å┘ç: (┘â┘Å┘å┘æ┘Ä╪º ╪Ñ┘É╪░┘Ä╪º ╪╡┘Ä╪╣┘Ä╪»┘Æ┘å┘Ä╪º ┘â┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Ä╪▒┘Æ┘å┘Ä╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪Ñ┘É╪░┘Ä╪º ┘å┘Ä╪▓┘Ä┘ä┘Æ┘å┘Ä╪º ╪│┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Ä╪¡┘Æ┘å┘Ä╪º)
play_arrow
share
video_library
Reference:
Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 6/135.
Hisnul Muslim 214
Chapter 103: Prayer of the traveller as dawn approaches
1 du'a
╪│┘Ä┘à┘É┘Ç╪╣┘Ä ╪│┘Ç╪º┘à┘É╪╣┘î ╪¿┘É╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ┘Ç╪»┘É ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪¡┘Å╪│┘Æ┘Ç┘å┘É ╪¿┘Ä┘ä╪º╪ª┘É┘Ç┘ç┘É ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘Ç┘å╪º. ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Ä┘å┘Ç╪º ╪╡┘Ç╪º╪¡┘É╪¿┘Æ┘Ç┘å╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä┘ü┘Æ┘Ç╪╢┘É┘ä ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘Ç┘å╪º ╪╣╪º╪ª┘É╪░╪º┘ï ╪¿╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘É ┘à┘É┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘å┘æ┘Ç╪º╪▒
play_arrow
share
video_library
Sami`a s─ümi`un biß╕Ñamdill─ühi wa ß╕Ñusni bal─ü'ihi `alayn─ü. Rabban─ü ß╣ú─üß╕Ñibn─ü, wa afß╕ìil `alayn─ü,`─ü'idhan bill─ühi minan-n─ür.
He Who listens has heard that we praise Allah for the good things He gives us. Our Lord, be with us and bestow Your favor upon us. I seek the protection of Allah from the Fire.
Reference:
Muslim 4/2086, the meaning of sami`a s─ümi`un (who listens has heard) is that 'a witness has witnessed our praise of Allah due to His blessings and favor upon us.' It could also be read samma`a s─ümi`un, in which case it means 'one who has heard this statement of mine will convey it to another and he will say it as well.' This is due to the attention given to the Thikr (remembrance of Allah) and supplications made during the early morning hours. The meaning of his saying 'Our Lord, be with us and bestow Your favor upon us' is: 'Our Lord, protect us and guard us. Bless us with Your numerous bounties, and avert from us every evil.' See An-Nawawi, Sharh Sahih Muslim 17/39.
Hisnul Muslim 215
Chapter 104: Stopping or lodging somewhere in travel and otherwise
1 du'a
╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Ç┘ê╪░┘Å ╪¿┘É┘â┘Ä┘ä┘É┘Ç┘à╪º╪¬┘É ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘ç┘É ╪º┘ä╪¬┘æ┘Ç╪º┘à┘æ╪º╪¬┘É ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ╪┤┘Ä┘Ç╪▒┘æ┘É ┘à╪º ╪«┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘Ç┘é
play_arrow
share
video_library
A`┼½dhu bikalim─üti ΓÇÿll─ühit-t─ümm─üti min sharri m─ü khalaq.
I seek refuge in the Perfect Words of Allah from the evil of what He has created.
Reference:
Muslim 4/2080.
Hisnul Muslim 216
Chapter 105: While returning from travel
1 du'a
From every elevated point sayAll─ühu Akbar (three times). and then recite:
┘è┘Å┘â┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘É╪▒┘Å ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘ë ┘â┘Å┘ä┘æ┘É ╪┤┘Ä╪▒┘Ä┘ü┘ì ╪½┘Ä┘ä╪º┘Ä╪½┘Ä ╪¬┘Ä┘â┘Æ╪¿┘É┘è╪▒┘Ä╪º╪¬┘ì ╪½┘Å┘à┘æ┘Ä ┘è┘Ä┘é┘Å┘ê┘ä┘Å: ┘ä╪º┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪¡┘Æ╪»┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ä╪º┘Ä ╪┤┘Ä╪▒┘É┘è┘â┘Ä ┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘à┘Å┘ä┘Æ┘â┘Å ┘ê┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ╪»┘Å ┘ê┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘ê┘Ä ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘ë ┘â┘Å┘ä┘æ┘É ╪┤┘Ä┘è┘Æ╪í┘ì ┘é┘Ä╪»┘É┘è╪▒┘î ╪ó┘è┘É╪¿┘Å┘ê┘å┘Ä ╪¬┘Ä╪º╪ª┘É╪¿┘Å┘ê┘å┘Ä ╪╣┘Ä╪º╪¿┘É╪»┘Å┘ê┘å┘Ä ┘ä┘É╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘É┘å╪º ╪¡┘Ä╪º┘à┘É╪»┘Å┘ê┘å┘Ä ╪╡┘Ä╪»┘Ä┘é┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪╣┘Æ╪»┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä┘å┘Ä╪╡┘Ä╪▒┘Ä ╪╣┘Ä╪¿┘Æ╪»┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä┘ç┘Ä╪▓┘Ä┘à┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪ú┘Ä╪¡┘Æ╪▓╪º╪¿┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪¡┘Æ╪»┘Ä┘ç┘Å
play_arrow
share
video_library
L─ü il─üha illall─üh waß╕Ñdahu l─ü shar─½ka lah. lahu ΓÇÿl-mulku, walahu ΓÇÿl-ß╕Ñamd. wa Huwa `al─ü kulli shay'in Qad─½r, ─ü'ib┼½na, t─ü'ib┼½na,`─übid┼½n, li Rabbin─ü ß╕Ñ─ümid┼½n, sadaqall─ühu wa`dah, wa nasara `abdah. wa hazama ΓÇÿl-'aß╕Ñz─üba waß╕Ñdah.
From every elevated point say All─ühu Akbar (Allah is the Most Great) three times and then recite: None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner. His is the dominion and His is the praise, and He is Able to do all things. We return repentant to our Lord, worshipping our Lord, and praising our Lord. He fulfilled His Promise, He aided His slave, and He alone defeated the Confederates.
Reference:
Bukhari 7/163, Muslim 2/980. The Prophet (∩╖║) used to say this when returning from a campaign or from Hajj.
Hisnul Muslim 217
Chapter 106: What to say upon receiving pleasing or displeasing news
1 du'a
┘â┘Ä╪º┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘å┘æ┘Ä╪¿┘É┘è┘æ┘Å ╪╡┘ä┘ë ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪╣┘ä┘è┘ç ┘ê╪│┘ä┘à ╪Ñ┘É╪░┘Ä╪º ╪ú┘Ä╪¬┘Ä╪º┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪ú┘Ä┘à┘Æ╪▒┘Å ┘è┘Ä╪│┘Å╪▒┘æ┘Å┘ç┘Å ┘é┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Ä:
(╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ╪»┘Å ┘ä┘É┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘É ╪º┘ä┘æ┘Ä╪░┘É┘è ╪¿┘É┘å┘É╪╣┘Æ┘à┘Ä╪¬┘É┘ç┘É ╪¬┘Ä╪¬┘É┘à┘æ┘Å ╪º┘ä╪╡┘æ┘Ä╪º┘ä┘É╪¡┘Ä╪º╪¬┘Å)
┘ê┘Ä╪Ñ┘É╪░┘Ä╪º ╪ú┘Ä╪¬┘Ä╪º┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪ú┘Ä┘à┘Æ╪▒┘Å ┘è┘Ä┘â┘Æ╪▒┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘ç┘Å ┘é┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Ä:
(╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ╪»┘Å ┘ä┘É┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘É ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘ë ┘â┘Å┘ä┘æ┘É ╪¡┘Ä╪º┘ä┘ì)
play_arrow
share
video_library
Alß╕Ñamdu lill─ühi ΓÇÿlladhi bi ni`matihi tatimmuß╣ú-ß╣ú─üliß╕Ñ─üt.
Alß╕Ñamdu lill─ühi `al─ü kulli ß╕Ñ─ül.
When something happened that pleased him, the Prophet (∩╖║) used to say:
Praise is to Allah Who by His blessings all good things are perfected.
And if something happened that displeased him, he used to say:
Praise is to Allah in all circumstances.
Reference:
Ibn As-Sunni, 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah, and Al-Hakim who graded it authentic 1/499. See also Al-Albani, Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 4/201.
Hisnul Muslim 218
Chapter 107: Excellence of sending prayers upon the Prophet (saws)
recommendation
The Prophet (∩╖║) said: "Whoever prays for Allah's blessings upon me once, will be blessed for it by Allah ten times."
┘é┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘å┘æ┘Ä╪¿┘É┘è┘æ┘Å ╪╡┘ä┘ë ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪╣┘ä┘è┘ç ┘ê╪│┘ä┘à: (┘à┘Ä┘å┘Æ ╪╡┘Ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ë ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘è┘æ┘Ä ╪╡┘Ä┘ä╪º┘Ä╪⌐┘ï ╪╡┘Ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ë ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘ç┘É ╪¿┘É┘ç┘Ä╪º ╪╣┘Ä╪┤┘Æ╪▒╪º┘ï)
play_arrow
share
video_library
Reference:
Muslim 1/288.
Hisnul Muslim 219
recommendation
The Prophet (∩╖║) said: "Do not make my grave a place of ritual celebration, but pray for Allah's blessings upon me, for your blessings reach me from wherever you are.
┘ê┘Ä┘é┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Ä ╪╡┘ä┘ë ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪╣┘ä┘è┘ç ┘ê╪│┘ä┘à: (┘ä╪º┘Ä ╪¬┘Ä╪¼┘Æ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Å┘ê╪º ┘é┘Ä╪¿┘Æ╪▒┘É┘è ╪╣┘É┘è╪»╪º┘ï ┘ê┘Ä╪╡┘Ä┘ä┘æ┘Å┘ê╪º ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘è┘æ┘Ä ┘ü┘Ä╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘Ä ╪╡┘Ä┘ä╪º┘Ä╪¬┘Ä┘â┘Å┘à ╪¬┘Ä╪¿┘Æ┘ä┘Å╪║┘Å┘å┘É┘è ╪¡┘Ä┘è┘Æ╪½┘Å ┘â┘Å┘å┘Æ╪¬┘Å┘à┘Æ)
play_arrow
share
video_library
Reference:
Abu Dawud 2/218, Ahmad 2/367. Al-Albani graded it authentic in Sahih Abu Dawud 2/383.
Hisnul Muslim 220
recommendation
The Prophet (∩╖║) said: "The miser is the one in whose presence I am mentioned yet does not pray for Allah's blessings upon me."
┘ê┘Ä┘é┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Ä ╪╡┘ä┘ë ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪╣┘ä┘è┘ç ┘ê╪│┘ä┘à: (╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¿┘Ä╪«┘É┘è┘ä┘Å ┘à┘Ä┘å┘Æ ╪░┘Å┘â┘É╪▒┘Æ╪¬┘Å ╪╣┘É┘å┘Æ╪»┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ü┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘à┘Æ ┘è┘Å╪╡┘Ä┘ä┘æ┘É ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘è┘æ┘Ä)
play_arrow
share
video_library
Reference:
At-Tirmidhi 5/551 and others. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/177 and Sahihul-Jarai' As-Saghir 3/25.
Hisnul Muslim 221
recommendation
The Prophet (∩╖║) said: "Indeed Allah has angels who roam the earth and they convey to me the greetings (or prayers of peace) of my Ummah (nation)."
┘ê┘Ä┘é┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Ä ╪╡┘ä┘ë ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪╣┘ä┘è┘ç ┘ê╪│┘ä┘à:(╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘Ä ┘ä┘É┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘É ┘à┘Ä┘ä╪º┘Ä╪ª┘É┘â┘Ä╪⌐┘ï ╪│┘Ä┘è┘æ┘Ä╪º╪¡┘É┘è┘å┘Ä ┘ü┘É┘è ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪ú┘Ä╪▒┘Æ╪╢┘É ┘è┘Å╪¿┘Ä┘ä┘æ┘É╪║┘Å┘ê┘å┘É┘è ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ╪ú┘Å┘à┘æ┘Ä╪¬┘É┘è ╪º┘ä╪│┘æ┘Ä┘ä╪º┘Ä┘à┘Ä)
play_arrow
share
video_library
Reference:
An-Nasa'i, Al-Hakim 2/421. Al-Albani graded it authentic in Sahih An-Nasa'i 1/274.
Hisnul Muslim 222
recommendation
The Prophet (∩╖║) said: "No one sends greetings (or prayers of peace) upon me but Allah returns my soul to me so that I may return his greetings."
┘ê┘Ä┘é┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Ä ╪╡┘ä┘ë ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪╣┘ä┘è┘ç ┘ê╪│┘ä┘à: (┘à┘Ä╪º ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ╪ú┘Ä╪¡┘Ä╪»┘ì ┘è┘Å╪│┘Ä┘ä┘æ┘É┘à┘Å ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘è┘æ┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ┘Ä ╪▒┘Ä╪»┘æ┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘è┘æ┘Ä ╪▒┘Å┘ê╪¡┘É┘è┘Ä ╪¡┘Ä╪¬┘æ┘Ä┘ë ╪ú┘Ä╪▒┘Å╪»┘æ┘Ä ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘ç┘É ╪º┘ä╪│┘æ┘Ä┘ä╪º┘Ä┘à┘Ä)
play_arrow
share
video_library
Reference:
Abu Dawud (no. 2041). Al-Albani graded it good in Sahih Abu Dawud 1/383.
Hisnul Muslim 223
Chapter 108: Excellence of spreading the Islamic greeting
recommendation
The Prophet (∩╖║) said: "You shall not enter Paradise until you believe, and you have not believed until you love one another. Shall I tell you of something you can do to make you love one another? Spread the greetings of Salam (peace) amongst yourselves (i. e. between each other).
┘é┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Ä ╪▒┘Ä╪│┘Å┘ê┘ä┘Å ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘É ╪╡┘ä┘ë ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪╣┘ä┘è┘ç ┘ê╪│┘ä┘à: (┘ä╪º┘Ä ╪¬┘Ä╪»┘Æ╪«┘Å┘ä┘Å┘ê╪º ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¼┘Ä┘å┘æ┘Ä╪⌐┘Ä ╪¡┘Ä╪¬┘æ┘Ä┘ë ╪¬┘Å╪ñ┘Æ┘à┘É┘å┘Å┘ê╪º ┘ê┘Ä┘ä╪º┘Ä ╪¬┘Å╪ñ┘Æ┘à┘É┘å┘Å┘ê╪º ╪¡┘Ä╪¬┘æ┘Ä┘ë ╪¬┘Ä╪¡┘Ä╪º╪¿┘æ┘Å┘ê╪º ╪ú┘Ä┘ê┘Ä┘ä╪º┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä╪»┘Å┘ä┘æ┘Å┘â┘Å┘à ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘ë ╪┤┘Ä┘è┘Æ╪í┘ì ╪Ñ┘É╪░┘Ä╪º ┘ü┘Ä╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Æ╪¬┘Å┘à┘Å┘ê┘ç┘Å ╪¬┘Ä╪¡┘Ä╪º╪¿┘Ä╪¿┘Æ╪¬┘Å┘à ╪ú┘Ä┘ü┘Æ╪┤┘Å┘ê╪º ╪º┘ä╪│┘æ┘Ä┘ä╪º┘Ä┘à┘Ä ╪¿┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘å┘Ä┘â┘Å┘à┘Æ)
play_arrow
share
video_library
Reference:
Muslim 1/74 and others.
Hisnul Muslim 224
recommendation
Three characteristics, whoever combines them, has completed his faith: to be just, to spread greetings to all people and to spend (charitably) out of the little you have.
╪½┘Ä┘ä╪º┘Ä╪½┘î ┘à┘Ä┘å┘Æ ╪¼┘Ä┘à┘Ä╪╣┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘å┘æ┘Ä ┘ü┘Ä┘é┘Ä╪»┘Æ ╪¼┘Ä┘à┘Ä╪╣┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪Ñ┘É┘è┘à┘Ä╪º┘å┘Ä: ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘Æ╪╡┘Ä╪º┘ü┘Å ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ┘å┘Ä┘ü┘Æ╪│┘É┘â┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪¿┘Ä╪░┘Æ┘ä┘Å ╪º┘ä╪│┘æ┘Ä┘ä╪º┘Ä┘à┘É ┘ä┘É┘ä┘Æ╪╣┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Ä┘à┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Æ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘Æ┘ü┘Ä╪º┘é┘Å ┘à┘É┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪Ñ┘É┘é┘Æ╪¬┘Ä╪º╪▒┘É
play_arrow
share
video_library
Reference:
Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 1/82 as a statement of the Companion 'Ammar (RA).
Hisnul Muslim 225
recommendation
`Abdullah bin `Umar (RA) said: A man asked the Prophet (∩╖║), "What is the best act of Islam?" He said, "To feed others and to give greetings of Salam (peace) to those whom you know and to those whom you do not know. "
┘ê┘Ä╪╣┘Ä┘å┘Æ ╪╣┘Ä╪¿┘Æ╪»┘É ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘É ╪¿┘Æ┘å┘É ╪╣┘Å┘à┘Ä╪▒┘Ä ╪▒┘Ä╪╢┘É┘è┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪╣┘Ä┘å┘Æ┘ç┘Å┘à┘Ä╪º: ╪ú┘å┘æ┘Ä ╪▒┘Ä╪¼┘Å┘ä╪º┘ï ╪│┘Ä╪ú┘Ä┘ä┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘å┘æ┘Ä╪¿┘É┘è┘æ┘Ä ╪╡┘ä┘ë ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪╣┘ä┘è┘ç ┘ê╪│┘ä┘à ╪ú┘è┘æ┘Å ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪Ñ┘É╪│┘Æ┘ä╪º┘Ä┘à┘É ╪«┘Ä┘è┘Æ╪▒┘î ┘é┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Ä: (╪¬┘Å╪╖┘Æ╪╣┘É┘à┘Å ╪º┘ä╪╖┘æ┘Ä╪╣┘Ä╪º┘à┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪¬┘Ä┘é┘Æ╪▒╪ú┘Å ╪º┘ä╪│┘æ┘Ä┘ä╪º┘Ä┘à┘Ä ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘ë ┘à┘Ä┘å┘Æ ╪╣┘Ä╪▒┘Ä┘ü┘Æ╪¬┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä┘à┘Ä┘å┘Æ ┘ä┘Ä┘à┘Æ ╪¬┘Ä╪╣┘Æ╪▒┘É┘ü┘Æ)

share
video_library
Reference:
Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 1/55, Muslim 1/65.
Hisnul Muslim 226
Chapter 109: Returning a greeting to a disbeliever
1 du'a
╪Ñ╪░┘Ä╪º ╪│┘Ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘à┘Ä ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘â┘Å┘à┘Æ ╪ú┘Ä┘ç┘Æ┘ä┘Å ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘â┘É╪¬┘Ä╪º╪¿┘É ┘ü┘Ä┘é┘Å┘ê┘ä┘Å┘ê╪º:
┘ê┘Ä╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘â┘Å┘à┘Æ
play_arrow
share
video_library
If one of the People of the Scripture (i.e., Christians and Jews) greets you saying As-Salaamu alaykum, then say (to him):
'Wa alaykum'
And upon you .
If one of the People of the Scripture (i. e. Christians and Jews) greets you saying As-Salaamu `alaykum, then say (to him): And upon you .
Reference:
Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 11/42, Muslim 4/1705.
Hisnul Muslim 227
Chapter 110: Upon hearing a rooster crow or the braying of a donkey
recommendation
When you hear the cock's crow, ask Allah for His favor upon you for surely it has seen an angel. When you hear the bray of a donkey, seek refuge in Allah from Satan, for surely it has seen a devil.
╪Ñ┘É╪░┘Ä╪º ╪│┘Ä┘à┘É╪╣┘Æ╪¬┘Å┘à┘Æ ╪╡┘É┘è┘Ä╪º╪¡┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪»┘æ┘É┘è┘Ä┘â┘Ä╪⌐┘É ┘ü┘Ä╪º╪│┘Æ╪ú┘Ä┘ä┘Å┘ê╪º ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Ä ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ┘ü┘Ä╪╢┘Æ┘ä┘É┘ç┘É ┘ü┘Ä╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Ä╪º ╪▒┘Ä╪ú┘Ä╪¬┘Æ ┘à┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘â╪º┘ï ┘ê┘Ä╪Ñ┘É╪░┘Ä╪º ╪│┘Ä┘à┘É╪╣┘Æ╪¬┘Å┘à┘Æ ┘å┘Ä┘ç┘É┘è┘é┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘É┘à┘Ä╪º╪▒┘É ┘ü┘Ä╪¬┘Ä╪╣┘Ä┘ê┘æ┘Ä╪░┘Å┘ê╪º ╪¿┘É╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘É ┘à┘É┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪┤┘æ┘Ä┘è╪╖┘Ä╪º┘å┘É ┘ü┘Ä╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪▒┘Ä╪ú┘Ä┘ë ╪┤┘Ä┘è┘Æ╪╖┘Ä╪º┘å╪º┘ï
play_arrow
share
video_library
Reference:
Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 6/350, Muslim 4/2092.
Hisnul Muslim 228
Chapter 111: Upon hearing the barking of dogs at night
recommendation
When you hear a dog barking or a donkey braying in the night, then seek refuge in Allah from them, for surely they have seen what you see not.
╪Ñ┘É╪░┘Ä╪º ╪│┘Ä┘à┘É╪╣┘Æ╪¬┘Å┘à┘Æ ┘å┘Å╪¿┘Ä╪º╪¡┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘â┘É┘ä╪º┘Ä╪¿┘É ┘ê┘Ä┘å┘Ä┘ç┘É┘è┘é┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘à┘É┘è╪▒┘É ╪¿┘É╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘ä┘É ┘ü┘Ä╪¬┘Ä╪╣┘Ä┘ê┘æ┘Ä╪░┘Å┘ê╪º ╪¿┘É╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘É ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ┘ç┘Å┘å┘æ┘Ä ┘ü┘Ä╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘å┘æ┘Ä ┘è┘Ä╪▒┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘å┘Ä ┘à┘Ä╪º ┘ä╪º┘Ä ╪¬┘Ä╪▒┘Ä┘ê┘Æ┘å┘Ä
play_arrow
share
video_library
Reference:
Abu Dawud 4/327, Ahmad 3/306. Al-Albani graded it authentic in Sahih Abu Dawud 3/961.
Hisnul Muslim 229
Chapter 112: For one you have insulted
1 du'a
┘é╪º┘ä ╪╡┘ä┘ë ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪╣┘ä┘è┘ç ┘ê╪│┘ä┘à:
'╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘à ┘ü╪ú┘è┘à╪º ┘à╪ñ┘à┘å ╪│╪¿╪¿╪¬┘ç ┘ü╪º╪¼╪╣┘ä ╪░┘ä┘â ┘ä┘ç ┘é╪▒╪¿╪⌐ ╪Ñ┘ä┘è┘â ┘è┘ê┘à ╪º┘ä┘é┘è╪º┘à╪⌐'
play_arrow
share
video_library
All─ühumma fa'ayyum─ü mu'minin sababtuhufaj`al dh─ülika lahu qurbatan ilayka yawma ΓÇÿl-qiy─ümah.
O Allah, whomever of the believers I have abused, give him the reward of a sacrificial slaughter for it on the Day of Resurrection.
Reference:
Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 11/171, Muslim 4/2007. The wording in Muslim's report is: 'make it a purification for him and a source of mercy.
Hisnul Muslim 230
Chapter 113: The etiquette of praising a fellow Muslim
1 du'a
If any of you praises his companion then let him say:
┘é╪º┘ä ╪╡┘ä┘ë ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪╣┘ä┘è┘ç ┘ê╪│┘ä┘à:
╪ú┘Ä╪¡┘Æ╪│┘É╪¿┘Å ┘ü┘Å┘ä╪º┘Ä┘å╪º┘ï ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪¡┘Ä╪│┘É┘è╪¿┘Å┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä┘ä╪º┘Ä ╪ú┘Å╪▓┘Ä┘â┘æ┘É┘è ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘ë ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘É ╪ú┘Ä╪¡┘Ä╪»╪º┘ï
╪ú┘Ä╪¡┘Æ╪│┘É╪¿┘Å┘ç┘Å ΓÇô ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘Æ ┘â┘Ä╪º┘å┘Ä ┘è┘Ä╪╣┘Æ┘ä┘Ä┘à┘Å ╪░┘Ä╪º┘â┘Ä ΓÇô ┘â┘Ä╪░┘Ä╪º ┘ê┘Ä┘â┘Ä╪░┘Ä╪º'
play_arrow
share
video_library
Aß╕Ñsibu ful─ünan wall─ühu ß╕Ñas─½buhwa l─ü uzakk─½ `alall─ühi aß╕Ñada.
If any of you praises his companion then let him say:
I consider (such and such a person), and Allah is his Assessor, (meaning: and I cannot claim anyone to be pious before Allah) if you know of this (good character trait in the person) to be such and such (saying what he thinks is praiseworthy in that person).
Reference:
Muslim 4/2296.
Hisnul Muslim 231
Chapter 114: For the one that have been praised
1 du'a
╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘à┘æ┘Ä ┘ä╪º┘Ä ╪¬┘Å╪ñ┘Ä╪º╪«┘É╪░┘Æ┘å┘É┘è ╪¿┘É┘à┘Ä╪º ┘è┘Ä┘é┘Å┘ê┘ä┘Å┘ê┘å┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪º╪║┘Æ┘ü┘É╪▒┘Æ ┘ä┘É┘è ┘à┘Ä╪º ┘ä╪º┘Ä ┘è┘Ä╪╣┘Æ┘ä┘Ä┘à┘Å┘ê┘å┘Ä [┘ê┘Ä╪º╪¼┘Æ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Æ┘å┘É┘è ╪«┘Ä┘è┘Æ╪▒┘ï╪º ┘à┘É┘à┘æ┘Ä╪º ┘è┘Ä╪╕┘æ┘Å┘å┘æ┘Å┘ê┘å┘Ä]
play_arrow
share
video_library
All─ühumma l─ü tu'─ükhidhn─½ bim─ü yaq┼½l┼½n. waghfir l─½ m─ü l─ü ya`lam┼½n[waj`aln─½ khayran mimm─ü yaß║ôunn┼½n].
O Allah, do not call me to account for what they sayand forgive me for what they have no knowledge of[and make me better than they imagine].
Reference:
Al-Bukhari, Al-'Adabul-Mufrad no. 761. See Al-Albani, Sahih Al-'Adabul-Mufrad (no. 585). The portion between brackets if from Al-Bayhaqi, Shu'ab Al-Iman 4/228, and comes another account.
Hisnul Muslim 232
Chapter 115: The Talbiya for the one doing Hajj or Umrah
1 du'a
┘ä┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘à┘æ┘Ä ┘ä┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘â┘Ä ┘ä┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘â┘Ä ┘ä╪º┘Ä ╪┤┘Ä╪▒┘É┘è┘â┘Ä ┘ä┘Ä┘â┘Ä ┘ä┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘â┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ╪»┘Ä ┘ê╪º┘ä┘å┘æ┘É╪╣┘Æ┘à┘Ä╪⌐ ┘ä┘Ä┘â┘Ä ┘ê╪º┘ä┘à┘Å┘ä┘Æ┘â┘Å ┘ä┘Ä╪º ╪┤┘Ä╪▒┘É┘è┘â┘Ä ┘ä┘Ä┘â┘Ä

video_library
Labbayk-All─ühumma labbayk. labbayka l─ü shar─½ka laka labbayk. inna ΓÇÿl-ß╕Ñamda, wanni`mata, laka wa ΓÇÿl-mulk. l─ü shar─½ka lak.
I am here at Your service, O Allah, I am here at Your service. I am here at Your service, You have no partner, I am here at Your service. Surely the praise, and blessings are Yours, and the dominion. You have no partner.
Reference:
Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 3/408, Muslim 2/841.
Hisnul Muslim 233
Chapter 116: The Takb├«r passing the black stone
recommendation
The Prophet (∩╖║) performed Tawaf riding a camel. Every time he passed the corner (containing the Black Stone), he would point to it with something that he was holding and say: All─ühu Akbar (Allah is the Most Great)!
╪╖┘Ä╪º┘ü┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘å┘æ┘Ä╪¿┘è┘æ┘Å ╪╡┘ä┘ë ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪╣┘ä┘è┘ç ┘ê╪│┘ä┘à ╪¿┘É╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¿┘Ä┘è┘Æ╪¬┘É ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘ë ╪¿┘Ä╪╣┘É┘è╪▒┘ì ┘â┘Å┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘à┘Ä╪º ╪ú┘Ä╪¬┘Ä┘ë ╪º┘ä╪▒┘æ┘Å┘â┘Æ┘å┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä╪┤┘Ä╪º╪▒┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘ç┘É ╪¿┘É╪┤┘Ä┘è┘Æ╪í┘ì ╪╣┘É┘å┘Æ╪»┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä┘â┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Ä╪▒┘Ä
play_arrow
share
video_library
Reference:
Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 3/476. See also 472. The 'something' that was referred to in this Hadith was a cane.
Hisnul Muslim 234
Chapter 117: Between the Yemeni corner and the black stone
1 du'a
∩┤┐╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Ä┘å┘Ä╪º ╪ó╪¬┘É┘å┘Ä╪º ┘ü┘è ╪º┘ä╪»┘æ┘Å┘å┘Æ┘è┘Ä╪º ╪¡╪│┘Ä┘å┘Ä╪⌐┘ï ┘ê┘ü┘è ╪º┘ä╪ó╪«┘É╪▒┘Ä╪⌐┘É ╪¡╪│┘Ä┘å╪⌐┘ï ┘ê┘é┘É┘å┘Ä╪º ╪╣╪░┘Ä╪º╪¿┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘å┘æ┘Ä╪º╪▒┘É∩┤╛
play_arrow
share
video_library
Rabban─ü ─ütin─ü fid-duny─ü ß╕Ñasanahwa fi ΓÇÿl-─ükhirati ß╕Ñasanahwa qin─ü `adh─üban-n─ür.
Our Lord, grant us the good things in this world, and the good things in the next life, and save us from the punishment of the Fire.
Reference:
Abu Dawud 2/179, Ahmad 3/411, Al-Baghawi, Sharhus-Sunnah 7/128. Al-Albani graded it good in Sahih Abu Dawud 1/354. The Ayat is from Surat Al-Baqarah, 2:201.
Hisnul Muslim 235
Chapter 118: When at Mount Safa and Mount Marwah
1 du'a
Whenever the Prophet (∩╖║) approached Mount Safa, he would recite:
(┘ä┘Ä┘à┘æ┘Ä╪º ╪»┘Ä┘å┘Ä╪º ╪º┘ä┘å┘æ┘Ä╪¿┘É┘è┘æ┘Å ╪╡┘ä┘ë ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪╣┘ä┘è┘ç ┘ê╪│┘ä┘à ┘à┘É┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪╡┘æ┘Ä┘ü┘Ä╪º ┘é┘Ä╪▒┘Ä╪ú┘Ä:
∩┤┐╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪╡┘æ┘Ä┘ü┘Ä╪º ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Æ┘à┘Ä╪▒┘Æ┘ê┘Ä╪⌐┘Ä ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ╪┤┘Ä╪╣┘Ä╪ó╪ª┘É╪▒┘É ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘É∩┤╛ '╪ú┘Ä╪¿┘Æ╪»┘Ä╪ú┘Å ╪¿┘É┘à┘Ä╪º ╪¿┘Ä╪»┘Ä╪ú┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪¿┘É┘ç┘É'
┘ü┘Ä╪¿┘Ä╪»┘Ä╪ú┘Ä ╪¿┘É╪º┘ä╪╡┘æ┘Ä┘ü┘Ä╪º ┘ü┘Ä╪▒┘Ä┘é┘É┘è┘Ä ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘ç┘É ╪¡┘Ä╪¬┘æ┘Ä┘ë ╪▒┘Ä╪ú┘Ä┘ë ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¿┘Ä┘è┘Æ╪¬┘Ä ┘ü┘Ä╪º╪│┘Æ╪¬┘Ä┘é┘Æ╪¿┘Ä┘ä┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘é┘É╪¿┘Æ┘ä┘Ä╪⌐┘Ä ┘ü┘Ä┘ê┘Ä╪¡┘æ┘Ä╪»┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä┘â╪¿┘æ┘Ä╪▒┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä┘é┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Ä: ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪¡┘Æ╪»┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ä╪º┘Ä ╪┤┘Ä╪▒┘É┘è┘â┘Ä ┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘à┘Å┘ä┘Æ┘â┘Å ┘ê┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ╪»┘Å ┘ê┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘ê┘Ä ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘ë ┘â┘Å┘ä┘æ┘É ╪┤┘Ä┘è┘Æ╪í┘ì ┘é┘Ä╪»┘É┘è╪▒┘î ┘ä╪º┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪¡┘Æ╪»┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ╪¼┘Ä╪▓┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪╣┘Æ╪»┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä┘å┘Ä╪╡┘Ä╪▒┘Ä ╪╣┘Ä╪¿┘Æ╪»┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä┘ç┘Ä╪▓┘Ä┘à┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪ú┘Ä╪¡┘Æ╪▓┘Ä╪º╪¿┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪¡┘Æ╪»┘Ä┘ç┘Å
╪½┘Å┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪»┘Ä╪╣┘Ä╪º ╪¿┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘å┘Ä ╪░┘ä┘â┘Ä. ┘é┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Ä ┘à┘É╪½┘Æ┘ä┘Ä ┘ç┘Ä╪░┘Ä╪º ╪½┘Ä┘ä╪º┘Ä╪½┘Ä ┘à┘Ä╪▒┘æ┘Ä╪º╪¬┘ì) ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä╪»┘É┘è╪½┘Å.
┘ê┘Ä┘ü┘É┘è┘ç┘É: (┘ü┘Ä┘ü┘Ä╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘ë ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘à┘Ä╪▒┘Æ┘ê┘Ä╪⌐┘É ┘â┘Ä┘à┘Ä╪º ┘ü┘Ä╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘ë ╪º┘ä╪╡┘æ┘Ä┘ü┘Ä╪º)
play_arrow
share
video_library
Whenever the Prophet (∩╖║) approached Mount Safa, he would recite: Innaß╣ú-ß╣óaf─ü wa ΓÇÿl-Marwata min sha`─ü'irill─üh. Abda'u bim─ü bada'all─ühu bih.
He began (his Sa`y) at Mount Safa climbing it, until he could see the House. He then faced the Qiblah repeating the words: L─ü il─üha illall─üh, All─ühu Akbar
Then he said: L─ü il─üha 'illall─ühwaß╕Ñdahu l─ü shar─½ka lah. Lahu ΓÇÿl-mulku wa lahu ΓÇÿl-ß╕Ñamdwa Huwa `al─ü kulli shay'in Qad─½r. l─ü 'il─üha illall─ühu waß╕Ñdahu, anjaza wa`dahu, wa naß╣úara `abdahu, wa hazama ΓÇÿl 'aß╕Ñz─üba waß╕Ñdah.
Then he would ask Allah for what he liked, repeating the same three times. He did at Mount Marwah as he did at Mount Safa.
Surely Safa and Marwah are among the signs of Allah. I begin by that which Allah began. He began (his Sa'y) at Mount Safa climbing it until he could see the House. He then faced the Qiblah repeating the words: There is none worthy of worship but Allah, and Allah is the Most Great. Then he said: None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner, His is the dominion and His is the praise, and He is Able to do all things. None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, He fulfilled His Promise, He aided His slave, and He alone defeated Confederates. Then he would ask Allah for what he liked, repeating the same thing like this three times. He did at Mount Marwah as he did at Mount Safa.
Reference:
Muslim 2/888.
Hisnul Muslim 236
Chapter 119: The Day of Arafah
1 du'a
The Prophet (∩╖║) said: The best invocation is that of the Day of Arafat, and the best that anyone can say is what I and the Prophets before me have said:
╪«┘è╪▒ ╪º┘ä╪»╪╣╪º╪í ╪»╪╣╪º╪í ┘è┘ê┘à ╪╣╪▒┘ü╪⌐ ┘ê╪«┘è╪▒┘Å ┘à╪º ┘é┘ä╪¬ ╪ú┘å╪º ┘ê╪º┘ä┘å╪¿┘è┘æ┘Å┘ê┘å ┘à┘å ┘é╪¿┘ä┘è :
┘ä╪º ╪Ñ┘ä┘ç ╪Ñ┘ä╪º ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ┘ê╪¡╪»┘ç┘Å
┘ä╪º ╪┤╪▒┘è┘â ┘ä┘ç┘Å
┘ä┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä┘à┘ä┘â┘Å ┘ê┘ä┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä╪¡┘à╪»┘Å
┘ê┘ç┘ê ╪╣┘ä┘ë ┘â┘ä ╪┤┘è╪í ┘é╪»┘è╪▒.
play_arrow
share
video_library
L─ü 'il─üha 'illall─ühu
waß╕Ñdahu l─ü shar─½ka lahu.
lahul-mulku wa lahul-ß╕Ñamdu
wa huwa `al─ü kulli shay'in qad─½r.
None has the right to be worshipped but Allah Alone,
Who has no partner.
His is the dominion and His is the praise,
and He is Able to do all things.
Reference:
At-Tirmidhi. Al-Albani graded it good in Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/184, and also Silsilatul-'Ahadith As-Sahihah 4/6.
Hisnul Muslim 237
Chapter 120: Remembrance at Muzdalifa
recommendation
He (∩╖║) rode Al-Qaswa until he reached Al-MashAAar Al-Haram, he then faced the qiblah, supplicated to Allah, and extoled His greatness and oneness. He stood until the sun shone but left before it rose.'
╪▒┘Ä┘â┘É╪¿┘Ä ╪╡┘ä┘ë ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪╣┘ä┘è┘ç ┘ê╪│┘ä┘à ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘é┘Ä╪╡┘Æ┘ê┘Ä╪º╪í┘Ä ╪¡┘Ä╪¬┘æ┘Ä┘ë ╪ú┘Ä╪¬┘Ä┘ë ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘à┘Ä╪┤┘Æ╪╣┘Ä╪▒┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä╪▒┘Ä╪º┘à┘Ä ┘ü┘Ä╪º╪│┘Æ╪¬┘Ä┘é┘Æ╪¿┘Ä┘ä┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘é┘É╪¿┘Æ┘ä┘Ä╪⌐┘Ä (┘ü┘Ä╪»┘Ä╪╣┘Ä╪º┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä┘â┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Ä╪▒┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä┘ç┘Ä┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä┘ê┘Ä╪¡┘æ┘Ä╪»┘Ä┘ç┘Å) ┘ü┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘à┘Æ ┘è┘Ä╪▓┘Ä┘ä┘Æ ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘é┘É┘ü╪º┘ï ╪¡┘Ä╪¬┘æ┘Ä┘ë ╪ú┘Ä╪│┘Æ┘ü┘Ä╪▒┘Ä ╪¼┘É╪»┘Ä┘æ╪º┘ï ┘ü┘Ä╪»┘Ä┘ü┘Ä╪╣┘Ä ┘é┘Ä╪¿┘Æ┘ä┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ ╪¬┘Ä╪╖┘Æ┘ä┘Å╪╣┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪┤┘æ┘Ä┘à╪│┘Å.
play_arrow
share
video_library
Reference:
Muslim 2/891.
Hisnul Muslim 238
Chapter 121: Takbir when throwing each pebble at the Jamarat
recommendation
The Prophet (∩╖║) said All─ühu Akbar (Allah is the Most Great) with each pebble he threw at the three pillars. Then he went forward, stood facing the Qiblah, and raised his hands and called upon Allah. That was after (stoning) the first and second pillars. As for the third, he stoned it and called out All─ühu Akbar with every pebble he threw, but when he was finished he left without standing at it (for supplications).
┘è┘Å┘â┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘É╪▒┘Å ┘â┘Å┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘à┘Ä╪º ╪▒┘Ä┘à┘Ä┘ë ╪¿┘É╪¡┘Ä╪╡┘Ä╪º╪⌐┘ì ╪╣┘É┘å┘Æ╪»┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¼┘É┘à┘Ä╪º╪▒┘É ╪º┘ä╪½┘æ┘Ä┘ä╪º┘Ä╪½┘É ╪½┘Å┘à┘æ┘Ä ┘è┘Ä╪¬┘Ä┘é┘Ä╪»┘æ┘Ä┘à┘Å ┘ê┘è┘Ä┘é┘É┘ü┘Å ┘è┘Ä╪»┘Æ╪╣┘Å┘ê ┘à┘Å╪│┘Æ╪¬┘Ä┘é┘Æ╪¿┘É┘ä┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘é┘É╪¿┘ä┘Ä╪⌐┘É ╪▒┘Ä╪º┘ü┘É╪╣╪º┘ï ┘è┘Ä╪»┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘ç┘É ╪¿┘Ä╪╣┘Æ╪»┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¼┘Ä┘à┘Æ╪▒┘Ä╪⌐┘É ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪ú┘Å┘ê┘ä┘Ä┘ë ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä╪½┘æ┘Ä╪º┘å┘É┘è┘Ä╪⌐┘É. ╪ú┘Ä┘à┘æ┘Ä╪º ╪¼┘Ä┘à┘Æ╪▒┘Ä╪⌐┘Å ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪╣┘Ä┘é┘Ä╪¿┘Ä╪⌐┘É ┘ü┘Ä┘è┘Ä╪▒┘Æ┘à┘É┘è┘ç┘Ä╪º ┘ê┘Ä┘è┘Å┘â┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘É╪▒┘Å ╪╣┘É┘å┘Æ╪»┘Ä ┘â┘Å┘ä┘æ┘É ╪¡┘Ä╪╡┘Ä╪º╪⌐┘ì ┘ê┘Ä┘è┘Ä┘å┘Æ╪╡┘Ä╪▒┘É┘ü┘Å ┘ê┘Ä┘ä╪º┘Ä ┘è┘Ä┘é┘É┘ü┘Å ╪╣┘É┘å┘Æ╪»┘Ä┘ç┘Ä╪º

Reference:
Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 3/581, 3, 4, and Muslim

Hisnul Muslim 241
Chapter 123: Upon receiving pleasant news
recommendation
The Prophet (∩╖║), upon receiving news which pleased him or which caused pleasure, would prostrate in gratitude to Allah blessed and exalted.
┘â┘Ä╪º┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘å┘æ┘Ä╪¿┘è┘æ┘Å ╪╡┘ä┘ë ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪╣┘ä┘è┘ç ┘ê╪│┘ä┘à ╪Ñ┘É╪░┘Ä╪º ╪ú┘Ä╪¬┘Ä╪º┘ç┘Å ╪ú┘Ä┘à┘Æ╪▒┘î ┘è┘Ä╪│┘Å╪▒┘æ┘Å┘ç┘Å ╪ú┘Ä┘ê┘Æ ┘è┘Å╪│┘Ä╪▒┘æ┘Å ╪¿┘É┘ç┘É ╪«┘Ä╪▒┘æ┘Ä ╪│┘Ä╪º╪¼┘É╪»╪º┘ï ╪┤┘Å┘â┘Æ╪▒╪º┘ï ┘ä┘É┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘É ╪¬┘Ä╪¿┘Ä╪º╪▒┘Ä┘â┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪¬┘Ä╪╣┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Ä┘ë
play_arrow
share
video_library
Reference:
Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah, At-Tirmidhi. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah 1/233, and 'Irwa'ul-Ghalil 2/226.
Hisnul Muslim 242
Chapter 124: When feeling some pain in the body
1 du'a
╪╢┘Ä╪╣┘Æ ┘è┘Ä╪»┘Ä┘â┘Ä ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘ë ╪º┘ä┘æ┘Ä╪░┘É┘è ╪¬┘Ä╪ú┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘à┘Ä ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ╪¼┘Ä╪│┘Ä╪»┘É┘â┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä┘é┘Å┘ä┘Æ: '╪¿┘É╪│┘Æ┘à┘É ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘É' ╪½┘Ä┘ä╪º┘Ä╪½╪º┘ï ┘ê┘Ä┘é┘Å┘ä┘Æ ╪│┘Ä╪¿┘Æ╪╣┘Ä ┘à┘Ä╪▒┘æ┘Ä╪º╪¬┘ì: '╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Å┘ê╪░┘Å ╪¿┘É╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘É ┘ê┘Ä┘é┘Å╪»┘Æ╪▒┘Ä╪¬┘É┘ç┘É ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ╪┤┘Ä╪▒┘æ┘É ┘à┘Ä╪º ╪ú┘Ä╪¼┘É╪»┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Å╪¡┘Ä╪º╪░┘É╪▒┘Å'
play_arrow
share
video_library
Put your hand on the place where you feel pain and say: Bismill─üh (three times).
Then say seven times: A`┼½dhu bill─ühi wa qudratihi min sharri m─ü ajidu wa uß╕Ñ─üdhir.
Put your hand on the place where you feel pain and say: With the Name of Allah (three times). Then say seven times: I seek refuge in Allah and in His Power from the evil of what I find and of what I guard against.
Reference:
Muslim 4/1728.
Hisnul Muslim 243
Chapter 125: When in fear of afflicting something with an (evil) eye from oneself
recommendation
If you see something from your brother, yourself or wealth which you find impressing, then invoke blessings for it, for the evil eye is indeed true.
╪Ñ┘É╪░┘Ä╪º ╪▒┘Ä╪ú┘Ä┘ë ╪ú┘Ä╪¡┘Ä╪»┘Å┘â┘Å┘à ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ╪ú┘Ä╪«┘É┘è┘ç┘É ╪ú┘Ä┘ê┘Æ ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ┘å┘Ä┘ü┘Æ╪│┘É┘ç┘É ╪ú┘Ä┘ê┘Æ ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ┘à┘Ä╪º┘ä┘É┘ç┘É ┘à┘Ä╪º ┘è┘Å╪╣┘Æ╪¼┘É╪¿┘Å┘ç┘Å [┘ü┘Ä┘ä┘Æ┘è┘Ä╪»┘Æ╪╣┘Å ┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪¿┘É╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¿┘Ä╪▒┘Ä┘â┘Ä╪⌐┘É] ┘ü┘Ä╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪╣┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘å┘Ä ╪¡┘Ä┘é┘æ┘î
play_arrow
share
video_library
Reference:
Ahmad 4/447, Ibn Majah, Malik. Al-Albani graded it authentic in Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 1/212. Also see Al-Arna'ut's checking of Ibn Al-Qayyim's Zadul-Ma'ad 4/170.

Hisnul Muslim 245
Chapter 127: When slaughtering or offering a sacrifice
1 du'a
╪¿┘É╪│┘Æ┘à┘É ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪ú┘Ä┘â┘Æ╪¿┘Ä╪▒┘Å [╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘à┘æ┘Ä ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ┘â┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘â┘Ä] ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪¬┘Ä┘é┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Ä┘ä┘Æ ┘à┘É┘å┘æ┘É┘è
play_arrow
share
video_library
Bismill─üh wall─ühu Akbar [All─ühumma minka wa lak] All─ühumma taqabbal minn─½.
With the Name of Allah, Allah is the Most Great![O Allah, from You and to You.] O Allah, accept it from me.
Reference:
Muslim 3/ 1557, Al-Bayhaqi 9/287.
Hisnul Muslim 246
Chapter 128: To ward off the plot of the rebellious devils
1 du'a
╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Å┘ê╪░┘Å ╪¿┘â┘Ä┘ä┘É┘à┘Ä╪º╪¬┘É ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç┘É ╪º┘ä╪¬┘æ┘Ä╪º┘à┘æ┘Ä╪º╪¬┘É ╪º┘ä┘æ┘Ä╪¬┘É┘è ┘ä┘Ä╪º ┘è┘Å╪¼┘Ä╪º┘ê┘É╪▓┘Å┘ç┘Å┘å┘æ┘Ä ╪¿┘Ä╪▒┘æ┘î ┘ê┘ä┘Ä╪º ┘ü┘Ä╪º╪¼╪▒┘î ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ╪┤┘æ╪▒┘æ┘É ┘à┘Ä╪º ╪«┘Ä┘ä┘é┘Ä ┘ê╪¿┘Ä╪▒┘Ä╪ú┘Ä ┘ê╪░┘Ä╪▒┘Ä╪ú┘Ä ┘ê┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ╪┤┘Ä╪▒┘æ┘É ┘à┘Ä╪º ┘è┘Ä┘å┘Æ╪▓┘É┘ä┘Å ┘à┘É┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪│┘æ┘Ä┘à┘Ä╪º╪í┘É ┘ê┘É┘à┘å┘Æ ╪┤┘Ä╪▒┘æ┘É ┘à┘Ä╪º ┘è┘Ä╪╣┘Æ╪▒┘Å╪¼┘Å ┘ü┘è┘ç┘Ä╪º ┘ê┘à┘É┘å ╪┤┘Ä╪▒┘æ┘É ┘à┘Ä╪º ╪░┘Ä╪▒┘Ä╪ú┘Ä ┘ü┘è ╪º┘ä╪ú┘Ä╪▒┘Æ╪╢┘É ┘ê┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ╪┤┘Ä╪▒┘æ┘É ┘à┘Ä╪º ┘è┘Ä╪«┘Æ╪▒┘Å╪¼┘Å ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ┘ç┘Ä╪º ┘ê┘É┘à┘å┘Æ ╪┤┘Ä╪▒┘æ┘É ┘ü┘É╪¬┘Ä┘å┘É ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘ä┘É ┘ê╪º┘ä┘å┘æ┘Ä┘ç╪º╪▒┘É ┘ê┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ╪┤┘Ä╪▒┘æ┘É ┘â┘Å┘ä┘æ┘É ╪╖╪º╪▒┘É┘é┘ì ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘æ┘Ä╪º ╪╖┘Ä╪º╪▒┘É┘é╪º┘ï ┘è┘Ä╪╖┘Æ╪▒┘Å┘é┘Å ╪¿╪«┘Ä┘è┘Æ╪▒┘ì ┘è┘Ä╪º ╪▒┘Ä╪¡┘Æ┘à┘Ä┘å┘Å
play_arrow
share
video_library
A`┼½dhu bikalim─üti ΓÇÿll─ühit-t─ümm─üti ΓÇÿllat─½ l─ü yuj─üwizuhunna barrun wa l─ü f─üjirunmin sharri m─ü khalaq. wa bara'a wa dhara'. wa min sharri m─ü yanzilu minas-sam─ü'. wa min sharri m─ü ya`ruju f─½h─ü. wa min sharri m─ü dhara'a fi ΓÇÿl-arß╕ì. wa min sharri ma yakhruju minh─ü. wa min sharri fitani ΓÇÿllayli wannah─ür. wa min sharri kulli ß╣¡─üriqinill─ü ß╣¡─üriqan yaß╣¡ruqu bikhayry─ü Rahm─ün.
I seek refuge in the Perfect Words of Allah -which neither the upright nor the corrupt may overcome -from the evil of what He created, of what He made, and of what He scattered, from the evil of what descends from theheavens, and of what rises up to them, from the evil of what He scattered in the earth, and of what emerges from it, from the evil trials of night and day, and from the evil of every night visitor, except the night visitor who comes with good. O Merciful One.
Reference:
Ahmad 3/419, with an authentic chain of narration, and Ibn As-Sunni (no. 637). Al-Arna'ut, graded its chain authentic in his checking of Al-'Aqidah At-Tahawiyyah p. 133. See also Majma'uz-Zawa'id, 10/127.
Hisnul Muslim 247
Chapter 129: Seeking forgiveness and repentance
1recommendation
Allah's Messenger (∩╖║) said: "By Allah, I seek the forgiveness of Allah, and repent to Him more than seventy times in a day.
┘é┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Ä ╪▒┘Ä╪│┘Å┘ê┘ä┘Å ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘É ╪╡┘ä┘ë ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪╣┘ä┘è┘ç ┘ê╪│┘ä┘à: '┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘É ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘É┘è ┘ä╪ú┘Ä╪│┘Æ╪¬┘Ä╪║┘ü┘É╪▒┘Å ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä╪¬┘Å┘ê╪¿┘Å ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘ç┘É ┘ü┘É┘è ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘è┘Ä┘ê┘Æ┘à┘É ╪ú┘Ä┘â┘Æ╪½┘Ä╪▒┘Ä ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ╪│┘Ä╪¿┘Æ╪╣┘É┘è┘å┘Ä ┘à┘Ä╪▒┘æ┘Ä╪⌐┘ì'
play_arrow
share
video_library
Reference:
Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 11/101.
Hisnul Muslim 248
recommendation
Allah's Messenger (∩╖║) said: "O people, repent to Allah, for I verily repent to Him one hundred times a day.
play_arrow
share
video_library
Reference:
Muslim 4/2076.
Hisnul Muslim 249
Allah's Messenger (∩╖║) said: Whoever says:
┘ê┘Ä┘é┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Ä ╪╡┘ä┘ë ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪╣┘ä┘è┘ç ┘ê╪│┘ä┘à: ┘à┘Ä┘å┘Æ ┘é┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Ä
(╪ú┘Ä╪│┘Æ╪¬┘Ä╪║┘Æ┘ü┘É╪▒┘Å ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪╣┘Ä╪╕┘è┘à┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘æ┘Ä╪░┘É┘è ┘ä╪º┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ┘Ä ┘ç┘Å┘ê┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘è┘æ┘Å ╪º┘ä┘é┘Ä┘è┘æ┘ê┘Å┘à┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä╪¬┘Å┘ê╪¿┘Å ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ä┘è┘ç┘É)
╪║┘Ä┘ü┘Ä╪▒┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪Ñ┘É┘å┘Æ ┘â┘Ä╪º┘å┘Ä ┘ü┘Ä╪▒┘æ┘Ä ┘à┘É┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪▓┘æ┘Ä╪¡┘Æ┘ü┘É.
play_arrow
share
video_library
Astaghfirull─üha ΓÇÿl-'Aß║ô─½malladhi l─ü il─üha ill─ü huwa ΓÇÿl-ß╕Ñayyul-Qayy┼½mwa at┼½bu ilayh.
Allah's Messenger (∩╖║) said, Whoever says:
I seek the forgiveness of Allah the Mighty, Whom there is none worthy of worship except Him, the Living, the Eternal, and I repent to Him.
Allah will forgive him even if he has deserted the army's ranks.
Reference:
Abu Dawud 2/85, At-Tirmidhi 5/569, and Al-Hakim who declared it authentic and Ath-Thahabi agreed with him 1/511. Al-Albani graded it authentic in Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/182. See also Jami'ul-'Usool li-'Ahdaith Ar-Rasool 4/ 389-90 checked by Al-Arna'ut.
Hisnul Muslim 250
recommendation
Allah's Messenger (∩╖║) said: "The closest that the Lord comes to the slave is in the last portion of the night. So, if you are able to be among those who remember Allah in this hour, then be among them."
┘ê┘Ä┘é┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Ä ╪╡┘ä┘ë ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪╣┘ä┘è┘ç ┘ê╪│┘ä┘à: ╪ú┘Ä┘é┘Æ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘Å ┘à┘Ä╪º ┘è┘Ä┘â┘Å┘ê┘å┘Å ╪º┘ä╪▒┘æ┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Å ┘à┘É┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪╣┘Ä╪¿┘Æ╪»┘É ┘ü┘É┘è ╪¼┘Ä┘ê┘Æ┘ü┘É ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘ä┘É ╪º┘ä╪ó╪«┘É╪▒┘É ┘ü┘Ä╪Ñ┘É┘å┘É ╪º╪│┘Æ╪¬┘Ä╪╖┘Ä╪╣┘Æ╪¬┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ ╪¬┘Ä┘â┘Å┘ê┘å┘Ä ┘à┘É┘à┘æ┘Ä┘å┘Æ ┘è┘Ä╪░┘Æ┘â┘Å╪▒┘Å ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Ä ┘ü┘É┘è ╪¬┘É┘ä┘Æ┘â┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪│┘æ┘Ä╪º╪╣┘Ä╪⌐┘É ┘ü┘Ä┘â┘Å┘å┘Æ
play_arrow
share
video_library
Reference:
At-Tirmidhi, An-Nasa'i 1/279 and Al-Hakim. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/183, and Jdmi'ul-'Usool with Al-Arna'ut's checking 4/144.
Hisnul Muslim 251
recommendation
Allah's Messenger (∩╖║) said: "The closest that the slave comes to his Lord is when he is prostrating, so invoke Allah much (in prostration)."
.┘ê┘Ä┘é┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Ä ╪╡┘ä┘ë ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪╣┘ä┘è┘ç ┘ê╪│┘ä┘à: ╪ú┘Ä┘é┘Æ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘Å ┘à┘Ä╪º ┘è┘Ä┘â┘Å┘ê┘å┘Å ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪╣┘Ä╪¿┘Æ╪»┘Å ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘É┘ç┘É ┘ê┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘ê┘Ä ╪│┘Ä╪º╪¼┘É╪»┘î ┘ü┘Ä╪ú┘Ä┘â╪½┘É╪▒┘Å┘ê╪º ╪º┘ä╪»┘æ┘Å╪╣┘Ä╪º╪í┘Ä.

Reference:
Muslim 1/350.
Hisnul Muslim 252
recommendation
Allah's Messenger (∩╖║) said: "It is a heavy thing for my heart if I do not seek Allah's forgiveness a hundred times a day."
.┘ê┘Ä┘é┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Ä ╪╡┘ä┘ë ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪╣┘ä┘è┘ç ┘ê╪│┘ä┘à: ╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ä┘Ä┘è┘Å╪║┘Ä╪º┘å┘Å ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘ë ┘é┘Ä┘ä┘Æ╪¿┘É┘è ┘ê┘Ä╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘É┘è ┘ä╪ú┘Ä╪│┘Æ╪¬┘Ä╪║┘Æ┘ü┘É╪▒┘Å ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Ä ┘ü┘É┘è ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘è┘Ä┘ê┘Æ┘à┘É ┘à┘É╪º╪ª┘Ä╪⌐┘Ä ┘à┘Ä╪▒┘æ┘Ä╪⌐┘ì.
play_arrow
share
video_library
Reference:
Muslim 4/2075. Ibn 'Athir explains that the Prophet (∩╖║) was always vigilant in his remembrance and drawing near to Allah, and if he forgot to do any of what he normally did from time to time, or it slipped his mind, he felt as if he had wronged himself and so he would begin to seek the forgiveness of Allah. See Jami'ul-'Usool 4/386.
Hisnul Muslim 253
Chapter 130: Excellence of Tasbih, Tahmid, Tahlil, and Takbir
11 du'a
Allah's Messenger (∩╖║) said: Whoever says [this du'a] one hundred times a day, will have his sins forgiven even if they are like the foam of the sea.
┘é┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Ä ╪╡┘ä┘ë ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪╣┘ä┘è┘ç ┘ê╪│┘ä┘à: ┘à┘Ä┘å┘Æ ┘é┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Ä
(╪│┘Å╪¿┘Æ╪¡┘Ä╪º┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪¿┘É╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ╪»┘É┘ç┘É)
┘ü┘É┘è ┘è┘Ä┘ê┘Æ┘à┘ì ┘à┘É╪º╪ª┘Ä╪⌐┘Ä ┘à┘Ä╪▒┘æ┘Ä╪⌐┘ì ╪¡┘Å╪╖┘æ┘Ä╪¬┘Æ ╪«┘Ä╪╖┘Ä╪º┘è┘Ä╪º┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘ê┘Æ ┘â┘Ä╪º┘å┘Ä╪¬┘Æ ┘à┘É╪½┘Æ┘ä┘Ä ╪▓┘Ä╪¿┘Ä╪»┘É ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¿┘Ä╪¡┘Æ╪▒
play_arrow
share
video_library
Subß╕Ñ─ünall─ühi wa biß╕Ñamdihi.
Allah's Messenger (∩╖║) said: Whoever says:
Glorified is Allah and praised is He.
one hundred times a day, will have his sins forgiven even if they are like the foam of the sea.
Reference:
Al-Bukhari 7/168, Muslim 4/2071, see also invocation no. 91 of this book.
Hisnul Muslim 254
┘ê┘Ä┘é┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Ä ╪╡┘ä┘ë ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪╣┘ä┘è┘ç ┘ê╪│┘ä┘à: ┘à┘Ä┘å┘Æ ┘é┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Ä
(┘ä╪º┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪¡┘Æ╪»┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ä╪º┘Ä ╪┤┘Ä╪▒┘É┘è┘â┘Ä ┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘à┘Å┘ä┘Æ┘â┘Å ┘ê┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ╪»┘Å ┘ê┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘ê┘Ä ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘ë ┘â┘Å┘ä┘æ┘É ╪┤┘Ä┘è┘Æ╪í┘ì ┘é┘Ä╪»┘É┘è╪▒┘î)
╪╣┘Ä╪┤┘Æ╪▒┘Ä ┘à┘É╪▒┘Ä╪º╪▒┘ì ┘â┘Ä╪º┘å┘Ä ┘â┘Ä┘à┘Ä┘å┘Æ ╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Æ╪¬┘Ä┘é┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä╪▒┘Æ╪¿┘Ä╪╣┘Ä╪⌐┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ┘ü┘Å╪│┘ì ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ┘ê┘Ä┘ä┘Ä╪»┘É ╪Ñ┘É╪│┘Æ┘à┘Ä╪º╪╣┘É┘è┘ä┘Ä
play_arrow
share
video_library
L─ü il─üha illall─ühwaß╕Ñdahu l─ü shar─½ka lah. lahu ΓÇÿl-mulku wa lahu ΓÇÿl-ß╕Ñamdwa huwa `al─ü kulli shay'in Qad─½r.
Allah's Messenger (∩╖║) said: Whoever says:
None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner. His is the dominion and His is the praise, and He is Able to do all things.
ten times, will have the reward for freeing four slaves from the Children of Isma'il.
Reference:
Al-Bukhari 7/67, Muslim 4/2071, see also invocation no. 93 of this book.
Hisnul Muslim 255
Allah's Messenger (∩╖║) said: Two words are light on the tongue, weigh heavily in the balance, and are loved by the Most Merciful One:
┘ê┘Ä┘é┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Ä ╪╡┘ä┘ë ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪╣┘ä┘è┘ç ┘ê╪│┘ä┘à: ┘â┘Ä┘ä┘É┘à┘Ä╪¬┘Ä╪º┘å┘É ╪«┘Ä┘ü┘É┘è┘ü┘Ä╪¬┘Ä╪º┘å┘É ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘ë ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘É╪│┘Ä╪º┘å┘É ╪½┘Ä┘é┘É┘è┘ä┘Ä╪¬┘Ä╪º┘å┘É ┘ü┘É┘è ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘à┘É┘è╪▓┘Ä╪º┘å┘É ╪¡┘Ä╪¿┘É┘è╪¿┘Ä╪¬┘Ä╪º┘å┘É ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ä┘ë ╪º┘ä╪▒┘æ┘Ä╪¡┘Æ┘à┘Ä┘å┘É:
(╪│┘Å╪¿┘Æ╪¡┘Ä╪º┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪¿┘É╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ╪»┘É┘ç┘É)
(╪│┘Å╪¿┘Æ╪¡╪º┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘É ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪╣┘Ä╪╕┘É┘è┘à┘É)
play_arrow
share
video_library
Subß╕Ñ─ünall─ühi wa biß╕Ñamdih.
Subß╕Ñ─ünall─ühi ΓÇÿl-`Aß║ô─½m.
Allah's Messenger (∩╖║) said: Two words are light on the tongue, weigh heavily in the balance, and are loved by the Most Merciful One:
Glorified is Allah and praised is He,
Glorified is Allah the Most Great.
Reference:
Al-Bukhari 7/168, Muslim 4/2072.
Hisnul Muslim 256
┘ê┘Ä┘é┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Ä ╪╡┘ä┘ë ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪╣┘ä┘è┘ç ┘ê╪│┘ä┘à: ┘ä┘Ä╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ ╪ú┘Ä┘é┘Å┘ê┘ä┘Ä
(╪│┘Å╪¿┘Æ╪¡┘Ä╪º┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ╪»┘Å ┘ä┘É┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘É ┘ê┘Ä┘ä╪º┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪ú┘Ä┘â┘Æ╪¿┘Ä╪▒┘Å)
╪ú┘Ä╪¡┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Å ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ä┘è┘æ┘Ä ┘à┘É┘à┘æ┘Ä╪º ╪╖┘Ä┘ä┘Ä╪╣┘Ä╪¬┘Æ ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘ç┘É ╪º┘ä╪┤┘æ┘Ä┘à╪│┘Å.
play_arrow
share
video_library
Subß╕Ñ─ünall─üh. walß╕Ñamdu lill─üh. wa l─ü il─üha illall─üh. wall─ühu 'Akbar
Allah's Messenger (∩╖║) said: For me to say:
Glory is to Allah, and praise is to Allah, and there is none worthy of worship but Allah, and Allah is the Most Great.
is dearer to me than all that the sun rises upon (i.e., the whole world).
Reference:
Muslim 4/2072.
Hisnul Muslim 257
recommendation
Allah's Messenger (∩╖║) said: "Is anyone of you incapable of earning one thousand Hasanah (rewards) in a day?" Someone from his gathering asked, "How can anyone of us earn a thousand Hasanah?" He said, "Glorify Allah a hundred times and a thousand Hasanah will be written for you, or a thousand sins will be wiped away."
┘ê┘Ä┘é┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Ä ╪╡┘ä┘ë ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪╣┘ä┘è┘ç ┘ê╪│┘ä┘à: ╪ú┘Ä┘è┘Ä╪╣┘Æ╪¼┘É╪▓┘Å ╪ú┘Ä╪¡┘Ä╪»┘Å┘â┘Å┘à ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ ┘è┘Ä┘â┘Æ╪│┘É╪¿┘Ä ┘â┘Å┘ä┘æ┘Ä ┘è┘Ä┘ê┘Æ┘à┘ì ╪ú┘Ä┘ä┘Æ┘ü┘Ä ╪¡┘Ä╪│┘Ä┘å┘Ä╪⌐┘ì ┘ü┘Ä╪│┘Ä╪ú┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪│┘Ä╪º╪ª┘É┘ä┘î ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ╪¼┘Å┘ä┘Ä╪│┘Ä╪º╪ª┘É┘ç┘É ┘â┘Ä┘è┘Æ┘ü┘Ä ┘è┘Ä┘â┘Æ╪│┘É╪¿┘Å ╪ú┘Ä╪¡┘Ä╪»┘Å┘å┘Ä╪º ╪ú┘Ä┘ä┘Æ┘ü┘Ä ╪¡┘Ä╪│┘Ä┘å┘Ä╪⌐┘ì ┘é┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Ä: ┘è┘Å╪│┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘É╪¡┘Å ┘à┘É╪º╪ª┘Ä╪⌐┘Ä ╪¬┘Ä╪│┘Æ╪¿┘É┘è╪¡┘Ä╪⌐┘ì ┘ü┘Ä┘è┘Å┘â╪¬┘Ä╪¿┘Å ┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪ú┘Ä┘ä┘Æ┘ü┘Å ╪¡┘Ä╪│┘Ä┘å┘Ä╪⌐┘ì ╪ú┘Ä┘ê┘Æ ┘è┘Å╪¡┘Ä╪╖┘æ┘Å ╪╣┘Ä┘å┘Æ┘ç┘Å ╪ú┘Ä┘ä┘Æ┘ü┘Å ╪«┘Ä╪╖┘É┘è╪ª┘Ä╪⌐┘ì.
play_arrow
share
video_library
Reference:
Muslim 4/2073.
Hisnul Muslim 258
┘à┘Ä┘å┘Æ ┘é┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Ä
(╪│┘Å╪¿┘Æ╪¡┘Ä╪º┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘É ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪╣┘Ä╪╕┘É┘è┘à┘É ┘ê┘Ä╪¿┘É╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ╪»┘É┘ç┘É)
╪║┘Å╪▒┘É╪│┘Ä╪¬┘Æ ┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘å┘Ä╪«┘Æ┘ä┘Ä╪⌐┘î ┘ü┘É┘è ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¼┘Ä┘å┘æ┘Ä╪⌐┘É
play_arrow
share
video_library
Whoever says:
Subß╕Ñ─ünall─ühi ΓÇÿl-'Aß║ô─½mi wa biß╕Ñamdih
will have a date palm planted for him in Paradise.
Whoever says:
Glorified is Allah the Most Great and praised is He.
will have a date palm planted for him in Paradise.
Reference:
At-Tirmidhi 5/511, and Al-Hakim who graded it authentic and Ath-Thahabi agreed 1/501. See also Al-Albani, Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 5/531 and Sahih At-Tirmidhi3/160.
Hisnul Muslim 259
Allah's Messenger (∩╖║) said: "O Abdullah bin Qais, should I not point you to one of the treasures of Paradise?" I said, "Yes, O Messenger of Allah." So he told me to say:
┘ê┘Ä┘é┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Ä ╪╡┘ä┘ë ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪╣┘ä┘è┘ç ┘ê╪│┘ä┘à: ┘è┘Ä╪º ╪╣┘Ä╪¿┘Æ╪»┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘É ╪¿┘Æ┘å┘Ä ┘é┘Ä┘è┘Æ╪│┘ì ╪ú┘Ä┘ä╪º┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä╪»┘Å┘ä┘æ┘Å┘â┘Ä ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘ë ┘â┘Ä┘å┘Æ╪▓┘ì ┘à┘É┘å┘Æ ┘â┘Å┘å┘Å┘ê╪▓┘É ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¼┘Ä┘å┘æ┘Ä╪⌐┘É ┘ü┘Ä┘é┘Å┘ä┘Æ╪¬┘Å: ╪¿┘Ä┘ä┘Ä┘ë ┘è┘Ä╪º ╪▒┘Ä╪│┘Å┘ê┘ä┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘É ┘é┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Ä: ┘é┘Å┘ä┘Æ
(┘ä╪º┘Ä ╪¡┘Ä┘ê┘Æ┘ä┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä┘ä╪º┘Ä ┘é┘Å┘ê┘æ┘Ä╪⌐┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ┘Ä ╪¿┘É╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘É)
play_arrow
share
video_library
L─ü ß╕Ñawla wa l─ü quwwata 'ill─ü bill─üh.
Allah's Messenger (∩╖║) said: "O Abdullah bin Qais, should I not point you to one of the treasures of Paradise? "I said, "Yes, O Messenger of Allah." So he told me to say:
There is no power and no might except by Allah.
Reference:
Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 11/213, Muslim 4/2076.
Hisnul Muslim 260
Allah's Messenger (∩╖║) said: The most beloved words to Allah are four:
┘ê┘Ä┘é┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Ä ╪╡┘ä┘ë ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪╣┘ä┘è┘ç ┘ê╪│┘ä┘à: ╪ú┘Ä╪¡┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘Å ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘â┘Ä┘ä╪º┘Ä┘à┘É ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ä┘ë ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘É ╪ú┘Ä╪▒┘Æ╪¿┘Ä╪╣┘î
(╪│┘Å╪¿┘Æ╪¡┘Ä╪º┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘É)
┘ê┘Ä(╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ╪»┘Å ┘ä┘É┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘É)
┘ê┘Ä(┘ä╪º┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å)
┘ê┘Ä(╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪ú┘Ä┘â┘Æ╪¿┘Ä╪▒┘Å)
┘ä╪º┘Ä ┘è┘Ä╪╢┘Å╪▒┘æ┘Å┘â┘Ä ╪¿┘É╪ú┘Ä┘è┘æ┘É┘ç┘É┘å┘æ┘Ä ╪¿┘Ä╪»┘Ä╪ú╪¬┘Ä
play_arrow
share
video_library
Subß╕Ñ─ünall─üh
Walß╕Ñamdu lill─üh.
Wa l─ü il─üha illall─üh
Wall─ühu Akbar.
Allah's Messenger (∩╖║) said: The most beloved words to Allah are four:
Glorified is Allah,
and The praise is for Allah,
and There is none worthy of worship but Allah,
and Allah is the Most Great.
It doesn't matter which of them you start with.
Reference:
Muslim 3/1685.
Hisnul Muslim 261
A desert Arab came to Allah's Messenger (∩╖║) and said, "Teach me a word that I can say. " The Prophet told him to say:
╪¼┘Ä╪º╪í┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä╪╣┘Æ╪▒┘Ä╪º╪¿┘É┘è┘æ┘î ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ä┘ë ╪▒┘Ä╪│┘Å┘ê┘ä┘É ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘É ╪╡┘ä┘ë ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪╣┘ä┘è┘ç ┘ê╪│┘ä┘à ┘ü┘Ä┘é┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Ä: ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘æ┘É┘à┘Æ┘å┘É┘è ┘â┘Ä┘ä╪º┘à╪º┘ï ╪ú┘Ä┘é┘Å┘ê┘ä┘Å┘ç┘Å: ┘é┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Ä: ┘é┘Å┘ä┘Æ (┘ä╪º┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪¡┘Æ╪»┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ä╪º┘Ä ╪┤┘Ä╪▒┘É┘è┘â┘Ä ┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪ú┘Ä┘â┘Æ╪¿┘Ä╪▒┘Å ┘â┘Ä╪¿┘É┘è╪▒╪º┘ï ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ╪»┘Å ┘ä┘É┘ä┘æ┘Ä
(┘ä╪º┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ê┘Ä╪¡┘Æ╪»┘Ä┘ç┘Å ┘ä╪º┘Ä ╪┤┘Ä╪▒┘É┘è┘â┘Ä ┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪ú┘Ä┘â┘Æ╪¿┘Ä╪▒┘Å ┘â┘Ä╪¿┘É┘è╪▒╪º┘ï ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ╪»┘Å ┘ä┘É┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘É ┘â┘Ä╪½┘É┘è╪▒╪º┘ï ╪│┘Å╪¿┘Æ╪¡┘Ä╪º┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘É ╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘É ╪º┘ä╪╣┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Ä┘à┘É┘è┘å┘Ä ┘ä╪º┘Ä ╪¡┘Ä┘ê┘Æ┘ä┘Ä ┘ê┘Ä┘ä╪º┘Ä ┘é┘Å┘ê┘æ┘Ä╪⌐┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ┘Ä ╪¿┘É╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘É ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪╣┘Ä╪▓┘É┘è╪▓┘É ╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘â┘É┘è┘à┘É).
┘é┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Ä: ┘ü┘Ä┘ç┘Ä╪ñ┘Å┘ä╪º┘Ä╪í┘É ┘ä┘É╪▒┘Ä╪¿┘æ┘É┘è ┘ü┘Ä┘à┘Ä╪º ┘ä┘É┘è ┘é┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Ä: ┘é┘Å┘ä┘Æ
(╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪º╪║┘Æ┘ü┘É╪▒┘Æ ┘ä┘É┘è ┘ê┘Ä╪º╪▒┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ┘å┘É┘è ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ç┘Æ╪»┘É┘å┘É┘è ┘ê┘Ä╪º╪▒┘Æ╪▓┘Å┘é┘Æ┘å┘É┘è).
play_arrow
share
video_library
L─ü il─üha illall─ühwaß╕Ñdahu l─ü shar─½ka lah, All─ühu Akbaru kab─½ra, walß╕Ñamdu lill─ühi kath─½ra, Subß╕Ñ─ünall─ühi Rabbil-`─ülam─½n, L─ü ß╕Ñawla wa l─ü quwwata ill─ü bill─ühi ΓÇÿl-`Az─½zil-Hak─½m.
He said, "That is for my Lord, but what about me?"
The Prophet (∩╖║) told him to say:
All─ühummaghfir l─½, warß╕Ñamn─½, waß╕Ñdin─½ warzuqn─½.
There is none worthy of worship but Allah, Who has no partner, Allah is the Great, the Most Great, and praise is to Allah in abundance, glory is to Allah, Lord of the worlds. There is no power and no might but by Allah the Mighty, the Wise.
He said, "That is for my Lord, but what about me?" The Prophet (∩╖║) told him to say:
O Allah forgive me, and have mercy on me and guide me, and provide for me.
Reference:
Muslim 4/2072, Abu Dawud reports the same Hadith with the addition: and when the Arab left, the Prophet (∩╖║) said: "He has filled his hands with goodness." 1/220.
Hisnul Muslim 262
Whenever anyone accepted Islam, the Prophet (∩╖║) used to teach him how to pray then he would instruct him to invoke Allah with the following words:
┘â┘Ä╪º┘å┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪▒┘æ┘Ä╪¼┘Å┘ä┘Å ╪Ñ┘É╪░┘Ä╪º ╪ú┘Ä╪│┘Æ┘ä┘Ä┘à┘Ä ╪╣┘Ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘à┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪º┘ä┘å┘æ┘Ä╪¿┘è┘æ┘Å ╪╡┘ä┘ë ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪╣┘ä┘è┘ç ┘ê╪│┘ä┘à ╪º┘ä╪╡┘æ┘Ä┘ä╪º┘Ä╪⌐┘Ä ╪½┘Å┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä┘à┘Ä╪▒┘Ä┘ç┘Å ╪ú┘Ä┘å┘Æ ┘è┘Ä╪»┘Æ╪╣┘Å┘ê┘Ä ╪¿┘É┘ç┘Ä╪ñ┘Å┘ä╪º┘Ä╪í┘É ╪º┘ä┘Æ┘â┘Ä┘ä┘É┘à┘Ä╪º╪¬┘É: (╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å┘à┘æ┘Ä ╪º╪║┘Æ┘ü┘É╪▒┘É ┘ä┘É┘è ┘ê┘Ä╪º╪▒┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ┘å┘É┘è ┘ê┘Ä╪º┘ç┘Æ╪»┘É┘å┘É┘è ┘ê┘Ä╪╣┘Ä╪º┘ü┘É┘å┘É┘è ┘ê┘Ä╪º╪▒┘Æ╪▓┘Å┘é┘Æ┘å┘É┘è)
play_arrow
share
video_library
All─ühummaghfir l─½, warß╕Ñamn─½, waß╕Ñdin─½, wa `─üfin─½ warzuqn─½
Whenever anyone accepted Islam, the Prophet (∩╖║) used to teach him how to pray then he would instruct him to invoke Allah with the following words: O Allah forgive me, and have mercy on me and guide me and give me good health and provide for me.
Reference:
Muslim 4/2073, and in one of Muslim's reports there is the addition: 'For these words combine [the goodness of] this world and the next.'
Hisnul Muslim 263
╪Ñ┘É┘å┘æ┘Ä ╪ú┘Ä┘ü┘Æ╪╢┘Ä┘ä┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪»┘æ┘Å╪╣┘Ä╪º╪í┘É (╪º┘ä┘Æ╪¡┘Ä┘à┘Æ╪»┘Å ┘ä┘É┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘É) ┘ê┘Ä╪ú┘Ä┘ü┘Æ╪╢┘Ä┘ä┘Ä ╪º┘ä╪░┘æ┘É┘â┘Æ╪▒┘É (┘ä╪º┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä┘Ä┘ç┘Ä ╪Ñ┘É┘ä╪º┘æ┘Ä ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘Å)
play_arrow
share
video_library
The most excellent invocation is: Alß╕Ñamdulill─üh
and the most excellent words of remembrance are: L─ü il─üha illall─üh.
The most excellent invocation is: Praise is for Allah. and the most excellent words of remembrance are: There is none worthy of worship but Allah.
Reference:
At-Tirmidhi 5/462, Ibn Majah 2/1249, and Al-Hakim who graded it authentic and Ath-Tbahabi agreed 1/503. See Al-Albani, Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 1/362.
Hisnul Muslim 264
╪º┘ä╪¿╪º┘é┘è╪º╪¬ ╪º┘ä╪╡╪º┘ä╪¡╪º╪¬:
(╪│╪¿╪¡╪º┘å ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç)
┘ê(╪º┘ä╪¡┘à╪» ┘ä┘ä┘ç)
┘ê(┘ä╪º ╪Ñ┘ä┘ç ╪Ñ┘ä╪º ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç)
┘ê(╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪ú┘â╪¿╪▒)
┘ê (┘ä╪º ╪¡┘ê┘ä ┘ê┘ä╪º ┘é┘ê╪⌐ ╪Ñ┘ä╪º ╪¿╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç)
play_arrow
share
video_library
The good deeds which endure are:
Subß╕Ñ─ünall─üh.
Walß╕Ñamdu lill─üh.
Wa l─ü il─üha illall─üh
Wall─ühu Akbar
Wa l─ü ß╕Ñawla wa l─ü quwwata ill─ü bill─üh.
The good deeds which endure are:
Glorified is Allah,
and The praise is for Allah,
and There is none worthy of worship but Allah,
and Allah is the Most Great,
and There is no power and no might except by Allah.
Reference:
Ahmad (no. 513) (Ahmad Shakir, ed.) and its chain of narration is authentic. See Majma'uz-Zawa'id 1/297. Ibn Hajar mentions it in Bulughul-Maram saying that Ibn Hibban and Al-Hakim considered it authentic.
Hisnul Muslim 265
Chapter 131: How the Prophet ∩╖║ made tasbeeh
recommendation
Abdullah bin 'Amr (RA) said: "I saw the Prophet (∩╖║) counting the glorification of his Lord on his right hand."
╪╣┘Ä┘å┘Æ ╪╣┘Ä╪¿┘Æ╪»┘É ╪º┘ä┘ä┘æ┘Ä┘ç┘É ╪¿┘Æ┘å┘É ╪╣┘Ä┘à┘Æ╪▒┘ì┘ê ╪▒╪╢┘è ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪╣┘å┘ç┘à╪º ┘é┘Ä╪º┘ä┘Ä: ╪▒┘Ä╪ú┘Ä┘è┘Æ╪¬┘Å ╪º┘ä┘å┘æ┘Ä╪¿┘è┘æ┘Ä ╪╡┘ä┘ë ╪º┘ä┘ä┘ç ╪╣┘ä┘è┘ç ┘ê╪│┘ä┘à ┘è┘Ä╪╣┘Æ┘é┘É╪»┘Å ╪º┘ä╪¬┘æ┘Ä╪│┘Æ╪¿┘É┘è╪¡┘Ä ╪¿┘É┘è┘Ä┘à┘É┘è┘å┘É┘ç┘É.
play_arrow
share
video_library
Reference:
Abu Dawud with a different wording 2/81, and At-Tirmidhi 5/521. See also Al-Albani, Sahihul-Jami'As-Saghir 4/271 (no. 4865).
Hisnul Muslim 266
Chapter 132: Comprehensive types of good and manners
recommendation
When night falls, restrain your children (from going out) because at such time the devils spread about. After a period of time has passed, let them be. Shut your doors and mention AllahΓÇÖs name, for verily the devil does not open a shut door, tie up your water-skins and mention AllahΓÇÖs name, cover your vessels with anything and mention AllahΓÇÖs name and put out your lamps.

Reference:
Al-Bukhari with Al-Fath 10/88 and Muslim 3/1595.
Hisnul Muslim 267
